lore: Traditional device for presenting important gifts. Its sculpted face comes to life boisterously presenting its contents to the recipient.
name: Betazoid Gift Box *VP
text: Immediately look through your draw deck for up to thirty seconds and choose three cards to place in your hand. Reshuffle draw deck and discard artifact.

lore: Cardassian male. Virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. Risked his life in the defense of his comrades.
name: Garak*
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Honor May replace anyone present randomly selected to die.

lore: U.S.S. Voyager employed a tricyclic input manifold of the warp core, variable-geometry pylons and a rather large complement of shuttlecraft.
name: U.S.S. Voyager (Chain of Command)
text: Shuttlecraft you download may come from discard pile. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Klaestron; Capturing-related card; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Klaestron dignitary. Son of Enina and General Ardelon Tandro. In 2369, used Cardassian technology to gain access to Deep Space 9 in order to kidnap Jadzia Dax.
name: Ilon Tandro*
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy ENGINEER Treachery Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

lore: Hirogen captured by Penk on his son's first hunt. Has fought at Tsunkatse for nearly two decades. Trained Seven of Nine, hoping she could end his captivity.
name: Hajur *VP
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Biology MEDICAL Anthropology Geology Archaeology

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Capturing-related card; Chancellor; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Chancellor and leader of the Klingon High Council. Willing to dishonor Worf in order to avoid political division. Fat.
name: K'mpec (Chain of Command)
text: V.I.P. Leadership Law Diplomacy DL/ {Kle'eg} DL/ {HQ: Secure Homeworld}

lore: Kirk relied heavily on his senior officers and closest friends in his command of the Starship Enterprise.
name: Captain Kirk (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 DL/ Any Captain's Order card If with {any Spock} and {any McCoy}, all three are attributes all +1.

lore: Former Federation officer who defected to Romulus in 2349. Later, apparently had second thoughts. Joined Spock's Romulan underground in 2369.
name: Stefan DeSeve*
text: CIVILIAN Romulan: Treachery, Greed Federation: OFFICER, Treachery, INTEGRITY -1

lore: Lieutenant Commander Benjamin Sisko was the executive officer of the U.S.S. Saratoga in 2366 during the Borg attack at Wolf 359.
name: Benjamin Sisko (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor DL/ {Any Jake} DL/ {Emergency Evacuation}

lore: Its five year mission: to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before.
name: Starship Enterprise (Chain of Command)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Where No Man Has Gone Before}

lore: Human clone of Jean-Luc Picard. General of a Reman Army. Possibly the worst Praetor in the history of the Romulan Star Empire.
name: Shinzon (Chain of Command)
text: V.I.P. Leadership Treachery x 2 Diplomacy ENGINEER {Any Jean-Luc Picard} gains (G>.

characteristicsKeywords: Borg/Human; Counterpart; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Rescued Borg counterpart. After returning to his command of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Picard developed a violent vendetta against the Borg.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Archaeology Navigation While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Bor].

lore: Whether preparing captives for interrogation, trial, torture, incarceration, punishment, or other purposes, Cardassian methods are well-established.
name: Cardassian Processing
text: Unless Diplomacy, Honor, Transporter Skill, and CUNNING>30 OR Law, SECURITY, and STRENGTH>40, one personnel is captured (random selection).

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Riker dubbed the U.S.S. Defiant a "tough little ship." Commanded by Worf when the Borg attacked Earth.
name: U.S.S. Defiant (Chain of Command)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 vs. [Bor].

lore: In times of crisis, a captain needs to be able to coordinate crew activities. James T. Kirk reminded John Harriman of this during the maiden voyage of the U.S.S. Enterprise-B.
name: Your Place is on the Bridge
text: Plays on your damaged ship OR your ship just targeted in a battle you did not initiate. Download its matching commander aboard. Discard interrupt.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Massive predator of a ship commanded by Shinzon. Its brief contact with the U.S.S. Enterprise-E would leave a lasting impression.
name: Scimitar (Chain of Command)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ Any Tactic DL/ {Engage Cloak}

lore: Humanoid dabo girl. In three months she didn't spill a drink, mix up a food order or short-change a bill. Actually liked by other dabo girls - and even the Ferengi waiters.
name: Aluura*
text: CIVILIAN Your other dabo girls and Ferengi waiters here are attributes all +2. Youth Honor Diplomacy

characteristicsKeywords: Android/Human/Romulan; Captain; Dual-personnel; Male; Soong-type android;
lore: To search for Spock on Romulus, the Soong-type android Data and his human captain, Jean-Luc Picard, disguised themselves as Romulan citizens.
name: Data and Picard*
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Data: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill Picard: Diplomacy Anthropology Archaeology

lore: Brilliant yet befuddled Ferengi engineer. Works for the Bajorans aboard Deep Space 9. Quark's brother. Nog's father. Gaila's cousin. Has a crush on Leeta.
name: Rom*
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Navigation Physics X=4 or 9.

lore: Jake Sisko and Nog are best friends. Loiterers. Frequently chased away from "their spot" by Odo. Briefly owned 100 gross of self-sealing stem bolts.
name: Jake and Nog*
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Jake: Youth Biology ENGINEER Nog: Youth Acquisition ENGINEER

lore: Freighter captain for Bajoran Ministry of Commerce. Smuggled weapons for the Maquis in 2372. Loves baseball. Romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko.
name: Kasidy Yates*
text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Smuggling Transporter Skill May add 2 card draws to "{cargo runs}" she completes.

lore: Ironically, Kira Nerys trained Legate Damar's freedom fighters in Resistance tactics. The Bajoran accepted a Starfleet commission to help ease the racial tensions.
name: Kira*
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Honor x 2 X=3 vs. [Dom].

lore: Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Seeks appointment to the Continuing Committee. Suffers from Tuvan Syndrome. Conspired with Sloan to bring down Senator Cretak.
name: Koval*
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar (when [Rom]). x 2 Exobiology Your Tal Shiar may report here.

lore: Bajoran dabo girl. Formed the Guild of Restaurant and Casino Employees with Rom. Amateur sociologist. Was formally separated from Julian Bashir on Risa in 2373.
name: Leeta*
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Youth Computer Skill Leadership Music DL/ {Dabo} OR {Kukalaka}

lore: Physically altered, the half-Betazoid, half-human Deanna Troi was coerced to assume the identity of a Tal Shiar major in the 2369 M'ret defection plot.
name: Major Rakal*
text: V.I.P. Romulan: Tal Shiar, Empathy, Treachery Federation: Empathy, Diplomacy, INTEGRITY +4, CUNNING -1

lore: Bajoran entomology student. Dabo girl. Orphaned by Cardassians. Romantically involved with Jake Sisko. Accepted to the science academy on Regulus III.
name: Mardah*
text: CIVILIAN Youth Biology SCIENCE

lore: Dedicated, hardworking ensign. The first Ferengi in Starfleet. Friend of Jake. Briefly served as chief engineer of U.S.S. Valiant under Captain Watters.
name: Nog*
text: ENGINEER Physics Honor Youth Acquisition ENGINEER (if aboard your Defiant-class or [Fer] ship).

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: The mirror version of Odo supervises ore processing on Terok Nor. Has strict rules of obedience. The only changeling his contemporaries have ever seen.
name: Overseer Odo*
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Process Ore}

lore: Ferengi ensign who manned the conn station in Barash's illusion. Riker thought him one of the few elements of the simulation he could get used to.
name: Prot*
text: OFFICER Youth Archaeology Navigation Geology

lore: Quark wedded Grilka by brek'tal ritual to head the House of Kazak (as the House of Quark) on Qo'noS. The Ferengi saved his be'nal from financial ruin.
name: Quark Son of Keldar*
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Honor Greed Attributes all +3 if with {Grilka}.

lore: Benjamin Sisko discovered the Celestial Temple in 2369. Reluctantly accepts Bajoran reverence.
name: The Emissary*
text: V.I.P. All other Bajorans in play are INTEGRITY +2. Your Bajorans may report for duty where present. Diplomacy DL/ {Bajoran Wormhole}

lore: Tog abducted Lwaxana Troi and her half-human daughter Deanna Troi. After beaming the pair out of their clothes, he planned to exploit their Betazoid skills.
name: The Trois*
text: V.I.P.+CIVILIAN Lwaxana: Empathy x 2 Diplomacy DL/ {Wolf} Deanna: Diplomacy Empathy DL/ {Plexing}

lore: Half-Bajoran daughter of Tora Naprem and Dukat. Survived crash of the Ravinok on Dozaria. Rescued in 2372. Talented artist. Fond of Elim Garak.
name: Tora Ziyal*
text: CIVILIAN Youth May seed under {Dozaria}. Geology {Dukat} is INTEGRITY +3 if present.

lore: Ironically, Kira Nerys trained Legate Damar's freedom fighters in Resistance tactics. The Bajoran accepted a Starfleet commission to help ease the racial tensions.
name: Kira**
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Honor x 2 X=3 vs. [Dom].

lore: Klaestron IV is a member of the United Federation of Planets. Its inhabitants also maintain a strong alliance with the Cardassian Union.
name: Klaestron Outpost*
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klaestron ENGINEER.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Federation ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship briefly commanded by Luaran. Upgraded with Breen weapons technology. Stolen by members of Damar's rebellion; commanded by Kira.
name: Stolen Attack Ship*
text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon battle cruiser, circa 2267. Some were provided to the Romulan Star Empire in exchange for cloaking technology. Commander Charvanek captained one.
name: Battle Cruiser*
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ Any [Univ] [OS] Klingon or Romulan

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Scout;
lore: Small, obsolete, twenty-year-old Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras.
name: Cha'Joh*
text: May benefit from two matching commanders. Cloaking Device

name: Containment Field
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Not duplicatable.) Each player who uses a DL/ icon, {Hidden Fighter}, or {Going to the Top} must first stack a card from hand face up here. Before each player's turn begins, they reclaim up to two of those cards; if they still have any here, they must skip that turn. Also, nullifies each {Destroy Radioactive Garbage Scow} (its owner loses its points), {Static Warp Bubble}, and {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers}.

name: Q the Referee
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may play one [Ref] card for free OR discard (or place beneath draw deck) one of your [Ref] cards from hand or in play to draw a card. Also, you may suspend play while you download any other [Ref] card (ignoring {Computer Crash}), then discard incident.

name: Access Denied
text: Seeds or plays on table. While in play, nullifies all {Establish Gateway} objectives targeting your missions. You may suspend play while you discard incident to download {Fractal Encryption Code}.

name: Defend Homeworld
text: Seeds or plays on table. When opponent initiates battle against your card at a homeworld matching that card's affiliation, just after it is targeted you may download there any number of {HQ} cards and compatible ships, leaders, SECURITY personnel, and hand weapons. Once per game, you may discard objective to download a SECURITY personnel OR any HQ card (except {Return Orb to Bajor}).

lore: When Miles O'Brien discovered his publicized racquetball match was unfairly influenced by an alien gambling device, he refused to take advantage of an unfair situation.
name: Fair Play
text: Seeds or plays on table; may not be nullified. No player may solve an opponent's unique mission unless its point box shows at least 40 points OR both players have a copy of it in play.

lore: In 2372, Tom Paris concocted a sweepstakes to guess the daily radiogenic particle count, skimming a tenth of the proceeds for himself. Chakotay put a stop to the game, confiscating the pot.
name: Fair Play (Voyager)
text: Seeds or plays on table; may not be nullified. No player may solve an opponent's unique mission unless its point box shows at least 40 points OR both players have a copy of it in play.

name: Temporal Vortex
text: Plays on a time location. While in play, any ships may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location. OR Suspends play while you place doorway on {Borg Ship} dilemma or {The Sheliak}. While in play, dilemma disappears. OR Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Distortion of Space/Time Continuum}. OR Relocates one of your ships at a time location to spaceline location of opponent's choice.

name: Feedback Surge
text: Seeds or plays on table. If opponent completes {Establish Gateway} targeting a mission they did not seed, you score those points (instead of opponent). Also, if opponent discards any seed cards using {Ajur}, {Boratus}, {Senior Staff Meeting}, or their own dilemma, you may immediately re-seed them under any mission(s); opponent loses 10 points for each such card.

name: In the Zone
text: Seeds or plays on table. If a non-Borg player scores more than 50 points during a single turn (including this turn), those points in excess of 50 do not count toward winning. While your score is exactly 50 points, each of your ships has double RANGE and SHIELDS. Also, nullifies {End Transmission} and {Preparation}, and each player may call "{Devidian Door}" only during their turn (and only once per turn).

lore: Zefram Cochrane struggled to maintain the optimum balance of matter and anti-matter injection for the Phoenix warp systems. The proper ratio, of course, is 1 to 1.
name: Intermix Ratio
text: Plays on table. If any player's ratio of bonus points to non-bonus points exceeds 1:1, the excess bonus points do not count toward winning. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Intruder Alert!
text: Seeds or plays on table; nullifies all seeded {Memory Wipe} cards. At any time, you may capture a one- or two-person Away Team in your {Ops} or assimilate one personnel intruder on your Borg ship or facility if your {Talon Drone} is present (discard incident) OR download {Intruder Force Field} (place incident atop event to protect it from nullification and extend its effects to all intruders on your ships).

name: It's Only a Game
text: Seeds or plays on table. Limits each non-Borg report with crew action to four total personnel/equipment. Limits {Red Alert} to one Personnel, one Ship and one Equipment card per turn. Limits probing and doubling for {Visit Cochrane Memorial} to once per game per persona. Also, whenever opponent draws three or more cards in one turn, you may download (even from discard pile) {Scorched Hand}, ignoring {Computer Crash}.

name: HQ: Orbital Weapons Platform
text: Plays on any homeworld. Each time opponent initiates battle here against your ship or facility matching this homeworld's affiliation, just after it is targeted each of your Orbital Weapons Platforms here may "fire upon" an opposing ship present. Each ship fired upon is damaged = [Flip][Flip] for each platform that targets it, and you may exclude that ship from the battle.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard reflected upon introducing an unstable element into a critical situation.
name: Mirror Image
text: Seeds or plays on table. All {Red Alert}, {Kivas Fajo - Collector}, {Masaka Transformation}s and {The Traveler: Transcendence} cards affect all players. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Obelisk of Masaka
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each time a card provides multiple card draws, only one may be converted to a download. Also, to move or initiate battle, each ship with one or more staffing icons (and each Interceptor) requires at least two crew members aboard. Once each turn (unless opponent has {The Mask of Korgano} in play), you may download {Masaka Transformations} targeting yourself, then discard incident.

lore: Surprised by Benjamin Sisko's rather unconventional response to Q's antagonism, the allegedly omnipotent being protested, "You hit me! Picard never hit me!"
name: Oof!
text: Nullifies {Fightin' Words}. OR Place each {Amanda Rogers}, {Kevin Uxbridge} and {Q2} in opponent's point area out of play; opponent loses 5 points for each. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.)

name: Operate Wormhole Relays
text: Seeds or plays on table. once each turn, your staffed ship with two or fewer staffing icons and SCIENCE, Physics x2, and Astrophysics aboard may move through {Barzan} or {Bajoran Wormhole} (or between two {Transwarp Network Gateway}s by using RANGE equal to twice the span of the destination location, and is not stopped.

name: Panel Overload
text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard incident to nullify {Bynars Weapon Enhancement} or {Genetronic Replicator}. You may place incident on any outpost to prevent its {Spacedoor}s from re-opening (nullified by 4 ENGINEER aboard).

name: Q's Tent
text: Place one atop Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different cards) during the seed phase. Q's Tent is now open and in play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Once per turn, play to take a card from tent into your hand, either your choice (discard doorway) or random selection (place doorway on top of your draw deck). Must show card to opponent. Draw no cards this turn.

name: Reactor Overload
text: Seeds or plays on table. If any player has "processed ore" to draw two cards per turn at any one {Ore Processing Unit}, destroys that site. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your ship or facility. EM surge disables each android aboard until Cybernetics present; erases all [Holo] cards aboard; kills each Borg aboard (unless [Com] drone in hive); and kills all {Rogue Borg} aboard. Return incident to your hand after either use.

name: Scanner Interference
text: Seeds or plays on table. Nullifies each {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} unless owner has 2 Computer Skill aboard a staffed ship at targeted mission. Just after opponent scans mission (after seed cards are replaced) you may discard incident to seed one card there from hand, discard pile or {Q's Tent}. At any time you may discard incident to download {Atmospheric Ionization}, {Distortion Field} and/or {Particle Scattering Field}.

lore: Plasma gas from the ruptured coolant tank liquified all the organic skin grafted onto Data's endoskeletal structure.
name: Scorched Hand
text: Plays to cause each player who has more than 12 cards in hand to shuffle all but 6 (random selection) and place beneath draw deck. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

lore: Prototype device developed by the Obsidian Order. Emits a quantum stasis field that prevents a changeling from altering its biomolecular structure.
name: Shape-Shift Inhibitor
text: Plays on table. Each player must first discard a personnel card in order to download a non-[Bor] personnel. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Strategema
text: Seeds or plays on table. {Ooby Dooby} and {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} are nullified. {Q's Planet} may not enter play. Your opponent may not initiate battle or play {Outgunned} at a homeworld against your force containing a card matching that homeworld's affiliation.

lore: Jean-Luc Picard had to convince Lily Sloane that she was on a starship orbiting Earth. To defeat the Borg, Captain Picard's crew had to succeed on the ship as well as on the planet.
name: The Big Picture
text: Plays on table. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) at least two missions with point boxes (one [S] and one [P]) needs an additional 40 points to win. (May not be nullified.)

lore: Though facing a long voyage across uncharted space, Kathryn Janeway never lost sight of her ultimate goal - to get her ship and crew home.
name: The Big Picture (Voyager)
text: Plays on table. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) at least two missions with point boxes (one [S] and one [P]) needs an additional 40 points to win. (May not be nullified.)

lore: The Juggler hosted Lwaxana Troi and Alexander Rozhenko's visit to the Parallax Colony, all the time juggling his three worlds.
name: The Juggler
text: Choose any player to re-shuffle the cards in their draw deck.

lore: The New Providence colony on Jouret IV was scooped up by the Borg in 2366, just as Federation and Romulan outposts along the Neutral Zone had been destroyed in 2364.
name: The Wake of the Borg
text: Plays on opponent's Neutral Zone mission if they seeded 3 or more. End of opponent's next turn, all non-[Bor] ships, facilities and personnel there are returned to hand.

lore: After years of poverty, the Takarians were eager to be rid of their Great Sages. Fortunately, Chakotay and Tom Paris were there to keep them from being sent away on "wings of fire."
name: Villagers With Torches
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever opponent begins a planet mission attempt with fewer than three personnel, all are killed unless opponent has {Thermal Deflectors} in play.

name: White Deprivation
text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of every player's turn, all of that player's [KW] personnel present together must battle (and stun or mortally wound when able) opposing non-changelings present, or (if none) any non-changelings present, or (if none) each other (split randomly into two equal groups). Also, one [KW] personnel in each of that player's crews and Away Teams dies (random selection).

name: Writ of Accountability
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, downloads an FCA personnel; discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your [Fer] FCA personnel. If opponent has used {Subspace Schism}, {Brain Drain} or {Horga'hn} more than twice OR played {Static Warp Bubble}, {Anti-Time Anomaly} or {Black Hole} more than once OR used their own dilemma(s) to score more than 15 points or to discard other dilemmas, they lose the game.

name: Tribunal of Q
text: Seeds on table. You may download [Ref] cards from your discard pile. While you are downloading or playing a [Ref] card, you may ignore any effect and no action may suspend play. In place of a card draw you may download a [Ref] card (once per game per card title) OR {Q the Referee} (limit once every turn). At the start of the first turn, if it is not your turn, you may download a [Ref] card.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by the Klingon Chancellor, K'mpec. Met with U.S.S. Enterprise to arbitrate the selection of a new Chancellor for the Klingon Empire.
name: I.K.C. Qam-Chee (Chain of Command)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Opposing cards here are attributes -1.

lore: Commander of the U.S.S. Voyager on a mission to retrieve her undercover security officer, Tuvok. Bailed Tom Paris out of jail. Likes dogs.
name: Kathryn Janeway (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill {Tuvok} may report here. DL/ {Rescue Captives}

lore: Going boldly into the unknown frontiers of the galaxy, brave captains and crews cheat death in search of new life.
name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
text: Plays on table. At start of turn, your undocked ships at any spaceline end are RANGE +3 until end of turn. Once per turn, when your ship moves from one spaceline to another, you may draw a card OR report an [AU] card aboard.

lore: While in command of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E, Riker defended the ship against attack by the Son'a. Reminded Picard, "No uniform, no orders."
name: William T. Riker (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation x 2 Honor DL/ {Federation Flagship: Renewed} DL/ {Riker Maneuver}

lore: Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise-C in an alternate reality. Became the Future Enterprise in an alternate future. Visited by crew from the Starship Enterprise.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise (Chain of Command)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Wall of Ships}

lore: After an encounter with the Timeship Aeon, Captain Janeway and her crew found themselves on Earth in 1996. The appeal of being on Earth - even in the past - was intense.
name: Distracted by Thoughts of Home
text: Place on mission. All personnel here are attributes all -1. Any player must discard a card from hand to attempt this mission. X=4 if this is a [DQ] mission, otherwise 2.

lore: In the game of chula, even choosing the less profitable but safer path does not guarantee that all of your players will continue to the next shap.
name: Chula: Unfortunate Roll
text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) are chosen. If their total INTEGRITY is odd, all three are "stopped." Otherwise, discard dilemma.

lore: "War is obsolete... as we are in danger of becoming."
name: Azetbur 2E (Visionary Chancellor)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Honor Law Leadership x 2 When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, you may destroy three of your Assault and/or Maneuver events to score 10 points.

lore: "The opportunity here is to bring them to their knees. Then we'll be in a far better position to dictate terms."
name: Lance Cartwright 2E (Co-Conspirator)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography Section 31 Leadership OFFICER SECURITY Treachery To play this personnel, you must destroy an event you command. To play this personnel, you must destroy an event you command.

lore: "I can see you, Kirk ... Can you see me?"
name: Once More Unto the Breach 2E
text: Your opponent chooses a staffed Cloaking Device ship he or she commands at this mission. That ship is Weapons +1 until the end of this dilemma. Unless you have Shields>that ship's Weapons, randomly select a personnel to be killed and all of your personnel are stopped.

lore: "It is the judgment of this court, that without possibility of reprieve or parole, you be taken from this place to the dilithium mines on the penal asteroid of Rura Penthe, there to spend the rest of your natural lives."
name: Surprise Amity 2E
text: When your opponent's mission attempt ends, if that opponent has more points than you, stop each of that opponent's personnel. Place this interrupt on the bottom of your deck.

affiliation: Any affiliation may attempt this mission.
lore: "They say no ship can survive it."
name: Breach Barrier 2E
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + CUNNING>40 When you are about to complete this mission, if an opponent has more points than you, choose one - score 5 points; unstop all your personnel; or restore Range of each ship you command.

lore: "... if you hurt that girl, I promise... I'll kill you."
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Rescuer)
text: Honor Leadership Navigation SECURITY When you play this personnel, you may choose one: take up to two of your [Baj] personnel from your discard pile into hand; or place the bottom two cards of your deck in your discard pile.

lore: "Sir, we can go in, rescue the hostages, and get out in 24 hours with an acceptable loss in manpower and equipment."
name: Operation Retrieve 2E
text: Plays in your core. When you are about to place an interrupt in your discard pile, if your opponent's personnel is facing a dilemma you own, you may place that interrupt on the bottom of your deck instead. (Unique.)

lore: Pheromone-guided assassination device used unsuccessfully against Grand Nagus Quark in 2369. Very difficult to avoid. Can be identified by the telltale sorium and argine traces.
name: Ferengi Locator Bomb 2E (The Undiscovered Country)
text: Unless Computer Skill, Navigation, and Physics OR Acquisition, Treachery, and CUNNING>32 present, one personnel (random selection) is placed on bottom of draw deck.

lore: "...it accumulated those frozen gases over time as it travelled through space."
name: What Lies Beneath 2E
text: Unless you have Archaeology + Geology + Honor OR Anthropology + Treachery + CUNNING>32, randomly select a personnel to be placed on the bottom of his or her owner's deck and all your personnel are stopped.

lore: Identification: HARVEST DRONE Task: Identify targets in Sector 001. Engage. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Four of Fifty 2E (The Undiscovered Country)
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Exobiology May download {One with the Borg} in place of a card draw. DL/ {Orbital Bombardment} OR {Establish Tractor Lock}

lore: Identification: SYNERGY DRONE Task: Recognize optimum performance. Coordinate. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Ten of Fifty 2E (The Undiscovered Country)
text: Cybernetics Attributes all +2 while sharing skills. Once each turn, may return to hand your non-[BO] Objective in play.

lore: "Perhaps it would be best to let the matter rest for a while. I'm sure, in time, all these minor problems will be resolved to our mutual satisfaction." Commander: Tenak'talar.
name: Weyoun 2E (Scheming Negotiator)
text: Anthropology Diplomacy SCIENCE Treachery When you play a [Dom] Treachery personnel, you may take a Jem'Hadar personnel from your discard pile and place it on the bottom of your deck.

lore: Over nine hundred million Cardassians were slaughtered by Dominion forces in retaliation for the actions of Damar's resistance.
name: The Cost of Freedom 2E
text: Plays in your core. At the start of your Execute Orders segment, discard the top three cards of your deck. For each event you discarded this way, each of your [Car] personnel is attributes +1 until the end of the turn. If you do not discard an event this way, all of your [Car] personnel are stopped.

lore: "... none of that has anything to do with you. You're a changeling. You're timeless."
name: Let Them Worry 2E
text: Unless you have Honor x3 OR MEDICAL + Physics + STRENGTH>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and if your opponent commands 3 Shape-shifter personnel, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "Doctor, have you been messing around with your program?"
name: Reprogrammed 2E
text: When an opponent plays an interrupt, if one of his or her personnel is facing a dilemma you own, discard a personnel from hand to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

lore: Thomas Riker, a transporter duplicate of William T. Riker, resented his doppelganger's authority and superior rank, and viewed him as a rival for the affections of Deanna Troi.
name: One to One 2E (Favor the Bold)
text: Each player reveals a personnel from hand (if none, CUNNING=0). Highest CUNNING scores points, others lose points. Cannot get past if tie.

lore: "I support all diplomatic overtures. But if you will excuse me, Praetor, I have an appointment with the Tholian ambassador."
name: Treachery Running Deep 2E
text: Unless you have Anthropology x3 OR Physics + Treachery + CUNNING>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and discard a card from hand for each Praetor personnel and Senator personnel your opponent commands.

lore: "The point is, with all due respect, you're trying to turn me into your idea of a model officer."
name: Ro Laren 2E (Headstrong Ensign)
text: Navigation OFFICER Computer Skill While this personnel is facing a dual dilemma, she cannot be randomly selected by dilemmas.

lore: "Formerly Proconsul and now Praetor of the Romulan Star Empire."
name: Neral 2E (Seasoned Politician)
text: Anthropology Archaeology Diplomacy Leadership x 2 Treachery While this personnel is facing a dilemma that requires Leadership or Treachery, he and each Treachery personnel present cannot be randomly selected by that dilemma.

lore: "But what if you're wrong and the Dominion doesn't commit its forces to protect Deep Space Nine? What if they launch a full-scale assault on Earth instead?"
name: Skeptical Superiors 2E
text: Unless you have Leadership x3 OR (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) + Computer Skill + CUNNING>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and randomly select a personnel to be stopped for each Admiral personnel your opponent commands.

lore: Leader of a band of torturous performers, The Clown could easily tap into the fears of his victims and manipulate the artificial environment in which they resided.
name: The Clown: On His Throne 2E (Favor the Bold)
text: Place on mission. Opponent chooses INTEGRITY, CUNNING, or STRENGTH. Replace other personnel attributes in dilemma and mission text here with the named attribute.

lore: "... I pledge my life to free Cardassia..."
name: Patriotic Spirit 2E
text: Unless you have OFFICER x3 OR Honor + Leadership + STRENGTH>28, randomly select a personnel to be stopped, and randomly select a personnel to be stopped for each Glinn personnel your opponent commands.

lore: "You're not like the other human. You don't like helping us ... Good. I don't like it either."
name: Arak'Taral 2E (Suspicious Second)
text: Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography OFFICER Physics Transporter Skill When this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may exclude a [Cmd] personnel present from that selection. When this personnel is an eligible target for a random selection, you may exclude a [Cmd] personnel present from that selection.

lore: "You knew there was a dangerous creature on this planet."
name: The Beast at El-Adrel 2E
text: Your personnel cannot gain skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Diplomacy x2 + Leadership x2 OR ENGINEER + Transporter Skill + CUNNING>33 OR a Hand Weapon, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: "I'm picking up transporter locks. They're beaming on board."
name: Unwanted Guests 2E
text: Your opponent randomly discards a personnel from his or her hand. Unless you have that personnel's skills, all your personnel are stopped.

lore: In the game of chula, even choosing the less profitable but safer path does not guarantee that all of your players will continue to the next shap.
name: Chula: Unfortunate Roll 2E (Favor the Bold)
text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) are chosen. If their total INTEGRITY is odd, all three are "stopped." Otherwise, discard dilemma.

lore: Apoplectic Bajoran haunted by the screams of Crell Moset's victims. Chakotay helped him focus his rage. Skilled holoprogrammer. Friend of Jor.
name: Tabor 2E (The Maquis)
text: ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE Computer Skill X=3 if six or more personnel in your discard pile.

lore: "Before we can go forward, the cycle must end."
name: Causal Recursion 2E
text: Unless you choose to remove five cards in your discard pile from the game OR have three missions worth 40 or more points each, place this dilemma in your core. You need an additional 10 points to win the game. When you score points from an event, you may remove this dilemma from the game.

lore: "Maximum power to the shields. Kill the music."
name: Covert Ambush 2E
text: Unless you have a personnel with 2 Engineer or a personnel with 2 Computer Skill, place this dilemma in your core. When your personnel is about to be placed in an opponent's brig, this dilemma's owner may remove this dilemma from the game to randomly select an additional personnel present to be placed in that opponent's brig.

lore: "To be totally armed, is to be totally secured."
name: Echo Papa Attack 2E
text: Your personnel cannot gain skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have these requirements: [P] - MEDICAL + OFFICER + SECURITY; or [S] - Leadership + Navigation + Computer Skill, randomly select a personnel to be killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

name: Ensnared 2E
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, if you have [TNG][Car] personnel at four or more missions an opponent seeded, name a unique personnel. If opponent has that personnel in play, place that personnel aboard your ship (captured).

lore: "After all, what is a person but the sum of their memories?"
name: Kira Nerys 2E (Lela)
text: Diplomacy Honor Law Leadership OFFICER SECURITY When you play this personnel, you may take a card from your discard pile into hand. When you play this personnel, you may take a card from your discard pile into hand.

lore: In politics, mysterious gifts should be handled with care. A bottle of poisoned kanar may have no effect on Vorta but would have been fatal to Tekeny Ghemor.
name: Occupational Hazards 2E (Raise the Stakes)
text: Unless 2 Greed OR 2 Treachery OR CUNNING>45, one personnel (random selection) is killed.

lore: Reman soldiers are trained in marksmanship as well as close-quarters combat, making them deadly assailants in any combat situation.
name: Upexi 2E
text: Exobiology Computer Skill SECURITY When a random selection is made, if this personnel is facing a dilemma at a mission worth 40 or more points, you may stop this personnel to ignore its results and select again. When a random selection is made, if this personnel is facing a dilemma at a mission worth 40 or more points, you may stop this personnel to ignore its results and select again.

lore: "This is a golden opportunity to gather intelligence on Romulan intentions and military capabilities."
name: U.S.S. Bellerophon 2E (Conference Host)
text: Tractor Beam. When you play this ship, you may place a [2eDS9] Diplomacy personnel from your hand aboard this ship.

lore: "I have been told that patience is sometimes a more effective weapon than the sword."
name: Worf 2E (Chief of Security)
text: Anthropology Honor x 2 OFFICER SECURITY When your [TNG] personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may stop this personnel instead.

lore: Experienced corporal who trained with gravity boots at Jupiter Station. MACO assigned to Enterprise in 2153. Goes by her middle name. Always alert.
name: Fiona McKenzie 2E (This Side of Paradise)
text: SECURITY Exobiology Leadership Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ {Raktajino}

lore: The latest in the Enterprise line, it gets "all the easy assignments." Commanded by William T. Riker in the Briar Patch incident with the Son'a.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E (Chain of Command)
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +1 for each [Ent-E] aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Commodore Decker, driven to the edge of madness by the loss of his entire crew, sacrificed himself in a vain attempt to destroy the "Planet Killer."
name: Personal Duty
text: To get past requires Leadership OR OFFICER. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: Khan's battle experience was significant but limited to terrestrial combat. Three-dimensional thinking gave Captain Kirk and the Enterprise a clear advantage.
name: Tactical Disadvantage
text: Players show their hands and examine revealed ships. Unless your total SHIELDS > opponent's total WEAPONS, kill one personnel (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Harry Kim and B'Elanna Torres were abducted by the Caretaker and exiled to the subterranean Ocampan society.
name: The Caretaker's "Guests"
text: One personnel present (opponent's choice) is placed atop draw deck. You may place a different personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile with this crew or Away Team.

lore: Linked into the Kohl mental preservation network, Harry Kim endured searing confrontations of his deepest fears.
name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine
text: Place on mission. Now and start of each mission or scouting attempt here, opponent names a skill. All your personnel with that skill are attributes -2 until end of turn.

lore: The steadfast obedience of the Jem'Hadar to their leaders often made working with other species difficult.
name: Friction
text: Plays on table if you control three [Dom] personnel. Each non-Jem'Hadar personnel enters play "stopped."

lore: When it comes to logic and emotions, Romulan women may differ from Vulcan women, but that is not the only thing Spock finds distracting about Commander Charvanek.
name: Getting Under Your Skin
text: Plays on table if you control three [Rom] personnel. Once each turn, when you play an event on table, opponent reveals top card of deck. If it is a personnel, score 5 points. (Unique.)

lore: Often housing political prisoners, clandestine Cardassian camps use hard labor as punishment.
name: Prison Compound
text: Plays if you control three [Car] personnel to score points. X=the total number of [*] on all your captives.

lore: The Bajoran Prylar worried about Kai Winn's interest in the Pah-Wraiths but remained a faithful attendant.
name: Solbor
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Exobiology Once per mission, scores 5 points if your Vedek, Prylar, or Kai helps solve a mission where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Cardassian resistance; Dissident; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: A proud nationalist, Gul Rusot joined Damar's underground resistance movement. Served on Terok Nor. Dissident.
name: Rusot (Things Past)
text: OFFICER Biology Geology Treachery If with {Damar}, gains Leadership and SECURITY.

lore: Male Shape-shifter serving as a representative of the Founder population. Greeted Odo when he returned to the Great Link.
name: Founder Architect
text: V.I.P. While attempting a mission, X=number of different events in play. Astrophysics Law

lore: Treacherous, scheming Cardassian. Closed the Bajoran Wormhole as a Pah-Wraith puppet.
name: Dukat (Things Past)
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may place two non-[Ref] cards from any one discard pile out of play. Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Kosst Amojan}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Devious augment from the time of Khan. Kept as a frozen human embryo until grown by Arik Soong.
name: Malik
text: SECURITY Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When "stopped" by a dilemma, draw a card. When killed by a dilemma, discard your hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Dissident; Male; Romulan underground; Soong-type android;
lore: Soong-type android in disguise as a Dissident and member of the Romulan Underground. Claimed to be from the city of Rateg.
name: Data (Things Past)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Exobiology Transporter Skill Cannot be killed by dilemmas ("stopped" instead).

lore: Telepathic Reman advisor to the Praetor, Shinzon. Dominion War veteran. General of a Reman Army.
name: The Viceroy
text: MEDICAL Diplomacy Empathy Treachery Biology When an opponent plays an event, you may discard a card to download an event to hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Battleship; Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Tractor Beam;
lore: Twice the size of a Galaxy-class starship, battleships of this design served in the Alpha Quadrant war.
name: Dominion Battleship (Things Past)
text: Attributes all +3 if Founder, Vorta, and Jem'Hadar aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam, Invasive Transporters

name: Bajoran Wormhole: Mirror Universe *VP
text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Mirror Quadrant. Limit one. Inserts into spaceline to create a Bajor Region location (span 1); any player may download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any ship may move between here and another Bajoran Wormhole if damaged or if ENGINEER and SCIENCE aboard, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human son of Sarek and Amanda Grayson. Over 140-year-old ambassador. On private mission to Romulus. Mindmelded with Picard.
name: Spock *VP
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Computer Skill Leadership SCIENCE Mindmeld

name: Bajoran Wormhole *VP
text: Requires two Bajoran Wormhole cards; each inserts into a spaceline to create a location (span 1). Play one in Alpha Quadrant (Bajor Region); download the other to Gamma Quadrant. Limit one per quadrant. While in play, any ship may move from one end to the other, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

lore: Noted captain. Succeeded Robert April and commanded the Starship Enterprise for 13 years. Accepted promotion in 2263 and relinquished command to James T. Kirk.
name: Christopher Pike *VP
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Your other [OS] personnel here are attributes all +1.

lore: Vicious Gorn Slavemaster of the Tholian Assembly who was assigned to gut the Starship Defiant in the Mirror Universe. He does not trust Terrans.
name: Slar
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER SECURITY Computer Skill Physics Treachery x 2 X = number of [MU] personnel present

name: Handshake *VP
text: Plays once each turn (for free) if you have played no cards this turn and have fewer in hand than opponent; they must choose to discard three cards or allow you to draw three. OR Plays to look at top five cards in any draw deck or discard pile for ten seconds; rearrange as desired. OR Plays if you have at least three other cards in hand; discard entire hand and draw seven cards. Discard incident after any use.

characteristicsKeywords: Borg/Human; Counterpart; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Rescued Borg counterpart. After returning to his command of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Picard developed a violent vendetta against the Borg.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (Chain of Command) *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Archaeology Navigation While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Bor].

lore: Unprepared and naive of the dangers that they would encounter, the Enterprise took its share of damage in those first few years. The ship and crew held up remarkable well under pressure.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (Enterprise)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: The U.S.S. Constellation took heavy damage from the Doomsday Machine as it past through system L-374. The planet killer proved to be quite formidable in battle against two Federation starships.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (The Original Series)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: The Future Enterprise was more advanced after its refit. With more powerful engines and advanced firepower, it was able to dispense two Klingon attack cruisers while only taking minimal damage.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (The Next Generation)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: The damage was heavy on both side of the war between the Federation and the Dominion. While the Dominion held little regard for their fallen, the Alpha quadrant species did not share that sentiment.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (Deep Space Nine)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: While in command of the Reliant, Khan was able to damage the flagship of the Federation. Only by hiding in the Mutara Nebula was the Enterprise able to evade him long enough to destroy the Reliant.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (The Wrath of Khan)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: When V'Ger came to Earth in search of its creator, it destroyed the Klingon vessels that penetrated the massive energy cloud. It viewed carbon based units aboard as a damaging infestation to be eliminated.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (The Motion Picture)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: Unfortunately for James T. Kirk, the U.S.S. Enterprise 1701-B left spacedock without many of its key components installed. It was thus ill equipped to deal with the effects of the Nexus and was damaged.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (Generations)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: Only with the combined efforts of Earth's entire defenses and the return of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E, was Starfleet able to destroy the Borg cube that attacked at Sector 001. But by then, the damage was done.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (First Contact)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

lore: With some help from the future, the U.S.S. Voyager was able to get past a Borg armada. One transphasic torpedo would damage a Borg cube, and two was enough to destroy it.
name: Rotation Damage Marker (Voyager)
text: Hull: -50% Requires two full turns to repair. Cloaking Device is off line. * If printed RANGE>5, it is reduced to 5.

name: Space-Time Portal *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] cards may seed and (once per turn) play. At any time, discard doorway to download {Alternate Universe Door} (except to table) OR play {Wormhole} on a location to relocate your ship there (stopped) OR nullify {Temporal Rift} OR return one of your ships to owner's hand OR (once per game) report with crew one [AU] ship (all crew must be [AU]) to any location.

lore: With Deep Space 9 evacuated of non-critical personnel during a local plasma disruption, it was an easy matter for a mercenary team to overwhelm those left behind.
name: Skeleton Crew
text: Place on mission. You may not begin a mission attempt here with fewer than six personnel.

lore: Restore the ancestral homeworld to the glory of the Empire.
name: Romulan "Reunification"
text: Plays to report a [Rom] SECURITY personnel to {Vulcan} if you have an unopposed [Rom] ship in orbit (discard event). OR Plays on {Vulcan}; worth points if your opponent has fewer personnel here than you have [Rom] personnel here.

lore: Trained nurses like Alyssa Ogawa are vital aids in life-threatening situations.
name: Critical Assistance
text: Once per turn, stops your Nurse to download a MEDICAL-related equipment to his or her location OR unstops a MEDICAL-classification personnel present.

lore: Male human serving in the Inspector General's office. Found no evidence of wrong-doing aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, in spite of his best efforts.
name: Dexter Remmick
text: SECURITY OFFICER Section 31 DL/ {Inspection} May report aboard your [Fed] ship in the Alpha Quadrant.

lore: Captain Archer's pet beagle. Likes cheese. T'Pol thinks he smells worse than even the humans do.
name: Porthos
text: ANIMAL [Sta] Humans present are INTEGRITY +1. Once every turn, may "chase" (stop) one ANIMAL present.

lore: Half-Human, half-Romulan female. Failed to subvert the Klingon Empire by assisting Lursa and B'Etor. Her future seemed dim after her failure to conquer Vulcan.
name: Sela (Life From Lifelessness)
text: V.I.P. Tal Shiar Treachery Diplomacy Youth DL/ {Romulan "Reunification"}

lore: Klingon living in exile. Brother of Worf. Son of Mogh. Recently deputized by Odo. Has a death wish.
name: Kurn (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SECURITY SECURITY Navigation Law Must replace your personnel present selected to die. SECURITY personnel present are attributes all +1.

name: For the Sisko
text: Plays on table if you have three [Baj] personnel in play. In place of your normal card play, discard a non-personnel card from hand to place two [Baj] personnel from your discard pile on top of your draw deck.

name: Determined Assault
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a [Non] ship firing. May not be used to fire upon a facility. Hit = [Down]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Invasive Strike: If an opponent's ship here, one random non-[BO] equipment card aboard is relocated there and stolen.

lore: While investigating the Arsenal of Freedom on Minos, a sudden attack separated the crew of the Enterprise.
name: The Arsenal: Separated
text: Divide your unique personnel into two face-down piles. One pile is "stopped" (opponent's choice). To get past requires CUNNING>27 remaining.

lore: Alien pilot that frequented a Starfleet bar in San Francisco. Offered to help Leonard McCoy, but would not go to the restricted Mutara sector.
name: Allamill
text: CIVILIAN Greed Smuggling Navigation DL/ Any [NA] [Films] card

lore: "I'm Captain Kathryn Janeway. This is Commander Tuvok. We're from the Federation starship Voyager."
name: Damaged Reputation
text: If INTEGRITY>50, lose 5 points. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR any Intelligence and 2 Treachery OR STRENGTH>30 (STRENGTH>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: Desperate to prevent the inevitable collapse of the universe, Jack and Patrick spent considerable time on a solution. After all, they only had seventy trillion years - at most.
name: Oh No!
text: If CUNNING>60, lose 5 points. To get past requires 3 Astrophysics OR {any PADD} and {any tricorder} OR INTEGRITY>30 (INTEGRITY>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: "The internal security net has been sabotaged... which suggests someone didn't want to be that easily found."
name: Vastly Outnumbered
text: If STRENGTH>55, lose 5 points. To get past requires Anthropology and 2 Honor OR two hand weapons OR INTEGRITY>28 (INTEGRITY>48 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: "Expand or die."
name: 45th Rule of Acquisition
text: Plays on your [Fer] ship. Once per turn, your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} may report aboard (for free). Each time your [Fer] personnel aboard is killed by an opponent's dilemma you may download one Gold-Pressed Latinum aboard or draw a card.

lore: B'Etor is the younger sister of Captain Lursa. Seeks to bring Security Chief Garak and The Intendant to trial for negligence and fraternizing with the enemy.
name: Captain B'Etor
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Law Physics SCIENCE Youth

lore: Typical Terran in the mirror universe. Caught trying to escape Terok Nor. Brought to The Intendant for sentencing by Security Chief Garak and Telok.
name: 0413-Theta
text: ENGINEER Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Lower Decks}

lore: Eliminate primary Maquis base of operations.
name: Find Hidden Base
text: SECURITY x3 + Leadership x2 + 2 hand weapons *+10 if no [Maq] in Badlands Region.

lore: Invited aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise to demonstrate his innovative technology. The ensuing murder mystery proved it successful, but at a high cost.
name: Dr. Reyga (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Stellar Cartography DL/ {Metaphasic Shields}

name: The Genesis Effect
text: Plays on your unexamined mission. When you play this incident, name a dilemma. If your personnel encounter that dilemma while attempting this mission with more than 2 and fewer than 8 personnel, nullify it. (Unique.)

lore: Kirk felt renewed in the face of new life, in spite of the death of Spock. "He's really not dead. As long as we remember him."
name: I Feel Young
text: Adds Youth to one [Films] personnel until end of turn. OR Downloads any [Films] Kirk if {any Spock} was just discarded from play.

lore: An original thinker, Captain Kirk took command of the Starship Enterprise as an admiral. He felt young.
name: Admiral Kirk (Life From Lifelessness)
text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Diplomacy Leadership DL/ {Khan!} DL/ {The Genesis Effect}

lore: Intelligent scientist in charge of the Genesis Project. When showing off her results, she quipped, "Can I cook or can't I?"
name: Carol Marcus (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE Exobiology x 2 Honor Physics X = number of cards in opponent's hand (limit 5).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Young scientist involved with the creation of the Genesis Device. Son of Carol Marcus and James T. Kirk. Survived an encounter with Khan.
name: David Marcus (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Biology x 2 Exobiology Physics Computer Skill

lore: In 2373, Nyrians beamed aboard U.S.S. Voyager, attempting to hijack the ship by replacing her crew. Eventually, Captain Janeway and her crew reversed the process.
name: Displaced
text: One personnel present (random selection) relocated to nearest planet. To get past requires CUNNING>30 (CUNNING>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: In the farthest reaches of the Delta Quadrant, medical supplies and those trained in their use are equally rare. Without them, even a minor injury can become lethal.
name: Medical Crisis
text: Randomly select a MEDICAL personnel. Killed if [Kaz] or [Vid], "stopped" otherwise. To get past requires 2 Biology and (2 MEDICAL OR a Nurse).

lore: Kivas Fajo kept one of the few surviving pottery vases created by Mark Off-Zel, a native of Sirrie IV. Former Klingon Chancellor K'mpec also owned a similar treasure.
name: Off-Zel Vase
text: Place in your point area. Z changes, where Z=the number of quadrants in which you have completed a mission (beyond the first).

lore: Determine cause of disaster.
name: Aftermath II
text: ENGINEER + Physics x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) Wormhole: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Determine cause of disaster.
name: Aftermath II (back)
text: ENGINEER + Physics x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Male Hirogen representative of inexperienced, overeager hunters. Trained by Harkan, who judged him to be too reliant on defense. Killed by Weiss.
name: Zivan
text: MEDICAL Physics DL/ {Body Armor}

lore: Typical male member of the Kazon-Relora sect. Assistant to Haron. Spaced by Culluh and Seska for his master's refusal of an alliance against Voyager.
name: Kazat
text: CIVILIAN Law Youth Honor

lore: Typical Vidiian seeking to steal organs from live "donors." Remembered as a serious threat by Kathryn Janeway during a near-death experience.
name: Delanh
text: CIVILIAN Greed SECURITY Physics

lore: Once freed from the Borg hive mind, General Korok commanded this vessel. Assisted the U.S.S. Voyager in the destruction of Tactical Cube 138.
name: Renegade Borg Sphere
text: [Non] Borg may report aboard. WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 vs. [Bor].

lore: Vorta advisor sent to Deep Space 9 by the Founders. Replaced Weyoun. Witnessed the surrender of the Dominion to the Alpha Quadrant alliance.
name: Tholun
text: MEDICAL Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Law

lore: Investigate possible changeling life signs.
name: Changeling Research II
text: SCIENCE x3 + Exobiology x2 + Geology Each {Seismic Quake} here affects two personnel. WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Investigate possible changeling life signs.
name: Changeling Research II (back)
text: SCIENCE x3 + Exobiology x2 + Geology Each {Seismic Quake} here affects two personnel. If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Human. Former partner of Q. Marooned in Gamma Quadrant but rescued by Jadzia Dax. Brought a dangerous crystal artifact aboard Deep Space 9.
name: Vash (Life From Lifelessness)
text: CIVILIAN Greed x 2 Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology May report at any [GQ] facility.

lore: Wadi head of the delegation from the Gamma Quadrant that visited station Deep Space 9 in 2369. After being cheated at dabo, made Quark play chula.
name: Falow
text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Computer Skill Honor Once per game, may nullify {a Chula} dilemma where present.

lore: Female Wadi. Part of Falow's delegation sent to Deep Space 9 to make first contact with the Alpha Quadrant. Skilled gambler and lover of games.
name: Ilandra
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Greed DL/ {Any Treaty} OR {Espionage} card

lore: Devoted to her father, Emory Erickson. Spent fifteen years serving as his nurse after the loss of her brother, Quinn. Childhood friend of Jonathan Archer.
name: Danica Erickson
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL

lore: Small transport vessel used in the mid-22nd century to carry passengers to and from their destinations.
name: Sarajevo
text: Attributes all +1 for each Transporter Skill aboard (limit 3). DL/ {Emory Erickson}

lore: Ambassadors used to luxury accommodations are difficult to please while in the field. Commanding officers routinely assign their staff to placate the visiting dignitaries.
name: Important Guests
text: To get past requires V.I.P OR CIVILIAN. For each of your V.I.P.s and CIVILIANS present, randomly select an OFFICER OR SECURITY personnel to be "stopped."

lore: Ancient Iconian computer programs transmitted to the U.S.S. Yamato, U.S.S. Enterprise, and Haakona attempted to overwrite the ships' computer systems.
name: Virus
text: Unless you have 4 Computer Skill present, place on ship. This ship, and all your other ships of the same class, are attributes all -2. Cure with 6 Computer Skill.

lore: Hirogen body armor can resist injuries from battle and environmental hazards. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Body Armor
text: While present with your SECURITY-classification personnel, all hand weapons present lose cumulative. (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

name: Inspection
text: Plays on table. Your ships native to the Alpha Quadrant (and each personnel aboard) are attributes all +1 while three Admirals and/or V.I.P.s aboard. At the start of each of your turns, you may exchange an OFFICER personnel aboard your staffed ship with an Admiral or V.I.P. in your discard pile.

lore: The strain experienced by Lt. Bailey during his encounter with the Fesarius pushed him to the brink of mental breakdown.
name: Driven
text: When your [OS] OFFICER is facing a dilemma, discard an [OS] OFFICER from hand to make him or her attributes all +5 until the end of that dilemma.

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Alliance in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Ferengi - Brunt - is part of us now."
name: Brunt of Borg
text: Treachery x 2 Computer Skill Navigation Greed Law V.I.P. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Fer].

lore: Elim Garak joined the Federation it its fight against the Dominion. Served as a code breaker in spite of his fear he was betraying his homeworld.
name: Agent Garak
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Treachery Anthropology Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Garak} (discards this one)

lore: Jem'Hadar bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Ordered by Weyoun to hunt for the traitor Damar. Killed Mila. Betrayed and killed by one of his Cardassian allies.
name: Turan'Ekan
text: SECURITY Geology Navigation Physics Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Dual-personnel; Female; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Retired chief petty officer Sergey Rozhenko is married to Helena Rozhenko. They have two sons, Nikolai and Worf, and one grandson, Alexander.
name: Sergey and Helena
text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Sergey: ENGINEER Honor Helena: Exobiology DL/ {Nikolai Rozhenko}

lore: In an alternate timeline, Nog served as captain of the U.S.S. Defiant. Aided Jake Sisko in an effort to reverse a time-altering subspace inversion.
name: Captain Nog
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Diplomacy Honor Physics DL/ {Ready Room Door}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council; Male;
lore: Son of a traitor, Ja'rod, and a traitor himself. Member of the Klingon High Council.
name: Duras (Life From Lifelessness)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Diplomacy Computer Skill Once each turn, may kill an opponent's personnel here that just completed a mission.

lore: Officer in service aboard the Gal Gath'thong during the attack against the Federation in 2266. Reduced two steps in rank for an unauthorized transmission.
name: Subcommander Decius
text: OFFICER Navigation SCIENCE Once per turn, may place a discarded event on bottom of draw deck.

lore: Typical Obsidian Order operative trained in exobiology and medical interrogation. Expert at surgically altering operatives for long-term assignments.
name: Emok
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Obsidian Order

lore: Cardassian warship that surveyed Dorvan V. Pursued the Liberty into the Badlands. Commanded by Evek.
name: Vetar
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Pursuit] card} WEAPONS +2 vs. [Maq].

name: The Guardian of Forever *VP
text: Plays on planet {Gateway} (limit one). Once per turn, one or more personnel present may time travel to a time location in this quadrant, or may return here from there (with any of owner's other personnel present). OR Plays once each turn to nullify any card that is closing Guardian, or to draw up to four cards if your Archaeology or Anthropology personnel just time traveled back to Guardian; place doorway out-of-play.

lore: Time travel can afford the user certain abilities that might not be available to those native to the current time.
name: Temporal Shifting *VP
text: Plays on a player. That player must choose to either discard three cards from hand or discard one [AU] card. If that player discards an [AU] card, he/she may draw up to four cards. Discard event.

lore: Formerly known as Terok Nor. Now a Bajoran trading center and administrative facility run by the Federation.
name: Deep Space 9 *VP
text: Seed during dilemma phase at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is not Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility commandeered by the Terran Rebellion in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor *VP
text: Seeds during dilemma phase at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

lore: Mining station built in Bajoran system. Operated by Cardassians using Bajorans in forced-labor conditions.
name: Terok Nor (back) *VP
text: Seeds at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

name: HQ: Secure Homeworld *VP
text: Seeds or plays on a homeworld. Your Away Teams which include a personnel who matches homeworld's affiliation may attempt the mission using these requirements: Leadership x2 + SECURITY + (Honor OR Treachery) + any one attribute total > point value of mission When you solve mission, capture all opposing personnel on planet who do not match affiliation of homeworld.

lore: Elim Garak joined the Federation it its fight against the Dominion. Served as a code breaker in spite of his fear he was betraying his homeworld.
name: Agent Garak *VP
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Treachery Anthropology Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Garak} (discards this one)

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility controlled by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor (back) *VP
text: Seeds at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

lore: In an alternate timeline, Nog served as captain of the U.S.S. Defiant. Aided Jake Sisko in an effort to reverse a time-altering subspace inversion.
name: Captain Nog *VP
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Diplomacy Honor Physics DL/ {Ready Room Door}

lore: Two humpback whales, male and female, raised in captivity on 20th-century Earth. Gracie is pregnant.
name: George and Gracie *VP
text: ANIMAL+ANIMAL George: Nullifies {The Whale Probe} at this location. Gracie: Worth points while on {Earth}.

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-74656. Commanded by Kathryn Janeway. Pulled 70,000 light years from the Alpha Quadrant. Its crew has spent nearly seven years on a long trek home.
name: U.S.S. Voyager *VP
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Bio-Neural Gel Pack} DL/ {Blue Alert}

lore: Whether it be Kanar, Blood Wine, or Romulan Ale, a little libation can often yield valuable intelligence.
name: Blended
text: To get past requires Empathy, Diplomacy, {Morn} or {any Scotty}. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: "Allamaraine, count to four. Allamaraine, then three more. Allamaraine, if you can see. Allamaraine, you'll come with me."
name: Chula: The Chandra
text: One person (random selection) continues, along with all crew or Away Team members who have at least one attribute number matching that personnel. Others are "stopped."

lore: Julian Bashir's confidence after completing two shaps did not serve him well in the fourth shap of the Wadi game Chula.
name: Chula: The Lights
text: Crew or Away Team member with total attributes closest to 22 (your choice if tie) returns to hand. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Despite his best effort, Miles O'Brien could not rally the villagers to defeat their feared enemy. Some people just aren't very good storytellers.
name: Dal'Rok
text: Place on mission. Now and start of each turn, kills personnel with lowest total attributes at this location. May be nullified by INTEGRITY+CUNNING+STRENGTH>150 at this location.

lore: Risky business ventures often require those involved to alter information or logs that might leave clues. The head honcho personally assigns an underling to undertake this risky scam.
name: Dead End
text: Unless you have at least 50 points, cannot get past; place dilemma atop mission; it may not be attempted by a player with less than 50 points. (Unique.)

lore: The universe is full of hucksters, charlatans, swindlers, confidence men, and Ferengi.
name: Flim-Flam Artist
text: Your opponent may immediately draw a card. To get past requires Diplomacy and 2 Computer Skill OR Law and CUNNING>32 (CUNNING>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: Only a seasoned leader can prevent disaster during tense situations.
name: Friendly Fire
text: Unless 2 Leadership and 2 SECURITY present, kills one personnel (random selection); place dilemma on this mission (or this {Empok Nor}); it cannot be attempted or scouted.

lore: A powerful being who claimed to be Apollo. Appeared in the classic style and performed "god-like" acts, but failed to convince the crew of the Enterprise to worship him.
name: "God"
text: Unless two Away Team members each have INTEGRITY>7, place on mission; destroys one ship here (opponent's choice). You must have a ship here to attempt mission.

lore: Magnetic security seals protecting hazardous areas sometimes employ triple-release safety latches. In unfamiliar environments, they can be difficult to operate properly.
name: Maglock
text: To get past, crew must have at least 3 OFFICER with STRENGTH>5 each.

lore: Tuvok was forced to question many of U.S.S. Voyager's crew to solve a mystery. The efforts took focus away from his other duties.
name: Murder Investigation
text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has SECURITY, all of them are "stopped."

lore: In 2373, Mr. Lubitsch, Mr. Hopkins, Mr. Marshall, and other New Essentialists sabotaged Risa's weather modification network causing a great deal of trouble in paradise.
name: New Essentialists
text: Unless INTEGRITY>40 and 2 Honor OR CUNNING>40 and 2 Treachery present, place one non-Borg Away Team member (random selection) atop draw deck. Nullify with {Jamaharon}.

lore: A transporter chief in possession of a good sense of timing can work miracles.
name: Now Would Be a Good Time
text: Unless Transporter Skill aboard your ship or facility here beams up entire Away Team, one personnel present (opponent's choice) is captured. Discard dilemma.

lore: Parts of B-4's assembly were found strewn across the Kolaran system. Many planetary scans were required to locate all the positronic signatures.
name: Picking Up the Pieces
text: To get past requires Geology or Computer Skill. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: In the mirror universe, methods of discipline are often agonizing. Incompetent superior officers are subjected to public torture as examples to the crew.
name: Punishment Box
text: Place on planet. Now and start of each mission attempt here, cannot get past unless one OFFICER is "placed in the box" ("stopped") until end of turn.

lore: Q and his creations have appeared as soldiers from medieval times, the American Civil War, the Napoleonic era, and World War II, in addition to others eras.
name: Q's Vicious Animal Things
text: Unless 22 < STRENGTH < 55, one Away Team member is killed (random selection) and opponent re-seeds dilemma under a different unsolved planet mission.

lore: To disable a station's deflector array (which has been turned into an anti-graviton beam), one could access the EPS feed and overload the waveguide. But there are alarms.
name: Restricted Area
text: If nine or fewer personnel in crew or Away Team, one is "stopped" (random selection). If more than nine personnel in crew or away team, three are captured (random selection).

lore: On Stardate 9521.6, the U.S.S. Excelsior monitored a "minor incident" on the Klingon moon Praxis.
name: Subspace Shock Wave
text: Ship is damaged and two crew members are killed (random selection) unless a Navigation personnel who has CUNNING>7 aboard. Discard dilemma.

lore: Unstaffed alien communications device. Sent to the Terran solar system in 2286. Broadcasting signal disables all technology in its wake. Waiting for a specific response.
name: The Whale Probe
text: Place on mission. End of every turn, moves one location toward and off spaceline's long end. All ships, personnel, and facilities are in stasis while here. (Unique.)

lore: The Central Command controls every Cardassian ship, outpost and space station from its great War Room.
name: Central Command
text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia Prime}. Once per turn, one Cardassian Gul or Legate OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Legislative body of Bajoran provisional government. Established following Cardassian withdrawal in 2369.
name: Chamber of Ministers
text: Seeds or plays on {Bajor}. A Nor may coexist here. Once per turn, one Bajoran Minister, Vedek or Kai OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Praetor Neral presides over the Continuing Committee of the Romulan People, the final authority on Romulus.
name: Continuing Committee
text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. May coexist with {Office of the Proconsul}. Once per turn, one Tal Shiar personnel OR {any Neral} may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: From his office in Paris, the President of the United Federation of Planets leads the representative council.
name: Office of the President
text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. Once per turn, one Federation Ambassador, Admiral, Vice-Admiral or President OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Proconsul heads the Romulan Senate. Neral was Proconsul during the 2368 Vulcan Unification ruse.
name: Office of the Proconsul
text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. Once per turn, one Romulan General, Admiral, Senator or Proconsul OR {Sela} or {Tomalak} OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Subterranean base of the Terran Rebellion. Hidden on a small planetoid in the treacherous Badlands.
name: Terran Rebellion HQ
text: Seeds or plays on {Terran Hideout}; it is now the homeworld of [Fed][TE] cards. Once per turn, one [TE] personnel (except [AU]) OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Great Hall of Qo'noS is the seat of power for the entire Klingon Empire.
name: The Great Hall
text: Seeds or plays on {Qo'noS}. Once per turn, one Klingon Emperor, Chancellor or personnel with "High Council" in lore OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Changelings intermingle in the Great Link, merging form and thought into one communal entity.
name: The Great Link
text: Seeds or plays on {Founders' homeworld}. {Ketracel-White} on planet does not count down. Once per turn, one Founder OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: The Grand Nagus enjoys absolute control over Ferengi business affairs from his Chamber of Petitioners.
name: Tower of Commerce
text: Seeds or plays on {Ferenginar}. Once per turn, one Ferengi V.I.P., CIVILIAN or Hupyrian OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Identification: BORG UNICOMPLEX Task: Centralize all collective operations. Coordinate.
name: Unicomplex
text: Seeds or plays at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons. Once each turn, {Borg Queen} OR one unique drone OR one unique ship may report for free here.

lore: Create false documents on Bajoran homeworld pertaining to Cardassian occupation.
name: Alter Records
text: Computer Skill x2 + Obsidian Order x2 OR Computer Skill x2 + Treachery x4

lore: Secretly escort covert operatives to the Romulan homeworld.
name: Cloaked Mission
text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Honor

lore: Convey documents to Grand Nagus Zek on the Ferengi homeworld; beware enemy patrols.
name: Deliver Message
text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + Acquisition OR {Quark Son of Keldar} OR {Nog}

affiliation: Any 'Espionage... on Federation' card may play here.  Also, mission may be attempted if {Selok} in Away Team.
lore: Infiltrate Starfleet HQ; compile intelligence dossier on the Federation homeworld.
name: Espionage Mission
requires: Espionage... on Federation; Founder; Sector 001 Region;
text: Tal Shiar x2 OR Obsidian Order x2 OR FCA x2 OR Klingon Intelligence x2 OR 2 Founders

lore: Uncover covert supply lines supporting rebels on the Klingon Homeworld.
name: Expose Covert Supply
text: Treachery x3 + Navigation

lore: Covertly compile data on current Dominion homeworld in the Omarion Nebula.
name: Intelligence Operation
text: Navigation x2 + (Tal Shiar OR Obsidian Order) + Anthropology + (SECURITY x3 OR {any Odo})

lore: Negotiate for return of stolen Orbs still on Cardassian homeworld.
name: Orb Negotiations
text: Diplomacy x3 + [Baj] V.I.P. OR [Orb] personnel Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

lore: Locate secret base of escaped slaves.
name: Search for Rebels
text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [KCA] leaders OR {Professor Sisko} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: When Counselor Troi's and Lt. Prieto's shuttle crashed on Vagra II, a mysterious field prevented the Enterprise from retrieving its stranded crew members.
name: Armus: Energy Field
text: One personnel (random selection) aboard each of your ships here is "stopped." To get past, crew must be able to meet mission requirements (even if playing Borg).

lore: In 1996, the warp signature of a stranded U.S.S. Voyager was detected by SETI engineer Rain Robinson. The ship's crew monitored her call to alert Henry Starling.
name: Dial-Up
text: All personnel with DL/ in Away Team are "stopped." Place this dilemma on this mission; you may not download cards. Nullify with 3 Computer Skill and Anthropology.

lore: Slower Earth cargo ships such as the E.C.S. Horizon and the E.C.S. Fortunate often fell victim to faster pirates.
name: Cargo Pirates
text: One personnel (random selection) is "stopped." Then, if you have a [DQ] personnel in play OR if your opponent has three thieves, one personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped."
