lore: Andorians despised Tellarites. Vulcans distrusted Andorians. Tellarites disliked everyone. Until they found a common ally in humankind, conflict in the region was inevitable.
name: Difference of Opinion
text: All [Non] personnel in crew or Away Team are "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: In 2153, Phlox created Sim from a Lyssarrian desert larva. Archer and his crew chose to end Sim's life to save Trip's.
name: Mimetic Simbiot
text: To get past requires 3 MEDICAL OR INTEGRITY>30. Then, choose two personnel (random selection). One of those personnel dies (your choice).

lore: Gamma Quadrant alien in the form of a fairy tale character taken from the mind of Molly O'Brien. Distracted the crew of Deep Space 9 as an attempt to study its inhabitants.
name: Rumplestiltskin
text: X personnel are "stopped" (random selection), where X = the number of personnel in Away Team with five or more [*] icons. Discard dilemma.

lore: Invasive program created in 2368 by Data and Geordi La Forge to cause the total system failure of the Borg Collective.
name: Topological Anomaly 4747
text: Borg and [Holo] personnel, androids, and one ENGINEER here (random selection) are placed in stasis. Cure on your next turn with new SCIENCE arriving or when countdown expires.

lore: Sturdy metallic shaft tipped with magnetic claws. Used for towing by Starfleet's 22nd-century starships.
name: Grappler
text: Plays aboard your NX-class ship. Adds Tractor Beam. When crew completes a space mission that requires an attribute, discard to score points.

lore: Representative of scanning devices used by 22nd-century space-faring civilizations. Used aboard Enterprise as a complement to standard-issue devices.
name: Vulcan Tricorder
text: Once each turn, you may select SCIENCE OR Biology OR Geology. Until re-selected, your ENGINEER- and SCIENCE-classification [22] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

lore: "Today we're about to cross a new threshold. For nearly a century, we've waded ankle-deep in the ocean of space."
name: Finally Ready to Swim
text: Seeds on table. Once every turn, when you play a [22] card, you may draw a card. When you play a non-[22] personnel or ship, you must discard a card from hand.

lore: Though they say that one man's trash is another man's treasure, nothing is worth more on the black market than a fast ship.
name: Secondary Market
text: Plays to return a ship that you have commandeered to its owner's hand. Score points and draw up to five cards.

lore: In the 22nd-century, brief periods of peaceful cooperation existed between Starfleet and the Klingon Empire, such as the effort to stop the Qu'vat Colony virus.
name: Treaty: Starfleet/Klingon
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Antaak} or {Phlox} in play). Your [Sta] cards and your [Kli][22] cards recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Ensign Sato felt she had much in common with Sluggo: out of place, far from home, and unsure if she could survive. But, she soon realized, "It's not that hard to adapt."
name: We're Ready
text: Plays on table if you have three [Sta] personnel in play. At the end of each of your turns, if you do not have a [Non] card in play, you may draw an additional card.

name: Out of Time
text: Plays for free at any time to take up to three temporal agents in your discard pile into hand OR to allow your temporal agent, any number of your personnel present, and/or your ship he or she is aboard to time travel between a time location and the corresponding spaceline location. Discard incident OR "stop" your temporal agent to place this on top of your draw deck.

lore: Genetically-enhanced ability often breeds enhanced ambition. Love, trust, and friendship are sacrificed in the name of power.
name: Absolute Power
text: Once per game, kill your personnel to "unstop" all your augments of the same affiliation as that personnel. OR Once each turn, kill your augment to draw three cards.

lore: The crew of Enterprise paved the way for interstellar cooperation because of their willingness to embrace alien cultures and knowledge.
name: Diverse Experiences
text: Once each turn, when you complete a mission, draw a card for each [22] personnel in crew or Away Team (maximum 5).

lore: Repair severe damage at automated facility.
name: Automated Repair Station
text: Physics + Computer Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download and use {Spacedock} here.

lore: Prevent the spread of a lethal disfiguring virus - at any cost.
name: Control Plague
text: Biology + Exobiology + MEDICAL x2 + CUNNING>34

lore: Rescue or purchase captive crew members kidnapped in pirate raids.
name: Free Orion Slaves
text: Leadership + SECURITY x2 + STRENGTH>40 Orions may report here (for free, once each turn).

lore: Observe cycle of rebirth with devout pilgrims.
name: Observe Stellar Rebirth
text: Navigation + Anthropology + Stellar Cartography + INTEGRITY>28

lore: Intercede on restless local planet to stabilize local space.
name: Prevent Rebellion
text: Anthropology + Honor + SECURITY + INTEGRITY>29

name: File Annual Report
text: Seeds or plays on your {Earth}. If you have completed a different mission, your [Sta] personnel may attempt Earth with the following requirements: OFFICER + any staffed [Sta] ship in orbit + INTEGRIY>30 When you solve, mission is worth 30 points (instead of printed value), and you may download one {[Univ][Sta] personnel}.

name: Remote Interference
text: Seeds or plays on table. Twice each turn, when you move your [Rom] Drone-class ship to a location where an opponent has a ship, you may draw a card. At start of each of your turns, you may return an empty [Rom] Drone-class ship to hand OR discard a card to download a [Rom] Drone-class ship to hand. (Unique.)

name: Straight and Steady
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your [22] card is attacked, you may discard objective to make each [22] card involved attributes all +5 until the end of that battle. At the end of your opponent's turn, you may discard objective to move your [22] ship one spaceline location toward your homeworld or facility. (Unique. Captain's Order.)

lore: Bajoran poet from the 22nd century. Believed he was the Emissary of the Prophets sent to restore his people's d'jarras.
name: Akorem Laan
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Physics Law DL/ {D'jarras}

characteristicsKeywords: Human/Borg; Female; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Recruited as a temporal agent by the crew of the U.S.S. Relativity. Former Borg Seven of Nine saved Voyager from being erased from the timeline.
name: Ensign Jameson
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Exobiology Physics x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Out of Time}

lore: Physician responsible, albeit accidentally, for creating the disfiguring Klingon augment virus. Found a future in cranial reconstruction. Had a knack for diplomacy.
name: Antaak
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL SCIENCE Honor Exobiology DL/ {Any Targ} DL/ {maH nlv}

lore: Military director of the Klingon augment project. Judged Phlox to be weak-willed.
name: General K'Vagh
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Treachery Once each turn, may draw a card when you report an augment here.

lore: Representative of female Klingon augments. Relished the results of increased strength, speed, and stamina, but despised the new feelings of fear.
name: Laneth
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Transporter Skill Biology

lore: Klingon augment. Son of General K'Vagh. As a test of his augmented abilities, led the team that boarded Enterprise - but was left behind.
name: Marab
text: SECURITY Treachery Leadership Youth Stellar Cartography

lore: One of many Klingon augments experimented on by Antaak at the Qu'Vat colony. Even though they lost their cranial ridges, they remained Klingon.
name: Volok
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics

lore: Manipulative gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Beautiful Orion slave girl and thief. Seduced Kelby in a plot to capture Enterprise.
name: D'Nesh
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Treachery Computer Skill Anthropology Orion Syndicate

lore: Slave of the situation created by D'Nesh, Maras, and Navaar. Orion captain of the Devna-Lev. A thief at heart, but a gracious host.
name: Harrad-Sar
text: OFFICER Navigation Smuggling Orion Syndicate DL/ Any slave girl

characteristicsKeywords: Orion; Female; Slave Girl; Support Personnel; Thief;
lore: Representative Orion slave girl. Secretly manipulates the Orion Syndicate, as many in her line of work do. Valued for her skills as a thief.
name: Maras
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Orion Syndicate

lore: Experienced gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Alluring Orion slave girl and a master thief. Nearly succeeded in capturing Enterprise.
name: Navaar
text: CIVILIAN Leadership x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Orion Syndicate DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

characteristicsKeywords: Suliban; genetically enhanced; Male; Shape-shifter; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Genetically-enhanced Suliban shape-shifter who led the Cabal in the 22nd-century. Temporal agent for a mysterious manipulator from the future.
name: Silik
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 ENGINEER Physics Leadership May report to any time location.

lore: Brilliant military strategist behind most of the campaigns of the Earth-Romulan War. A former senator expelled for challenging Imperial doctrine.
name: Admiral Valdore
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Gareb} DL/ {Remote Interference}

lore: Blind Aenar male captured by Romulan agents. Told he was the last surviving Aenar. Manipulated into telepathically piloting the drone ships.
name: Gareb
text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Geology

lore: Designer of the Raptor prototype. Created the long-distance telepresence control system. Secretly informed Vrax about the project.
name: Nijil
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Computer Skill Navigation Your Drone-class ships are RANGE +2.

lore: Representative of one of the many young female officers stationed on Enterprise. Their experiences aboard would be invaluable in their careers.
name: Dallas
text: SCIENCE Physics

lore: Cautious admiral responsible for overseeing portions of the NX project and removing "dead wood" from Starfleet's ranks.
name: Daniel Leonard
text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation x 2 DL/ Any [Sta] ship

characteristicsKeywords: Human/Alien; 31st-century; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Resourceful temporal agent from the 31st-century. Frequently "assisted" the Enterprise crew in preventing alterations to the timeline. More or less human.
name: Daniels
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Archaeology Physics Anthropology DL/ {Out of Time}

lore: Comparable captain of Columbia, the second Warp 5 ship. Romantically involved with Jonathan Archer.
name: Erika Hernandez
text: OFFICER Anthropology Diplomacy Leadership SECURITY DL/ Any Captain's Order card

lore: Representative Starfleet officer serving aboard the NX-class ships in the 2150s. The crew routinely faced illness and injury in the line of duty.
name: Garrid
text: MEDICAL Biology SCIENCE

lore: Uneasy educator recruited to be Captain Archer's communications officer. Fluent in countless languages. Capable relief cook.
name: Hoshi Sato (Straight and Steady)
text: SCIENCE Music Anthropology Geology Computer Skill Exobiology DL/ {We're Ready}

lore: On the edge of known space, he was one of many Enterprise crew captured by Orion slavers. Did not sell well. Held it together long enough to be rescued.
name: Jeffrey Pierce
text: SECURITY Anthropology Computer Skill Diplomacy

lore: Disciplined NX-01 senior armory officer. Recruited into a covert operations unit authorized by Article 14, Section 31, of the Starfleet Charter.
name: Malcolm Reed (Straight and Steady)
text: SECURITY OFFICER Law Section 31 Computer Skill DL/ {Starfleet Phaser Pistol}

lore: Representative of the veteran officers assigned to Enterprise. Starfleet hoped their experience would prove useful in deep space.
name: McDermott
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership SECURITY Transporter Skill

lore: Austere commander romantically involved with Charles Tucker III. Commander of Enterprise in Jonathan Archer's absence.
name: T'Pol (Straight and Steady)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy OFFICER Mindmeld Stellar Cartography

lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey originally commanded by Martrex. In 2153, commandeered and commanded by Raakin, and then commanded by Malik.
name: I.K.S. Nguq'Yab
text: Attributes all +1 for each augment aboard (limit 4). Tractor Beam

lore: First of two prototypes created from modified warbirds. Controlled remotely via telepresence. Carried adaptable triphasic weapons systems.
name: Raptor One
text: Holographic Skin May report to any spaceline location.

lore: NX-02. Boasted advanced hull plating and pulsed phase cannon upgrades based on Jonathan Archer's recommendation.
name: Columbia
text: DL/ {Warp Speed Transfer}

lore: San Francisco survived World War III and became a beacon of human progress.
name: 22nd-Century San Francisco
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Seat of Starfleet} here. Each card with both [Sta] and [Preview] gains [22] (even if not in play). Native to this timeline: all [Sta] cards, [Non][22] personnel, [Neu][22] cards, and [22] equipment (except [MQ] cards). Non-[22] cards are excluded from battle here.

lore: Secret facility where the Empire created superior Klingon augments.
name: Augment Research Facility
text: Seeds or plays on table. Native to this timeline: all [Kli][22] cards, [Neu][22] cards, [22] equipment, and all augments with both [AU] and [22]. Once per turn, one such augment reporting at this location may report for free.

lore: From the spires of Romulus, ten soldiers nearly conquered the galaxy.
name: Drone Control Room
text: Seeds or plays on table; any player may download {Admiral Valdore} here. If any player has Empathy, Leadership, and Treachery here, that player's Drone-class ships may move and attack without staffing or a leader. Native to this timeline: all [Rom][22] cards and [22] equipment. Once per turn, one native personnel reporting at this location may report for free.

lore: Captain Archer's pet beagle. Likes cheese. T'Pol thinks he smells worse than even the humans do.
name: Porthos *VP
text: ANIMAL [Sta] Humans present are INTEGRITY +1. Once every turn, may "chase" (stop) one ANIMAL present.

lore: Physician responsible, albeit accidentally, for creating the disfiguring Klingon augment virus. Found a future in cranial reconstruction. Had a knack for diplomacy.
name: Antaak *VP
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL SCIENCE Honor Exobiology DL/ {Any Targ} DL/ {maH nlv}

lore: They have two settings, stun and kill. It would be best not to confuse them.
name: Starfleet Phaser Pistol *VP
text: Starfleet use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (or +3 if that personnel has SECURITY). (Cumulative.)

lore: Famous captain thought lost in 2293. Returned from the nexus 78 years later to make a difference once more.
name: James T. Kirk *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Computer Skill Honor DL/ Any Captain's Order card Scores 5 points each time he helps solve a mission.

lore: After beaming Kirk and Spock aboard the Qel'Poh to escape the destruction of Genesis, Maltz told Kirk he didn't deserve to live. Kirk replied, "Fine, I'll kill you later."
name: A Fast Ship Would Be Nice *VP
text: Kills one personnel (opponent's choice). You may substitute a bodyguard or {Guard Drone} present OR an empty ship here (moved to opponent's side of spaceline; commandeered).

lore: No strangers to oppression, many Bajorans fought the 2374 Dominion occupation from within. With Odo's help, Kira's small "resistance cell" paved the way for the Dominion withdrawal.
name: Espionage: Bajoran on Dominion *VP
text: Plays on any Dominion mission (for free if you have {Odo} there). Your Bajoran personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: A wall display of all ships to bear the name Enterprise is a tradition built into each new ship of the line. This exhibit is in the ready room aboard Enterprise.
name: Wall of Ships *VP
text: Downloads {any Enterprise}. Discard event. OR Plays on table. Adds 1 to RANGE, WEAPONS, and SHIELDS of each of your Enterprises. (Cumulative.)

lore: "We have analyzed your defensive capabilities as being unable to withstand us. If you defend yourselves, you will be punished."
name: We Are the Borg *VP
text: Downloads two [Def] drones; discard event. OR Plays on table. Each turn, report one of your [Bor] cards for free or make an additional end-of-turn draw (immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

lore: Leonard H. "Bones" McCoy. Chief medical officer of the starship Enterprise. Awarded the Legion of Honor.
name: Dr. McCoy *VP
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Biology Once per game, may nullify a dilemma requiring MEDICAL where present. DL/ Any "{I'm a Doctor, not}..." card

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human. History will record that Mr. Spock rose to command the I.S.S. Enterprise, then reformed the Empire and ultimately caused its downfall.
name: First Officer Spock *VP
text: SCIENCE OFFICER Mindmeld Diplomacy x 2 Honor Transporter Skill DL/ Any [OS] Equipment card

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Admiral Riker in an alternate future. U.S.S. Enterprise-D was fitted with a third warp engine nacelle, greatly enhancing its speed and power.
name: Future Enterprise *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
name: Enterprise *VP
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

lore: Heroic diplomat and greatest explorer of the 22nd century. Captained Enterprise in the 2150s. Saved Earth from the Xindi. Friend of Charles Tucker III.
name: Jonathan Archer 2E (Broken Bow)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership ENGINEER Honor At [S]: Navigation, Anthropology, Physics, Law

lore: Commemorative inscription mounted on the bridge of the U.S.S. Defiant. Serves as an inspiration to the Defiant crew. Meant little to the soldiers of the Terran Empire.
name: Defiant Dedication Plaque *VP
text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is RANGE +2, or +3 if ship is Defiant class. (Not cumulative. Captain's Order.)

name: Battle Bridge Door
text: Place one atop Battle Bridge side deck during the seed phase. Battle Bridge is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). OR Stock in deck and play at start of ship battle (even during opponent's turn) if you have Leadership in that battle. Allows you to draw two extra Tactic cards (cumulative) or enhances each of your ships' and facilities' WEAPONS +1; then discard doorway.

lore: Self-contained garment for protecting personnel in a hostile environment. A variable magnetic field can be activated in the boots when working in zero-gravity.
name: Environmental Suit
text: You may discard this equipment to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma or a Tactic card (that personnel is stopped instead).

lore: Standard display on most modern starships. Combines weapons control with target acquisition and analysis subroutines. Highly effective in the hands of a trained tactical officer.
name: Tactical Console
text: Plays on your ship docked at your facility. While you have {Miles O'Brien} or a SECURITY-classification personnel aboard, ship is weapons +3. (Captain's Order.)

name: Make It So
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if your staffed ship has its matching commander aboard, you may "unstop" it (once per game per Ship card title) OR download {Ready Room Door} (to download a Captain's Order) OR , if that ship is in battle (even during opponent's turn), download a Tactic card (once per game per Tactic card title). Discard incident after use, unless that matching commander has [Ent-E] icon.

lore: Upon encountering Dominion ships during a rescue attempt in 2370, Captain Keogh ordered the U.S.S. Odyssey and two runabouts to execute a predetermined attack pattern.
name: Attack Pattern Delta
text: Plays at start of ship battle. Doubles one {Tactical Console} until end of battle OR draw up to X additional Tactic cards, where X = the number of your ships in this battle.

name: Attack Wing
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 for each of your ships firing. DEFENSE bonus +1 if you have a Jem'Hadar attack ship defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Sickbay damaged: randomly kills one MEDICAL, Exobiology or disabled personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Infirmary}).

name: Bajoran Phaser Banks
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 1. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a Bajoran ship firing with Resistance or Navigation aboard (or +4 if one crew member has both skills). Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Borg Cutting Beam
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 3. If you hit, you may relocate one of target's crew members (random selection; from any one site if on a Nor) to one of your ships in this battle and assimilate that personnel. Hit or direct hit = [Down]. Hull: -40%

name: Breen Disruptor Burst
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Breen ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Breen Energy-Dampening Weapon
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Requires a ship with Energy Dampener firing. Hit or direct hit = [Down][Flip] and, unless target is {U.S.S. Sao Paulo}, is {I.K.C. Ki'tang}, or has Energy Dampener, "power surge" also disables RANGE and WEAPONS. Hull: -20% Power surge: special equipment off line. Discard this damage marker at end of opponent's next turn.

name: Chain Reaction Pulsar
text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. Requires a staffed ship which has three or more staffing icons firing. ATTACK bonus +1 if Akira class. Hit or direct hit = [Down] and nullifies one Event card enhancing target's attributes (once per turn). Hull: -35% Scanners off line: you may play {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} only where you have an undamaged ship.

name: "Crimson Forcefield"
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. Harmless pyrotechnic ruse nullifies opponent's Tactic card unless opponent has an OFFICER with CUNNING>8 aboard a ship or facility in this battle. Hit = [Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -40% Cloaking Device off line.

name: Evasive Maneuvers
text: Attack: -2. Defense: 4. DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a ship with no staffing requirements defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Plasma leak: randomly kills one ENGINEER, Astrophysics or Physics personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ore Processing Unit}).

name: Ferengi Energy Weapon
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Ferengi ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Full Phaser Spread
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Galaxy-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Science panel destroyed: randomly kills one SCIENCE or Stellar Cartography personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Science Lab}).

name: Isolytic Burst
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. Requires a {Son'a Battleship} or {Li'seria} firing. If you hit, randomly kills one additional personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice). Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Maximum Firepower
text: Attack: 6. Defense: -3. Hit = [Flip][Flip] (or [Flip][Flip][Flip] if you have {Future Enterprise}, {I.K.C. Chang}, {I.K.C. Fek'lhr}, {Decius}, any [AU] ship with the word "future" in its lore firing). Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Transporters off line.

name: Phased Polaron Beam
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Phaser Banks
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Federation ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Photon Torpedo
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have an Akira-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Tactical panel overload: randomly kills one SECURITY or Computer Skill personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Security Office}).

name: Picard Maneuver
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. If you initiated ship battle with your matching commander aboard your ship, it appears to be in two places at once and has a 50/50 chance to avoid all damage this battle. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% EPS taps overloaded: Opponent may immediately download to this ship one {Plasma Fire} or {Warp Core Breach} (if possible).

name: Plasma Torpedo
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Romulan ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Plasma Energy Burst
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +4 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a D'Kora-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, causes electromagnetic disruptions ([Down]). EM burst: until end of your next full turn, WEAPONS disabled and all ENGINEER-classification personnel are "stopped."

name: Primary Energy Weapon
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Borg ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Pulse Disruptor
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Klingon ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Pulse Phaser Cannons
text: Attack: 4. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Defiant-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Tractor beam off line.

name: Quantum Torpedo
text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Sovereign-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -15% Sensors off line: crew cannot attempt space missions.

name: Riker Maneuver
text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. Requires a ship at a nebula firing; ATTACK bonus +3 if {William T. Riker} aboard. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip], and another opposing ship present (your choice) is also hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Plasma containment rupture: opponent may immediately download {Plasma Fire} to this ship.

name: Target Warp Field Coils
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. May not be used to fire upon a facility. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Warp drive off line: opponent may immediately download {Engine Imbalance} to this ship as an interrupt (immune to {Amanda Rogers}).

name: Spiral-Wave Disruptor
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Cardassian ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

name: Strafing Run
text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Hideki-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Bridge damaged: randomly kills one OFFICER, Leadership or Navigation personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ops}).

name: Target Engines
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% RANGE enhancements off line.

name: Target Shields
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, drains target's SHIELDS ([Down]). SHIELDS enhancements off line.

name: Target These Coordinates
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Hit = [Down][Flip] (or [Down][Flip][Flip] if target is affected by {Weak Spot}). Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Shields fluctuating: opponent's transporters, if operated by Transporter Skill personnel, may beam through SHIELDS.

name: Target Weapons
text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% WEAPONS enhancements off line.

name: T'Pol/Soong Maneuver
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +3 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a NX-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Burn and Turn: until the end of your next full turn, this ship may not move to a mission where an opponent has a ship.

lore: Armus' boredom and cruelty led to Data pointing his phaser at his crewmates and then himself.
name: Armus: Roulette
text: If four personnel (random selection) have CUNNING>30 OR one of them has Leadership and INTEGRITY>7, discard dilemma. Otherwise, one is killed (opponent's choice) and the other selected personnel are "stopped." Mission continues.

lore: Banished from the Continuum, Q lamented his transformation into a "normal, imperfect, lumpen human being."
name: Helpless
text: One Away Team member is chosen (random selection). If that personnel does not have a skill in mission requirements, that personnel and one other personnel (random selection) are "stopped" (even if playing Borg).

lore: A simple game of probabilities can make a fortune or provide a way home.
name: High Rollers
text: Opponent may download and seed here any two {Royale Casino} dilemmas, then place on mission. Each Royale Casino dilemma you face here first "stops" one Away Team member (your choice).

lore: After Royale's clearly marked exits failed to provide an escape, Riker, Data, and Worf were forced to follow the clues: up.
name: Royale Casino: Elevator
text: Opponent may report a personnel. Return one of your Away Team members to hand (your choice). Compare those personnel; highest total printed attributes wins points. Discard dilemma.

lore: "Our captain needs a holiday."
name: Shore Leave
text: To get past requires a male and a female OR Honor + INTEGRITY>50. Opponent may then download and seed here up to two of the following (except Combo dilemmas): {Female's Love Interest}, {Male's Love Interest}, {Parallel Romance}, or {Wind Dancer}.

lore: While confronting the Echo Papa 607 weapons system, Geordi La Forge ordered a saucer separation to protect the ship's crew. He took command of the stardrive section.
name: The Arsenal: Divided
text: Divide your unique crew members into two face-down piles. One pile is "stopped" (opponent's choice). To get past, ship must be staffed and have INTEGRITY>27 remaining.

lore: Even the strongest minds have weaknesses.
name: The Loss
text: To get past requires 2 Empathy OR 2 Mindmeld OR 2 androids OR INTEGRITY>38. Opponent may then download and seed here up to two of the following: {Bendii Syndrome}, {Helpless}, {System-Wide Cascade Failure}, or {Two-Dimensional Creatures}.

lore: Old feuds and lingering grudges can persist across years or even centuries, destroying many innocent lives.
name: The Vengeance Factor
text: Opponent may download and seed here up to two of the following (except Combo dilemmas): {Microvirus}, {The Gatherers}, or {Yuta}, then place on mission. Skill and attribute requirements of Microvirus and The Gatherers here are doubled.

name: Dyson Sphere Door
text: Place one atop Dilemma side deck (up to 13 dilemmas) during the seed phase. Dilemma side deck is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). You may seed [AU] dilemmas. Dilemmas you download must come from here (ignoring opponent's cards that prevent downloading). When opponent seeds {Empok Nor}, you may download and seed up to three dilemmas related to Empok Nor beneath station from here.

lore: Portable transport technology capable of beaming a single target over a short distance. Data carried a prototype version of the device.
name: Emergency Transport Unit
text: You may return this equipment to hand to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma (that personnel is placed on your ship here and is "stopped").

lore: "You do not understand. I do not serve things evil. I am evil."
name: All-Consuming Evil
text: Seeds or plays on {Vagra II}. Doubles effects of all Armus dilemmas. Once per game, may suspend play to download {any Armus} dilemma and seed it beneath any mission, then discard event. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Akorem Laan called for the reinstatement of the caste system abandoned during the Occupation. The Kira family name indicated Nerys' membership in the artists' d'jarra.
name: D'jarras
text: Plays on table. All of your [Baj] OFFICER-classification personnel gain CIVILIAN. All of your [Baj] CIVILIAN-classification personnel gain OFFICER.

lore: To avoid compromising the Prime Directive, the Federation uses camouflaged stations to observe primitive societies.
name: Duck Blind
text: Seeds or plays on your Alpha Quadrant planet mission (except a homeworld). End of each turn, if your 2 Anthropology present, draw an extra card. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Over 100 years of refits and relaunches, the Federation's flagship kept its historic name and registry number.
name: Federation Flagship: Renewed
text: Plays on your {[Fed] Enterprise (except [OS])}. End of each turn, if ship is undocked, uncloaked, and has its matching commander aboard at a [S] mission, draw an additional card. (Unique.)

lore: Infected and facing death, Riker was forced to relive his past. "It's spread to the spinal column."
name: Shades of Gray: Anguish
text: Seeds or plays on table. Doubles requirements of each {Cosmic String Fragment}, {Gravitic Mine}, {Menthar Booby Trap}, and {Null Space}, and personnel that help overcome those dilemmas are "stopped." (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Infected and facing death, Riker was forced to relive his past. "...the infection will spread to the brain within an hour."
name: Shades of Gray: Brutality
text: Seeds or plays on table. Doubles skill requirements of each {Archer}, {Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease}, {Interphasic Plasma Creatures}, {Tsiolkovsky Infection}, and {Nanites}. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Infected and facing death, Riker was forced to relive his past. "Then all we've done is made things worse!"
name: Shades of Gray: Cruelty
text: Seeds or plays on table. Adds 2 Exobiology to each set of requirements on each {Alien Abduction}; {Chalnoth}; {Coalescent Organism}; {Shaka, When the Walls Fell}; and {Zaldan}. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Dyson Sphere Door *VP
text: Place one atop Dilemma side deck (up to 13 dilemmas) during the seed phase. Dilemma side deck is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). You may seed [AU] dilemmas. Dilemmas you download must come from here (ignoring opponent's cards that prevent downloading). When opponent seeds {Empok Nor}, you may download and seed up to three dilemmas related to Empok Nor beneath station from here.

lore: Infected and facing death, Riker was forced to relive his past. "...I don't know if he can withstand it. He's extremely weak."
name: Shades of Gray: Despair
text: Seeds or plays on table. Adds 1 to every printed number that appears on each {Ancient Computer}, {Birth of "Junior"}, {Nitrium Metal Parasites}, and {Rascals} (except Combo dilemmas). (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Son'a facility constructed to oversee the Federation's process in evaluating the Ba'ku.
name: Son'a Observatory
text: Seeds on {Ba'ku Planet}. Cloaking Device. Your Son'a cards may report here (for free, once each turn). Twice per game, you may download a Son'a personnel OR {Matthew Dougherty} here.

lore: As Starfleet explored and expanded its territory, it began establishing outposts to provide repair and resupply services. The first was on Berengaria VII.
name: Starbase One
text: Build at your completed mission where you have a [Sta] ENGINEER. DL/ Any [Sta] card

name: Federation Flagship: Relaunched
text: Seeds on table; download {U.S.S. Enterprise-E} to your [Fed] Outpost (opponent may [Flip]). Your [Ent-E] and [Fed][FC] personnel may report aboard your U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Once each turn, one such personnel may do so for free. Your three [Ent-E] personnel present together may meet an additional [Cmd] staffing requirement. Discard this incident if you have a [Fed] personnel in play who is not [Ent-E] or [FC].

name: Holoprogram: Historical Poker Game
text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Albert Einstein}, {Sir Isaac Newton}, or {Stephen Hawking} aboard. Once per turn, if all three are aboard, you may "observe greatness": discard a card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw one card (or up to two if {Data} is present).

name: Hotel Royale
text: Plays on {Theta VIII}. Your cards with "Hotel Royale" or "Royale Casino" in lore may report on planet (for free, once each turn). Points you score from Royale Casino dilemmas faced by your opponent's personnel do not count towards {Writ of Accountability}. OR Plays to download {The Charybdis} or a personnel with "Hotel Royale" or "Royale Casino" in lore, then discard incident.

name: maH nlv
text: Seeds on table. Your [22] Klingons may report where you have an [OS] Klingon (or vice-versa). Your [22] and [OS] Klingons may use 2 Treachery as if it were 1 Honor. OR Plays on your crew or Away Team of at least three [22] Klingons. Replace those Klingons (place out-of-play) by downloading an equal number of [OS] or [22] Klingon personnel.

name: Seductive Dance
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, when your {Commander Uhura} or slave girl is facing a dilemma, discard your event from play to choose one: one personnel present adds a skill from another personnel present until the end of the dilemma OR all personnel present are attributes all +1 until the end of current mission attempt OR one personnel present about to be killed is "stopped" instead.

name: Warp Speed Transfer
text: Plays on table. When your crew is attempting a space mission aboard your ship, you may suspend play to move your other staffed ship on the same spaceline (up to double its full RANGE) to that mission and place one personnel aboard on the attempting ship; that personnel joins the crew. Each ship's RANGE for this turn is used, then place incident out-of-play. (Unique.)

lore: A hologram of Lewis Zimmerman wanted to delete The Doctor's growing interest in music to stabilize the EMH's program.
name: Cluttering Irrelevancies
text: Once per turn, plays at start of mission attempt to target your [Holo] personnel. That personnel gains any skill until the end of the mission attempt, then returns to hand.

lore: Discover origin of 20th-century Earth material in orbit of alien planet.
name: Investigate Anachronism
text: Anthropology x2 + (Greed x2 OR CUNNING>33) When seeded, you may download {Hotel Royale} here.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Locate and rescue stranded crash survivors held by evil entity.
name: Save Stranded Crew
text: Transporter Skill + Leadership + ENGINEER x2 When seeded, you may download {All-Consuming Evil}.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Bodyguard; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of Bajoran security officers serving aboard Deep Space 9. Often served as a bodyguard for visiting dignitaries and key personnel.
name: Brilgar
text: SECURITY Anthropology Law

lore: "Species 10026 is already adding to our perfection. You can feel their distinctiveness coursing through us, enhancing us."
name: Borg Queen (Shades of Gray)
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. Leadership Treachery Twice per game, may download {We Are the Borg}.

lore: Identification: REQUISITIONS DRONE Task: Assess resources for evaluation. Obtain. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species
name: Six of Seven
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Physics Once per game, may download {Bynars Data Transfer} in place of your normal card play.

lore: Female Haliian. Romantically involved with Geordi La Forge. Did not get along with officer Keith Rocha. Posted at Relay Station 47.
name: Aquiel Uhnari
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Computer Skill Exobiology Youth DL/ {Canar}

lore: Coldly logical soldier. In the mirror universe, the Vulcan Tuvok fought for the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Tuvok (Shades of Gray)
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Mindmeld Memory Omega Once per game, may be taken into hand from draw deck when any player uses the DL/ on a [MQ] card.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Teacher;
lore: Married to Miles O'Brien. In 2369, Keiko O'Brien served as a school teacher on Deep Space 9.
name: Mrs. O'Brien
text: CIVILIAN Biology Exobiology Honor SCIENCE May draw a card for each Youth personnel that enters play here (once per game per affiliation).

lore: Re-creation of the famed 21st-century physicist. Pursued the Unified Field Theory. Worked on the warp engine. Suffered from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
name: Stephen Hawking
text: SCIENCE Physics Astrophysics x 2 Music

lore: Klingon chief of security aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Returned to Starfleet after a hiatus as the Federation Ambassador to Qo'noS.
name: Worf (Shades of Gray)
text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Leadership Law Anthropology Diplomacy

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Male; Nurse; Support Personnel; Thief;
lore: Representative of Ferengi thieves in the 22nd century. Served as a nurse in Ulis' band of privateers. Had no other roles.
name: Grish
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Transporter Skill

lore: Ferengi thief that succeeded his cousin Ulis as commander of the Quetsivoo. Held dominion over the crew's Andorian ale supply.
name: Krem
text: SCIENCE Honor Astrophysics Geology FCA Navigation DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: Thief in Ulis' band of privateers. Likes tranya. Rattled by T'Pol's implication that his captain was trying to cheat him.
name: Muk
text: SECURITY Archaeology Physics Treachery DL/ Any [Fer][22] personnel OR any [22] equipment

lore: Captain of the Quetsivoo. The Ferengi thief served as leader of the privateers Grish, Krem, and Muk. Found a future as a cook and guide.
name: Ulis
text: ENGINEER Acquisition Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Biology DL/ {Secondary Market}

lore: Kazon-Ogla serving under Jabin. Laid aside his varied interests to serve his sect as a guard.
name: Rielat
text: MEDICAL Anthropology Navigation Acquisition Music DL/ {Thermal Deflectors}

lore: Klingon captain of the I.K.S. Nguq'Yab. Commanded dozens of secret missions throughout the Empire on behalf of the Klingon High Council.
name: Martrex
text: OFFICER Leadership Music Biology Stellar Cartography

lore: Slave girl sold in the markets of Verex III. Orion female known for her extreme appetites and her innate, intimate skills.
name: Neras
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Once per game, when reported, draw two cards.

lore: Illusion of Kevin Uxbridge's wife, who was killed by the Husnock. Re-created to comfort her powerful husband.
name: Rishon
text: CIVILIAN Biology Geology Music Honor Twice per game, may download {Rishon Uxbridge}.

lore: Employee of the Royale Casino. Occasionally served as a waiter. Romantically involved with Rita.
name: The Bellboy
text: CIVILIAN Doubles points of {Royale Casino} dilemmas where present. Greed Honor

lore: Male and female aliens from Devidia II. Served as a 19th-century doctor and nurse.
name: The Foragers
text: MEDICAL+MEDICAL Doctor: Treachery Greed DL/ {Ophidian Cane} Nurse: Biology Exobiology DL/ {Devidian Foragers}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Christopher Pike-related; Female; Slave Girl;
lore: Human survivor who became a green-skinned slave girl in an illusion. Attempted to seduce Christopher Pike for her Talosian captors.
name: Vina
text: CIVILIAN Honor Start of each turn, select a skill; loses skill at end of turn.

lore: Romulan senator. Old acquaintance of Admiral Valdore. Leveraged his political clout to sponsor the Raptor Drone project. Does not tolerate failure.
name: Senator Vrax
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 SCIENCE Law Diplomacy Astrophysics

lore: Denobulan doctor kidnapped and taken to the Qu'Vat colony. Forced to help the Klingons develop a cure to the augment virus. Specialist in immunology.
name: Phlox (Shades of Gray)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology MEDICAL SCIENCE Honor Biology

lore: Vidiian male. Broker of information. Former chairman of the Sodality's Bureau of Classical Art. Previously smuggler of antiquities, turned to smuggling organs.
name: Morulla
text: SECURITY Smuggling Computer Skill DL/ {Jaglom Shrek - Information Broker}

lore: Small Ferengi transport ship favored by privateers in the 22nd century. Featured minimal crew quarters and a deceptively large cargo bay.
name: Quetsivoo
text: Attributes all +1 for each thief aboard (limit 4). DL/ {Ferengi Gas Trap}

name: Schoolroom
text: Youth personnel, professors, and teachers may report here. Once each turn, if player who controls station has a professor or teacher here, that player may place a personnel from hand with Archaeology, Anthropology, Astrophysics, Biology, Exobiology, Geology, Physics, or Stellar Cartography on the bottom of their discard pile to give each of his or her Youth personnel in play that skill until end of turn. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

lore: Denobulan doctor kidnapped and taken to the Qu'Vat colony. Forced to help the Klingons develop a cure to the augment virus. Specialist in immunology.
name: Phlox (Shades of Gray)*
text: MEDICAL Exobiology MEDICAL SCIENCE Honor Biology

lore: "You're on Enterprise. Enterprise-J to be exact, a distant relative of your ship. We're four hundred years in the future. I've brought you to a monumental moment in history, the battle of Procyon Five, where the Federation engaged the Sphere Builders. ... You are the only one who can convince them of what I have told you. It is crucial to history that you do not sacrifice yourself."
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-J 2E
text: Plays in your core. Each of your personnel at a mission that is worth 40 or more points is attributes +1. (Unique.)

lore: Klingon chief of security aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Returned to Starfleet after a hiatus as the Federation Ambassador to Qo'noS.
name: Worf (Shades of Gray) *VP
text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Leadership Law Anthropology Diplomacy

lore: "I wish to note for the record that the evidence against my clients is entirely circumstantial. I beg the court to consider this when pronouncing its sentence."
name: Show Trial 2E
text: Randomly select a personnel who has Leadership or MEDICAL to be stopped. If you have more points than each of your opponents, randomly select an additional personnel to be stopped.

lore: "We almost escaped the void on our own. If we work together, I believe we'll succeed."
name: The Void Alliance 2E
text: To play this event, you must command three [Voy] personnel. Plays in your core. When your personnel is facing a dilemma, you may give command of this event to the player on your left to have that personnel gain a skill of your choice until the end of that dilemma (move this event to his or her core).

lore: "We can take the whole by force, what they propose to divide!"
name: Warrior's Resolve 2E
text: Order - Randomly select a card in your discard pile to be removed from the game. If that card was a [Kli] personnel, add that personnel's cost to the attributes of each of your [Kli] ships until the end of turn. Place this interrupt on the bottom of your deck.

lore: "You can't just go storming onto their ship without their permission."
name: George Primmin 2E (Starfleet Security)
text: Anthropology OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, name a unique personnel. That personnel cannot be killed or stopped by dilemmas until the end of turn.

lore: "Unless we find a way to destroy the creatures without killing their human hosts, my command responsibilities will force me to kill over a million people."
name: Coordinated Counterattack 2E
text: To play this event, you must command six [OS] or [CF] personnel. Plays in your core. Opponent's personnel cannot gain skills.

affiliation: Any affiliation (except [Bor]) may attempt this mission.
lore: "Our planet has a dual existence ... it shifts between this dimension and another."
name: Explore Extradimensional World 2E
text: Anthropology + Exobiology x2 + SCIENCE + Transporter Skill + CUNNING>32 Your personnel cannot attempt this mission if it was attempted by your personnel on your previous turn.

lore: Meaning Desert Wind, the Syrranite leader assumed the name Arev to travel incognito. Pacifist Vulcan dissident, he carried the katra of Surak.
name: Syrran 2E (Raise the Stakes)
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Mindmeld Anthropology Archaeology Diplomacy Honor x 2

lore: "War is obsolete... as we are in danger of becoming."
name: Azetbur 2E (Visionary Chancellor) *VP
text: Anthropology Diplomacy Exobiology Honor Law Leadership x 2 When this personnel uses a skill to complete a mission, you may destroy three of your Assault and/or Maneuver events to score 10 points.

lore: "The point is, with all due respect, you're trying to turn me into your idea of a model officer."
name: Ro Laren 2E (Headstrong Ensign) *VP
text: Navigation OFFICER Computer Skill While this personnel is facing a dual dilemma, she cannot be randomly selected by dilemmas.

lore: "'All I ask is a tall ship, and a star to steer her by.'"
name: U.S.S. Enterprise 2E (Earth's Savior) *VP
text: Tractor Beam. While you command a [OS] or [Films] personnel, you may play this ship at your {Earth}. When this ship is about to move between Earth and another mission, subtract 1 from the Range required.

lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: Contingency vessel. Assimilate human homeworld. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Sphere 2E (Resistance is Futile) *VP
text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes. DL/ {Optimize Drones}

lore: The perfect mate, an empathic metamorph. Kriosian mutant romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Dutifully married Alrik despite her bond to Jean-Luc.
name: Kamala 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: V.I.P. Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Empathy When reported, select any skill present.

lore: Uneasy educator recruited to be Captain Archer's communications officer. Fluent in countless languages. Capable relief cook.
name: Hoshi Sato 2E (Straight and Steady) *VP
text: SCIENCE Music Anthropology Geology Computer Skill Exobiology DL/ {We're Ready}

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: During Captain Sisko's absence after the death of Jadzia Dax, Kira Nerys was promoted to command DS9. She soon learned the responsibilities of the captain's chair.
name: Colonel Kira 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill X=2 if a [Rom] personnel in play.

lore: "I think I know my way around an engine room."
name: B'Elanna Torres 2E (Straightforward Engineer) *VP
text: ENGINEER x 2 Physics Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery Order - If this personnel is aboard your ship, discard a card from hand to remove a Damage card from that ship. You may do this only once each turn.

lore: "Brik yop tal hapdrew, ki los hoem bog?"
name: Quark 2E (Little Green Man) *VP
text: Acquisition Anthropology Physics While this personnel is present with a [AU] personnel, he is attributes +1 and gains Acquisition, Diplomacy, and Treachery.

lore: Treasure hunter, archaeologist, liar, and thief romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Partnered with Q to explore distant Gamma Quadrant ruins.
name: Vash 2E (The Next Generation) *VP
text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology Smuggling Acquisition DL/ {Dig}

lore: Alien physiologist who keeps an exotic menagerie. Denobulan doctor and occasional counselor. Has three wives, adhering to his world's polyamorous customs.
name: Phlox 2E (Broken Bow) *VP
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology SCIENCE DL/ {Sickbay} Attributes all +1 for each ANIMAL present.

lore: "Oh, Rom..."
name: Leeta 2E (Rebel Supporter) *VP
text: Anthropology Honor When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. While you have more than ten cards in your discard pile, each of your Dissident personnel present is attributes +1.

lore: Pel posed as a male waiter in order to bypass Ferengi commerce laws and earn profit. Rom exposed her secret, jealous that she had usurped his position at Quark's side.
name: Secret Identity 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is discarded. If you did not seed this dilemma, you may download a personnel of the same affiliation to join crew or Away Team.

lore: Portable transport technology capable of beaming a single target over a short distance. Data carried a prototype version of the device.
name: Emergency Transport Unit 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: You may return this equipment to hand to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma (that personnel is placed on your ship here and is "stopped").

lore: Commodore Decker, driven to the edge of madness by the loss of his entire crew, sacrificed himself in a vain attempt to destroy the "Planet Killer."
name: Personal Duty 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: To get past requires Leadership OR OFFICER. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: Khan's battle experience was significant but limited to terrestrial combat. Three-dimensional thinking gave Captain Kirk and the Enterprise a clear advantage.
name: Tactical Disadvantage 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Players show their hands and examine revealed ships. Unless your total SHIELDS > opponent's total WEAPONS, kill one personnel (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Harry Kim and B'Elanna Torres were abducted by the Caretaker and exiled to the subterranean Ocampan society.
name: The Caretaker's "Guests" 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: One personnel present (opponent's choice) is placed atop draw deck. You may place a different personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile with this crew or Away Team.

lore: Linked into the Kohl mental preservation network, Harry Kim endured searing confrontations of his deepest fears.
name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Place on mission. Now and start of each mission or scouting attempt here, opponent names a skill. All your personnel with that skill are attributes -2 until end of turn.

lore: The steadfast obedience of the Jem'Hadar to their leaders often made working with other species difficult.
name: Friction 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Plays on table if you control three [Dom] personnel. Each non-Jem'Hadar personnel enters play "stopped."

lore: When it comes to logic and emotions, Romulan women may differ from Vulcan women, but that is not the only thing Spock finds distracting about Commander Charvanek.
name: Getting Under Your Skin 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Plays on table if you control three [Rom] personnel. Once each turn, when you play an event on table, opponent reveals top card of deck. If it is a personnel, score 5 points. (Unique.)

lore: Often housing political prisoners, clandestine Cardassian camps use hard labor as punishment.
name: Prison Compound 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Plays if you control three [Car] personnel to score points. X=the total number of [*] on all your captives.

lore: The Bajoran Prylar worried about Kai Winn's interest in the Pah-Wraiths but remained a faithful attendant.
name: Solbor 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Exobiology Once per mission, scores 5 points if your Vedek, Prylar, or Kai helps solve a mission where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Cardassian resistance; Dissident; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: A proud nationalist, Gul Rusot joined Damar's underground resistance movement. Served on Terok Nor. Dissident.
name: Rusot 2E (Things Past) *VP
text: OFFICER Biology Geology Treachery If with {Damar}, gains Leadership and SECURITY.

lore: Male Shape-shifter serving as a representative of the Founder population. Greeted Odo when he returned to the Great Link.
name: Founder Architect 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: V.I.P. While attempting a mission, X=number of different events in play. Astrophysics Law

lore: Treacherous, scheming Cardassian. Closed the Bajoran Wormhole as a Pah-Wraith puppet.
name: Dukat 2E (Things Past) *VP
text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may place two non-[Ref] cards from any one discard pile out of play. Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Kosst Amojan}

lore: Devious augment from the time of Khan. Kept as a frozen human embryo until grown by Arik Soong.
name: Malik 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: SECURITY Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When "stopped" by a dilemma, draw a card. When killed by a dilemma, discard your hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Dissident; Male; Romulan underground; Soong-type android;
lore: Soong-type android in disguise as a Dissident and member of the Romulan Underground. Claimed to be from the city of Rateg.
name: Data 2E (Things Past) *VP
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Exobiology Transporter Skill Cannot be killed by dilemmas ("stopped" instead).

lore: Telepathic Reman advisor to the Praetor, Shinzon. Dominion War veteran. General of a Reman Army.
name: The Viceroy 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: MEDICAL Diplomacy Empathy Treachery Biology When an opponent plays an event, you may discard a card to download an event to hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Tractor Beam;
lore: Twice the size of a Galaxy-class starship, battleships of this design served in the Alpha Quadrant war.
name: Dominion Battleship 2E (Things Past) *VP
text: Attributes all +3 if Founder, Vorta, and Jem'Hadar aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam, Invasive Transporters.

lore: Planning Lt. Worf's party was easy; translating "For He's A Jolly Good Fellow" into Klingon was hard. There didn't seem to be a Klingon word for "jolly."
name: Surprise Party
text: Plays on table. Your opponent may immediately draw up to two cards. At the end of each of your turns, you may draw an extra card. (Unique.)

lore: Earth's first faster-than-light ship. Launched via a Titan missile. Commanded by Zefram Cochrane.
name: Phoenix *VP
text: May take off and land once per game. Worth points while in orbit.

lore: Contagious affliction which causes animals to de-evolve into ancestral forms. Disease named for Lieutenant Reginald Barclay.
name: Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease *VP
text: Entire crew or Away Team (except androids) de-evolves (dies) unless MEDICAL, SCIENCE and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Deadly flying parasites decimated the populations of Levinius V, Theta Cygni XII, Ingraham B, and finally Deneva, where they killed George Samuel Kirk and his wife, Aurelan.
name: Denevan Neural Parasites *VP
text: Attacks half of Away Team (random selection, round up). You may protect one selected personnel for each {phaser}, {disruptor}, or unselected [Def] Borg present; others are killed.

name: Quark's Isolinear Rods *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may ignore each opponent's {Computer Crash}. Also, you may nullify any or all cards preventing you from playing {Q's Tent} (discard incident after card taken from tent). Once per game, you may download to hand {Intermix Ratio}, {The Big Picture} or a non-OFFICER who has Computer Skill x2 (discard incident). Does not count down while you have {any Quark} in play.

lore: Chakotay, along with many of Voyager's crew, suffered from bizarre symptoms as a result of genetic tampering. The Srivani responsible for the experimentation were not easy to uncover.
name: Mutation *VP
text: Plays to shuffle top two cards of any discard pile into owner's draw deck. OR Plays once each turn; discard one card to draw two.

lore: Not a psychiatrist, mechanic, coal miner, bricklayer, scientist, physicist, moon shuttle conductor, escalator, magician or fish peddler. Just an old country doctor.
name: Admiral McCoy *VP
text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Exobiology Cantankerousness Other MEDICAL are CUNNING +3 where present.

lore: Commander Deanna Troi is ship's counselor aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human. Not much of a fan of Steppenwolf.
name: Deanna Troi (First Contact) *VP
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Empathy Navigation Once per game, may "unstop" her Away Team.

lore: Bartender and proprietor of Quark's Bar, Grill, Gaming House and Holosuite Arcade. Longtime nuisance to Odo.
name: Quark *VP
text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Smuggling Acquisition Anthropology Diplomacy X=2 or 7. Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Small Cloaking Device}

lore: Lurian. Freighter captain. Frequent patron of Quark's. Part of the infamous Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Hides a small fortune in latinum in his second stomach.
name: Morn *VP
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Greed Acquisition Smuggling ENGINEER Biology DL/ {Gold-Pressed Latinum}

lore: Leader of the Son'a, a people banished from their home planet by the Ba'ku. Will let nothing stand in the way of his revenge upon them, least of all his Federation allies.
name: Ru'afo *VP
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Biology Leadership Treachery x 2 Astrophysics DL/ {Injector Assembly One}

lore: Deep underground passages such as those on Xantoras pose a problem for transporters. Without climbing skills, they may also pose a problem to away team personnel.
name: Dangerous Climb
text: Unless STRENGTH>40 OR 2 Geology and CUNNING>20 present, kills one Away Team member (random selection).

lore: Starship work is hazardous. When danger arises, one must place the good of the crew ahead of one's own life.
name: Dedication to Duty
text: One unique personnel is "stopped" (random selection). Choose one: kill that personnel OR opponent may draw cards equal to the number of [*] on that personnel. Mission continues.

lore: The bitterness of defeat and the exultation of triumph have taught many leaders a great lesson: they must preserve in peace what they have won in war.
name: Dignitaries and Witnesses
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>20 and an Admiral OR STRENGTH>30 and a General OR CUNNING>30 and 3 Leadership OR STRENGTH>20 and a Maje.

lore: The Prophets would not respond to Kai Winn's prayers despite her zeal. Dukat, in his lust for power, twisted her rejection to the service of the Pah-Wraiths.
name: Forsaken
text: To get past requires 2 Honor OR 2 Treachery. Each Honor or Treachery personnel that helps overcome this dilemma is placed on the bottom of owner's draw deck.

lore: Tales of changelings became a thing of legend in many cultures. Conflict with "Solids" drove them to become secretive, skilled infiltrators, and talented locksmiths.
name: Founder Secret
text: To get past requires a changeling OR {Interphase Generator} OR {Croden's Key} OR CUNNING>40 and {any tricorder} OR STRENGTH>70 OR 4 [Def] drones OR {Breen CRM114}.

lore: In 2370, Data suggested Worf would be able to use an inverse warp field to restore the barriers between quantum realities. Thankfully, Mr. Data was correct, in every reality.
name: Fractured Time
text: Nine personnel (random selection) continue. Place out-of-play all other personnel in this crew or Away Team.

lore: Although some creatures have intricate greeting rituals, others will defend themselves violently at the first sign of danger.
name: Gomtuu Shock Wave
text: Unless 2 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>32 OR Empathy and INTEGRITY>35 present, all undocked ships at this location are damaged and relocated one location toward far end of spaceline.

lore: Sarda's contract with Quark allowed him to proposition his employees. The provision was hidden on page 21, subsection 12, paragraph D.
name: Linguistic Legerdemain
text: Unless Anthropology and Exobiology present, X=1+number of affiliation icons on this mission with no matching personnel present; place on mission; it cannot be attempted.

name: Temporal Micro-Wormhole
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] Personnel and Equipment cards may report for duty. Once per game, you may download {Space-Time Portal} (or nullify its report with crew) OR download {Dr. Telek R'Mor}. Once each turn (twice per game), you may report a personnel aboard your ship regardless of affiliation, then discard doorway; for rest of game, that personnel may mix with your other affiliations.

lore: Early 25th-century technology brought from an alternate future to the year 2377 by Admiral Janeway. It allowed her shuttle to withstand Korath's attack.
name: Ablative Armor
text: While aboard your ship or facility, opponent's ATTACK total must be more than double that ship or facility's DEFENSE total to score a hit, and more than triple to score a direct hit.

lore: Tiny microscopic machines used to repair, maintain, and assimilate new Borg drones. A single drone may contain thousands or even millions of nanoprobes.
name: Borg Nanoprobes
text: Once per turn, where present, may abduct and assimilate one personnel just stunned by your [Def] drone OR nullify a Species 8472-related dilemma (except {Gravimetric Distortion}).

lore: Currency used in trade across the Alpha Quadrant. Available in slips, strips, bars, and bricks. The luxuriant Ferengi Nagal Residence even has latinum-plated waste extraction fixtures.
name: Gold-Pressed Latinum
text: Once each turn, on {a Trading Post}, homeworld or {Quark's Bar}, you may discard two Latinum (one if your Acquisition present) to download a non-Latinum Equipment card there.

lore: General Chang, Admiral Cartwright, and others conspired to derail the Federation-Klingon peace process by assassinating key leaders on both sides.
name: Assassination Plot
text: Name a skill. Kill an opposing personnel (random selection) with that skill present with your assassin. Return your assassin to owner's hand. Discard event.

lore: From patrol logs to casualty reports, all information concerning Dominion and Cardassian war efforts in the Alpha Quadrant came through one room.
name: HQ: War Room
text: Plays on a homeworld. Your OFFICER, SECURITY, Leadership and Resistance personnel of same affiliation as that homeworld are CUNNING +2 and STRENGTH +2.

lore: Shoulder-mounted large-caliber energy weapon. Fires a large purple bolt. Primarily used against aerial targets. Not to be confused with a Tetryon Pulse Launcher.
name: Isomagnetic Disintegrator
text: Plays on table. Shuffle your hand into your discard pile, then exchange your discard pile for your draw deck. Draw four cards (may not be converted to downloads). Discard event.

lore: In 2370, the D'Arsay archive transferred multiple mythical personalities into Data, including the sun goddess Masaka.
name: Masaka Transformations
text: Plays on any player. That player must shuffle entire hand, place on bottom of draw deck, then draw the same number of cards from the top. Discard event after use.

lore: Some crave the adventure and mystique of deep space. They desire to explore the stars, navigate uncharted systems, and go boldly where no man has gone before.
name: Space Boomer
text: Plays on your personnel with Navigation x2 or Stellar Cartography x2. While aboard a matching ship, if you have completed a [S] mission, that ship is RANGE +3.

lore: Identification: TRANSWARP HUB Task: Dispatch Borg vessels throughout the galaxy.
name: Transwarp Hub
text: Seeds or plays at any nebula. Once each turn, your ship may move from here to any {Transwarp Network Gateway}, or vice versa.

name: Bribery
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Smuggling or Greed personnel may discard one of your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} present to add [FER] to your mission there (except {Ferenginar}) until end of your next turn OR to prevent one entire point loss of up to 9 points just incurred there (discard incident) OR to release (and relocate to that personnel) one of your personnel held captive there.

name: Dig
text: Plays on your non-[Bor] Archaeology personnel to place any one card in your discard pile beneath your draw deck, then draw a card (or two cards if {Jean-Luc Picard} or an Archaeology x2 personnel present) OR discard the top card of your deck to place any other card from your discard pile atop draw deck OR discard a card from hand to take any one card from your discard pile into hand. After any use, discard incident.

name: Diplomatic Contact
text: Plays on your non-[Bor] personnel with Diplomacy and Treachery. Once each turn, you may discard a non-personnel card from hand to place a personnel from your discard pile on top of your deck. If that personnel is the same affiliation as this personnel, discard incident.

name: Service the Collective
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever your current objective targets either a homeworld OR your mission that has an affiliation icon matching your counterpart there, your Borg are not restricted from probing on same turn they complete scouting. Also, while a personnel you've assimilated as a counterpart is on your ship, that ship is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against counterpart's former affiliation(s).

lore: "Captain, there's no need to mince words: in space, all warriors are cold warriors."
name: Cold Warriors
text: Plays when facing a dilemma. Your personnel with Treachery x2 gain Diplomacy and Law until end of turn. OR Nullifies {Ankari "Spirits"}.

lore: The Founders manipulate their expanding empire using their ability to appear in many forms. It has proven invaluable to their success.
name: Shape-Shift
text: Allows your Founder in play to morph into a different Founder (exchange it with one in hand OR discard it to download one there). (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

lore: Long range sensor data is often used to project and anticipate the tactics of an adversary.
name: Tactical Scan
text: Glance at the top three cards of any Battle Bridge side deck for twenty seconds. OR Play one at start of battle to name a tactic. No player may play that tactic this battle.

name: Council of Warriors
text: Plays on your [KLI] mission showing less than 30 points (or on {Qo'noS}), if unattempted. Nullified if you play (or have played) {Scan}, {Full Planet Scan}, or a non-Klingon personnel. If you solve by end of your next turn, place objective in point area; place here all ships your ships destroy in battle and all personnel your Klingons kill in personnel battle to score points equal to WEAPONS or STRENGTH printed on card.

lore: Student of B'hala, the lost Bajoran city. Former Prylar promoted to the rank of Ranjen to serve as minister overseeing the excavation project.
name: Ranjen Koral
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Archaeology x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Dig}

lore: Excommunicated Vedek. Worked in counterintelligence for the Maquis. Experimented with using mind control to recruit agents. Honed his techniques on Tuvok.
name: Teero Anaydis
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Exobiology MEDICAL Anthropology Computer Skill

lore: Kai of Bajor formerly known as Vedek Winn. Won her post through ambitious political maneuvering. Fairly successful as a negotiator.
name: Winn Adami
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Law Treachery DL/ {Diplomatic Contact}

lore: Identification: HEURISTICS DRONE Task: Secondary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid; Species 571.
name: Four of Nine
text: Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL Once each turn, may place one drone present beneath draw deck, then download another.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Captain; Capturing-related card; Gul; Male;
lore: Harsh interrogator who excels in extracting confessions from Maquis terrorists. Gul. Patrols the Badlands as captain of the Vetar.
name: Evek (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership If you hold a captive, gains Biology and Law.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Female; Gul; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Dogged rival of Nu'Daq, Galathon, and the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise in the pursuit of the DNA program. Female gul in command of the Bralek.
name: Ocett (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Archaeology Exobiology Navigation Treachery DL/ {Dig}

lore: Ambitious brute sent as an assassin to kill political dissidents in 2370. Rose to the rank of Gul. Not to be confused with the commander of Outpost 61.
name: Toran (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Astrophysics Diplomacy Physics DL/ {Assassination Plot}

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Assassin; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling assassin posing as a sculpture at the Federation-Romulan Antwerp Conference. Planted a bomb that killed 27 attendees.
name: Founder Agitator
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Physics x 2 DL/ {Assassination Plot}

lore: Female changeling. Center of power for the entire Dominion. Key figure in the Great Link. Told Odo of his origin; greatly desires his return to the Link.
name: Founder Leader
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Law DL/ {Shape-Shift}

lore: The Great Link's savior, the changeling Odo became a Founder to save his people and secure peace at the close of the Dominion War.
name: Odo (Homefront II)
text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor Law Computer Skill Anthropology Exobiology

lore: In an alternate future where Voyager had remained lost for 23 years, Kathryn Janeway decided to travel back in time and guide her younger self to a faster route home.
name: Admiral Janeway
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE ENGINEER Leadership Computer Skill Physics DL/ {Ablative Armor}

lore: Vulcan ambassador. Assigned Spock to negotiate peace with Gorkon. Yielded to Klingon due process in Admiral Kirk and Dr. McCoy's trial for murder.
name: Ambassador Sarek (Homefront II)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Mindmeld Law DL/ {Facilitate Peace Talks}

lore: Academy Superintendent during the Nova Squadron incident in 2368. Promoted to rear admiral prior to accepting the post. A formidable woman.
name: Andrea Brand
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Navigation Law Transporter Skill

lore: Liquidator with the Ferengi Commerce Authority. Rude. Arrogant. Corrupt. Despised and envied by Ferengi everywhere. Strives to ruin Quark.
name: Brunt
text: V.I.P. FCA x 2 Treachery x 2 Navigation Law Greed Computer Skill DL/ {Writ of Accountability}

lore: The first Grand Nagus. Credited with writing the Rules of Acquisition. Appeared in Quark's dream; looked a lot like Rom. Told Quark the Rules were a marketing ploy.
name: Grand Nagus Gint
text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Acquisition Law Archaeology DL/ {Bribery} DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

lore: Beginning with his invasion of Cardassia in 2372, Gowron became increasingly prideful and paranoid. Nearly destroyed the Empire in his quest for glory.
name: Chancellor Gowron
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Law DL/ {HQ: War Room} DL/ {Council of Warriors}

lore: Gorkon's Chief of Staff in 2293, General Chang is a powerful and vocal advisor to the High Council. Commander of the I.K.S. Kla'Diyus.
name: Chang
text: OFFICER SECURITY x 2 Leadership Treachery x 2 Law DL/ {Cold Warriors}

lore: Tenacious rival of Ocett and Jean-Luc Picard in pursuit of the DNA program. Commanded the I.K.S. Maht-H'a on behalf of the High Council.
name: Nu'Daq (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Archaeology Exobiology Leadership Navigation Treachery DL/ {Dig}

lore: Conscientious admiral who defected to the Federation in 2366. Disinformed by Romulan High Command. Neither a butcher nor a hero.
name: Alidar Jarok (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Navigation DL/ {Tactical Scan} OR {Life-form Scan}

lore: Intelligence analyst who posed as a diplomat on Deep Space 9 for a briefing on the Dominion. She questioned Kira Nerys' friendship with "the Founder" Odo.
name: Karina (Homefront II)
text: SCIENCE Tal Shiar Physics Treachery Transporter Skill

lore: Intelligence analyst sent to retrieve information on the Dominion threat. Secretly commanded the Kilhra to destroy Deep Space 9.
name: Ruwon (Homefront II)
text: SECURITY Exobiology Tal Shiar Leadership Treachery Diplomacy

lore: Tal Shiar pilot aboard the Serrola. She distrusts Cardassians, but willing to work with them to eliminate the threat posed by the Dominion.
name: Selveth (Homefront II)
text: ENGINEER Navigation Geology Tal Shiar Treachery Astrophysics

lore: Romulan military strategist. He studied, and grudgingly approved, Benjamin Sisko's plan for an attack on the Dominion shipyards at Chin'toka.
name: Senator Letant
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

lore: Impatient senator and political dissident. Contempt for Hiren's bureaucracy led her to become an assassin for Shinzon. Consorts with high-ranking officers.
name: Tal'Aura
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Biology Computer Skill Treachery x 2 Geology DL/ {Assassination Plot}

lore: Diagnostic tech on the NX-01. Has a keen sense of hearing. Trained with Lt. Reed to become a bodyguard.
name: Burrows
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Astrophysics Transporter Skill May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Self-taught Chief Engineer of Enterprise. Best friend and confidant to Jonathan Archer. From Panama City, Florida. Enjoys pecan pie.
name: Charles Tucker III
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Honor Computer Skill x 2 Diplomacy Transporter Skill x 2 DL/ {Any tricorder}

lore: Space boomer born aboard the ECS Horizon. Joined Starfleet to travel as far - and as fast - as he could. Enjoys ancient gangster stories.
name: Travis Mayweather (Homefront II)
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Astrophysics Geology Transporter Skill DL/ {Space Boomer}

lore: Trill mercenary in the mirror universe. Unlike Ezri Dax, this Ezri is not joined to a symbiont. Partners with Mr. Brunt. Romantically involved with the Intendant.
name: Ezri *VP
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Transporter Skill Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography DL/ {Crossover}

lore: Blind Aenar male captured by Romulan agents. Told he was the last surviving Aenar. Manipulated into telepathically piloting the drone ships.
name: Gareb*
text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Human/Alien; 31st-century; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Resourceful temporal agent from the 31st-century. Frequently "assisted" the Enterprise crew in preventing alterations to the timeline. More or less human.
name: Daniels*
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Archaeology Physics Anthropology DL/ {Out of Time}

lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey originally commanded by Martrex. In 2153, commandeered and commanded by Raakin, and then commanded by Malik.
name: I.K.S. Nguq'Yab*
text: Attributes all +1 for each augment aboard (limit 4). Tractor Beam
