lore: Crowd favorite in the Tsunkatse matches broadcast by Penk. Electrifying Pendari known for his superior strength, bad temper, and keen sense of smell.
name: The Pendari Champion *VP
text: SECURITY Leadership Geology In battle, may pair first (and select his adversary).

lore: Like Melville's fictional Captain Ahab, the former Borg Jean-Luc Picard burned with vengeance. Piled upon the Borg the sum of all his rage and hate.
name: Jean-Luc *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Archaeology X=4 vs. [Bor]. DL/ {Prepare Assault Teams} (if with another [Ent-E]).

lore: Like Melville's fictional Captain Ahab, the former Borg Jean-Luc Picard burned with vengeance. Piled upon the Borg the sum of all his rage and hate.
name: Jean-Luc
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Archaeology X=4 vs. [Bor]. DL/ {Prepare Assault Teams} (if with another [Ent-E]).

lore: As their cube and then their sphere were destroyed, the Borg adapted to the changing situation, single-minded, implacably persistent.
name: Contingency Plan
text: Place on ship; cannot be attacked by [Bor] or returned to hand. Opponent may download {A Change of Plans}. {Assimilate Starship} targeting this ship is worth 35 points.

lore: With all political authority vanished, humanity teetered on the edge of its second Dark Age.
name: Back to Basics
text: Your opponent shuffles each personnel and ship in their discard pile into draw deck. If fourteen or more cards were shuffled in, Away Team stopped. Discard dilemma.

lore: For residents of 2063 Bozeman, after dealing with Borg bombardment, temporal incursions, and drunk Betazoids, making their way to the bar takes everything they've got.
name: Crowded Bar
text: Each player draws a card. Stop one personnel for each card in hand (your choice if you have fewer than six cards in hand, opponent's choice otherwise). Discard dilemma.

lore: After encountering drones in person, Lily Sloane revised her initial reaction to Picard's description of the Borg.
name: Definitely Not Swedish
text: Opponent may download and seed here up to two of the following: {Don't Call Me Ahab}, {My First Raygun}, or {Strict Dress Code}. Discard dilemma.

lore: Personal Access Display Device loaded with mission-specific details for ready reference. Used for tasks from reporting scans to repairing historic warp vehicles.
name: Mission Briefing PADD
text: Once each turn, you may select Anthropology OR Biology. Until re-selected, your OFFICER-classification [Ent-E] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

lore: The Borg Queen's search for a like-minded counterpart led her to Data. The android was more resistant than anticipated.
name: A Willing Companion
text: Plays on table. You may have an additional counterpart in play. If this event leaves play, discard counterparts down to allowed number. (Cumulative.)

lore: The Borg hive mind allows assets to be quickly reassigned, bringing the entire Collective closer to perfection.
name: Adapt: Allocate Resources
text: Plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may discard this event to download any [BO] Event or Interrupt card.

lore: Due to the limited complement aboard smaller Borg vessels, drones are often assigned multiple tasks to achieve optimal mission outcomes.
name: Optimize Drones
text: Plays on any mission. While your sphere is here, your [Com] and [Def] personnel here are attributes all +1. Discard when your objective targeting this mission completed. (Unique.)

name: Launch the Phoenix
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may seed {Montana Missile Complex}. {Phoenix} may not be played (but may be acquired). Once each turn, your card native to 2063 Earth may report there for free. If your Phoenix takes off with [Ent-E] (or {any Lily Sloane}) aboard, Launch Successful: Place objective on Phoenix, draw 3 cards. Your Alpha Quadrant [FED] missions are worth +5 points while Phoenix in orbit.

name: Protect Historic Encounter
text: Seeds on {Earth}; you may download {Launch the Phoenix}. Your [Ent-E] personnel may attempt Earth using these requirements: Anthropology + Archaeology + CUNNING>30 When solved, mission worth 30 points (instead of printed value) and you may download a personnel native to {2063 Earth}.

lore: Identification: TEMPORAL DRONE Task: Calibrate and maintain chronometric particles. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Twelve of Ninety-Six
text: Physics Anthropology SCIENCE Navigation May download {Temporal Vortex} in place of a card draw.

lore: Representative of versatile support officers on the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Formerly served in operations. She enjoys swimming and shipboard artistic events.
name: Jae
text: SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Senior transporter operations engineer. Friend of Maggie Hubbell. Once romantically involved with Wesley Crusher. Way out of his league.
name: Suzanne Dumont
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Transporter Skill Honor

lore: Class of heavy cruiser designed for border defense. First ship of this design entered service after the dissolution of the Khitomer Accords.
name: U.S.S. Akira
text: Attributes all +2 if [Ent-E] aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Android/Borg; Counterpart; Male; Soong-type android; Soong-type android;
lore: Tempted by flesh, the Soong-type android Data filled Locutus' role as an assimilated counterpart to speak to the Federation.
name: Data of Borg
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 ENGINEER Exobiology DL/ {Resistance is Futile} At the start of each of your turns, you may return this personnel to your hand. If you do not, remove this personnel from the game.

lore: Identification: RECONNAISSANCE DRONE Task: Scout areas where resistance is anticipated. Secure. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Six of Ninety-Six
text: Exobiology SECURITY Transporter Skill Navigation When you play this personnel, you may shuffle any deck then peek at the top two cards.

lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: Contingency vessel. Assimilate human homeworld. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Sphere (Resistance is Futile)
text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes. DL/ {Optimize Drones}

lore: In 2371, Chief Engineer Geordi La Forge received ocular implants that surpassed the functions of his old VISOR. Attended Zefram Cochrane High School.
name: Geordi La Forge (First Contact) *VP
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Leadership DL/ {Ocular Implants}

name: Process Ore *VP
text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit}. Start of each turn, if you control this Nor at a planet location and you have a matching ENGINEER or SECURITY personnel unopposed here, you may "process ore." Discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw up to two cards.

lore: The Great Link's savior, the changeling Odo became a Founder to save his people and secure peace at the close of the Dominion War.
name: Odo (Homefront II) *VP
text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor Law Computer Skill Anthropology Exobiology

lore: While stranded on a savage world by the Kazon-Nistrim, the crew of U.S.S. Voyager encountered a carnivorous creature with an appetite for Starfleet engineers.
name: Hanonian Land Eel *VP
text: Unless SECURITY, SCIENCE, and STRENGTH>50 present, kills Away Team member with lowest CUNNING or fewest [*] icons (opponent's choice).

lore: Trill. Disregarded her commitments to both Starfleet and Trill custom in order to honor a Klingon blood oath sworn by her symbiont's previous host, Curzon Dax.
name: Jadzia Dax (Blaze of Glory) *VP
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Diplomacy Anthropology Honor Other (R> personnel present are attributes all +2.

lore: Ba'ku female who became romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. In her 300 years, learned to sustain a perfect moment in time - but never learned to swim.
name: Anij *VP
text: CIVILIAN Twice per game, may nullify a non-[Ref] interrupt and place it atop owner's draw deck. Anthropology

lore: Romulan Astrophysical Academy member on deep space duty in 2351. Beamed to the present via a micro-wormhole to the U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Dr. Telek R'Mor *VP
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography Honor ENGINEER May report directly to any ship.

name: Kobayashi Maru Scenario *VP
text: Seeds or plays on a mission; adds Computer Skill to mission requirements. At the start of each mission attempt here, one attempting personnel (random selection) is placed beneath this incident ("in play" for uniqueness only). When a player solves this mission, all of their compatible personnel beneath this incident join the solving crew or Away Team (any other personnel are discarded). (Unique.)

lore: The Duras family's untrustworthiness is equal to their ambition. Duras tarnished Worf's honor, tried to have Picard killed, poisoned K'mpec, and murdered K'Ehleyr.
name: A Good Day to Lie
text: To get past, requires 3 Diplomacy OR 3 Treachery. If a [Kli] Treachery personnel in play, opponent may then download {Duras} to anywhere at this location.

lore: In 2369, a skeleton crew was left aboard the Enterprise while the rest of the crew searched for their rogue android.
name: All Available Personnel
text: Opponent may download {Balancing Act} to table as [Incident] OR download {Skeleton Crew} atop any mission. Cannot get past unless you began mission attempt with at least six personnel.

lore: The Federation often sends expert negotiators to defuse volatile situations before they spiral out of control.
name: Diplomatic Intervention
text: Opponent may download up to two [Fed] ambassadors to planet; they cannot be battled this turn. Place on mission. To solve mission, you must have more Diplomacy here than opponent.

lore: Torn between his allegiance to Starfleet and his Klingon heritage, Worf resigned his commission to serve his people in the Klingon Civil War.
name: Divided Loyalties
text: All multi-affiliation personnel and dual personnel are "stopped" for your next two full turns. To get past requires CUNNING>20 (or CUNNING>40 if this is a [DQ] mission).

lore: Despite prior agreements about cooperating in a joint exploration of Delphi Ardu IV, the Ferengi seized the chance to get the better of their Federation adversaries.
name: Ferengi Ambush
text: Opponent may download to this planet up to three different [Univ] Ferengi and/or one {Ferengi Whip}. They may initiate battle (if possible).

lore: Misinterpreting the Tamarian's intent, Picard was unable to comprehend the true source of danger on the planet.
name: I'm Not Going to Fight You
text: Opponent may download and seed here up to two of the following: {Chalnoth}, {El-Adrel Creature}, {Nausicaans}, or {Rebel Encounter}, then place on mission. Each of those dilemmas here first "stops" one Diplomacy (your choice).

lore: Even well-intentioned contact with less-advanced civilizations can still lead to disastrous repercussions.
name: Local Trouble
text: To get past requires Anthropology and STRENGTH>24. Opponent may then download and seed here up to two of the following: {Archer}, {Hunter Gangs}, or {Punishment Zone}.

lore: Proximity to severe stellar phenomena can disrupt shipboard systems. In 2364, intense magnetic fields from the Delos star overloaded many consoles on the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Magnetic Field Disruptions
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Astrophysics or Navigation. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Small, solar-powered, inorganic collective life-form native to Velara III. Sabotaged Federation terraforming operations to protest the destruction of their home.
name: Microbrain
text: To get past, one Exobiology OR Geology personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 3 Exobiology OR 3 Geology.

lore: Confronted with Sir Guy of Gisbourne's archers, Jean-Luc Picard, posing as Robin Hood, ordered his crew deeper into Q's recreation of Sherwood Forest.
name: Pinned Down
text: To get past, two personnel (random selection) must be "stopped." Then, if any [Q] card in play, another personnel (random selection) is "stopped."

lore: Despite overtures of friendship from the House of Duras, the Arbiter of Succession was unswayed, noting they had manipulated the circumstances with the skill of a Romulan.
name: Temptation
text: To get past, three personnel (random selection) must be "tempted." Each one without Honor OR Treachery is "stopped."

lore: Experienced diplomats are willing to meet their opponents on their terms and to confront challenges to their integrity with appropriate invectives when necessary.
name: Tense Negotiations
text: To get past, one Diplomacy OR Leadership personnel (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 3 Diplomacy OR 3 Leadership.

lore: Prioritizing the most urgent cases first, as Dr. Crusher did on Rutia IV, requires swift evaluation and unbiased medical judgment to save as many lives as possible.
name: Triage
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Biology or MEDICAL. To get past requires INTEGRITY>22 remaining.

lore: The crews of the Enterprise and the Hathaway were forced to abandon their simulated battle to confront a real adversary.
name: War Games
text: To get past requires 2 ENGINEER, SECURITY, and Navigation. Then, place on ship; if opponent's ship moves to this location, discard dilemma and opponent scores points.

lore: When one of his warp field experiments trapped his mother in a collapsing warp bubble, Wesley was fortunate an expert was on hand to aid in her rescue.
name: Warp Bubble Mishap
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Physics or SCIENCE. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Spock undertook a personal mission to reconcile ancient enemies Romulus and Vulcan. Starfleet took a dim view of his brash actions.
name: Cowboy Diplomacy
text: Once per game, plays (for free) to score points if your [Fed] Diplomacy personnel is on a planet mission opponent seeded.

lore: During shipboard emergencies such as Roga Danar's escape from the U.S.S. Enterprise brig in 2366, off-duty crew and civilians are advised to stay in their quarters for safety.
name: General Quarters
text: Seeds or plays on table. May not leave play. All players may only download personnel into play once every turn.

lore: Disillusioned with a modern Klingon society corrupted by the illusion of peace, Korris and Konmel sought to live their lives like true Klingons.
name: Heart of Glory
text: Plays on your Klingon (for free if {Korris} or {Konmel}). X varies, where X=number of personnel this Klingon stuns or mortally wounds (limit three). (Unique.)

lore: Starship crews often venture beyond the reaches of known space to explore strange new worlds, broaden their knowledge, and expand their power in the universe.
name: Let's See What's Out There
text: Plays to draw two cards. If you have 4 [TNG] personnel at one or more missions opponent seeded where there is no facility, draw two additional cards. Discard event.

lore: An ancient humanoid race, realizing they were alone in their part of the galaxy, seeded new life on other Alpha and Beta Quadrant worlds as a monument to their existence.
name: You Are a Monument
text: Plays on table. May not leave play. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) an Alpha Quadrant mission needs an additional 40 points to win.

name: Attention All Hands
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [Univ][TNG] personnel (except an android, hologram, or [AU]) that you do not already have in play may report (for free) aboard your matching outpost. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may download a [Univ][TNG] ship to your matching outpost.

name: Continuing Mission
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [WC] card. Your personnel and ships that have a Star Trek: The Next Generation or Star Trek Generations property logo gain [TNG] (even if not in play). Once each turn, when you play a [TNG] personnel with four or fewer [*] icons (and no DL/ ), you may draw a card. Discard this incident if you play (or have played) a non-[TNG] personnel or ship.

name: Equipment Replicator
text: Seeds or plays on your non-[DQ] ship that requires [Cmd] or your non-[DQ] outpost. Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download any {Kit}, {PADD}, {Relay}, {Scanner}, or {Tricorder} equipment to your [TNG] personnel or 3 non-[AU] ENGINEER aboard.

name: Ferengi Military Operations
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your [TNG][Fer] personnel (except V.I.P. or CIVILIAN) may report (for free) to your [Fer] outpost. Once per game, if your [Fer] DaiMon is at a location where you win a battle, capture an opponent's personnel, or commandeer an opponent's ship, choose two of the following: score 5 points, draw two cards, or download an equipment there.

name: Finest Crew in the Fleet
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your {[TNG][Fed] personnel with "U.S.S. Enterprise" in lore} may report (for free) aboard your {U.S.S. Enterprise} or to your [Fed] outpost. Once per game, if your matching commander is aboard your U.S.S. Enterprise, you may download one {Federation Flagship} card to hand.

name: Get It Done
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may place two [TNG] cards from hand on the bottom of your deck to choose: make a unique [TNG] personnel attributes +2 until end of turn OR make a [TNG] ship range +2 until end of turn OR shuffle the bottom three personnel and/or ships from your discard pile into your draw deck. After any use, discard incident OR discard a [TNG] card from hand. (Captain's Order.)

name: Legitimate Leader of the Empire
text: Plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Gowron} to your facility. While your Gowron is at a non-homeworld mission, once each turn, your non-Treachery [TNG][Kli] personnel may report (for free) to him or to your [Kli] outpost. When your [TNG][Kli] personnel targeted by {Arbiter of Succession} wins a battle or helps solve a mission, you may draw two cards.

name: Mercenary Raiders
text: Plays on {Calder II}. Your {Galen} and [TNG] personnel with "Stone of Gol" in lore may mix and cooperate regardless of affiliation. Once each turn, one such personnel may report aboard your {Mercenary Ship} (for free). Once per game, you may discard incident and place out-of-play two of your "use as equipment" artifacts in play or one {Vulcan Stone of Gol} (from hand) that you have earned to score points.

name: Officer Exchange Program
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download {I.K.S. Pagh} or any [TNG] personnel with "I.K.S. Pagh" in lore to hand. Once every turn, when you are about to place a Tactic on an opponent's ship involved in battle with your I.K.S. Pagh, you may place that Tactic out-of-play instead to score 5 points (once per game per Tactic card title).

name: Scientific Diplomacy
text: Seeds or plays on {Veytan}. Your {Dr. Reyga}, {T'Pan}, and each of your [TNG] personnel with "metaphasic shield" in lore may report for free to your ship or outpost here (once each turn), and may mix and cooperate with your [TNG] cards. When you solve this mission, you may place a [TNG] SCIENCE personnel from your discard pile in your point area (worth points equal to INTEGRITY).

name: Strategic Base
text: Once per game, seeds or plays on any mission. If you subsequently play an outpost here, discard incident and draw three cards. OR Seeds or plays on your outpost (except [Neu] or [Non]). Adds point value of this mission to outpost's DEFENSE total. Your leaders and SECURITY personnel here are attributes all +1.

lore: The Ferengi were unprepared for the ingenious games, tricks, and toys the "children" used to retake the Enterprise. "You're it!"
name: "Tag!"
text: Once per game, downloads (even from your discard pile) a {[TNG] Youth} personnel to replace (discard) your non-Youth [TNG] personnel.

lore: To a Klingon, honor is everything.
name: A Matter of Honor
text: Once per game, downloads (even from your discard pile) a {[TNG] Honor x2} personnel to replace (discard) your non-Honor [TNG] personnel.

lore: Many in the Alpha Quadrant, lacking the lobes for business, are wary of the Ferengi Alliance's capitalistic practices.
name: Business Gambit
text: Once per game, plays to "stop" your [Fer] Greed personnel and an opposing personnel present. Steal an equipment present OR download an equipment there.

lore: Complete illicit sale of decommissioned B'rel-class hardware.
name: Acquire Surplus Ships
text: Acquisition + ENGINEER + Computer Skill OR Diplomacy + Greed + Treachery

lore: Mediate an end to Gatherer raids in this area.
name: Amnesty Talks
text: Anthropology + Diplomacy x2 + Law OR Leadership + SECURITY + Treachery x2 OR {Marouk}

lore: Prevent annihilation of inhabited star system by deranged scientist.
name: Avert Solar Implosion
text: Anthropology + Leadership + OFFICER + Honor + STRENGTH>38 OR {James T. Kirk} + {Jean-Luc Picard}

lore: Negotiate with natives for use of their newly-constructed starbase.
name: Encounter at Farpoint
text: Empathy + Exobiology + Honor + INTEGRITY>25 OR Acquisition + Diplomacy + Treachery + CUNNING>30

lore: Test revolutionary shield design within star's superdense corona.
name: Host Metaphasic Shielding Test
text: Diplomacy + ENGINEER + Navigation + SCIENCE When you solve, may download {Metaphasic Shields} here.

lore: Protect colonies from returning Klingon sleeper ship.
name: Intercept Sleeper Ship
text: Leadership x2 + WEAPONS>8 OR {Any K'Ehleyr} + INTEGRITY>35 {I.K.S. T'Ong} may report here (with up to 3 personnel)

lore: Seek cause of missing outposts.
name: Investigate Destruction
text: Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + OFFICER OR Navigation + SECURITY + Treachery

lore: Seek ancient Debrune artifacts near Sakethan burial mounds.
name: Raid Ancient Burial Site
text: Archaeology + SECURITY + Treachery + STRENGTH>50 May seed one {Mercenary Ship} face up here. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Lay genetic groundwork for vengeance against old foe.
name: Revenge Plot
text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + Treachery x2 OR any {Bok} + CUNNING>35

lore: Study wreckage and crew member of lost scout.
name: Salvage Borg Ship
text: Astrophysics + ENGINEER + MEDICAL + Computer Skill *+10 if a [Bor] card in play. Opponent's side: Your Borg ships may report with crew here. Points: [35]

lore: Hijack ship in glorious battle.
name: Seize Freighter
text: OFFICER x2 + Honor + Navigation *+5 if {Korris} or {Konmel} in crew.

lore: Steal energy converter from remote Federation outpost.
name: Steal Technology
text: OFFICER + Greed + Transporter Skill + Treachery When you solve, may download (or steal) an equipment here.

lore: Investigate source of energy emanating from ancient T'Kon outpost.
name: The Last Outpost
text: Acquisition + SECURITY + Treachery x2 OR Diplomacy x2 + Leadership + OFFICER

lore: Provide medical assistance to last members of disease-ravaged culture.
name: Treat Plague Ship
text: Biology + CUNNING>26 + discard one MEDICAL personnel *+10 if {Plague Planet} complete.

lore: Make routine stop at hospitable world near enemy space.
name: Visit Tranquil Colony
text: Diplomacy + Anthropology + ({Jean-Luc Picard} OR {Tebok} OR CUNNING>35)

name: Expand the Empire
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, for each mission opponent seeded where you have [TNG][Kli] personnel, you may download to hand (even from outside the game) a different interrupt with "Klingon" in title or gametext. Discard objective after use.

name: Ferengi Commerce Operation
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, for each mission opponent seeded where you have [TNG][Fer] personnel, you may download one equipment there. Then, if you have [TNG][Fer] personnel at six or more such missions, you may also download one "use as equipment card" artifact to your [Fer] ship (as if earned). Discard objective after use.

name: Seek Out New Life
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, for each mission opponent seeded where you have [TNG][Fed] personnel, you may download to hand one [TNG] personnel whose species you do not have in play. Discard objective after use.

lore: Typical civilian researcher studying pre-warp civilizations throughout Federation space. Supervised an anthropological study on Mintaka III.
name: Barron
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Geology

lore: While hosting an experimental metaphasic shield test, Beverly Crusher took on the roles of diplomat, detective, coroner, and test pilot.
name: Beverly
text: MEDICAL Diplomacy Law Navigation Exobiology DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

lore: 1/2 Napean, 1/2 human representative of Starfleet engineers. Inherited his empathic sense from his mother. Formerly served at Utopia Planitia Yards.
name: Daniel Kwan
text: ENGINEER Physics Empathy

lore: Pinocchio-like in his desire, the Soong-type android would gladly trade his superior abilities to be human. Learning to whistle "Pop Goes the Weasel."
name: Data (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Astrophysics ENGINEER When reported, select Anthropology, Physics, or Navigation.

lore: Geochemist representative of science specialists assigned to Galaxy-class starships. Intrigued by the symbiotic nature of the Trill species.
name: Davies
text: SCIENCE Physics Geology

lore: Ship's counselor and occasional ambassador. 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human. Formerly romantically involved with William T. Riker as his imzadi.
name: Deanna Troi (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Empathy Anthropology Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Intuition} DL/ {Life-form Scan}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Metaphasic Shield-related personnel; Mission Specialist;
lore: Subspace theoretician and husband of T'Pan. Invited to participate in a metaphasic shield test. Doubted Dr. Reyga's new technology.
name: Dr. Christopher
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE

lore: Conn officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2364. Son of two Starfleet officers. Blind at birth, he has used the VISOR to see since the age of five.
name: Geordi La Forge (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER At [S]: Navigation, Astrophysics, Stellar Cartography At [P]: ENGINEER, Physics, Computer Skill

lore: Arrogant engineer believed to have improved engine performance on several ships in 2364. Finds problem solving highly therapeutic.
name: Kosinski
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics SCIENCE Stellar Cartography X=4 when facing a dilemma.

lore: Typical relief operations officer in the 24th century. Relishes the chance to explore new frontiers. Originally considered a security career.
name: Lian T'su
text: OFFICER Navigation Transporter Skill Astrophysics

lore: Representative of junior security officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Assigned to compile the duty roster for his department.
name: Lopez
text: SECURITY Biology Honor DL/ {Federation PADD}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: One of many staff doctors assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise. Took charge of sickbay in 2368 after Beverly Crusher was incapacitated.
name: Martin
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: One of many ambassadors serving in the Federation Diplomatic Corps. Distant relative of Earth politician. Gambler and poker player.
name: Seth Mendoza
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy Law

lore: Typical Ferengi technician. Previously served on a D'Kora-class marauder but chose to become a privateer under Lurin in search of bigger profits.
name: Baht
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Transporter Skill

lore: The former captain of the U.S.S. Stargazer, Jean-Luc Picard was manipulated into attacking his own ship.
name: Captain Picard
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Physics DL/ {Picard Maneuver}

lore: Bok could not forgive Captain Picard for the death of his son. Vengeful commander of the Kurdon.
name: DaiMon Bok
text: OFFICER Exobiology Treachery x 2 ENGINEER Transporter Skill DL/ {Thought Maker} Once per game, may capture {any Jean-Luc Picard} here.

lore: Conspired with Goss during the Barzan negotiations. Explored the wormhole with Kol. Prefers analysis to speculation.
name: Dr. Arridor (The Next Generation)
text: MEDICAL Acquisition Greed Exobiology Biology Leadership Treachery

lore: Talented Ferengi officer. Recruited by Bok to help in the capture and ransom of Jason Vigo. Devotee of the Rules of Acquisition.
name: Gozar
text: OFFICER Acquisition Exobiology Leadership Navigation Treachery Diplomacy

lore: One of many junior crew members often found on D'Kora marauders. Part of Letek's landing party. Berik's nephew. Former assay assistant on Lappa IV.
name: Kayron
text: SECURITY SCIENCE

lore: Ferengi scientist serving under Goss. Studied the Barzan wormhole with Dr. Arridor. Didn't realize the significance of the meson and lepton fluctuations.
name: Kol (The Next Generation)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Navigation Greed Stellar Cartography Attributes all +2 if with {Goss} or {Dr. Arridor}.

lore: Typical nurse found throughout the Ferengi Alliance. Now working with the privateer Lurin. Cousin of Broik. Collects antique musical recordings.
name: Levin
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Music

lore: Representative Ferengi security officer. Often part of away teams to strange, new worlds. Helped steal an energy converter. Disgusted by clothed females.
name: Mordoc (The Next Generation)
text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Treachery Transporter Skill

lore: Typical Ferengi soldier. Aspiring inventor and employee of Lurin. Tired of Klingon rations.
name: Obol
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Greed

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Duras-related; Male;
lore: Opportunistic bartender on Deep Space 9. Traded information about the Sisters of Duras in exchange for erasing William T. Riker's gambling winnings.
name: Quark (The Next Generation)
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill x 2 Acquisition Greed Diplomacy Anthropology DL/ {Any PADD}

lore: Profiteer representive of Ferengi second officers. Opposed Bok's decision to give away the salvaged U.S.S. Stargazer at no cost.
name: Rata
text: OFFICER Treachery Acquisition Greed Geology Astrophysics

lore: Warp drive specialist aboard the I.K.S. Pagh, representative of engineers in the Klingon Defense Force. Considered a gourmand by shipmates.
name: B'Somgh
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Physics Astrophysics Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: To persuade K'Temoc not to attack, Worf served as acting captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Mate of K'Ehleyr. Finds the command chair "comfortable."
name: Captain Worf
text: SECURITY OFFICER Diplomacy Navigation Honor x 2 If with {any K'Ehleyr}, both are attributes all +2.

lore: 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 human romantically involved with Worf. K'Ehleyr posed as first officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. She left Worf incomplete.
name: Commander K'Ehleyr
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Honor Anthropology Diplomacy Law

lore: Appointed by K'mpec to serve as Arbiter of Succession. Asked to discover the Chancellor's poisoner and stave off a Klingon civil war.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (The Next Generation)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Anthropology Honor Law DL/ {Arbiter of Succession} (if with an opponent's Klingon).

lore: "The greatest warrior of them all." Clone of the unforgettable Klingon leader. Fulfilled prophecy. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
name: Kahless (The Next Generation)
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 Anthropology Leadership x 3 DL/ {Warrior's Birthright}

lore: "The Tyrant Molor" in the Kot'baval Festival. Eager to help warriors deepen their understanding of Klingon heritage. Research on Maranga IV outpost.
name: Kitrik (The Next Generation)
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Geology Computer Skill

lore: Former lieutenant in the Klingon Defense Force. Deserted with Korris and Kunivas to restore glory to the Empire. Expert at concealing weaponry.
name: Konmel (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill Stellar Cartography DL/ {Klingon Disruptor} (if with {Korris}).

lore: High cleric of Boreth. Responsible for cloning Kahless in an attempt to restore hope to his people.
name: Koroth (The Next Generation)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology MEDICAL Once per game, if on {Boreth}, may download {Kahless} OR {Clone Machine} there.

lore: Renegade captain that sought an honorable death. To him, peace was a living death. Deserted with Konmel and Kunivas to restore Imperial glory.
name: Korris (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER SECURITY May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Follower of Kahless. Representative of young male Klingons eager to study the teachings of Kahless at the sacred Boreth monastery.
name: Losta
text: OFFICER Geology Navigation Youth DL/ {Lower Decks} (if present with {Kahless} or on {Boreth}).

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
lore: Representative of low-level technicians throughout the Klingon Empire. Before serving on the I.K.S. Pagh, worked as a supply agent on Rura Penthe.
name: Q'elyn
text: ENGINEER Acquisition

lore: The first Starfleet officer to serve on a Klingon ship as part of an exchange program. Commanded the I.K.S. Pagh after relieving Kargan of duty.
name: William T. Riker (The Next Generation)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Anthropology Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Emergency Transport Unit}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; Female; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel;
lore: Typical Klingon female inspired by the Sisters of Duras. Ruthlessly supervised the I.K.S. Pagh engine room. Curious about William T. Riker's endurance.
name: Zegov
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Treachery Greed SECURITY

lore: Male lionfish. Survived a crash-landing on Veridian III. Confidant of Jean-Luc Picard. Object of curiosity.
name: Livingston
text: ANIMAL Any matching commander of ship he is aboard is attributes all +2 where present. DL/ {Ready Room Door}

lore: Tilonian psychiatrist created by Suna as part of a plan to brainwash Riker. Worked in Ward 47 of the Tilonus Institute for Mental Disorders.
name: Dr. Syrus
text: MEDICAL Law

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Dour smuggler of few words. Acquired part of the Stone of Gol for Baran. Commanded a Klingon shuttle. Disliked games and replicated bloodwine.
name: Koral (The Next Generation)
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Smuggling Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Treasure hunter, archaeologist, liar, and thief romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Partnered with Q to explore distant Gamma Quadrant ruins.
name: Vash (The Next Generation)
text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology Smuggling Acquisition DL/ {Dig}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: William T. Riker "went renegade" to penetrate Baran's crew during the hunt for the Stone of Gol.
name: Will Riker
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Anthropology Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Dropping In}

lore: Typical of small Ferengi craft converted for long-range missions. Often used to search for new business opportunities.
name: Ferengi Scout Vessel

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by DaiMon Bok during his quest for vengeance against Captain Picard. First officer Kazago commanded following Bok's arrest.
name: Kurdon
text: Tractor Beam, Holodeck DL/ Any [TNG][Fer] personnel

lore: Talarian freighter hijacked by three Klingons in pursuit of a warrior's death. Commanded by Korris, who then destroyed the I.K.S. T'Acog.
name: Batris
text: Tractor Beam WEAPONS +5 vs. [Kli].

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon Defense Force Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kargan. Tritanium hull plating attracted subatomic bacteria in 2365.
name: I.K.S. Pagh (The Next Generation)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam In battle, draw an extra Tactic.

name: Continuing Mission *VP
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [WC] card. Your personnel and ships that have a Star Trek: The Next Generation or Star Trek Generations property logo gain [TNG] (even if not in play). Once each turn, when you play a [TNG] personnel with four or fewer [*] icons (and no DL/ ), you may draw a card. Discard this incident if you play (or have played) a non-[TNG] personnel or ship.

lore: A malevolent being was formed when the inhabitants of Vagra II rid themselves of all the evil they had inside.
name: Armus - Skin of Evil
text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: Large infant spaceborne life-form. Attached itself to the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368, sucking energy from the ship.
name: Birth of "Junior"
text: Place on ship. End of each turn, RANGE reduced by 1; if reduced to 0, ship destroyed. Nullify with 3 ENGINEER.

lore: Barges containing dangerous waste can be adrift for centuries. One such barge threatened Gamelon V in 2367.
name: Radioactive Garbage Scow
text: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

lore: While confronting the Echo Papa 607 weapons system, Geordi La Forge ordered a saucer separation to protect the ship's crew. He took command of the stardrive section.
name: The Arsenal: Divided
text: Divide your unique crew members into two face-down piles. One pile is "stopped" (opponent's choice). To get past, ship must be staffed and have INTEGRITY>27 remaining.

lore: While investigating the Arsenal of Freedom on Minos, a sudden attack separated the crew of the Enterprise.
name: The Arsenal: Separated
text: Divide your unique personnel into two face-down piles. One pile is "stopped" (opponent's choice). To get past requires CUNNING>27 remaining.

lore: Invasive program created in 2368 by Data and Geordi La Forge to cause the total system failure of the Borg Collective.
name: Topological Anomaly 4747
text: Borg and [Holo] personnel, androids, and one ENGINEER here (random selection) are placed in stasis. Cure on your next turn with new SCIENCE arriving or when countdown expires.

lore: Ancient Iconian computer programs transmitted to the U.S.S. Yamato, U.S.S. Enterprise, and Haakona attempted to overwrite the ships' computer systems.
name: Virus
text: Unless you have 4 Computer Skill present, place on ship. This ship, and all your other ships of the same class, are attributes all -2. Cure with 6 Computer Skill.

lore: Sentry of the Parallax Colony. Only allows those whose hearts are joyous to pass.
name: Wind Dancer
text: To get past, {Lwaxana Troi} must be present OR at least one Away Team member must have: Youth OR Music OR STRENGTH>9.

name: Alternate Universe Door
text: Place one on table during the seed phase. Door is now open, allowing your [AU] icon cards to enter play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Plays to nullify one {Revolving Door} or {Subspace Schism}. (Discard doorway.) OR Allows one ship to pass through {Q-Net}. (Discard doorway.) OR Nullify one {Temporal Rift}, and return doorway to your hand.

lore: Planning Lt. Worf's party was easy; translating "For He's a Jolly Good Fellow" into Klingon was hard. There didn't seem to be a Klingon word for "jolly."
name: Surprise Party
text: Plays on table. Your opponent may immediately draw up to two cards. At the end of each of your turns, you may draw an extra card. (Unique.)

lore: Search planet for illegal Maquis arms cache.
name: Search for Weapons
text: OFFICER + Navigation + Treachery May seed hand weapons under here.

lore: Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Federation Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Federation ENGINEER.

lore: Ferengi commercial centers are frequented by many races for trade, information, repair and resupply.
name: Ferengi Trading Post
text: Seed one (you may also seed one [Univ] {D'Kora} face up here) OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER. Each player's non-Borg cards may report and mix aboard regardless of affiliation.

lore: The Klingon Homeworld is Qo'noS. The Klingon Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Klingon Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klingon ENGINEER.

lore: Romulus is one of the two homeworlds for the Romulans. The Romulan Star Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Romulan Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Romulan ENGINEER.

lore: Gather plant life for medical research from planet with highly ionized atmosphere.
name: Botanical Research
text: SCIENCE + MEDICAL + CUNNING>35 {Atmospheric Ionization} may seed here.

lore: Unify diverse nation-states via coercion and occupation.
name: Impose Order
text: Diplomacy + Treachery + STRENGTH>40 *Unopposed OFFICER on planet may steal points.

name: Assign Mission Specialists
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may download to one of your outposts up to two different mission specialists (personnel whose only skill is a regular skill) that you do not already have in play. Also, while in play, each of your mission specialists scores 5 points whenever they use their skill to meet a mission requirement. You may voluntarily discard objective at start of any of your turns. (Unique.)

characteristicsKeywords: Borg/Human; Counterpart; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Rescued Borg counterpart. After returning to his command of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Picard developed a violent vendetta against the Borg.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (Chain of Command)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Archaeology Navigation While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Bor].

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Hood and former commanding officer of William T. Riker. Years ago, he and Jean-Luc Picard served together as lieutenants on the same ship.
name: Robert DeSoto
text: OFFICER If on {U.S.S. Hood}, your compatible V.I.P.s may report aboard. Leadership Honor Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Lt. Commander Shelby is an ambitious Starfleet officer. Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise as a specialist on the Borg.
name: Shelby
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Ensign Sito Jaxa, a Bajoran, is one of a number of navigation officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Sito Jaxa
text: SECURITY Navigation Youth

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human son of Sarek and Amanda Grayson. Over 140-year-old ambassador. On private mission to Romulus. Mindmelded with Picard.
name: Spock
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Computer Skill Leadership SCIENCE Mindmeld

lore: Traveled to 2344 and helped prevent a disastrous war. Survivor of the Battle of Narendra III. Consort of Romulan general. Mother of Sela.
name: Tasha Yar - Alternate
text: SECURITY Honor Leadership DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

lore: Lieutenant Worf is chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Klingon warrior and Starfleet officer. Son of Mogh. Raised on Earth by foster parents.
name: Worf
text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Invited aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise to demonstrate his innovative technology. The ensuing murder mystery proved it successful, but at a high cost.
name: Dr. Reyga (Life From Lifelessness)
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Stellar Cartography DL/ {Metaphasic Shields}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council; Male;
lore: Son of a traitor, Ja'rod, and a traitor himself. Member of the Klingon High Council.
name: Duras (Life From Lifelessness)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Diplomacy Computer Skill Once each turn, may kill an opponent's personnel here that just completed a mission.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Son of M'Rel. Leader of the Klingon High Council after defeating the Duras forces in the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Gowron
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor

lore: Captain of the sleeper ship I.K.S. T'Ong, on a crucial mission ordered by the High Command in the late 23rd century. Awoke 75 years later in a much-changed galaxy.
name: K'Temoc
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Transporter Skill Geology DL/ {Engage Cloak}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Captain of the I.K.S. Pagh when Commander William T. Riker served as an exchange officer.
name: Kargan
text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill

lore: Famed female Klingon scientist and warp-field specialist who evaluated the metaphasic shield.
name: Kurak
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill Physics Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Female; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Mission Specialist;
lore: Klingon female trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Propositioned Commander William T. Riker on the I.K.S. Pagh in 2365.
name: Vekma
text: MEDICAL Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Captain; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Male captain of a mercenary ship raiding archaeological sites to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Baran
text: OFFICER Greed Archaeology Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Takaran male. Attempted to steal Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield technology to claim as his own.
name: Jo'Bril
text: SCIENCE Treachery Astrophysics Physics Greed

lore: Zalkonian captain. Sought to capture criminals undergoing a dangerous mutation before they could further disrupt society.
name: Sunad
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Physics Law

lore: Representative of female mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
name: Vekor
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Navigation Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Vulcan/Romulan; Female; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Female Romulan mercenary. In reality a physically altered Vulcan isolationist seeking the Stone of Gol.
name: Tallera
text: SECURITY Computer Skill SCIENCE Mindmeld Leadership Treachery

lore: Starfleet vessel, registry NCC-20381. In 2364, was assigned a routine mission of exploration in and around the Lorenze Cluster under the command of Paul Rice.
name: U.S.S. Drake
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise-C in an alternate reality. Became the Future Enterprise in an alternate future. Visited by crew from the Starship Enterprise.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise (Chain of Command)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Wall of Ships}

lore: Class of small ships often used for scientific missions. Named for 20th century rocket scientist Hermann Oberth.
name: U.S.S. Oberth
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Tractor Beam; Transport;
lore: Ferengi trade vessel. Same spaceframe as the D'Kora-class marauder, but has a smaller crew complement and devotes far more internal volume to cargo capacity.
name: D'Kora Transport
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
name: I.K.S. Bortas
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Class of ships identical in configuration to the classic B'rel class Klingon Bird-of-Prey, although much larger.
name: I.K.S. K'Vort
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Little-known ship. Difficult to track due to a unique hull design that renders it invisible to long-range scans. Baran captained one in 2370.
name: Mercenary Ship
text: Long-Range Scan Shielding

lore: Specialized science ship used for an Interphase Generator experiment in 2368.
name: Science Vessel

lore: The place that started it all. Changed the galaxy as we know it.
name: Seat of Starfleet
text: Seeds or plays on {2154 Earth}. Once per turn, one [Sta] personnel may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.) DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

lore: The Borg Queen's initial consideration of Admiral Janeway's deal dissipated once she triangulated the admiral's signal. The Borg then adopted a more aggressive strategy.
name: A Change of Plans
text: Plays to do any or all of the following: discard your current objective; return it to your hand if you have {Borg Queen} in play; and download one [BO] Objective card.

lore: Inventor of warp drive. Reluctant hero. First human to make contact with an alien species. Ready to make history, even with a four-alarm hangover.
name: Zefram Cochrane *VP
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics May play {Visit Cochrane Memorial} on same planet.

name: Spacedoor *VP
text: Seeds on your outpost during facility phase. Outpost is SHIELDS -8 (cumulative). In place of your normal card play, you may return your empty ship docked here (and all cards played on it) to owners' hands, nullifying any {Static Warp Bubble} targeting you OR download {Spacedock} or one compatible ? ship to outpost. Flip Spacedoor over after either use.

name: Spacedoor (back) *VP
text: You may use opponent's {Red Alert}! (only at this outpost) as if you had a copy in play. At the end of your turn, you may discard a card from hand to flip Spacedoor over. (Immune to cards that close doorways.)

lore: Member of the Q who felt immortal life had become futile, meaningless, and unendurable. Lobbied to be made mortal so he could commit suicide and upset the Continuum's status quo.
name: Quinn *VP
text: Thrice per game, nullifies an interrupt or event just played or revealed (even {a Treaty}), unless immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Amanda Rogers}.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Born in LaBarre, France. Has an artificial heart. Reads Shakespeare. Something of a Renaissance man.
name: Jean-Luc Picard *VP
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Archaeology Navigation Music

lore: Son of a respected Federation official. Captain of U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Usually confident in dealing with reporters, but on the ship's maiden voyage was having an off day.
name: John Harriman *VP
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Geology Honor

lore: Called d'akturak, "ice man", by Curzon Dax due to his negotiating prowess. Commanded the I.K.C. Gr'oth during the Sherman's Planet sabotage mission in 2267.
name: Koloth *VP
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Exobiology Honor Klingon Intelligence DL/ {Bat'leth}

lore: Reclusive genius who perfected the positronic brain originally proposed in the 20th century. Ex-husband of Juliana. "Father" of the androids Data and Lore.
name: Dr. Soong *VP
text: SCIENCE Cybernetics x 2 Computer Skill ENGINEER Once each turn, may reprogram any androids present.

lore: Activated after his predecessor's suspicious death, this clone of the Vorta Weyoun had subtle errors. He hoped to end the Dominion War by defecting to Odo's side.
name: Weyoun 6 *VP
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Law Biology May replace any changeling present selected to die.

lore: Third Federation ship so christened, launched on stardate 9715. Became fully operational the following Tuesday.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-B *VP
text: Tractor Beam (unless any attribute is reduced). El-Aurians may report aboard.

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Khan-related card; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-1864. Placed at the disposal of Project Genesis to locate a suitable Stage Three testing site. Captured at Ceti Alpha V and subsequently commanded by Khan.
name: U.S.S. Reliant *VP
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Site of the ground-breaking peace talks between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.
name: Camp Khitomer *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Native to this timeline: all cards with both [Films] and [AU] icon. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

lore: In an attempt to save the lives of millions, James T. Kirk crossed onto an unstable bridge to obtain Dr. Tolian Soran's control PADD. The feat required balance and strength.
name: Balancing Act (Homefront III)
text: Each player whose missions with point boxes were mostly [S] or mostly [P] (by a difference of 3 or more), when seeded, loses 50 points (even if playing Borg).

name: Ready Room Door
text: Once per turn, plays to download to one of your ships its matching commander (draw no cards this turn) OR to download one Captain's Order. After any use, discard doorway; place it atop your draw deck; or place it atop one of your Captain's Order events to protect that event from nullification.

name: The Nexus
text: Seeds like a dilemma. When encountered, place on far end of spaceline. (Not duplicatable.) Destroys all ships present; place personnel aboard (or on planet here) under doorway (they are in play). End of every turn, moves one location toward opposite end. At end of spaceline, place on table. At any time, any player may relocate their personnel under here to any planet (even a time location). (Immune to {Revolving Door}.)

lore: Unusual, easily concealed weapon carried by Dr. Tolian Soran. Capable of producing powerful bursts of phased energy. Targeting scope increases accuracy, in the right hands.
name: El-Aurian Phaser
text: Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1, or +3 if they have both Treachery and SCIENCE.

lore: Standard-issue tricorder. Geordi La Forge asked Data to use one to analyze solar probes discovered in a secret chamber of the Amargosa observatory. Data had other ideas.
name: Mr. Tricorder
text: May report to {any Data}. Your personnel present who have both OFFICER and ENGINEER all add Computer Skill. Androids here are attributes all -6.

lore: PADD used by Dr. Tolian Soran to remotely control his solar probe and its trilithium-based nuclear inhibitor. Modified programming also governs launch and cloak functions.
name: Trilithium Weapon Control PADD
text: Your Astrophysics and Stellar Cartography personnel present are CUNNING +1, or +3 if they also have Treachery.

lore: Kidnapped by Kivas Fajo, Data became part of an impressive collection of rare and one-of-a-kind items. Fajo had no problem with the morality of Data's imprisonment.
name: Fajo's Gallery
text: Seeds or plays on table. You may draw two cards each time you capture a unique personnel, and one card each time one of your [Fajo] cards or your {Mona Lisa} enters play.

lore: The Borg use neural energy to collectively repair damaged biological and technological components. The Borg use alcoves to facilitate this process.
name: Regenerate
text: Plays to fully repair and "stop" any {Borg Ship} dilemma or Borg ship (nullifying any cards reducing its attributes) OR to shuffle your discard pile into draw deck. Discard event.

lore: When threatened, fight. When in doubt, surprise them. Brute strength is not the most important asset in a fight. Real power is in the heart. A Klingon does not run away from his battles.
name: Qapla'!
text: If an opponent attacks you, during that battle your Klingons with Honor add INTEGRITY to STRENGTH. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Eliminate primary Maquis base of operations.
name: Find Hidden Base
text: SECURITY x3 + Leadership x2 + 2 hand weapons *+10 if no [Maq] in Badlands Region.

name: Engage Cloak
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your staffed ship cloaks or phases, it may relocate here (capacity one ship). Just before that ship decloaks or dephases, return it to its former location; it may immediately move (up to its full RANGE) once for each of your full turns it was on this objective. (If ship returns to spaceline on your turn, it may also use that turn's RANGE).

name: HQ: Defensive Measures
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your personnel with any Intelligence gain 1 Leadership and may initiate battle against their own affiliation. Also, opponent may not attempt any of your missions with more than one affiliation icon on each end unless opponent attempted to seed a copy of that mission OR opponent is using an appropriate {Espionage} card.

name: Reaching Out
text: Plays on your non-homeworld mission requiring Diplomacy (for free if your {Jonathan Archer} there). Limit one per mission. Your [Sta] personnel may now attempt this mission. When your [Sta] personnel solve, discard to score points if mission has at least two non-[FED] affiliation icons.

lore: In 2370, the human William T. Riker accompanied Ro Laren on a clandestine mission to investigate the Maquis. He posed as a Bajoran freedom fighter.
name: Riker Wil
text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Diplomacy Music While at your [FED] mission, adds [BAJ].

lore: "I am the beginning; the end; the one who is many. I am the Borg.... I am the collective."
name: Borg Queen
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download {A Change of Plans} or a Borg drone in place of one card draw.

lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Federation. "The knowledge and experience of the human - Jean-Luc Picard - is part of us now."
name: Locutus of Borg
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Navigation Archaeology Music While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Fed].

lore: Ruthless Obsidian Order officer. Madred's torture of Jean-Luc Picard quickly degenerated into a desperate attempt to break Picard's will. A pitiable man.
name: Gul Madred
text: OFFICER Obsidian Order SECURITY Treachery Archaeology DL/ {Torture}

lore: Typical Vulcan admiral. She presided over Worf's extradition hearing in 2372. Threatened to hold both Worf and Ch'Pok in contempt of court.
name: T'Lara
text: V.I.P. Leadership Law Exobiology Mindmeld

lore: Nova Squadron pilot during the collision on stardate 45703. Cadet third class. Lost a year's worth of academy credits for his part in the cover-up.
name: Wesley Crusher (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Navigation Physics Youth Honor Computer Skill Stellar Cartography X=3 or 7.

lore: DaiMon. Presented flowers to Lwaxana Troi. Abducted her from Betazed, hoping to exploit her empathic skills during negotiations.
name: Tog
text: OFFICER Greed Anthropology Exobiology Once per game, may capture one Empath present.

lore: First maje of the Kazon-Nistrim. Romantically involved with Seska. Commands a Kazon Raider. Seeks to capture U.S.S. Voyager and its technology at any cost.
name: Culluh
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 ENGINEER Treachery Greed Archaeology Diplomacy DL/ {Boarding Party}

lore: Father of Duras, Lursa and B'Etor. Disappeared shortly after transmitting security codes to the Romulans, precipitating the Khitomer massacre.
name: Ja'rod
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership ENGINEER Computer Skill Attributes all +5 if with {Toral}.

lore: El-Aurian refugee "rescued" from the nexus in 2293 by the Enterprise-B. Spent the next 78 years obsessed with finding a way to return, no matter the cost.
name: Dr. Tolian Soran
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery Worth points while placed under {The Nexus}.

lore: Yridian informant. Told Worf of the secret prison camp in the Carraya system. Likes to tinker with his warp drive. Commanded a Yridian Shuttle.
name: Jaglom Shrek
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Physics Transporter Skill Greed DL/ {Jaglom Shrek - Information Broker}

lore: Inspired in 2063 with a new view of humanity's place in the cosmos, her work helped end post-atomic horror and led to world government in 2113.
name: Kathleen Tonell
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Support Personnel;
lore: Loyal "daughter" of Arik Soong. Augment grown from a genetically engineered embryo kept from the time of Khan. Romantically involved with Raakin and Malik.
name: Persis
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics

lore: Representative of the many senators navigating the perilous and delicate political landscape on Romulus. Seeks to better the Star Empire for his two sons.
name: Sabrun
text: V.I.P. Law Diplomacy Exobiology

lore: Shinzon's protector and counselor. Reman general who kept the Praetor on task. Helped Shinzon invade Deanna Troi's mind. Not known for his beauty.
name: The Viceroy (Homefront III)
text: MEDICAL Leadership Empathy Treachery Exobiology Geology DL/ {Empathic Touch}

lore: Beguiling adversary of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Plotted to display its broken hull on Romulus as a symbol of victory. Commanded the Deranas.
name: Tomalak (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Law Treachery DL/ Any Captain's Order card

lore: Headstrong captain of the Enterprise NX-01. Son of warp engine designer Henry Archer. Negotiated with Vulcans, Andorians, Xindi, and Orions.
name: Jonathan Archer (Homefront III)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy ENGINEER Leadership Honor SECURITY DL/ {Reaching Out}

lore: Cardassian warship commanded by Ocett. One of two vessels sent to investigate a significant Federation archaeological discovery in 2369.
name: Bralek
text: Tractor Beam DL/ Any [TNG] [Car] personnel

lore: Typical Zalkonian defense vessel. One commanded by Sunad traveled at warp 9.72, hunting the fugitive known as John Doe in the Zeta Gelis Cluster.
name: Zalkonian Vessel
text: Kills untransfigured {John Doe} if at same location at end of your turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird involved in the 2369 race to unravel the DNA puzzle discovered by Richard Galen. Commanded by Galathon.
name: Trolarak
text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: San Francisco survived World War III and became a beacon of human progress.
name: 22nd-Century San Francisco
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Seat of Starfleet} here. Each card with both [Sta] and [Preview] gains [22] (even if not in play). Native to this timeline: all [Sta] cards, [Non][22] personnel, [Neu][22] cards, and [22] equipment (except [MQ] cards). Non-[22] cards are excluded from battle here.

lore: Trilithium-based nuclear inhibitor housed within a solar probe. Built by Dr. Tolian Soran to reshape gravitational forces and gain access to the joyous fantasy realm within the Nexus.
name: Trilithium Weapon
text: Use as Equipment card. Discard to rotate your Mission card here (except a Mission II) so that your side now faces opponent.

lore: Caught in the Nexus, where time has no meaning, James T. Kirk forgot he had been cooking Ktarian eggs for breakfast.
name: Do You Smell Something Burning?
text: "Stops" half of your away team (random selection, round down). Nullify with a cook, ANIMAL, or {Lure of the Nexus}. Mission continues.

lore: A broken container of invidium disrupted the U.S.S. Enterprise's systems in 2366 before it was rendered inert by Geordi La Forge and Reginald Barclay.
name: Invidium Leak
text: Cannot get past unless crew has 3 ENGINEER OR a personnel with CUNNING>7 and MEDICAL OR a personnel with CUNNING>7 and Physics.

lore: In 2365, two Antedeans planned to bomb the conference on Pacifica. Without Lwaxana Troi's help, Starfleet would not have learned their robes were lined with explosive ultritium.
name: Antedean Assassins
text: To get past, one Anthropology OR Empathy personnel (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 2 Anthropology OR 2 Empathy.

lore: Thieves, time travel, mysterious artifacts, and digging in caves made for a refreshing change from the demands of commanding a starship.
name: Captain's Holiday
text: To get past requires 2 Archaeology OR 2 Geology.

lore: Following the tragic news of the deaths of his brother and nephew, Jean-Luc Picard retreated to the seclusion of his quarters to mourn.
name: Devastating Communique
text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped" until end of your next turn. May be nullified by {Subspace Interference}.

lore: Suffering from felicium withdrawal, T'Jon threatened William T. Riker's life in an attempt to manipulate Jean-Luc Picard. Picard refused to enable the Ornaran's addiction.
name: Ornaran Threat
text: Randomly select a personnel to be "stopped." Unless you have 2 Diplomacy and MEDICAL OR 2 SECURITY and STRENGTH>25, that personnel is killed.

lore: When Yranac was unforthcoming with information about those responsible for Jean-Luc Picard's alleged death, William T. Riker used alternative methods to jog the Yridian's memory.
name: Reluctant Informant
text: Lowest INTEGRITY personnel and one other [Cmd] (if present, opponent's choice) are "stopped" until end of your next turn. Nullify with Empathy OR a brig present.

lore: In 2369, the Cardassians expended considerable resources to capture and interrogate Jean-Luc Picard. They failed to extract the Federation's defense plans for Minos Korva.
name: Shall We Begin Again?
text: Opponent draws 3 cards, then reveals their hand. For each [Cmd] personnel revealed, "stops" one personnel present (random selection).

lore: In 2371, after Lursa and B'Etor stole trilithium from a Romulan outpost, the Romulans came looking for it at the Amargosa observatory.
name: Trilithium Raid
text: Opponent may download up to two [Univ] Romulans to a facility at this location (or up to six if facility is a station). To get past requires 2 ENGINEER and STRENGTH>40.

lore: Romulan security operatives such as Selok, who posed as Vulcan ambassador T'Pel for years, spy on governments throughout the quadrant. They could be anywhere.
name: Undercover Agent
text: If a [Rom] ship is in play, opponent may download to here {Selok} or a Romulan with an infiltration icon. To get past requires SECURITY, Biology, and (CUNNING>40 OR Law).

lore: Illegal compound believed mythical by some. Used by Harcourt Fenton Mudd to improve the attractiveness of his "cargo." Its true power lay in the user's self-confidence.
name: Venus Drug
text: Plays on any location. Your female personnel here gain Youth and are attributes all +2.

name: Always a Chess Game
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your [TNG][Rom] personnel (except Tal Shiar, CIVILIAN, or V.I.P.) may report for free to your [Rom] outpost OR you may report (for free) to your ship its [TNG][Rom] matching commander. Once per game, score 5 points when your [TNG][Rom] personnel helps solve a non-[Univ] Neutral Zone mission.

name: Illegitimate Leader of the Empire
text: Plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Klingon Civil War} OR download to your facility any [TNG][Kli] or [TNG][Rom] card with "Duras" in title or lore. Once each turn, your non-Honor [TNG][Kli] personnel may report (for free) to your [Kli] outpost, or to your {Duras}, {Lursa}, {B'Etor}, or {Sisters of Duras}. Discard incident if you have {Gowron} or any Klingon with Honor in play.

name: Federation Flagship: Recovered
text: Seeds or plays on table. If opponent's card just destroyed your only ship in play, place that ship here (with all cards aboard). Download one of the following to your matching facility or that spaceline's end: a different ship of the same class or identification OR any other Enterprise (if destroyed ship was {any Enterprise}). Relocate crew and equipment from here to downloaded ship (they are "stopped"). Discard incident.

name: The Romulan Underground
requires: Dissident; Romulan underground; Romulus System Region;
text: Plays on a Romulus System planet. Once each turn, {Major Rakal}, a [TNG] [Rom] Dissident, or [TNG] [Rom] personnel with "underground" in lore may report for free here. Your Away Team which includes such a personnel may attempt this mission. When you solve, you may discard incident and three [TNG] [Rom] Honor personnel from that Away Team to score points.

name: They Will Be Coming
text: Seeds during facility phase on spaceline end (on far end from {Earth}, if possible); may download one [Bor] ship here. Once each turn, you may report a [Univ] Borg to your [Bor] ship for free. Nullified if you seeded any non-Alpha Quadrant mission. (Unique.)

lore: Like their father Ja'rod and their brother Duras, Klingon sisters Lursa and B'Etor chose to betray their people and form an alliance with the Romulans in an attempt to seize power.
name: A Family of Traitors
text: Once per game, downloads (even from your discard pile) a {[TNG] Treachery x2} personnel to replace (discard) your non-Treachery [TNG] personnel.

lore: While neither the Federation nor the Romulans may enter the Neutral Zone, chance encounters do occur. The Romulans manipulate such situations to look like the aggrieved party.
name: Explain Your Presence
text: Once per game, plays on your [Rom] OFFICER if opponent's crew there. "Stop" that personnel and examine opponent's crew; score points.

lore: Intercept Starfleet officer en route to shore leave.
name: Abduction Plot
text: Transporter Skill + Treachery + CUNNING>34 + (any Intelligence + Leadership OR Law + OFFICER) Opponent's side: [FED] Navigation x3 + SHIELDS>6 [Fed] shuttlecraft may report with crew (limit 2) here.

lore: Participate in tactical training scenarios in harsh environment.
name: Advanced Combat Training
text: Computer Skill + SECURITY + Leadership + MEDICAL

lore: Aid vessel involved in Maquis attack.
name: Assist Damaged Vessel
text: Leadership + MEDICAL + Biology + ENGINEER + no [Maq] ships here Opponent's side: [FED][KLI][BAJ] Leadership + SECURITY + Treachery + Physics [Maq] ships may report with crew (limit 2) here.

lore: Defend sole survivors of colony devastated by Husnock attacks.
name: Assist Survivors
text: Diplomacy + Biology + (Empathy OR Anthropology x2) {Rishon} may seed face up here. Opponent's side: Once per game, {Husnock Ship} may report with crew here.

lore: Suppress knowledge of colony of Romulans and formerly imprisoned Klingons.
name: Conceal Unlikely Society
text: Anthropology + (Honor x2 OR any Intelligence) *Discard up to three Youth for +5 each.

lore: Meet with old adversary to discuss a "gift."
name: Attend Mysterious Rendezvous
text: Navigation x2 + Leadership x2 + ({DaiMon Bok} OR {Jean-Luc Picard} OR INTEGRITY>30)

lore: Search devastated world for hidden lab of famed android designer Dr. Soong.
name: Investigate Dead Planet
text: ENGINEER + CUNNING>32 + (Acquisition OR {Data}) When you solve, may download an android here. Opponent's side:  ENGINEER + CUNNING>32 + (Acquisition OR {Lore}) Your {Crystalline Entity} here is doubled.

lore: Debate enforcement of death penalty for breach of local law.
name: Legal Appeal
text: Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology + Law + no Youth Opponent's side: [NON] CIVILIAN x2 + SECURITY + Law x2 Once per game, {Edo Vessel} may report with crew here.

lore: Investigate unauthorized activity endangering fragile peace treaty.
name: Prevent Military Escalation
text: OFFICER x2 + Leadership + Honor OR {Miles O'Brien} Opponent's side: OFFICER x3 + Leadership OR {Benjamin Maxwell} Once per game, {U.S.S. Phoenix} may report with crew here.

lore: Retrieve escape pod of fleeing Bajoran operative.
name: Recover Prisoner
text: OFFICER + SECURITY + (Treachery OR Physics OR Greed) When you solve, may capture an opponent's personnel here. Opponent's side: [FED] Navigation + Youth + SECURITY When you solve, may download {Rescue Captives}.

lore: Restock Ferengi vessel.
name: Resupply Marauder II
text: OFFICER + ENGINEER x2 + Acquisition Solving player's D'Kora-class ships are RANGE +1. If destroyed, flip mission over.

lore: Restock Ferengi vessel.
name: Resupply Marauder II (back)
text: OFFICER + ENGINEER x2 + Acquisition Solving player's D'Kora-class ships are RANGE +1. If your Ferengi ENGINEER is here, you may discard a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} from here to flip mission over; draw no cards that turn.

name: Ensnared
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, if you have [TNG][Car] personnel at four or more missions an opponent seeded, name a unique personnel. If opponent has that personnel in play, place that personnel aboard your ship (captured).

name: We Are Back
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, at the start of your turn, for every two missions an opponent seeded where you have [TNG][Rom] personnel, you may download to hand one [TNG][Rom] ship and one [TNG][Rom][Cmd] personnel. Discard objective.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Cardassians researching new means of interrogation. Glinn. Visited the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2369 as Gul Lemec's aide.
name: Corak
text: SCIENCE Biology Physics

lore: Female chief engineer on the Vetar. Believes females make better engineers. Injured in a Maquis attack in 2370. Tactful manager.
name: Gollek
text: ENGINEER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation Diplomacy

lore: Cardassian informant who provided military secrets to the Federation for the good of the Cardassian Union. Commanded a Type VI Shuttlecraft.
name: Joret Dal
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Honor DL/ {Escape Pod} DL/ {Counterintelligence}

lore: Smuggler, entrepreneur, starship thief, peddler of the Venus drug, and emperor of androids. Just an "honest businessman." Married to Stella Mudd.
name: Harcourt Fenton Mudd
text: CIVILIAN Greed Smuggling Treachery Acquisition DL/ {Venus Drug}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bodyguard; Cook; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel; Thief;
lore: Human thief working for Baran during the hunt for the Stone of Gol. Served as cook, occasional bodyguard, and boarding party member.
name: Rybak
text: SECURITY Smuggling Acquisition Greed If on your {Mercenary Ship}, it is attributes all +1.

lore: Expert in shield and cloak technology serving on the Apnex in 2368. Invited to Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield test but refused permission by his government.
name: Agyer
text: SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Space Boomer}

lore: Legendary 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human head of of the Romulan underground. An advocate of reunification, Spock was betrayed by his friend Senator Pardek.
name: Ambassador Spock
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Diplomacy x 2 Honor Law Mindmeld DL/ Any [Univ][Rom] personnel with INTEGRITY>6 OR {Pardek}

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Dissident; Male; Mission Specialist; Senator;
lore: Typical political aide. Dissident who defected to the Federation in stasis with Vice-Proconsul M'ret in 2369. Former senator in the youth diplomatic corps.
name: D'Lors
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy

lore: Human captain disguised as a Romulan. Worked with the Romulan underground movement. Shared his memories of Sarek through a mindmeld with Spock.
name: Jean-Luc Picard (Engage)
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Anthropology Archaeology Music Honor DL/ {Vulcan Mindmeld}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Capturing-related card; High Council; Infiltrator; Male;
lore: High Council emissary. Klingon who conspired with Romulans to assassinate Governor Vagh and thereby disrupt the Klingon-Federation alliance.
name: Kell (Engage)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Computer Skill ENGINEER Exobiology DL/ {E-Band Emissions}

lore: Typical member of the Romulan underground. Female colleague of Tamarith. Pleased by Spock's decision to stay on Romulus after Pardek's betrayal.
name: Kharic
text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Exobiology Anthropology Honor

lore: Representative of non-military personnel guarding the Carraya system prison camp for Khitomer survivors. Sometimes serves as Tokath's bodyguard.
name: Khev
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Biology Youth

lore: Typical Romulan engineer who became trapped in a temporal fragment in 2369. Did not realize the cause was life-form incubation in the engine core.
name: Mareth
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Youth

lore: Special security officer aboard the Apnex. Assigned to guard the prototype phase-inverting cloaking device. Worked as a bartender before joining the military.
name: Parem (Engage)
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Physics Treachery Attributes all +1 when facing a dilemma.

lore: Neral deceived Ambassador Spock by pretending he supported a reunification of Romulus with Vulcan.
name: Proconsul Neral
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Treachery x 2 Youth Law Leadership DL/ {Live Long and Prosper} DL/ {The Art of Diplomacy} (extends effects to [Rom]).

lore: Typical field nurse assigned to a damage control team on the Haakona in 2365. Was tending injured crew members when Jean-Luc Picard appeared.
name: T'Jev
text: MEDICAL Biology Greed Anthropology

lore: One of many female officers serving aboard Romulan warbirds. Former engineering technician who got caught in a temporal fragment in 2369.
name: Tacil
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Treachery Geology

lore: Tal Shiar officer assigned to the Office of the Proconsul in 2368. Often works alongside his twin brother Telak. Likes viinerine with Romulan ale.
name: Toraan
text: SECURITY Tal Shiar Exobiology Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Romulan Disruptor}

lore: Refitted vessel captained by William T. Riker during Starfleet's blockade of the Klingon-Romulan border in 2368. Underwent further refit in 2373.
name: U.S.S. Excalibur
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: In 2372, Culluh and Seska took command of the Alpha Quadrant vessel U.S.S. Voyager and its technology for the benefit of the Kazon-Nistrim sect.
name: Voyager
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Home Away from Home}

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird commanded by Tomalak. Often assigned to the Neutral Zone. Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise twice in 2366.
name: Deranas
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in Neutral Zone.

name: Always a Chess Game *VP
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your [TNG][Rom] personnel (except Tal Shiar, CIVILIAN, or V.I.P.) may report for free to your [Rom] outpost OR you may report (for free) to your ship its [TNG][Rom] matching commander. Once per game, score 5 points when your [TNG][Rom] personnel helps solve a non-[Univ] Neutral Zone mission.

lore: Cardassian informant who provided military secrets to the Federation for the good of the Cardassian Union. Commanded a Type VI Shuttlecraft.
name: Joret Dal*
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Honor DL/ {Escape Pod} DL/ {Counterintelligence}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: William T. Riker "went renegade" to penetrate Baran's crew during the hunt for the Stone of Gol.
name: Will Riker*
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Anthropology Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Dropping In}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Dour smuggler of few words. Acquired part of the Stone of Gol for Baran. Commanded a Klingon shuttle. Disliked games and replicated bloodwine.
name: Koral (The Next Generation)*
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Smuggling Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Talarian freighter hijacked by three Klingons in pursuit of a warrior's death. Commanded by Korris, who then destroyed the I.K.S. T'Acog.
name: Batris*
text: Tractor Beam WEAPONS +5 vs. [Kli].

lore: With all political authority vanished, humanity teetered on the edge of its second Dark Age.
name: Back to Basics 2E (Virtual Promo Cards)
text: Your opponent shuffles each personnel and ship in their discard pile into draw deck. If fourteen or more cards were shuffled in, Away Team stopped. Discard dilemma.

name: Q's Tent: Civil War
text: Place one atop Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different cards face down and up to 13 different [Ref] cards face up) during the seed phase. Q's Tent is now open and in play.
