Your other Q-related side decks are closed and cannot be opened or reopened. You may not play {Q's Tent} during your turn. You may not begin mission attempts with less than four personnel.

lore: In anticipation of a prisoner exchange, a Dominion delegation boarded Empok Nor in 2374. They found that the Ferengi were already entrenched there.
name: Ferengi Infestation *VP
text: Opponent may download up to two male Ferengi to a facility at this location (or up to six if facility is {Empok Nor}). To get past requires 2 SECURITY and CUNNING>50.

lore: The perfect mate, an empathic metamorph. Kriosian mutant romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Dutifully married Alrik despite her bond to Jean-Luc.
name: Kamala *VP
text: V.I.P. Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Empathy When reported, select any skill present.

lore: Revived Borg drones found in Earth's Arctic Circle assimilated the nearest ship in an attempt to rejoin the Collective.
name: Assimilated Vessel
text: End of every turn: Attacks one ship (random selection), then moves. Opponent scores points if dilemma moves off spaceline (even if [Bor]).

lore: Data and his brother Lore each contained a homing device. When Dr. Soong activated them in 2367, Data took control of the U.S.S. Enterprise to reach his creator.
name: Cybernetic Homing Device
text: If android or non-[Bor] Borg aboard, opponent may move ship up to printed RANGE (ship is "stopped"), then discard dilemma. Otherwise, to get past requires CUNNING>36.

lore: Under Lore's emotional influence, Data felt a sense of brutal pleasure after killing a Borg on Ohniaka III. He pursued those feelings until his ethical subroutines were reinitialized.
name: Data Has Some Issues
text: Place on ("stops") a personnel present (random selection). End of each turn, they kill another personnel present with lower STRENGTH (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 ENGINEER.

lore: Silaran Prin used hunter probes to exact vengeance against several Shakaar resistance cell members including Latha Mabrin, Furel, and Lupaza.
name: Hunter Probe
text: Unless 2 SECURITY and 2 Anthropology present, opponent chooses two personnel. Both die at end of turn. Mission continues.

lore: After Worf's suggestion to activate the U.S.S. Enterprise-E's self-destruct sequence, Jean-Luc Picard's outburst surprised his crew. They carried out his orders nonetheless.
name: Irrational Commander
text: Unless you have two leaders with Honor OR two leaders with Treachery, place on mission. Crew must have any attribute>double mission points to solve. (Unique.)

lore: Electromagnetic phenomenon that surrounded Taurus II in 2267. Damaged the shuttlecraft Galileo and left transporters temporarily unreliable.
name: Murasaki Effect
text: Damages all unstaffed ships in orbit. Place on mission. Each time transporters used here, one just-beamed personnel is killed (random selection).

lore: Heavily armed Osaarian merchant ship. Its crew turned to piracy after being stranded in the Delphic Expanse.
name: Osaarian Pirates
text: End of every turn: Destroys one equipment (random selection) on each facility (except a Nor) and ship here without Smuggling aboard, then moves.

lore: The untested junior engineers assigned to salvage Empok Nor were frozen with terror after Cardassian killers gradually began eliminating them.
name: Paralyzed by Fear
text: "Stops" each personnel in crew or Away Team with printed CUNNING+INTEGRITY<13. Nullify with {Miles O'Brien}.

lore: Shinzon's elimination of the Romulan Senate using a thalaron radiation device ensured his ascension to the pinnacle of power in the Star Empire.
name: Regime Change
text: Opponent chooses: kills three personnel (random selection) who report for free using game text on planet (or planet facility here) OR kills one V.I.P. (random selection).

lore: Black market device of Romulan origin which scrambles transporter beams on rematerialization. Silaran Prin used one to kill Shakaar resistance cell informant Trentin Fala in 2373.
name: Remat Detonator
text: Unless 2 Transporter Skill present, place on table. Whenever your personnel have just beamed, opponent may discard dilemma to kill one (their choice).

lore: Angry life-form transformed into a massive and powerful vessel. Nothing like it in Starfleet records - not even close.
name: Spaceborne Entity
text: No personnel may report "for free" at this location. End of every turn: Attacks all ships matching mission's affiliation icons, then moves.

lore: In 2371, a warp core breach forced the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise to land the saucer section on Veridian III, bringing the ship's mission to an end.
name: Brace for Impact
text: Plays to land your damaged ship at a planet location. If Galaxy-class, X=landed ship's lowest printed attribute. Otherwise, X=0.

lore: Stranded on Earth in the 1930s, Spock struggled to construct a mnemonic memory circuit using the comparatively primitive equipment of the era.
name: Stone Knives and Bearskins
text: Plays on any planet mission. Suspends gametext of all non-unique Equipment present (except blade weapons, [Rule] cards, {Ketracel-White}, and {Gold-Pressed Latinum}).

lore: As the power of a spacefaring culture declines, outposts established throughout its former territory are often occupied by independent groups.
name: Repurposed Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Non-Aligned ENGINEER. Does not allow aligned cards to report.

name: Followers of the One
text: Plays on {Varria III}. [Non] androids and [Non] Borg cards may report to planet or in orbit; once each turn, {The One} (or a personnel with his name in lore) may do so for free. Your [Non] androids and [Non] Borg may beam through shields of an opponent's ship at the same mission as your Borg ship, but may only battle once that turn. Your [Non] Borg are immune to {Reactor Overload}.

name: Taken Prisoner
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may report a [TNG][Car] personnel (for free) to your [Car] outpost or to your [TNG][Car] ship at a mission an opponent seeded or that is worth 40 or more points. Once each turn (thrice per game), if an opponent's personnel present with your [TNG][Car] personnel is about to be killed, you may capture that personnel instead.

lore: The isolationist Paxan race hid their existence by erasing explorers' memories. The Paxans failed to remove all clues to their encounter with the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367.
name: A Missing Day
text: Plays once each turn to count down an opponent's dilemma, interrupt, or event (except {Omega Particle}).

lore: To prevent the assassination of Captain Kirk in 2268, the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant needed to blend into the background of daily life aboard the Starship Enterprise.
name: Fitting In
text: Plays once each turn to give your non-[AU] personnel a skill from an [AU] personnel present until end of turn.

lore: Hide from pursuing Borg cube in dense, hazardous nebula.
name: Evade Borg Vessel
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation + Leadership + CUNNING>36 Only one of your ships may battle here every turn.

lore: Help separated and disoriented Borg regain order.
name: Foster New Collective
text: SECURITY x3 + STRENGTH>36 + ([Com] OR [Nav] OR [Def]) Opponent's side: Your <Y) and (Y> may report on planet (for free).

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Install new android hardware at remote laboratory.
name: Install Emotion Chip
text: Cybernetics x2 + INTEGRITY>34 *+5 for each unique Soong-type android present, up to three.

lore: Find Bajoran terrorist's resistance cell.
name: Locate Terrorist Leader
text: Anthropology + SECURITY + Computer Skill + (Honor OR Treachery OR Resistance)

name: Redirect Energy Ribbon
text: Seeds on {Veridian III}. Your El-Aurian personnel may attempt it using these requirements: Treachery + Astrophysics + {Trilithium Weapon} + {Trilithium Weapon Control PADD} When you solve, download or relocate {The Nexus} (even from on table) to any of your planet missions and you may convert Veridian III to a space mission.

lore: Identification: TOPOLOGY DRONE Task: Analyze planetary surface features. Secure. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Twelve of Thirteen
text: Geology Allows each scout ship in this hive to take off or land once each turn.

lore: Representative of espionage specialists serving in the Cardassian military. Posed as a monk to attack a Maquis cell at the Juhraya colony in 2370.
name: Goran
text: MEDICAL Transporter Skill Anthropology Obsidian Order DL/ {Cardassian Disruptor}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Elder gul encountered by the U.S.S. Enterprise in multiple realities. Commanded the Rokassa. Investigated espionage uses of the Argus Array.
name: Nador
text: OFFICER Treachery Stellar Cartography Law Leadership Anthropology

lore: Trainee instructor at Starfleet Academy, Mr. Spock supervised the Kobayashi Maru scenario. 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human mentor of Saavik.
name: Captain Spock (The Sky's the Limit)
text: OFFICER Biology Honor Leadership Physics SCIENCE Mindmeld DL/ {The Needs of the Many}

lore: Human tactical officer typical of those serving in the late 23rd century. Directed efforts to transport the S.S. Lakul survivors aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-B.
name: D.C. Franklin
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Transporter Skill

lore: Promoted to vice-admiral after seven years in the Delta Quadrant. Dispatched the U.S.S. Enterprise-E to Romulus on an "easy" diplomatic assignment.
name: Kathryn Janeway (The Sky's the Limit)
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Diplomacy Computer Skill Physics While on {Earth}, your [Fed] ships are RANGE +1.

lore: Human navigator typical of U.S.S. Enterprise-B staff officers. Befriended Demora Sulu. Enjoys strategy games and tales of the ancient American West.
name: Marruu
text: OFFICER Navigation Computer Skill

lore: Typical nurse who served under Beverly Crusher for many years. Helped evacuate sickbay when the Borg boarded the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.
name: Martinez
text: MEDICAL Biology Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Duras-related; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Experienced officer who often commanded the U.S.S. Enterprise. Defeated the Sisters of Duras at Veridian III. Well versed in saucer separations.
name: William T. Riker (The Sky's the Limit)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Music DL/ {Brace for Impact}

lore: Typical Ferengi physician. Served aboard the Krayton in 2366. Distrusted Lwaxana Troi. Tried to study her empathic powers with a mind probe.
name: Dr. Farek (The Sky's the Limit)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Treachery Computer Skill

lore: Betazoid ambassador held captive by Tog. Misled him about her willingness to cooperate. Later described Tog as slightly repulsive, but with a certain charm.
name: Lwaxana Troi (The Sky's the Limit)
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Anthropology Computer Skill

lore: Since failing to seize control of the Klingon Empire, B'Etor, sister of Duras, had been seeking to acquire powerful weapons. Still the prettier sister.
name: B'Etor (The Sky's the Limit)
text: V.I.P. Treachery Youth DL/ {Lursa} Once per game, may steal an Artifact present.

lore: Characteristic of male Klingon warriors supporting attempts by the House of Duras to regain power after their defeat in the Klingon Civil War.
name: Dokar
text: OFFICER Biology Treachery Transporter Skill

lore: Klingon helmsman serving the Sisters of Duras. Briefly worked as a bounty hunter. Warrior at heart. Surprised when his ship began to cloak at Veridian III.
name: K'Vit
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Anthropology Treachery If on {Cha'Joh}, it is RANGE +2.

lore: Ambitious sister of Duras and B'Etor. Working to restore her family's previous position of power. Named her newborn son after her father, Ja'rod.
name: Lursa (The Sky's the Limit)
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership DL/ {B'Etor} Treachery Klingons present are attributes all +1.

lore: Typical disconnected Borg disciple of The One. Participated in the raid on Ohniaka III. Swore to avenge the death of his friend Torsus.
name: Bosus
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Treachery Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Male; Soong-type android; The One-related personnel;
lore: Loyal brother of Lore. The Soong-type android was swayed by emotions to join The One's cause.
name: Data (The Sky's the Limit)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Exobiology Biology Treachery Mortally wounds each opponent he stuns in battle.

lore: Representative of lost Borg who found a new sense of purpose with The One. Temporarily separated himself from his new collective.
name: Goval
text: SCIENCE Biology Archaeology Exobiology

lore: The perfect mate, an empathic metamorph. Kriosian mutant romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Dutifully married Alrik despite her bond to Jean-Luc.
name: Kamala
text: V.I.P. Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Empathy When reported, select any skill present.

lore: Renegade Borg who commanded the initial phase of raids on Federation outposts. Loyal aide to The One. Recruited Data to their cause.
name: Lieutenant Crosis
text: OFFICER Treachery Computer Skill SECURITY {Investigate Raid} has [NON].

lore: Male El-Aurian representative of refugees rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise-B from the S.S. Lakul before it was destroyed by the Nexus.
name: Millin
text: CIVILIAN Honor Anthropology

lore: One of many Borg disconnected from the Collective who became loyal to The One. Guarded the Federation prisoners but was easily tricked by them.
name: Morik
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Transporter Skill Geology X=number of different [NA] Borg present (limit 6).

characteristicsKeywords: Android; Male; Soong-type android; The One-related personnel;
lore: The Soong-type android Lore found his calling giving purpose to disconnected Borg drones.
name: The One
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Computer Skill Diplomacy Transporter Skill DL/ {Lore's Fingernail}

lore: Borg befriended by Geordi La Forge. Became an individual, "Hugh," fracturing his hive's link to the Collective. Led those resisting Lore's leadership.
name: Third of Five (The Sky's the Limit)
text: ENGINEER Honor Leadership Biology Exobiology DL/ {Group of Individuals}

lore: Complex strategist affected by temporal irregularities in 2369. Once captained a D'deridex. Has a family tradition of military service.
name: Relam
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Treachery SCIENCE

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Typical Romulan pilot. Beamed aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise during an encounter with quantum singularity lifeforms in 2369. Enjoys chess.
name: Tarvang
text: ENGINEER Navigation Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Freighter; Long-Range Scan Shielding; Tractor Beam;
lore: Typical Cardassian freighter. Carries anything from research equipment to disruptors to taspar eggs. Uses high-energy subspace fields to mask its cargo.
name: Supply Ship
text: Long-Range Scan Shielding, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Scout;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras. Fought at Veridian III.
name: Cha'Joh (The Sky's the Limit)
text: May report to location of {Dr. Tolian Soran}. Cloaking Device

lore: Large Borg ship operated by a group of renegade Borg. First encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise while raiding the Federation outpost on Ohniaka III.
name: Assimilator
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Transwarp Conduit}

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Merchant vessel; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: One of many decommissioned Vulcan merchant vessels. Several were stolen by the Romulans in a ploy to conquer Vulcan for the Star Empire.
name: Stolen Ship
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Merchant vessel; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: One of many decommissioned Vulcan merchant vessels. Several were stolen by the Romulans in a ploy to conquer Vulcan for the Star Empire.
name: Stolen Ship*
text: Tractor Beam

lore: When Odo was under suspicion for murder, Bajoran nationals led by Zayra demanded that the changeling be handed over to them. Benjamin Sisko spared the constable from their "justice."
name: Angry Mob
text: Kills a SECURITY or shape-shifter present (random selection) unless remaining Away Team has INTEGRITY>27 from up to four personnel OR STRENGTH>50. Discard dilemma.

lore: Conducting illicit negotiations with a pair of volatile Klingons requires an experienced eye and careful haggling, much like the day-to-day life of a tailor.
name: Back Room Dealings
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Treachery or INTEGRITY<4. To get past requires STRENGTH>24 remaining.

lore: Bashir... Julian Bashir. Role in a holoprogram created by his friend Felix, of a spy for Great Britain in the Cold War of 20th-century Earth. Has escaped countless traps.
name: Secret Agent Julian Bashir *VP
text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Biology DL/ {'45 Dom Perignon} Your personnel may not be captured where present.

lore: Genetically engineered criminal exiled to Ceti Alpha V by Kirk. Bent solely on avenging the death of his wife.
name: Khan *VP
reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
text: V.I.P. [Fed] opponents need {any Kirk} present to solve mission here. Leadership Treachery x 2 Computer Skill

lore: Massive living machine created by an unknown race around the lost NASA space probe Voyager VI. Left a trail of destruction during its return to Earth in search of its creator.
name: V'Ger *VP
text: Ship is destroyed unless 2 Empathy OR Diplomacy, Anthropology, and Computer Skill present. Discard dilemma.

lore: While orbiting Pollux IV, the godlike Apollo caused the wind to withdraw from the sails of the Starship Enterprise and demanded that the crew worship him and pay tribute.
name: What Does God Need With a Starship? *VP
text: Nullifies {"God}." OR Plays once every turn. Opponent chooses: you may download a ship to any location OR you may "stop" or "unstop" (your choice) any ship in play.

name: Construct Starship *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may download any outpost or {headquarters} (if you have a matching ENGINEER at an appropriate location) OR download {Spacedock} (even to a docking site) OR download a unique ship to your facility that has a Spacedock (if you have an ENGINEER aboard who is that ship's matching commander). Discard objective OR draw no cards this turn.

lore: Dahar master. Legendary warrior. Former ambassador to Vulcan. Victorious at Klach D'Kel Brakt. Swore blood oath against the Albino. Sought the Sword of Kahless.
name: Kor *VP
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Honor Music Other Klingons present are each STRENGTH +2.

lore: Respected admiral. Friend of Soval. Sent the crew of Enterprise out into the final frontier to go where no man had gone before.
name: Maxwell Forrest *VP
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership x 2 Astrophysics DL/ Any NX-class ship

lore: Specially commissioned in 2286 to replace the famous ship lost one year earlier. Proudly continued the mission of its predecessor under the command of James T. Kirk.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-A *VP
text: DL/ {Any Federation [Films] personnel} OR {James T. Kirk} Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet. Stolen and commanded by Admiral Kirk; re-christened with historical irony by Dr. McCoy.
name: H.M.S. Bounty *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: Formidable vessel commanded by Penk, from which he broadcasts his popular fighting circuit. Heavily shielded to prevent anyone from abducting his competitors.
name: Tsunkatse Ship *VP
text: Your personnel with "Tsunkatse" in lore may report aboard. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype Starfleet vessel, NX-59650. Boasts ablative armor, regenerative shielding, and multivector assault mode. Captured by Romulans during a test flight.
name: U.S.S. Prometheus *VP
text: May download {Multivector Assault Mode} when in battle. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Khan-related card; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-1864. Placed at the disposal of Project Genesis to locate a suitable Stage Three testing site. Captured at Ceti Alpha V and subsequently commanded by Khan.
name: U.S.S. Reliant* *VP
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Kathryn Janeway offered the disconnected drone Seven of Nine a new life free from the Borg Collective and the chance to rediscover her humanity as Annika Hansen.
name: Starting Over
text: Discard your hand, then draw the same number of cards. If you have a Borg personnel in play, draw two extra cards. (No draws may be converted to downloads.) Discard event.

lore: David Marcus used dangerously unpredictable protomatter to build the Genesis Device, inadvertently dooming the Genesis Planet.
name: Unstable Matrix
text: Seeds on {Genesis}. If mission complete, you may lose points (discard event) to convert to a space mission. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Analyze automated subspace relay station for information on the Dominion.
name: Access Relay Station (Homefront IV)
text: OFFICER + SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Computer Skill x2 + CUNNING>34

lore: Purchase bilitrium from Klingon outcasts for delivery to Bajoran insurgents.
name: Acquire Illicit Explosives (Homefront IV)
text: Physics + CIVILIAN + Treachery OR Physics + Smuggling

lore: Ambush enemy ship while it conducts delicate research.
name: Attack at Rare Phenomenon
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Computer Skill + SECURITY

lore: Investigate unusual bio-readings.
name: Battle Reconnaissance
text: ENGINEER + Computer Skill + Transporter Skill + STRENGTH>32

lore: Battle over strategically significant system.
name: Clash at Chin'toka
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + two leaders + CUNNING>36

lore: Harvest rare substance for use as replacement power source.
name: Collect Omicron Particles
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Astrophysics + Navigation Adjacent missions are span -1.

lore: Permanently close ancient portal held by renegade Jem'Hadar.
name: Destroy Iconian Gateway
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + STRENGTH>34

lore: Return to analyze and destroy last traces of deadly nanobiogenic weapon accidentally re-released.
name: Eliminate Virus (Homefront IV)
text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + Computer Skill *Points do not count when {Harvester Virus} in play.

lore: Maneuver among icy comet fragments during hot pursuit.
name: Evade Dominion Squadron
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + CUNNING>34 + (Geology OR Leadership)

lore: Confer with colonial leaders about recent tensions.
name: Investigate Maquis Activity
text: Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + STRENGTH>37 + no [Maq] *+5 if this is your first completed mission.

lore: Study final collapse of unstable and formerly forbidden planet.
name: Genesis Planet
text: Geology + CUNNING>42 + (Biology + Exobiology + SCIENCE OR SECURITY + Transporter Skill + Treachery)

lore: Study remains of antique Vulcan ship.
name: Investigate Derelict
text: ENGINEER + Exobiology + Navigation + SECURITY When you solve, restores RANGE of all ships in region.

lore: Engage enemy near vital sensor array.
name: Navigate Argolis Cluster
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + Physics OR OFFICER + Leadership + SECURITY + STRENGTH>36

lore: Defend civilian government from Klingon patrols.
name: Protect The Escapees
text: ENGINEER + Honor + Navigation + INTEGRITY>30 Solving player may initiate battle against [Kli].

lore: Refurbish outpost established in the earliest days of space exploration.
name: Renovate Starbase
text: ENGINEER x2 + OFFICER When you solve, download a facility here.

lore: Restock Ferengi vessels for operations in adjacent sectors.
name: Resupply Marauder
text: OFFICER + ENGINEER x2 + Acquisition Solving player's D'Kora-class ships are RANGE +1.

lore: Fight for control of critical communications array.
name: The Siege of AR-558
text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>38

lore: Search for officer kidnapped from Deep Space 9 by Maquis.
name: Search and Rescue (Homefront IV)
text: Navigation x2 + Honor + OFFICER + CUNNING>35

lore: Quickly repair damaged communication system; call for help.
name: Signal for Rescue
text: Biology + ENGINEER + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>42

lore: Evaluate subspace abnormality for possible transwarp applications.
name: Study Rare Phenomenon
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + Physics + SCIENCE

lore: Chart region of intense plasma activity.
name: Study Badlands (Homefront IV)
text: Navigation x2 + Stellar Cartography x2

lore: Assist with triage of heavy combat casualties.
name: Surgery Under Fire
text: Biology + MEDICAL + OFFICER + STRENGTH>36

lore: Scan uncharted system for inhabited, habitable and resource-rich worlds.
name: Survey Star System (Homefront IV)
text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + SCIENCE

lore: Substantiate reports of information broker working here.
name: Verify Evidence (Homefront IV)
text: Navigation x2 + (CUNNING>24 OR {any tricorder}) + (Leadership x2 OR hand weapon OR Smuggling)

name: Assimilate Homeworld (Homefront IV)
text: Plays on table. Target both a homeworld with no [BO] objective on it and your matching counterpart. Your Borg may scout that homeworld. After scouting complete, if your counterpart is at that location, you may probe: [Com]: Assimilated. Place on mission. Cards of that affiliation (except [AU] cards) may not report to any outpost for rest of game.

lore: Elim Garak forced himself to interrogate Odo in an attempt to regain favor with his father, Enabran Tain.
name: Elim *VP
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Computer Skill x 2 Obsidian Order Random selections here involving only opponent's personnel are instead your choice. DL/ {Interrogation}

lore: Klingon honor and Ferengi greed are not a natural match. To win the heart of Grilka, Quark had to dispel many Klingon prejudices against the Ferengi.
name: Cultural Differences
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Acquisition or Anthropology. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

lore: Julian Bashir found the harvester virus remarkably resistant to most forms of radiation, making the disease difficult to destroy. It only took 375 attempts.
name: Difficult Disposal
text: To get past requires 2 ENGINEER and MEDICAL OR ENGINEER and 2 MEDICAL.

lore: With Kira Nerys' life seemingly in danger from an expanding crystal, Odo tried everything from brute force to harmonic vibrations in an attempt to free his friend.
name: Encased in Crystal
text: To get past requires 2 Geology and SECURITY OR Geology and 2 SECURITY OR 2 Music.

lore: Pheromone-guided assassination device used unsuccessfully against Grand Nagus Quark in 2369. Very difficult to avoid. Can be identified by the telltale sorium and argine traces.
name: Ferengi Locator Bomb
text: Unless Computer Skill, Navigation, and Physics OR Acquisition, Treachery, and CUNNING>32 present, one personnel (random selection) is placed on bottom of draw deck.

lore: With limited resources and outdated technology, the Bajoran resistance had to rely on their instincts rather than navigational sensors to pilot their vessels.
name: Fly by the Seat of your Pants
text: To get past requires 2 Navigation and OFFICER OR Navigation and 2 OFFICER.

lore: Argrathi criminal remediation relies on false memories of imprisonment. After being accused of espionage, Miles O'Brien received a memory of a 20-year incarceration.
name: Hard Time
text: One personnel (random selection) is returned to hand; X = the number of [*] on that personnel. To get past requires at least X personnel remaining.

lore: The Prophets living in the Bajoran wormhole found their existence was disrupted each time a vessel entered the Celestial Temple. The Sisko negotiated for safe passage.
name: More of Your Kind
text: Randomly stops half of your crew (round down). Nullify with any [Orb] personnel.

lore: Jadzia Dax and Arjin had to maneuver carefully while transporting a protouniverse, avoiding any verteron nodes that could destabilize their delicate cargo.
name: Precision Piloting
text: To get past requires Navigation with [Cmd] or [Stf]. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (your choice).

lore: Julian Bashir made sure to meet all of the dabo girls working at Quark's Bar. Jadzia Dax took a perverse pleasure in making sure those meetings were awkward.
name: Socializing with the Staff
text: To get past requires a female. All female personnel are "stopped," but if two are more present, one must continue (random selection).

lore: Pel posed as a male waiter in order to bypass Ferengi commerce laws and earn profit. Rom exposed her secret, jealous that she had usurped his position at Quark's side.
name: Secret Identity
text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is discarded. If you did not seed this dilemma, you may download a personnel of the same affiliation to join crew or Away Team.

lore: The assignment of two chiefs of security aboard Deep Space 9 inevitably muddled the chain of command. Benjamin Sisko reassured Odo that George Primmin was not in charge.
name: Too Many Chiefs
text: One SECURITY-classification personnel (random selection) is "stopped." If that personnel has Leadership, two additional SECURITY personnel are "stopped" (random selection).

lore: The bombing of Garak's tailor shop led Odo and Garak to investigate the whereabouts of Enabran Tain. However, their investigation also caught the eye of the Tal Shiar.
name: Unlikely Pair
text: Choose to "stop" until countdown expires: two personnel not of the same species (your choice) OR two personnel (random selection).

name: The First Stable Wormhole
text: Seeds on table. You may download {Bajoran Wormhole}(s) (even from outside the game). When your ship travels through Bajoran Wormhole, you may discard a card from hand to download {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (even from discard pile). Your [GQ] missions are span -1 for your [DS9] ships. Doubles point boxes of your {File Mission Report} (for [GQ] missions) and {Rescue Personnel} (if Away Team on a [GQ] planet).

lore: After the Cardassian occupation, many Bajorans wished to rid themselves of all alien influence. The Circle's isolationist attitude led to acts of violence against non-Bajorans.
name: Bajor for Bajorans
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Jaro Essa} in play). At the end of each of your turns, if you have no non-[Baj] personnel in play, you may draw an extra card.

lore: Julian Bashir was captured by Dominion operatives at a conference. Like General Martok, he was imprisoned in the Gamma Quadrant and replaced by a changeling.
name: Internment
text: Plays to relocate a captive held by your trap card to your brig (in same quadrant or Alpha Quadrant). OR Plays to download a capturing-related card to hand. Discard event.

lore: The discovery of the Bajoran wormhole created new opportunities for inter-quadrant exploration, commerce, and colonization.
name: New Frontiers
text: Plays to draw two cards. If you have four [DS9] personnel at a mission not in their native quadrant, draw two additional cards. Discard event.

lore: The stimulating Klingon coffee is a staple of Benjamin Sisko's morning routine. He isn't awake until he's had his first cup.
name: Raktajino
text: Plays to make a unique personnel attributes +2 until end of turn OR shuffle the bottom three personnel and/or ships from your discard pile into your draw deck. Discard event.

lore: In 2371, Benjamin Sisko used an ancient Bajoran spacecraft to prove Bajorans were capable of interstellar travel before many other races.
name: Shipwright
text: Plays on table. Your [Baj] ships are RANGE +1. (Cumulative.) OR Lose points to make your ship with Solar Sail RANGE +10 this turn.

name: Alliance for Global Unity
text: Plays on table. Your [Baj] personnel lose Resistance (even if not in play). Once each turn, your [DS9][Baj] personnel with "the Circle" in lore reporting to a compatible facility in the Bajor Region may do so for free. Each time you solve a mission, you may download a [DS9][Baj] card to that mission, {an HQ} card, {Bajoran Civil War}, or {Bajor For Bajorans}. Discard this card if you play or have played a personnel that is not [Baj], [Non], or [Neu].

name: Articles of Jurisprudence
text: Plays on your escorted captive on {Cardassia Prime}; you may discard captive at any time. (Unique.) Each of your [Car] Law personnel add captive's skills. [Car] personnel without Honor are each attributes all +2. OR Plays once each turn to draw a card for each captive you are escorting or have in your brig (limit four).

name: Call for Reinforcements
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may download a [Univ] ship. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may fully repair your ship if you have a matching facility (or compatible {Nor}) in play.

name: Gagh Tek Or?
text: Plays to download {Lursa} and {B'Etor} OR {Yeto} and {T'Kar} OR {Quark Son of Keldar} and {Grilka} OR once per game, download {Klingon Restaurant} and one [DS9] Klingon (may report to that site); when reporting and for rest of game, personnel downloaded with this incident may mix and cooperate with your [DS9] cards regardless of affiliation. Draw no cards this turn. Discard incident.

name: Here by Invitation
text: Plays on table; you may download {Treaty: Federation/Bajoran}. Once each turn, your [DS9][Baj] or [DS9][Fed] personnel with "DS9" or "Deep Space 9" in lore may report (for free) aboard {Deep Space 9} (to an appropriate site) OR to your {U.S.S. Defiant}. Once per game, if your facility commander is at {Commander's Office}, you may download an objective. Nullified if you have {Bajoran Resistance Cell} in play.

name: I Miss This Office
text: Plays on table; if opponent's {Deep Space 9} in play, you may download {Cardassian Outpost} (ignoring ENGINEER requirement). Once each turn, your [DS9][Car] personnel reporting to {Terok Nor} (or, if opponent's Deep Space 9 in play, to your outpost) may do so for free if [Stf] or have "Terok Nor" in lore. If your personnel just commandeered Deep Space 9, you may download {Baseball}.

name: Nano-Biogenic Disarmament
text: Seeds or plays on {T'Lani III}. Your cards with "harvester virus" in lore may report here; once each turn, one such personnel may do so for free if you do not have a facility here. When you solve, you may download and seed a dilemma with "harvester virus" in lore beneath any mission OR discard incident to score points.

name: Labor Camp
text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit} or your non-homeworld planet mission (for free if {Forced-Labor Camp} present). Start of each turn, if your [Car] or [Fer] personnel present is escorting a captive, score 5 points. (Unique.)

name: New Arrivals
text: Seeds on table. Once each turn, you may play a [Univ] personnel you do not already have in play for free. End of each turn, you may draw an extra card. Discard incident if you play more than one personnel for free on any turn.

name: Reshape the Quadrant
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [RC] card. Your Nors, personnel, and ships that have a Star Trek: Deep Space Nine property logo gain [DS9] (even if not in play). Discard incident if you play (or have played) a non-[DS9] personnel or ship.

lore: Set up subspace communication array.
name: Establish Interquadrant Communications
text: ENGINEER + Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + Anthropology

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Facilitate high stakes gaming event.
name: Host Tournament
text: Diplomacy + Honor + Greed x2 [GQ][Non] cards may report on planet.

lore: End centuries of warfare and rescue crash survivors.
name: Pacify Warring Factions
text: (SECURITY x2 OR {Kai Opaka}) + scout ship with 2 ENGINEER aboard

lore: Renegotiate contract in exchange for information.
name: Reopen Trade Discussions
text: Diplomacy + Stellar Cartography + (Acquisition OR CUNNING>35)

lore: Recover scrap from crashed vessel.
name: Salvage Wrecked Ship
text: ENGINEER x2 + Archaeology + Acquisition When you solve, may download {Jem'Hadar Birthing Chamber} here.

lore: Recreate ancient spacefarers' "impossible" journey.
name: Verify Legendary Journey
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + Honor + Stellar Cartography May insert adjacent to Bajor Region OR Cardassia Region.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; Minister; Support Personnel; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Bajoran political aides. Worked with Jaro Essa and, despite her connections to the Circle, later rose to become a minister.
name: Beyor
text: CIVILIAN Law Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Representative of female Bajorans serving in the militia. Dispatched by General Krim to help the Circle secure Deep Space 9.
name: Anneli
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology

lore: Selfless hero held prisoner on Cardassia IV. Bajoran willing to sacrifice himself to rescue Li Nalas. Never gave up hope of returning him to Bajor.
name: Borum
text: MEDICAL Resistance Honor DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser} May exchange for a [Baj] leader in your discard pile.

lore: Typical Bajoran vedek. He collects antique Bajoran mandalas. Tried to acquire one in an auction at Quark's Bar in 2373. Interested in human culture.
name: Dohlem
text: CIVILIAN Youth Anthropology Diplomacy Navigation

lore: Husband and father who lived in the Singha refugee camp in 2346. Married to Kira Meru, who he called the bravest woman he'd ever known.
name: Kira Taban
text: MEDICAL Resistance Biology Honor Physics Scores points if killed.

lore: Planetary geologist in charge of the Jeraddo energy project in 2369. He ordered the forced relocation of the moon's last three residents.
name: Minister Toran
text: ENGINEER Geology x 2 Music

lore: Representative of male Bajorans who became disillusioned with the provisional government and joined the Circle. Helped kidnap Kira Nerys.
name: Murjo
text: ENGINEER Treachery Astrophysics Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Vedek;
lore: Hero of Bajor Kira Nerys posed as a vedek to enter the Chamber of Ministers. Exposed Cardassian connections to the Circle.
name: Vedek Kira
text: OFFICER SECURITY Navigation Archaeology DL/ {Hidden Fighter}

lore: Former vedek who lost his position in 2371 for protesting against peace with the Cardassians. Misinterpreted Trakor's third prophecy.
name: Yarka
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Physics

lore: Comfort woman aboard Terok Nor in 2346. Romantically involved with Dukat. Worked all hours in hope of a better life for her family.
name: Kira Meru
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology Geology DL/ {Comfort Women}

lore: Shipwright Benjamin Sisko built and commanded the Baraka, a replica Bajoran lightship. Human. Recreated a legendary interstellar journey.
name: Ben Sisko
text: ENGINEER Honor Navigation Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship}

lore: Ferengi merchant Quark was deputized by Odo to get information on Kressari weapons movements. Keen participant in the Bajoran gratitude festival.
name: Deputy Quark
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Anthropology Computer Skill SECURITY (if {Odo} in play). DL/ {Renewal Scroll}

lore: Typical Cardassian dissident. Works at the central medical center on Cardassia Prime. She befriended Legate Damar to obtain information on the Dominion.
name: Belva
text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology

lore: Irascible Gul assigned to pursue Tahna Los. Captain of the Aldara. Has mapped Klingon, Romulan, and Starfleet-patrolled space for the Cardassian Union.
name: Danar (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

lore: The Butcher of Gallitep. Gul and labor camp commandant during the occupation of Bajor. Later impersonated by former file clerk Aamin Marritza.
name: Darhe'el
text: ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Exobiology Geology Leadership DL/ {Fajo's Gallery}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
lore: Gul of the Second Order. Abducted by the Maquis from Deep Space 9 in 2370. He easily resisted their interrogation attempts.
name: Dukat (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Navigation ENGINEER Biology Attributes all +2 if opponent's [Maq] card in play.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Capturing-related card; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Impartial changeling. Served on Terok Nor during the occupation of Bajor. An observer by necessity.
name: Investigator Odo
text: SECURITY Anthropology Honor Law x 2 Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
lore: Representative Gul of the Cardassian Guard, Seventh Order. Attacked Deep Space 9 in 2369. Eager to stake a claim in the Gamma Quadrant.
name: Jasad (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Physics Navigation Treachery If in [GQ], [Car] ship he is aboard is attributes all +2.

lore: Representative of senior Cardassian security experts. Advised the Detapa Council. Became a dissident after observing the trial of Miles O'Brien.
name: Tadim
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Honor Music Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical Glinn of the Third Battalion. Psychotropic drug test subject. Revived from stasis on Empok Nor when a Starfleet salvage team arrived in 2373.
name: Jerax
text: SECURITY Biology Geology

lore: Chief Archon. She believes efficient execution of Cardassian jurisprudence makes good viewing and is uplifting for the public.
name: Makbar (Emissary)
text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Treachery x 2 DL/ {Any [Pun] card}

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Irritable Gul posted on Bajor during the occupation. Took leave on Terok Nor in 2346. Staged an incident to help Dukat win the favor of Kira Meru.
name: Oran
text: OFFICER MEDICAL SCIENCE Physics When reported, gains any skill until end of turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Dissident; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Ferengi bartender romantically involved with Natima Lang. Former dissident who illicitly sold discounted food to oppressed Bajorans on Terok Nor.
name: Quark (Emissary)
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Acquisition Anthropology ENGINEER Smuggling DL/ {Natima Lang}

lore: Typical low-level member of the Obsidian Order. Captured during Enabran Tain's attack on the Founder homeworld and held at Internment Camp 371.
name: Rogesh
text: SCIENCE Obsidian Order Physics Navigation Treachery

lore: Young Trill initiate seeking to be joined with a symbiont. Level five pilot who helped his field docent, Jadzia Dax, transport a protouniverse.
name: Arjin
text: SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Youth Physics May report where {Jadzia Dax} is present (for free).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Cook; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Officer who reluctantly took command of Deep Space 9 in 2369. Named Emissary of the Prophets by Kai Opaka. Expert cook. Friend of Cal Hudson.
name: Benjamin Sisko (Emissary)
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Music Honor If in [GQ]: ENGINEER, Diplomacy, Navigation

lore: Son of Benjamin Sisko. Apprenticed under Miles O'Brien. Helped save Deep Space 9 from its counterinsurgency program. Friend of Nog.
name: Jake Sisko (Emissary)
text: ENGINEER Honor Youth Biology DL/ Any ENGINEER-related equipment card

characteristicsKeywords: Benzite; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
lore: Benzite female. One of many runabout pilots stationed on DS9. Transported a survey team to Torga IV in 2373. Was married by Benjamin Sisko.
name: Hoya
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Science officer who reported to Deep Space 9 in 2369. Female Trill joined with the Dax symbiont in 2367. Very different from Curzon.
name: Jadzia Dax (Emissary)
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Navigation If in [GQ]: Geology, Physics, Archaeology, Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Harvester Virus-related card; Male;
lore: Genetically enhanced chief medical officer of DS9. Helped destroy the harvester virus. Once mistook a preganglionic fiber for a postganglionic nerve.
name: Julian Bashir (Emissary)
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Exobiology If in [GQ]: Biology, SCIENCE, X=2

lore: Female Elaysian stellar cartographer. Visited DS9 in 2370. Romantically involved with Julian Bashir, the doctor who helped her walk in standard gravity.
name: Melora Pazlar
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Navigation Astrophysics If in [GQ]: Stellar Cartography, Astrophysics

lore: Human chief of operations. Irish. He formerly served aboard the U.S.S. Rutledge and the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Miles O'Brien (Emissary)
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Miracle Worker If in [GQ]: SECURITY, ENGINEER, Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ {Reaction Control Thrusters}

lore: One of many human astrophysicists aboard Deep Space 9 who studies the Bajoran Wormhole. Stayed with her crew during the siege of 2370.
name: Paulson
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Cook; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Owner and cook at the Klingon restaurant aboard Deep Space 9. Often serenades his customers with Klingon folk songs. Makes excellent rokeg blood pie.
name: Chef Kaga
text: CIVILIAN Biology Exobiology Music DL/ Gagh

lore: Vindictive criminal and Lethean thief who assaulted Julian Bashir while stealing bio-mimetic gel in 2371. He was later arrested by Odo.
name: Altovar (Emissary)
text: MEDICAL Empathy Exobiology Treachery x 2 DL/ {Lethean Telepathic Attack} (as an event, where Altovar present).

lore: Typical female Kellerun technician. Learned all she could about the harvester virus. Eagerly worked to destroy the devastating weapon in 2370.
name: Bhaduri
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Computer Skill Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: T'Lani; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of male T'Lani who worked together with their former Kellerun enemies to destroy the weapon known as the harvester virus.
name: Jakin
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Kellerun; Bodyguard; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
lore: Male Kellerun bodyguard of E'Tyshra and Sharat. Representative of those who intended to eliminate all knowledge of the harvester virus. Crack shot.
name: Javed
text: SECURITY Treachery Exobiology

lore: The hunted species known as Tosk had no identity outside of the hunt. He befriended Miles O'Brien after traveling through the wormhole in 2369.
name: Tosk
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Honor ENGINEER Computer Skill Excluded from random selections.

lore: Lightship built by Ben Sisko in 2371 from ancient Bajoran designs. Has artificial gravity. Unexpectedly traveled beyond Bajor's Denorios Belt.
name: Baraka
text: Solar Sail DL/ {Shipwright}

lore: One of three runabouts delivered to DS9 by the U.S.S. Enterprise. Often commanded by Miles O'Brien. Carried the harvester virus team in 2370.
name: U.S.S. Ganges
text: DL/ {Magnetic North}

lore: Runabout fitted with an advanced sensor module to serve as a scientific scout vessel. Often commanded by Jadzia Dax. Registry number NCC-72905.
name: U.S.S. Orinoco
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard). DL/ {Explore Gamma Quadrant}

lore: Munitions ship originally designed to deploy biological weapons. Used as a laboratory for the obliteration of the harvester virus in 2370.
name: T'Lani Cruiser
text: Tractor Beam

name: Klingon Restaurant
text: Klingons may report here. Once each turn, any cook may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Klingon ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

lore: The Prophets of Bajor live outside of linear time.
name: The Celestial Temple
text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, any player may relocate their unique non-Treachery personnel between here and their ship or facility at the Alpha Quadrant {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any player with an [Orb] personnel here may draw an additional card at the end of each turn unless total WEAPONS>9 at any Bajoran Wormhole. No capturing or battles allowed here.

lore: In 2370, Quark was approached by Sakonna to arrange a covert arms deal to deliver weapons to the Maquis.
name: Arms Deal
text: Unless Acquisition OR Vulcan with Treachery OR Smuggling OR [Maq] personnel present, crew or Away Team "stopped." Discard dilemma.

lore: Jadzia Dax became romantically involved with Meridian native Deral. Dax was so enamored she attempted to follow Deral when Meridian returned to its non-corporeal state.
name: Brief Romance
text: Opponent specifies "male" or "female." Place on one personnel present of that gender (random selection). That personnel is "stopped" until countdown expires.

lore: The throw of the dice is the foundation of chula. Each combination of Wadi symbols determines which challenge next awaits the game's participants.
name: Chula: The Dice
text: To get past requires one personnel with INTEGRITY>6, another with CUNNING>7 and a third with STRENGTH>8.

lore: Valued for their professionalism, Flaxian assassins are often employed by the Tal Shiar. Retaya was sent to eliminate Garak using a combinant poison disguised as perfumes.
name: Flaxian Assassin
text: Unless 2 SECURITY and Biology present, kills one personnel (two if opponent has Tal Shiar in play) with three or more [*] icons (random selection).

lore: Altovar tried to steal biomimetic gel from the Deep Space 9 infirmary. When interrupted by Julian Bashir, he assaulted the doctor telepathically. Such attacks are usually fatal.
name: Lethean Telepathic Attack
text: Unless 2 Empathy present, place on one personnel ({Julian Bashir} if present, otherwise random selection). Personnel is disabled (killed if CUNNING+STRENGTH<16).

lore: Quark's greed led him to critical evidence in a lockbox which ultimately solved a five-year-old murder case.
name: Lockbox
text: Unless Greed present, Away Team "stopped" (discard dilemma). Otherwise, score points if you solve mission this turn.

lore: In 2374, an ill-prepared band of Ferengi arranged a prisoner exchange aboard Empok Nor. Their profound lack of competence made the process even more difficult than they had expected.
name: Oops!
text: Unless Leadership present, kills one personnel (random selection) and "stops" all others present. To get past requires three [Stf] personnel OR three [Def] drones OR {Nog}.

lore: Large spider-like creature inhabiting the Bajoran moons. One-time food source for Resistance fighters. Caused Dax concern, since Trill/symbiont biochemistry cannot tolerate insect bites.
name: Palukoo
text: Unless Resistance OR ANIMAL present, "bites" a non-android present (random selection). If Trill with symbiont, dies now (discard dilemma); otherwise, disabled until countdown expires.

lore: While on a scientific mission to planet L-S VI, Dr. Mora Pol's away team experienced a volcanic disturbance. The quake released noxious gases which cut short their research.
name: Seismic Quake
text: One Away Team member (random selection) is "stopped" if opponent's score is odd, killed otherwise. Cannot get past (shuffle back into seed cards here) unless Geology present.

lore: A shattered comet created a danger to ships and the Bajoran wormhole. The three silithium-laden "vipers" had to be guided through to the other side, fulfilling a Bajoran prophecy.
name: The Three Vipers
text: Ship damaged unless ENGINEER and 2 Navigation present. Even if not damaged, crew "stopped" unless SCIENCE, OFFICER and Astrophysics present. Discard dilemma.

name: Bajoran Wormhole
text: Requires two Bajoran Wormhole cards; each inserts into a spaceline to create a location (span 1). Play one in Alpha Quadrant (Bajor Region); download the other to Gamma Quadrant. Limit one per quadrant. While in play, any ship may move from one end to the other, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

lore: Diligent adherence to landing procedures is crucial to the successful operation of runabouts, shuttles and other small spacecraft.
name: Establish Landing Protocols
text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your ships which has no staffing requirements may use 1 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. (Captain's Order.)

lore: During the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, participants inscribe their troubles on small scrolls. Burning the renewal scrolls in a special brazier symbolically turns their problems to ash.
name: Renewal Scroll
text: Plays if you have three or more Bajorans in play. "Burn" (discard from hand) any number of cards and "renew" (draw) an equal amount, plus two more. Discard event.

lore: In 2369, the Bajoran provisional government applied for Federation membership. That same year, Bajor invited Starfleet to administer the recently acquired space station Terok Nor.
name: Treaty: Federation/Bajoran
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Federation and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: The Bajoran homeworld is Bajor. The Bajorans establish outposts throughout their territory.
name: Bajoran Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Bajoran ENGINEER.

lore: The resistance concealed small spacecraft throughout the Bajor system during the occupation. A decade later, Kira Nerys and Jadzia Dax recovered one from the abandoned Lunar V base.
name: Hidden Fighter
text: Downloads one ship with no staffing requirements to your Away Team on a planet. (You may also download {Establish Landing Protocols} or {Engage Shuttle Operations}.)

lore: Formerly known as Terok Nor. Now a Bajoran trading center and administrative facility run by the Federation.
name: Deep Space 9
text: Seeds during dilemma phase at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is not Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Mining station built in Bajoran system. Operated by Cardassians using Bajorans in forced-labor conditions.
name: Terok Nor (back)
text: Seeds at a {Bajor Region} location. If commandeered by any personnel who is Bajoran or Federation affiliation, flip card over. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Cardassia Prime is the homeworld of the Cardassians. The Cardassian Union establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Cardassian Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Cardassian ENGINEER.

lore: In anticipation of a Cardassian takeover in 2373, Benjamin Sisko sabotaged the Deep Space 9 central computer. The resulting damage hampered Terok Nor for quite some time.
name: Sisko 197 Subroutine
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your Nor's {Ops}. Nor may not be moved or commandeered. Any player may nullify with 4 Computer Skill present. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Miles O'Brien used the polar magnetic field of Parada IV to shield his runabout from the sensors of pursuing ships.
name: Magnetic North
text: Plays on your ship that has no staffing requirements if it is orbiting a planet. Prevents battles from being initiated against that ship. Discard interrupt when ship moves.

lore: The Bajoran Wormhole is the only one known to be stable. One terminus is in the Alpha Quadrant near Bajor; the other, in the Gamma Quadrant near the Idran system.
name: Wormhole Navigation Schematic
text: Allows your ship with SCIENCE and Navigation aboard to travel through {Bajoran Wormhole} without being "stopped." (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {The Three Vipers}.

lore: Study and catalog neutrino discharge from charged plasma field.
name: Characterize Neutrino Emissions
text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + Astrophysics + Physics Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

lore: Attend joint intelligence exchange on this Cardassian world regarding Klingon military movements.
name: Security Briefing
text: SECURITY + Diplomacy x2 + V.I.P. x3 You may play {System 5 Disruptors} for free here.

lore: Investigate possible crash location of Cardassian prisoner transport Ravinok.
name: Search for Survivors
text: OFFICER x2 + Computer Skill x2 + STRENGTH>30 May seed [Univ] [Car] and [Univ] [Baj] personnel under here.

name: Assign Support Personnel
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) Your "support personnel" (those who have exactly two skills, but no special skills) may report aboard your compatible ships that have two or more staffing icons. Once each turn, you may discard objective to download a "support personnel" (once per game per Personnel card title) to your matching ship that has two or more staffing icons, or to your matching facility.

name: Explore Gamma Quadrant
text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, place on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. If ship's crew or Away Team solves a Gamma Quadrant mission, then ship returns and docks at that facility, draw three cards and score points (discard objective).

name: File Mission Report
text: Seeds or plays on table. When one of your personnel has used a classification or skill to meet a mission requirement, and you have not yet attempted another mission, that personnel may "file a mission report" if unopposed at a site which allows this. Score points (discard objective). Limit one per mission.

name: Forced-Labor Camp
text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia IV}, {Ligos VII} or your planet that has Geology or Archaeology as a requirement. Your [Car] and [Fer] personnel may attempt mission. On Cardassia IV or Ligos VII, changes your mission requirements to these: SECURITY + Geology + STRENGTH>(mission points x2) After you solve, while you escort a captive on this planet, you may draw one additional card at end of each turn.

name: HQ: Secure Homeworld
text: Seeds or plays on a homeworld. Your Away Teams which include a personnel who matches homeworld's affiliation may attempt the mission using these requirements: Leadership x2 + SECURITY + (Honor OR Treachery) + any one attribute total > point value of mission When you solve mission, capture all opposing personnel on planet who do not match affiliation of homeworld.

name: Process Ore
text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit}. Start of each turn, if you control this Nor at a planet location and you have a matching ENGINEER or SECURITY personnel unopposed here, you may "process ore." Discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw up to two cards.

name: Rescue Personnel
text: Plays on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. Target your Away Team on a planet which is either in a different quadrant or at a time location. If ship travels there, beams up Away Team and returns to facility, draw one card per personnel "rescued" (up to 5) and score points (discard objective). Limit one such "rescue" per location. (Unique.)

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
lore: Representative of Bajoran engineering apprentices serving on Deep Space 9. Assisted Miles O'Brien with computer "pup" in 2369.
name: Anara
text: ENGINEER Physics Transporter Skill

lore: Vedek. Follows springball religiously. Romantically involved with Kira Nerys. Began spiritual service as a gardener; still enjoys tending the grounds.
name: Bareil Antos
text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Member of Bajoran Militia and the Circle. Participated in DS9 siege of 2370. Deceived General Krim, under orders from Jaro Essa. Tried to kill Benjamin Sisko.
name: Colonel Day
text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Navigation

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; General; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: High-ranking Bajoran Militia leader. Member of the Circle. Took over Deep Space 9 in 2370, but returned the station when informed of Cardassian involvement.
name: General Krim
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Male; Minister; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: Ambitious member of Chamber of Ministers. Leader of Alliance for Global Unity, a.k.a. the Circle. Minister Jaro was allied with Vedek Winn until exposed as a traitor.
name: Jaro Essa
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Greed Treachery x 2 CUNNING +3 if with {Vedek Winn}.

lore: Typical member of the Chamber of Ministers. Has background in the sciences. Led Bajoran delegates in talks with Skrreean refugees.
name: Minister Rozahn
text: V.I.P. Leadership Stellar Cartography SCIENCE

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel; Vedek;
lore: Bajoran Vedek. Typical member of Vedek Assembly. Accompanied Minister Rozahn to Deep Space 9 in 2370 to deny Skrreean request to settle on Bajor.
name: Vedek Sorad
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy MEDICAL

lore: Dissident. Typical member of Cardassian underground. Loyal to Ghemor. Helped Kira Nerys escape Obsidian Order in 2371. Has hopes for a better Cardassia.
name: Ari
text: OFFICER Honor Transporter Skill Computer Skill

lore: Male trained in science and exoarchaeology. Studied the effects of stolen Bajoran Orbs on the Cardassian nervous system. Had an unpleasant Orb experience.
name: Borad
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Archaeology Youth

lore: Cardassian Ministry of Science member. Worked on the 2371 subspace relay project. Mistook Miles O'Brien's irritation with her as a Cardassian mating ritual.
name: Gilora Rejal
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Attributes all +2 if {Miles O'Brien} in play.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Dissident; Male;
lore: Student of Natima Lang. Dissident. Member of Cardassian underground sentenced to death by Central Command. Sought refuge at Deep Space 9.
name: Hogue
text: CIVILIAN Youth SCIENCE Navigation Honor

lore: One of the finest public conservators on Cardassia. Assigned to defend Miles O'Brien. Deeply disturbed when he "won" the case and O'Brien was freed.
name: Kovat
text: CIVILIAN Honor Diplomacy Law Anthropology

lore: Legate. Member of Central Command. Tried to conceal Cardassian effort to supply weapons to Demilitarized Zone colonists in 2370.
name: Parn
text: V.I.P. Treachery Archaeology Diplomacy

lore: Tailor. Merchant. Elim Garak is suspected of being a spy by his friend Julian Bashir. Raises Edosian orchids as a hobby. Haggled with the Sisters of Duras.
name: Plain, Simple Garak
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Acquisition Biology May be replaced by another version at any time.

lore: Young dissident. Forced to flee Cardassia with Natima Lang and Hogue because of her political views. Member of Cardassian underground.
name: Rekelen
text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Geology

lore: Duplicitous female agent. First Vorta to contact the Federation. Posed as an oppressed fugitive in order to win sympathy - and opportunities for espionage.
name: Eris
text: V.I.P. Treachery Diplomacy MEDICAL

lore: Female member of the Dominion. Changeling. Characteristic of the members of the Great Link. Adept at mimicking the solids.
name: Founder
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Exobiology May morph (exchange with your Founder in hand).

lore: Member of the Karemma Commerce Ministry. Helped to defuse a torpedo lodged in the hull of the U.S.S. Defiant. Learned of Ferengi business philosophy from Quark.
name: Hanok
text: V.I.P. Acquisition Diplomacy Smuggling ENGINEER DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

lore: Typical male Dosi. Violent and impatient negotiator. Threatened to kill Quark because of the Ferengi's annoying tenacity.
name: Inglatu
text: CIVILIAN Greed Acquisition MEDICAL Geology

lore: Typical male Karemma official. Broker of tulaberry wine for the Dominion. Well versed in valuable metals. One-time business partner of Quark.
name: Ornithar
text: CIVILIAN Greed SCIENCE Geology

lore: Fifth. Jem'Hadar alpha assigned to Kudak'Etan. Well versed in the Alpha Quadrant anomaly. Once guarded prisoners repairing the commandeered U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Umat'Adan
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography DL/ {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (once per turn).

lore: Representative female member of the Dosi, a physically aggressive merchant race aligned with the Dominion. Tulaberry wine expert.
name: Zyree
text: CIVILIAN Biology Greed Archaeology

lore: Highly valued assistant to Chief O'Brien. Called "Quique" by his friends. Joked that he wants to grow up to be O'Brien - just not as old and grizzled.
name: Enrique Muniz
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Honor Navigation Geology

lore: Gifted terraformer who in 2370 planned to crown his career by reigniting the burned-out star Epsilon 119. Failure - and modesty - do not agree well with him.
name: Gideon Seyetik
text: SCIENCE Each time he helps solve a mission requiring SCIENCE, you may draw a card. Astrophysics Physics x 2

characteristicsKeywords: Klaestron; Capturing-related card; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
lore: Klaestron dignitary. Son of Enina and General Ardelon Tandro. In 2369, used Cardassian technology to gain access to Deep Space 9 in order to kidnap Jadzia Dax.
name: Ilon Tandro
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy ENGINEER Treachery Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

lore: Representative of first officers serving in Starfleet. Assigned to the U.S.S. Odyssey. Courageously fought against the Jem'Hadar in 2370.
name: Jace Michaels
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Physics Honor

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Odyssey. In 2370, ordered to investigate the Jem'Hadar threat and rescue Benjamin Sisko. Knew Jadzia Dax, but not on friendly terms.
name: Keogh
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Physics Geology DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

lore: Lt. Commander Eddington. Security officer assigned to Deep Space 9 because of Starfleet concerns about Odo. Defected to the Maquis.
name: Michael Eddington
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery Honor Computer Skill

lore: Ensign Carson is one of the many talented navigators serving Starfleet. Former member of Nova Squadron. Assigned to bridge duty aboard U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Sarita Carson
text: SECURITY Navigation SCIENCE

lore: Aggressive Ferengi opportunist. Diplomatically, but insistently, threatened Quark with a protection racket while Quark was briefly serving as the Grand Nagus.
name: Gral
text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Acquisition Diplomacy SECURITY DL/ {Protection Racket}

lore: Aging financial and political leader of the Ferengi Alliance. Romantically - and secretly - involved with Ishka. Admits he's not as greedy as he used to be.
name: Grand Nagus Zek
text: V.I.P. Acquisition Greed Leadership Law Diplomacy DL/ {HQ: Ferengi Credit Exchange}

lore: Hupyrian servant. Grand Nagus Zek's bodyguard, pilot, and handkerchief valet. Took a vow to speak only to his master. As loyal as he is silent.
name: Maihar'du
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 DL/ {Bodyguards} OR {Security Sacrifice} Exobiology DL/ {Scepter of the Grand Nagus}

lore: Typical Ferengi entrepreneur. Took over the Arcybite gouge-mining refineries in the Clarius system. Plans to introduce synthehol to the Gamma Quadrant.
name: Nava
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Geology SCIENCE Anthropology

lore: Waiter. Female. Used synthetic lobes to appear male. Wore clothes and sought profit in violation of Ferengi law. Romantically involved with Quark - briefly.
name: Pel
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Biology May avoid selections that target males or females.

lore: Klingon mercenary used by Verad. Helped capture Jadzia in an attempt to steal the Dax symbiont.
name: T'Kar
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Treachery

lore: Particularly brusque Klingon who aided Verad's takeover of Deep Space 9 in 2370. Immobilized Odo in a containment device.
name: Yeto
text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography Transporter Skill

lore: Maquis terrorist. Cal Hudson's co-pilot. Helped abduct Gul Dukat, blaming him for supplying illegal weapons to Cardassians in the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Amaros
text: ENGINEER Navigation Physics

characteristicsKeywords: T'Lani; Ambassador; Female; Harvester Virus-related card;
lore: Female T'Lani ambassador. Worked with Sharat to end war with the Kellerun. Schemed to eliminate everyone with knowledge of the harvester virus.
name: E'Tyshra
text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Leadership Treachery

lore: Longtime Maquis member. Helped Thomas Riker commandeer the U.S.S. Defiant. Helped Ro Laren steal medical supplies from the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Kalita
text: OFFICER Anthropology Computer Skill Navigation

lore: Female Vulcan. Gunrunner. Bought weapons from Quark in 2370. Helped the Maquis abduct Gul Dukat, but failed to establish a forced mindmeld with him.
name: Sakonna
text: ENGINEER Treachery Mindmeld Physics Acquisition

characteristicsKeywords: Kellerun; Ambassador; Harvester Virus-related card; Male;
lore: Kellerun ambassador. Helped negotiate cease fire with the T'Lani. Worked on project to eliminate harvester virus and associated technology in 2370.
name: Sharat
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Exobiology Treachery Computer Skill

lore: Female Kobliad security officer. Representative of law enforcement agents found on non-aligned worlds. Pursued the criminal Rao Vantika for 20 years.
name: Ty Kajada
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership

lore: Mainstay of the Bajoran Militia. During the 2370 coup attempt by the Circle, assault vessels commanded by General Krim and Colonel Day invaded Deep Space 9.
name: Assault Vessel
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Military spacecraft used by the Cardassian Union. The Type-3 Galor-class warship is the backbone of the Cardassian fleet.
name: Galor
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Common patrol vessel of the Cardassian Union. Uses the same hull as the Cardassian shuttlecraft, but boasts a much higher performance profile.
name: Patrol Ship
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: The Karemma conduct trade operations for the Dominion. Their vessels can be found throughout the Gamma Quadrant. Hanok commanded one.
name: Karemman Vessel
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Class of runabout often named for Terran rivers. First commissioned in 2368. The following year, the U.S.S. Enterprise delivered three Danube-class vessels to DS9.
name: U.S.S. Danube
text: Reports for free to {Docking Pads}.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: NX-74205. Built to battle Borg. Recommissioned to oppose the Dominion. First ship to test ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Defiant
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

name: Bajoran Shrine
requires: disruptor; Kai; Orb artifact; Prylar; Vedek;
text: Prylars, Vedeks, and Kais may report here. Once each turn, any player who has a Prylar, Vedek, or Kai unopposed here with any other Bajoran may "conduct services": discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw one card (or two if any Orb artifact is present). Unless station is under [Baj] or [Fed] control, Shrine is suspended and may be destroyed by any personnel using {a disruptor} at an adjacent site. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Reshape the Quadrant *VP
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [RC] card. Your Nors, personnel, and ships that have a Star Trek: Deep Space Nine property logo gain [DS9] (even if not in play). Discard incident if you play (or have played) a non-[DS9] personnel or ship.

name: Cargo Bay
text: Smuggling, Acquisition, and [Non] Navigation personnel may report here (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Once each turn, if a freighter, transport, or [Fer] ship's crew member completes a "cargo run" (brings a non-weapon Equipment card here from another facility), for each mission passed (except starting and ending locations) owner may draw a card or download a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here. (Once per game per Equipment card title.) Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Commander's Office
text: Once each turn, any player who has a matching [Cmd] OFFICER unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, download to hand one Captain's Order card. Matching OFFICER personnel may {file mission report}s here. This site is always the "innermost" site of any Nor (may not separate {Ops} from any other site). Any Nor: Ops Module

name: Docking Pads
text: Any ship with no staffing requirements may report, dock (land) and undock (take off) here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Player controlling station may, once per game, download {Establish Landing Protocols}. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Habitat Ring

name: Docking Ports
text: Any ship with fewer than three staffing icons may report, dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Freighters and transports report for free here. Capacity: 9 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Docking Pylons
text: Any ship with fewer than five staffing icons may dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Ships may not report here but may repair here. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Garak's Tailor Shop
text: Obsidian Order personnel may report here (for free if {any Garak}). Once each turn, any player who has a personnel unopposed here who has both Obsidian Order and Treachery may glance at top card of opponent's draw deck. Also, any player who doesn't control station but has Obsidian Order unopposed here may report Cardassian personnel and Cardassian-compatible Equipment cards here. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Holosuite
text: This site must be placed adjacent to {Quark's Bar} (or another Holosuite). Has a Holodeck. {Holoprogram} cards may be played here (limit one; station controller may discard it during their turn). [Holo] Equipment cards and compatible [Holo] personnel may report here, and may be transferred directly to/from owner's ship docked at this station. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Infirmary
text: Compatible MEDICAL-classification personnel, MEDICAL-related Equipment cards and {I.P. Scanner} may report here. Once each turn, any MEDICAL personnel unopposed here may "revive" a personnel present who was disabled by a {Hypospray} (revived personnel is no longer disabled). Matching MEDICAL personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Promenade

name: Guest Quarters
text: If unoccupied, any non-Borg V.I.P. may report here regardless of affiliation. Once each turn, any player who has a V.I.P. unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, draw two cards and place one of them beneath draw deck. (Not cumulative.) Any Nor: Habitat Ring

name: Ops
text: Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any Nor: Ops Module

name: Ops: Mirror Universe
text: Cards with same [KCA] or [TE] icon as this Nor are considered to match its affiliation for purposes related to its sites. Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any [MQ] Nor: Ops Module

name: Ore Processing Unit
text: Compatible ENGINEER-classification personnel and ENGINEER-related Equipment cards may report here. If {Automated Security System} on {Ops} at this station, personnel may not move to here from an adjacent site, or vice versa. This unit does not {process ore} when station is under Federation or Bajoran control. Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Promenade Shops
text: Non-Borg CIVILIAN personnel may report here regardless of affiliation. Any player who has a non-Borg personnel present may probe: [Event], [Interrupt], [Equipment]: Shopping. Draw probe card. [Objective], [Car], [Kli]: Brawl. Must immediately initiate a personnel battle (if opposed by non-Borg at this site). Any Nor: Promenade

name: Quark's Bar
requires: Bartender; Dabo Girl; Ferengi; Ferengi ship; Waiter;
text: {Morn} and Ferengi may report here. Once each turn, a bartender, a dabo girl, a waiter, {any Quark} or {any Rom} may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Any player who has Morn unopposed here may draw an additional card at end of each turn. Any player who kills any waiters or dabo girls here in battle must discard two cards for each. Ferengi ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

name: Science Lab
text: Compatible SCIENCE-classification personnel, SCIENCE-related Equipment cards, {I.P. Scanner} and {PADD}s may report here. Once each turn, if station at a [S] mission and player who controls station has a SCIENCE personnel unopposed here, that player may scan bottom seed card under the mission. Matching SCIENCE personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Docking Ring

name: Security Holding Cell
text: Has a Brig. Once each turn, player who controls station may download {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive held in this Brig if that player has a Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 personnel (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) unopposed here. Any Nor: Promenade

name: Security Office
text: Compatible SECURITY-classification personnel and hand weapons may report here. Whenever a personnel battle was just initiated on this station, any player's personnel here, if one has SECURITY, may move there (if possible) and join the battle. Matching SECURITY personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Promenade

lore: Shipwright Benjamin Sisko built and commanded the Baraka, a replica Bajoran lightship. Human. Recreated a legendary interstellar journey.
name: Ben Sisko*
text: ENGINEER Honor Navigation Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship}

lore: Ferengi merchant Quark was deputized by Odo to get information on Kressari weapons movements. Keen participant in the Bajoran gratitude festival.
name: Deputy Quark*
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Anthropology Computer Skill SECURITY (if {Odo} in play). DL/ {Renewal Scroll}
