lore: Comfort woman aboard Terok Nor in 2346. Romantically involved with Dukat. Worked all hours in hope of a better life for her family.
name: Kira Meru*
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology Geology DL/ {Comfort Women}

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Dissident; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Ferengi bartender romantically involved with Natima Lang. Former dissident who illicitly sold discounted food to oppressed Bajorans on Terok Nor.
name: Quark (Emissary)*
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Acquisition Anthropology ENGINEER Smuggling DL/ {Natima Lang}

lore: Although a thorough analysis of a DNA sample can be a time-consuming endeavor, it can also provide information crucial to identifying criminal suspects.
name: DNA Clues *VP
text: Place on mission. Further dilemmas requiring any MEDICAL here require 2 more if you continue OR 2 less if crew or Away Team has Exobiology and "stops" now to investigate.

lore: Although some creatures have intricate greeting rituals, others will defend themselves violently at the first sign of danger.
name: Gomtuu Shock Wave *VP
text: Unless 2 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>32 OR Empathy and INTEGRITY>35 present, all undocked ships at this location are damaged and relocated one location toward far end of spaceline.

lore: Silicon-based life-form native to Janus VI. Every 50,000 years, all Horta die off except one, which must repopulate the species through egg laying. Will kill to protect its young.
name: Horta *VP
text: Place on planet. Now and end of every player's turn, kills one of that player's personnel present (random selection). Cure with 2 Leadership, 2 Mindmeld, and 2 Exobiology.

lore: Benjamin Sisko was forced to abandon Deep Space 9 to spare Bajor from the Dominion's wrath. He left his prized baseball behind as a message to Gul Dukat that he would return.
name: Baseball *VP
text: Plays to score points if you just commandeered opponent's facility. Lose points if opponent regains control.

lore: Hide from pursuing Borg cube in dense, hazardous nebula.
name: Evade Borg Vessel *VP
text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation + Leadership + CUNNING>36 Only one of your ships may battle here every turn.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling security chief of Deep Space 9. Not very good at pretense. Always investigates Quark.
name: Odo *VP
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 Law Once per turn, may "stop" {any Quark} present.

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Gul. Ex-prefect of Bajor. Commander of the Prakesh. Father of Ziyal. Cardassian Union liaison with Dominion. Desires to regain command of Terok Nor.
name: Dukat *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill

lore: Janice Rand is yeoman to Captain Kirk aboard the Enterprise. Captain of the Academy Diving Team in 2264-65. Student of horticulture and xenobotany.
name: Yeoman Rand *VP
text: OFFICER Youth Biology ENGINEER DL/ {File Mission Report} [OS] personnel may file mission reports aboard her ship.

lore: Faced Kirk at Beta XII-A. Swore blood oath against the Albino with Kor, Koloth, and Curzon Dax to avenge the death of his firstborn son.
name: Kang *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor SECURITY Physics DL/ {Blood Oath}

lore: The Continuing Committee The Star Trek CCG Community lives on at www.trekcc.org
name: New Frontiers *VP
text: Plays to draw two cards. If you have four [DS9] personnel at a mission not in their native quadrant, draw two additional cards. Discard event.

lore: In the interest of security, Klingon Chancellor Azetbur and the Federation president agreed to share the location of the forthcoming peace conference with only their most trusted aides.
name: Executive Authorization *VP
requires: Chairman; Chancellor; Counterpart; Founder; General; Governor; High Council Leader; Intendant; Kai; Legate; Minister; Nagus; President; Proconsul; Queen;
text: To get past requires a President, High Council Leader, General, Legate, Chancellor, Proconsul, Chairman, Intendant, Minister, Kai, Founder, Nagus, Governor, Queen, counterpart, or {PADD}.

lore: Evil Soong-type android. Data's "elder brother."
name: Lore *VP
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Computer Skill Treachery x 2 SECURITY Transporter Skill Leadership Doubles all {Rogue Borg} and {Crystalline Entities} in play.

lore: Vulcan security chief of U.S.S. Voyager. Janeway's tactical officer and confidant for many years. Former instructor at Starfleet Academy. Breeds prize orchids.
name: Tuvok *VP
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Mindmeld Biology Music Law

name: Contain Boarding Parties
text: Seeds or plays on {Deep Space 9}; you may download {Sisko 197 Subroutine}. Twice per game, when opponent voluntarily initiates battle aboard, you may download up to six [DS9] personnel (each must be [Fed] or [Baj]), and/or one hand weapon to sites aboard where those cards may report. Does not count down during the first turn of the game.

name: Trust the Prophets
text: Seeds on table; you may download {The Celestial Temple}. The Celestial Temple ignores WEAPONS of {Deep Space 9} (and any ships docked there). Compatible [DS9] [Fed] (except [OS]) cards are considered to match Deep Space 9's affiliation for purposes related to its sites.

name: We Need You Here
text: Seeds or plays on {Commander's Office}. If your {Reshape the Quadrant} is in play, you may ignore restrictions of site(s) on this station which instruct you to "draw no cards that turn." Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download a site to this station. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Representative transporter officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. He held the rank of ensign in the early years of the flagship's mission.
name: Herbert
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Biology Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; Teacher; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Typical scientist and teacher in the U.S.S. Enterprise's primary school. She expressed concern to Data about Lal's ability to fit in.
name: Lieutenant Ballard
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Physics

lore: Respected mediator. Deaf and mute Ramatin male. Taught sign language to warring factions on Solais V. Gave the Klingons a word for "peacemaker."
name: Riva (Warp Pack: Emissary)
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Honor When reported, each player draws a card.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: The U.S.S. Defiant was commandeered by the Maquis in 2371 to attack Cardassian forces.
name: Stolen Defiant *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 vs. [Car].

lore: To avoid escalating violence between Cardassian and Federation settlers, Cardassian Central Command blamed Gul Dukat for supplying weapons to the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Scapegoat
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with V.I.P. or Anthropology. To get past requires INTEGRITY>24 remaining.

lore: The unexpected arrival of a Klingon fleet to defend DS9 against the changeling threat led to issues with docking schedules, shore leave, and unauthorized "inspections."
name: Unscheduled "Assistance"
text: Opponent chooses two locations. To get past requires CUNNING>X, where X=15 times the number of your ships at those locations.

name: Not So Demilitarized
text: Plays on table; you may download {They Call Themselves the Maquis}. Once each turn, while all your facilities are [Maq], one [DS9][Maq] personnel may report for free OR you may download {For the Cause} to your Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region mission. You may not play {Espionage} cards.

name: They Call Themselves the Maquis
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [Maq] cards may mix and, if ever attacked, have no affiliation attack restrictions. Your [Maq] ships are immune to {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Your equipment, [Maq] personnel, and [Maq] ships may report to your {Liberty} or to a Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region [P] mission; once each turn, one such unique personnel may do so for free.

lore: Starfleet's attach to the Federation's Demilitarized Zone colonies. Friend of Benjamin Sisko. Widower who found new purpose as leader of a Maquis cell.
name: Cal Hudson
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Treachery Law Smuggling

lore: One of many Klingons seeking glory outside the Klingon Empire. She sympathized with the grievances of the Maquis.
name: M'Vil
text: MEDICAL Archaeology Stellar Cartography Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: The U.S.S. Defiant was commandeered by the Maquis in 2371 to attack Cardassian forces.
name: Stolen Defiant
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 vs. [Car].

lore: Brothers Krit and Nahsk were Morn's co-conspirators in the Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Their run-in with Quark could have been much less pleasant.
name: A Pleasant Surprise
text: To get past, "stop" a personnel with CUNNING>6 and either Diplomacy or Treachery (random selection).

lore: Keevan ensured his own survival by betraying Remata'Klan and his fellow Jem'Hadar, sending them into a deadly trap.
name: Deliberate Tactical Error
text: Half of all [Univ] personnel in Away Team (random selection, round down) are killed (erased if [Holo]). To get past requires two leaders OR two [Cmd] OR two [Def].

lore: Saltah'na energy spheres caused the crew of DS9 to play out an ancient power struggle: scheming, maneuvering, and plotting to eliminate their former friends.
name: Dramatis Personae
text: "Stops" all personnel in crew or Away Team named in lore by another personnel present. Discard dilemma.

lore: As hard to catch as a Norpin falcon, crafty and cunning Maquis leader Michael Eddington was able to stay one step ahead of the dogged pursuit of his former commanding officer.
name: Maquis Vendetta
text: To get past, "stop" a Leadership personnel (random selection). If that personnel has OFFICER or SECURITY, randomly select two additional personnel to be "stopped."

lore: After years of conflict and military aggression, colonists near the Cardassian-Federation border often doubted the sincerity of Cardassian negotiators.
name: Protestations of Innocence
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>28 (INTEGRITY>42 if you initiated battle this game; INTEGRITY>63 if you voluntarily initiated battle).

lore: While playing to maintain his darts winning streak at Quark's, Miles O'Brien aggravated an old kayaking injury, necessitating shoulder surgery and forfeiting his darts game.
name: Recurring Injury
text: To get past, one personnel with Biology OR MEDICAL (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 2 Biology OR 3 MEDICAL.

lore: To resist her Maquis captors, Kira Nerys blew out two plasma conduits, forcing the U.S.S. Defiant to seek refuge in a nebula until the cloaking device could be repaired.
name: Sabotaged Plasma Conduit
text: To get past requires 2 Computer Skill and Physics OR Computer Skill and 2 Physics.

lore: Many colonists living in the Demilitarized Zone refused to abandon the worlds they had made their homes, despite pressure from the Federation and Cardassian governments.
name: Determined to Stay
text: Plays on your unattempted Demilitarized Zone Region mission. When your [Maq] personnel solve, if no opposing ship is at this mission, you may draw up to five cards.

lore: In 2370, the Maquis blew up the Cardassian freighter Bok'Nor to prevent the transportation of additional weapons to Cardassian colonists in the Demilitarized Zone.
name: Organized Terrorist Activities
text: Plays if you have eight [DS9][Maq] personnel in play. Damage an undamaged ship in (or adjacent to) a region (once per game per Ship card title). Discard event.

name: Bleed Resources
text: Plays on your [Maq], [TNG][Rom], or [DS9][Car] personnel. When this personnel helps solve a mission, you may choose one: Examine opponent's hand and choose two of those cards to be discarded OR Opponent places three cards (random selection) from hand on top of his or her draw deck OR Opponent discards the top four cards of his or her draw deck.

name: Defending Their Homes
text: Plays on table; you may download {They Call Themselves the Maquis}. Once each turn, one [TNG][Maq] personnel may report for free OR you may download {For the Cause} to your Demilitarized Zone Region mission. Discard if you have {a Treaty} in play.

name: Learning Curve
text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, if you played two or more [Maq] personnel this turn, you may place two cards from the top of your draw deck face down on this incident. You may play [Maq] cards from this incident as though they were in your hand. At any time, you may place this card and each card atop it beneath your draw deck to draw that many cards. (Unique.)

name: Used to Being Outnumbered
requires: Badlands Region; Condor Class; Demilitarized Zone Region;
text: Seeds or plays on table. Condor-class ships may be used by [Baj] or [Fed]. In the Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Regions, opponent's ATTACK total must be more than double your Condor-class ship's DEFENSE total to score a hit, and more than triple to score a direct hit. While your Condor-class ship is moving within a region, it is RANGE +2.

name: You Could Be Invaluable
text: Seeds or plays on table. At the start of a mission attempt involving only your [DS9][Maq] personnel, you may reveal the top card of opponent's draw deck. If it is a personnel neither player has in play, opponent reports them to your attempting crew or Away Team (under your control; they gain [Maq]). Return personnel to opponent's hand (if still in play) at end of mission attempt. (Unique.)

lore: Ro Laren was able to maintain Jean-Luc Picard's confidence in her loyalty just long enough to conceal her defection to the Maquis and help her new allies evade Starfleet's trap.
name: Stalling for Time
text: Plays once each turn on any location if you have three [TNG][Maq] personnel in play. Opponent chooses one of their personnel here to return to hand.

characteristicsKeywords: Asymmetric mission; Badlands Region; Capturing-related card;
lore: Interrogate captured officer at secret base.
name: Break Prisoner
text: SECURITY x2 + Treachery x2 + Biology + CUNNING>30 *+10 if your escorted captive here. Opponent's side: No gametext. Points: [35]

lore: Distract adversary to allow equipment theft.
name: Divert Attention
text: Navigation x2 + Leadership + Treachery + CUNNING>36 Span -2 for [Maq] ships.

lore: Reveal military construction at unsanctioned facility.
name: Expose Secret Buildup
text: Computer Skill + Leadership + Physics + SECURITY + (any Intelligence x2 OR CUNNING>37)

lore: Broker sale of biogenic storage containers.
name: Supply Terrorists
text: Diplomacy + SECURITY + Acquisition + CUNNING>36

name: For the Cause
text: Plays on your Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region mission. Your [Maq] personnel may attempt this mission and may replace all levels of one requirement with: Leadership + SECURITY + CUNNING>30

name: The Only Way Home
text: Seeds on table. When your [Maq] personnel solve a [DQ][P] mission, relocate your [Maq] personnel to your [Maq] ship there, then relocate ship to any Alpha Quadrant mission. For the rest of the game, your [Non][DQ] personnel are attributes all +2 and may report to your [Maq] ships.

lore: Maquis sympathizer and Bajoran officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Found a new father figure in Macias. Betrayed Jean-Luc Picard's trust in her.
name: Ro Laren (The Maquis)
text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Bleed Resources}

lore: Maquis sympathizer and Bajoran officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Found a new father figure in Macias. Betrayed Jean-Luc Picard's trust in her.
name: Ro Laren (The Maquis)*
text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Bleed Resources}

lore: Apoplectic Bajoran haunted by the screams of Crell Moset's victims. Chakotay helped him focus his rage. Skilled holoprogrammer. Friend of Jor.
name: Tabor (The Maquis)
text: ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE Computer Skill X=3 if six or more personnel in your discard pile.

lore: Apoplectic Bajoran haunted by the screams of Crell Moset's victims. Chakotay helped him focus his rage. Skilled holoprogrammer. Friend of Jor.
name: Tabor (The Maquis)*
text: ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE Computer Skill X=3 if six or more personnel in your discard pile.

lore: Captain dispatched to apprehend Michael Eddington. Asked Benjamin Sisko to save him a seat at Eddington's court-martial. Calls San Francisco home.
name: George Sanders
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Honor Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Maq].

lore: Pilot and security officer typical of those who secretly support the Maquis. Captured Gul Dukat on Deep Space 9 on Cal Hudson's orders. Drinks lattes.
name: Niles
text: SECURITY Navigation Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: Technician and former petty officer aboard the U.S.S. Gandhi. Recruited into the Maquis by Thomas Riker. Enjoys studying early Earth warp technology.
name: Tamal
text: ENGINEER Anthropology SCIENCE Geology

lore: Defiant leader and starship thief. Posed as William T. Riker. Commanded the Stolen Defiant on raids in Cardassian space. Resents his transporter double.
name: Thomas Riker (The Maquis)
text: OFFICER Geology Leadership SECURITY Treachery Music DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: "Starfleet observer" who helped U.S.S. Voyager track his former Maquis comrades in the Badlands. Talented pilot. Has a mercenary spirit.
name: Tom Paris (The Maquis)
text: SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Geology Biology Draw a card if stopped by an opponent's dilemma.

lore: Undercover Vulcan who infiltrated Chakotay's Maquis cell. Former archery teacher at the Vulcan Institute for Defensive Arts. Has three sons and a daughter.
name: Tuvok (The Maquis)
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation OFFICER Mindmeld DL/ {Learning Curve}

lore: Maquis saboteur William Patrick Samuels was a farmer from Volan II. Covertly planted a protomatter implosion device aboard the Bok'Nor.
name: Bill Samuels
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery DL/ {Organized Terrorist Activities}

lore: Male Bolian engineer. Helped smuggle goods to the Maquis. First officer who often commanded the freighter S.S. Xhosa in Kasidy Yates' absence.
name: Brathaw
text: ENGINEER Acquisition Astrophysics Computer Skill Smuggling

lore: Typical pilot in Macias' Maquis cell. Suspicious of everyone at first, but impressed by Ro Laren during a supply raid. Later worked with Thomas Riker.
name: Kalita (The Maquis)
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Biology Navigation

lore: Conflicted captain romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko. Served prison time for transporting medical supplies to the Maquis.
name: Kasidy Yates (The Maquis)
text: ENGINEER Leadership Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill Each other [Maq] personnel present is STRENGTH +2.

lore: Representative of female colonists living on Volan III in 2370. Skilled administrator and colonial leader. Unlucky in love.
name: Kobb
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Law Leadership

lore: One of many Klingons seeking glory outside the Klingon Empire. She sympathized with the grievances of the Maquis.
name: M'Vil*
text: MEDICAL Archaeology Stellar Cartography Biology

lore: Grizzled leader of a Maquis cell. Former resident of Juhraya. Trusted Ro Laren despite Kalita's caution. Knows someone will take his place. Likes hasperat.
name: Macias
text: CIVILIAN Leadership MEDICAL Exobiology May exchange for a [Maq] personnel in your discard pile.

lore: Intriguing Ferengi eager to please Sakonna. Became a temporary arms dealer to the Maquis.
name: Quark (The Maquis)
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Computer Skill If present with [Maq] Treachery, gains SECURITY, Computer Skill, Smuggling, and Biology.

lore: Intriguing Ferengi eager to please Sakonna. Became a temporary arms dealer to the Maquis.
name: Quark (The Maquis)*
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Computer Skill If present with [Maq] Treachery, gains SECURITY, Computer Skill, Smuggling, and Biology.

lore: Resistance fighter. One of the few Maquis to survive Jem'Hadar attacks in 2373. Wife of Michael Eddington. Bluffed about a cloaked missile strike.
name: Rebecca Sullivan
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor Music Astrophysics Geology

lore: Demilitarized Zone colonist typical of those who joined the Maquis. Enjoys fishing. Believes his family has bad luck.
name: Reide
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Exobiology Physics

lore: Freedom fighter who kidnapped and then recruited Ro Laren into the Maquis. Led his squadron in an attack on a Yridian convoy. Friend of Macias.
name: Santos
text: CIVILIAN Leadership MEDICAL Navigation Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: One of many colonists living on Volan III in the Demilitarized Zone. Bolian member of Cal Hudson's Maquis cell. He helped plan Dukat's kidnapping.
name: Sark
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Transporter Skill

lore: Maquis soldier always prepared to defend against Cardassian attacks. Assigned by Amaros to stand guard over Dukat after the Gul's abduction.
name: Shankar
text: OFFICER Archaeology Biology Geology Treachery DL/ Any phaser or disruptor

lore: Commanded by Ro Laren under the watchful eye of Kalita. Participated in the theft of medical supplies from the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
name: Cosette
text: Attributes all +2 in Demilitarized Zone Region.

lore: Maquis raider commanded by Michael Eddington in retaliatory strikes against Cardassian colonies. Uses many components salvaged from ambushed ships.
name: Guingouin
text: Once each turn, may land or take off using 1 RANGE.

lore: Versatile class of ship designed early in the 24th century by the Federation. Crew complement can vary widely.
name: Maquis Raider
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

lore: Independent freighter commanded by Kasidy Yates. Operated under contract for Bajor's Ministry of Commerce in 2372. Smuggled Maquis supplies.
name: S.S. Xhosa
text: Tractor Beam

lore: 30-year old vessel commanded by Captain Chakotay. Like many Maquis ships, has borne many names. Also known as the Liberty.
name: Val Jean
text: Attributes all +2 in Badlands Region.

name: Close Quarters Combat
requires: Badlands Region; Condor Class; Demilitarized Zone Region;
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a Condor-class ship firing in Demilitarized Zone or Badlands Region. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip] Hull: -20% Airlock Malfunction: until end of your next full turn, no free reporting aboard.

name: Female's Love Interest & Garbage Scow *VP
text: FEMALE'S LOVE INTEREST: Female crew or Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. RADIOACTIVE GARBAGE SCOW: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

lore: The Parallax Poet's cosmic lesson for Alexander was, "Every moment requires a purpose. Every purpose requires a plan. The Higher... The Fewer."
name: The Higher... The Fewer *VP
text: Subtract X from your total score, where X=the number of personnel in this crew or Away Team.

lore: With a salt-draining entity loose aboard his ship, Captain Kirk placed the Starship Enterprise on security condition three, ordering off-duty crew to stay in their quarters for safety.
name: General Quarters *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. May not leave play. All players may only download personnel into play once every turn.

name: Bluegill Infestation *VP
text: Seeds on table; place up to seven unique personnel face up beneath here from outside the game. Your copies of those personnel in play are STRENGTH +5, considered Bluegills, and may not be stunned. Also, when one of your Bluegills is killed, you must randomly select a personnel from here; if it matches one who was killed, that personnel was considered to be the Bluegill Queen. (Unique.)

lore: Vorta in charge of Internment Camp 371. Responsible for training and equipping Jem'Hadar troops. Accepts nothing less than perfect obedience.
name: Deyos *VP
text: SECURITY May draw a card for each non-Youth Jem'Hadar that enters play here. Treachery x 2 Archaeology

lore: Dedicated member of the Pathfinder Project. Established a means for Voyager to regularly communicate with Earth from tens of thousands of light-years away.
name: Reginald Barclay (The Borg) *VP
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Honor Delta Quadrant [FED] missions you solve are +5 points.

lore: "Moogie" to Quark and Rom. Financial genius. Wears clothes. Earns profit. Secretly helps Zek run his empire.
name: Ishka *VP
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Computer Skill Honor Music Your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} may report here, for free. While {Grand Nagus Zek} is here, doubles his skills.

lore: Lursa and B'Etor, like their father before them, collaborated with the Romulan Star Empire.
name: Sisters of Duras *VP
text: V.I.P.+V.I.P. Lursa: Treachery Leadership Geology Greed B'Etor: Treachery Physics Youth Greed

lore: Vice-Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Secretary of the War Plans Council. Key Romulan senator for over 14 years. Negotiated the non-aggression pact with the Dominion.
name: Senator Vreenak *VP
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Tal Shiar x 2 Anthropology Leadership Law DL/ Any Romulan treaty

lore: Highly logical starship Enterprise first officer. First Vulcan in Starfleet. Suppresses his human half. Fascinating.
name: Mr. Spock *VP
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Computer Skill Exobiology Music OFFICER Mindmeld x 2 DL/ {Vulcan Nerve Pinch} If with {Captain Kirk}, both are attributes all +2.

name: Quantum Incursions
text: Seeds like a [S/P] dilemma. QR Code

lore: In 2372, the Terran Rebellion kidnapped Jake Sisko from Deep Space 9, knowing that Benjamin Sisko would promptly pursue his son to the mirror universe.
name: Crossover: An Invitation
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your personnel native to the Alpha Quadrant may report (but not download) as if they were [MQ].

lore: A factionalized society, Kazon sects rely on the strong and dominant leadership of their Maje. Weakness is never tolerated.
name: Leader of the Sect
text: Seeds on your [Kaz] facility. At the start of any player's turn, if you do not have a Maje in play, you may download a Maje here.

lore: Federation starbase commanded by Fleet Admiral Shanthi in 2370, where she conducted an inquiry into the Pegasus affair.
name: Starbase 247
text: Seeds at any [FED] [S] mission. DL/ {You Know I'd Like to Help} OR {Spacedock}

name: Holoprogram: Cafe des Artistes
text: Seeds or plays on your ship or facility with a Holodeck. Thrice per turn, you may stop your couple present to draw a card. Once per game, you may download a romantic partner of your personnel present, then discard incident. (Unique.)

lore: Analyze anomaly in politically delicate location.
name: Investigate Anti-Time Eruption
text: ENGINEER x3 + Leadership x3 + Astrophysics x3 + Physics x3

lore: Jem'Hadar Sixth representative of soldiers stationed aboard Terok Nor during the Dominion occupation of 2374. Struggled to decipher Cardassian egotism.
name: Rak'tazan
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics

lore: Matt Decker commanded the Starship Constellation. Vowed revenge on the machine that killed his crew. Father of Willard Decker. Dislikes practical jokes.
name: Commodore Decker
text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology ENGINEER SECURITY

lore: Trill serving on the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Operations officer during the battle with Son'a warships in the Briar Patch in 2375. Not joined with a symbiont.
name: Kell Perim
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Navigation SCIENCE While on your ship, it is RANGE +1 in the Briar Patch Region.

characteristicsKeywords: Betazoid; Ambassador; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: Female Betazoid ambassador who visited DS9 several times. Suffered the effects of Zanthi fever in 2371. Romantically involved with Jeyal and Odo.
name: Lwaxana Troi (20th Anniversary)
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Odo} (even from your discard pile).

lore: Klingon strategic operations officer aboard DS9. Often commanded the U.S.S. Defiant. Romantically involved with Jadzia Dax. Likes prune juice.
name: Worf (20th Anniversary)
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor x 2 Diplomacy SECURITY Doubles DEFENSE bonus of your Tactic (if involved).

lore: Klingon warrior whose recessive gene allowed him to access Unimatrix Zero. Fought to free himself and his fellow Borg. Known as Six of Ten by his hive.
name: General Korok
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Professional gambler on late 19th century Earth. Always looking for an easy mark. French-speaking native of New Orleans. Fond of the waltz.
name: Frederick La Rouque
text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Treachery Worth points if he is most CUNNING Greed in play.

lore: Typical Tilonian nurse created by Suna as part of a brainwashing scenario. Appeared to enjoy the torment he inflicted on the occupants of Ward 47.
name: Orderly Mavek
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Music DL/ {Frame of Mind} (as an Event, targeting an opposing personnel).

lore: Starfleet Intelligence agent. Posed as a reporter to investigate xenophobic organization Terra Prime. Romantically involved with Travis Mayweather.
name: Gannet Brooks
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Diplomacy Computer Skill SECURITY Biology Treachery

lore: "I suppose you're worried about your fish, too."
name: My Ship, My Crew
text: Opponent names a classification. You choose: randomly select a personnel in crew or Away Team with that classification (if any) to be "stopped" OR randomly select three personnel in crew or Away Team without that classification to be "stopped". (May also be seeded as [S/P] .)

characteristicsKeywords: Borg ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Identification: FEDERATION SOVEREIGN-CLASS Task: Prevent first contact between humans and Vulcans in 2063. Borg Queen commands.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E (20th Anniversary)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam. May report to {Earth}. DL/ {Borg Queen}

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Federation starship claimed under Ferengi Salvage Code. Captained by Lurin. A mysterious machine.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise (20th Anniversary)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Former Borg coerced into Tsunkatse competition. Trained by Hajur. Imperfect. Reaffirmed her humanity in the arena.
name: Seven of Nine (League Promo)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill Honor STRENGTH +5 in battle.

lore: Benjamin Sisko constructed a clock while being affected by the energy matrix of Saltah'na telepathic spheres. The spheres were storing the energy of an ancient power struggle.
name: Saltah'na Clock *VP
text: Place on ship or facility here (opponent's choice). Personnel aboard must initiate battle whenever possible (no leader is required and affiliation attack restrictions do not apply).

lore: Jake Sisko and Julian Bashir were pinned down by Klingon artillery while attempting to retrieve a portable generator from their runabout on Ajilon Prime.
name: Artillery Attack *VP
text: Kills X personnel (random selection); immediately probe: [*]: X = number of [*] icons on probe card. [Equipment]: X = 0 (discard probe card). Otherwise: X = 1.

lore: Beloved childhood companion (and first surgical patient) of Julian Bashir. Loaned to, and especially treasured by, Leeta. A timeless symbol of innocence and security.
name: Kukalaka *VP
text: Your non-Borg personnel present are each INTEGRITY +2, or +3 if {Leeta} present. Also, each player is limited to one {Brain Drain} OR one {Going To The Top} every turn. (Unique.)

lore: Zibalian trader Kivas Fajo has a spaceborne warehouse of rare cargo like hytritium as well as a private collection of unique and priceless treasures.
name: Kivas Fajo - Collector *VP
text: Choose any player to immediately draw three new cards from the top of their draw deck. Discard event after use.

name: The Art of Diplomacy *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [MQ], [Maq], Resistance, and Orion Syndicate personnel who are using a hand weapon may use 2 Treachery as if it were 1 Diplomacy (ignoring reductions from rifles) and, once each turn, may place incident out-of-play to kill one other personnel present. Once per game, you may discard incident to download one hand weapon to one of your personnel who has 2 Treachery.

lore: Surrounded by a fleet of Suliban ships, Jonathan Archer decided to save the lives of his crew by conceding to Silik's demands.
name: Outgunned *VP
text: Plays at start of battle against opponent's only ship here. If undocked and your total WEAPONS involved > its SHIELDS x3: battle cancelled; ship commandeered and crew captured.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Colonel; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling. Impersonated Colonel Lovok during the 2371 attack on the Dominion homeworld. Led the Romulan/Cardassian fleet into a Jem'Hadar ambush.
name: Lovok Founder *VP
text: OFFICER Tal Shiar Computer Skill Navigation SCIENCE Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: Highly decorated general and High Council member. Accepted Worf, Alexander and Jadzia into the House of Martok. Lost his left eye battling the Jem'Hadar.
name: Martok *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation x 2 DL/ {D'k Tahg} Your [Kli] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Senator;
lore: Female Romulan. Kimara Cretak was liaison to Deep Space 9 in 2375. Coordinated a fleet of warbirds attempting to deliver weapons to a Bajoran moon.
name: Senator Cretak *VP
text: V.I.P. Honor Law SECURITY Physics Your [Rom] ships at same location are WEAPONS +2.

lore: To outrun the reflexes and agility of his Jem'Hadar captors, Miles O'Brien used the even swifter response time of a transporter's energizing coil.
name: Close Call
text: One personnel present (random selection) is killed if that personnel does not have Computer Skill or Transporter Skill. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR 3 SECURITY remaining.

lore: To obtain a rare gift for his father, Jake Sisko and his friend Nog bartered, swapped favors, stole a teddy bear, and even negotiated with Weyoun.
name: Incentive-Based Economics
text: To get past requires Honor and no SECURITY OR CIVILIAN, Anthropology, Diplomacy, Youth, and a personnel with STRENGTH<8.

lore: Section 31 went to great lengths to ensure their mole Koval gained a seat on the praetor's Continuing Committee over rival Senator Cretak.
name: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges
text: To get past requires V.I.P. and no Treachery OR SECURITY, Exobiology, Computer Skill, and a personnel with INTEGRITY<5.

lore: On the run after a Kellerun attempt to wipe out all knowledge of the harvester virus, Bashir and O'Brien had to repair an old communications system to signal for rescue.
name: Nanobiogenic Fugitives
text: Choose two personnel with ENGINEER (or one personnel with Physics) to be stopped. To get past requires 2 Computer Skill and Physics remaining.

lore: Benjamin Sisko became trapped outside the normal flow of time after an accident caused by the 2372 subspace inversion of the Bajoran Wormhole.
name: Subspace Accident
text: Unless 3 Astrophysics OR 2 Physics and 2 SCIENCE present, personnel with most [*] icons is held with dilemma atop mission. Discard both at end of your next turn.

lore: Undermining the new administration of Terok Nor required careful planning, inside information, playing dumb, and plying Damar with kanar.
name: The New Resistance
text: To get past requires Honor and no OFFICER OR Diplomacy, Leadership, Computer Skill, V.I.P., and a personnel with CUNNING<7.

lore: Although Enabran Tain was presumed dead after the failed attack on the Great Link, the spymaster was in fact captured by Dominion forces.
name: Underestimating the Founders
text: One non-[Holo] personnel is captured (your choice if opponent currently has a captive; otherwise, random selection). Nullify with any 3 Intelligence.

lore: Appealing to Odo's sense of order and justice, Gul Dukat had the changeling investigate the chemist shop murder to avoid executing ten Bajorans at random as reprisal.
name: A Better Alternative
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, may discard a unique non-[Bor] card from hand to draw a card. If the discarded card was a site or a [DS9] [Car] card, draw two additional cards.

lore: Despite their alliance to destroy the Founders, Tal Shiar and Obsidian Order agents did not trust one another. Watching for signs of betrayal kept them at peak efficiency.
name: Mutual Distrust
text: Plays on your personnel (limit one each); target their Intelligence. Once each turn, when you play a personnel with different Intelligence, draw a card. (Cumulative.)

lore: Center of enterprise for the Dosi, other Gamma Quadrant citizens, and their associates.
name: Dosi Trading Post
text: Seeds on {Dosi planet}. Your personnel with Greed or Acquisition, and your Karemma and Dosi personnel, may report here (for free, once each turn).

lore: Detention and interrogation facility for high-profile prisoners. Commanded by Deyos.
name: Internment Camp 371
text: Seeds at {Asteroid Camp}. Has a Brig. Once each turn, you may play a personnel with "Internment Camp 371" in lore for free here. DL/ {Training Ring}

name: Cross-Quadrant Expansion
text: Seeds or plays on any facility in the Alpha Quadrant. Just after your [DS9] personnel reports here, you may relocate that personnel to your ship with two or more staffing icons at a Gamma Quadrant location. At the end of each turn, if you have a matching ship at a Gamma Quadrant location, you may draw an extra card. Discard incident if you have a Dominion treaty in play or if you seeded a mission in the Bajor region.

name: Dominion Hierarchy
text: Plays on your Founder; once each turn, Dominion Hierarchy plays for free. OR Plays on your Vorta present with a Founder and Jem'Hadar to make that Vorta attributes all +2 and gain a skill of your choice until end of turn, then discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on your [Dom] facility. You may suspend play while you download {Jem'Hadar Sacrifice} or {Security Sacrifice}, then discard incident.

name: Holographic Communicator
text: Seeds or plays on table. Just after you report a [DS9] ship with at least one [Cmd] or [Stf] staffing icon to your Alpha Quadrant facility, you may place this incident on that ship. This ship, and all your other ships of the same class, add Holodeck. If ship is destroyed, return incident to table.

name: Holographic Settlement
text: Seeds or plays on {Yaderan colony}. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet (and report activated). Your {Rurigan} and your [DS9] [Holo] personnel may report here; once each turn, one such personnel may do so for free if [GQ]. Whenever a [Holo] personnel on a planet is deactivated, it must be returned to its owner's hand (limit once each turn) or placed beneath owner's draw deck.

name: Joint Operation
text: Plays on table; you may download {Treaty: Romulan/Cardassian}. Your [DS9][Car] (except [MQ]) and [DS9][Rom] personnel may report to your ship in the {Orias System}. Once each turn, your [DS9][Car] or [DS9][Rom] personnel with any Intelligence may report for free OR nullify {Homefront} where present.

name: Reward from the Founders
text: Plays on table. You may report only one Jem'Hadar each turn. Once each turn, you may play a [DS9] Vorta for free, then draw a card if you do not have {Dominion War Efforts} in play. Twice per game, you may download {Ketracel-White} to your Vorta present with your Jem'Hadar. Discard incident if you voluntarily initiate a personnel battle with more than 2 of your Jem'Hadar.

name: Where Opportunities are Made
text: Seeds or plays on your [Fer] facility in the Alpha Quadrant. While your [DS9][Fer] ship is at a Gamma Quadrant location, your [DS9][Fer] cards may mix and cooperate with your Dosi, Karemma, [Dom] ships, and [Dom] facilities; your [DS9][Fer] personnel may report as if [GQ] and may report to {Dosi Trading Post} (as if Dosi). Once per game, you may download {Cross-Quadrant Expansion} to this facility.

lore: Benjamin Sisko exploited Ferengi loyalty to the Grand Nagus, forcing Quark to use his contacts with the Karemma to help Starfleet's search for the Founders.
name: Sucking Up to the Boss
text: Plays once each turn on your [DS9][Fer] personnel. Name a skill. For the rest of turn, while facing a dilemma with your 3 Acquisition present, personnel gains that skill.

lore: Build facility for wounded Romulans in allied government territory.
name: Establish Medical Complex
text: ENGINEER x3 + MEDICAL + SECURITY + CUNNING>35 When you solve, may download {Romulan Outpost} here.

lore: Source new land to increase fleece production and trade potential.
name: Expand Karemman Operations
text: Geology + Leadership + SCIENCE + (Greed x2 OR CUNNING>40)

lore: Attend Karemma conference hosted by the Dosi to coordinate distribution.
name: Further Tulaberry Talks
text: Diplomacy + CUNNING>36 + (Acquisition x2 OR Treachery + Greed)

lore: Secure internees and key infiltration targets captured from the Alpha Quadrant.
name: Internment Operations
text: Treachery x2 + SECURITY x2 + Leadership + Vorta + STRENGTH>40 Opponent's side: [FED][KLI][ROM] ENGINEER x2 + Computer Skill x2 + Honor + INTEGRITY>40

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Determine source of unusual particle field.
name: Investigate Omicron Particles
text: Computer Skill + (3 [Holo] personnel OR {Jadzia Dax}) When seeded, you may download {Holographic Settlement}.

lore: Gather information about distant areas of the galaxy.
name: Probe Alpha Quadrant System
text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + (Vorta OR Dosi OR Diplomacy x2)

name: Combined Strike
text: Plays on your [GQ] mission (for free if [CAR] or [ROM]). Your personnel may report here, to your matching Intelligence personnel aboard your ship native to the Alpha Quadrant. When solved by your non-[GQ] personnel, draw up to 5 cards, then discard objective to score points; if opponent has a [GQ][Dom] facility, you may download {Combined Strike}.

name: Disguise Encroachment
text: Plays on your unsolved mission. If at {Derna} or a mission where you have no facility, you may immediately report a [Rom] Treachery personnel here. Once solved, if opponent subsequently solves (or has solved) a mission that is adjacent or in the same region, score points; opponent loses points (discard objective).

name: Training Ring
text: Plays on your facility with a Brig. Once each turn, you may target a captive in that Brig; then randomly select your Jem'Hadar or SECURITY personnel present. If your selected personnel has higher printed STRENGTH than captive, place captive in point area; he or she is worth X points, where X = printed STRENGTH of targeted captive.

lore: Retired mastermind planning a dramatic comeback. Working with the Tal Shiar and his fellow Cardassians to destroy the Founders. Mentored Elim Garak.
name: Enabran Tain (The Gamma Quadrant)
text: V.I.P. Obsidian Order Tal Shiar Treachery x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Combined Strike}

lore: Cardassian posted aboard the Serrola as a liaison to the Romulans. Typical transporter forensics specialist. Glinn later interned by the Dominion.
name: Turo
text: MEDICAL Obsidian Order Transporter Skill

lore: Prior to contact with the Alpha Quadrant, the female Vorta Kilana mapped transport and patrol routes.
name: Administrator Kilana
text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Leadership Archaeology Stellar Cartography x 2 Once per game, may download {Dominion Hierarchy}.

lore: Stalwartly loyal Vorta. Third incarnation of Weyoun. Dutifully directed the destruction of the New Bajor colony in 2370, as ordered by the Founders.
name: Administrator Weyoun
text: V.I.P. Leadership Computer Skill Law Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Sixth under Ikat'ika. One of many Jem'Hadar guards at Internment Camp 371. Grew to respect Klingons after seeing Worf's endurance in combat.
name: Amar'itak
text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics ENGINEER

lore: Typical Jem'Hadar Second aboard Weyoun's Warship. Assisted Weyoun during his encounter with Jake Sisko, Nog, and Elias Giger in 2373.
name: Guna'shan
text: OFFICER Geology Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Ambassador; Bodyguard; Internment Camp 371-related personnel; Jem'Hadar First; Male;
lore: Jem'Hadar First present at Alpha Quadrant armistice signing; later ambassador to Qo'noS. Former bodyguard at Internment Camp 371.
name: Jiten'parekh
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Transporter Skill Leadership Stellar Cartography SECURITY

lore: Typical Dosi bureaucrat. Assigned to audit off-world trade. She specializes in Alpha Quadrant transaction. Formerly first officer on a Dosi Trade Vessel.
name: Pimoo
text: OFFICER Anthropology Transporter Skill Computer Skill

lore: Ferengi bartender and trade envoy of Grand Nagus Zek. Assigned to negotiate with the Dominion. Oblivious to Pel's romantic intentions toward him.
name: Quark (The Gamma Quadrant)
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Navigation Acquisition Anthropology Computer Skill If in [GQ]: May serve as Nagus.

lore: Typical Jem'Hadar Fourth, assigned as a bodyguard on the Founders' homeworld. Assisted Science Advisor Borath with maintenance of his equipment.
name: Retana'var
text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER

lore: Prior to the invasion of the Alpha Quadrant, the male Vorta Borath oversaw the Dominion research and development divisions.
name: Science Advisor Borath
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Exobiology Physics Biology Astrophysics Leadership DL/ {Internment}

lore: Jem'Hadar Third previously assigned to the Dominion relay station on Callinon VII. Administrator Kilana's pilot on several key missions.
name: Varen'agor
text: OFFICER Biology Navigation Physics

lore: Typical Ferengi trade route manager. Secretly an informant for the FCA. He visited DS9 in 2370 to observe the wormhole. Played tongo at Quark's.
name: Prosar
text: CIVILIAN Astrophysics FCA Youth Stellar Cartography

lore: Village protector investigating recent disappearances but unable to produce results. Unaware that he, and his cloak, are holograms.
name: Colyus
text: SECURITY Law Leadership SECURITY Other [GQ][Non] personnel present are attributes all +1.

lore: Inexperienced Rakhari thief who spoke out against his government. Moved to Vulcan with his daughter, Yareth. Carries a morphogenic locket.
name: Croden
text: CIVILIAN Navigation Biology Stellar Cartography Honor Greed

lore: Changeling of great ability. One of the Hundred sent by the Founders to explore the galaxy. Dislikes monoforms. Linked with Odo. Occasionally fiery.
name: Laas
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Physics Exobiology x 2 May report where your changeling is present (for free).

lore: Representative of holograms unaware of their projected nature. Physician and scientist of his small community. Has few patients.
name: Merruk
text: SCIENCE Anthropology MEDICAL Physics

lore: Yaderan chased off his homeworld by the Dominion. Holographically recreated it and its inhabitants on another planet. Very fond of his creations.
name: Rurigan
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 3 Honor Anthropology

lore: Yaderan "granddaughter" of Rurigan's imagination. Hologram who bonded with the changeling Odo. Almost ventured too far from the village.
name: Taya
text: CIVILIAN Youth Geology Archaeology Honor DL/ {Any Odo} OR any [GQ][Non] personnel.

lore: Typical Romulan scientist serving the Tal Shiar. He programmed an optimal bombardment dispersal pattern to destroy the Founders.
name: Selan
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Tal Shiar

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
lore: Standard commerce ship used by the Dosi. Uses a hull design similar to the ships of the Karemma, but equipped with better weaponry.
name: Dosi Trade Vessel
text: Tractor Beam, Acquisition May report to {Dosi planet}.

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Support vessel rebuilt for the mass transit of soldier for ground operations. Shares basic design framework with other Dominion ships.
name: Jem'Hadar Troopship
text: Tractor Beam. RANGE and SHIELDS +1 for each Jem'Hadar aboard (limit 3).

lore: Scout vessel commanded by Odo during a mission to find Enabran Tain. Subsequently captured and carried into the Gamma Quadrant aboard the Serrola.
name: U.S.S. Mekong
text: DL/ {Rescue Personnel}

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Freighter; Tractor Beam; Transport;
lore: After the discovery of the Bajoran Wormhole, the Ferengi Alliance optimized their vessels for new trade opportunities.
name: Ferengi Freighter
text: Tractor Beam Attributes all +1 in [GQ].

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; D'deridex Class; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Enabran Tain and Lovok. Led a Tal Shiar-Obsidian Order flotilla tasked to destroy the Founders and thereby collapse the Dominion.
name: Serrola
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in [GQ].

name: Wardroom
text: [GQ][Non] personnel may report here, ignoring their [GQ] icon (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Once each turn, one such personnel may report here for free if you have 2 V.I.P. here (or personnel of two different affiliations). Matching V.I.P. personnel may {file mission report}s here. {Deep Space 9}: Habitat Ring

lore: Changeling of great ability. One of the Hundred sent by the Founders to explore the galaxy. Dislikes monoforms. Linked with Odo. Occasionally fiery.
name: Laas *VP
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Physics Exobiology x 2 May report where your changeling is present (for free).

lore: One chula puzzle places the players in a cocktail party filled with poison gas. The antidote awaits the one who is clever (or foolish) enough to take a chance on a mysterious beverage.
name: Chula: The Drink *VP
text: To get past, four personnel present (random selection) must be "tested." All four are "stopped" unless one has CUNNING<6 OR CUNNING>9.

lore: Stalwartly loyal Vorta. Third incarnation of Weyoun. Dutifully directed the destruction of the New Bajor colony in 2370, as ordered by the Founders.
name: Administrator Weyoun *VP
text: V.I.P. Leadership Computer Skill Law Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: "I am the beginning; the end; the one who is many. I am the Borg.... I am the collective."
name: Borg Queen *VP
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download {A Change of Plans} or a Borg drone in place of one card draw.

lore: Hirogen captured by Penk on his son's first hunt. Has fought at Tsunkatse for nearly two decades. Trained Seven of Nine, hoping she could end his captivity.
name: Hajur* *VP
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Biology MEDICAL Anthropology Geology Archaeology

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet. Stolen and commanded by Admiral Kirk; re-christened with historical irony by Dr. McCoy.
name: H.M.S. Bounty* *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

characteristicsKeywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype Starfleet vessel, NX-59650. Boasts ablative armor, regenerative shielding, and multivector assault mode. Captured by Romulans during a test flight.
name: U.S.S. Prometheus* *VP
text: May download {Multivector Assault Mode} when in battle. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Third of the nine mysterious energy vortices called Tears of the Prophets by the Bajorans. Grants visions of the future. Only Orb not stolen by Cardassians during the occupation.
name: Orb of Prophecy and Change
text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, you may glance at the top card of your draw deck. Insert it anywhere within your draw deck if you wish. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Two assassins boarded Kronos One, slaughtering any crew in their path and fatally wounding Chancellor Gorkon. Gorkon's final words begged Kirk to continue the peace initiative.
name: Don't Let It End This Way
text: Kills half of your "stopped" personnel at this location (your choice, round up). To get past requires 2 SECURITY.

lore: In some cultures, such as the Terran Empire, promotions are often achieved by the forced removal of one's superiors.
name: Crew Advancement
text: Opponent names an attribute. Crew or Away Team members with highest printed value of that attribute are "stopped." (In case of ties, "stops" all tied personnel.)

lore: Incorrigible omnipotent being. Member of the Q Continuum. Q exhibits a child-like petulance and sense of playfulness.
name: Q
text: Unless 2 Leadership and INTEGRITY>60, opponent may download up to 2 [Q] cards and place them atop their Q-Continuum side deck; crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash of 4 cards, then is stopped. Discard dilemma.

name: Holding Cell Door
text: Seeds (during facility phase) or plays on your ship or facility (except a Nor). Adds a Brig. OR Downloads {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive in your Brig, if you have Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) present; discard doorway or place atop draw deck. OR Nullifies any card closing another Holding Cell Door; discard doorway.

lore: Q gave Jean-Luc Picard the opportunity to change the reckless mistakes of his youth and live a life free from danger.
name: A Second Chance at Life
text: Discard a non-personnel card from hand to report a personnel from your discard pile. Discard event.

lore: Shot in the chest by the Lenarians, Jean-Luc Picard's life was left hanging in the balance due to the damage his artificial heart received.
name: A Bad End
text: Kills half of your "stopped" personnel at this location (your choice, round up). To get past requires 2 Biology.

lore: With mint frosting.
name: Cellular Peptide Cake
text: Plays on table. At any time, you may return an opponent's Event to hand (except if [Ref], a Treaty, or immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}). Then return this card to hand and discard an Event OR Discard event.

lore: The crew of the Starship Enterprise used distraction to regain control of their ship from the Kelvans. Mr. Scott, in fine naval tradition, put his stash of alcoholic beverages to good use.
name: It's Green
text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has ENGINEER, all of them are "stopped."

name: Continuing Mission
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [WC] card. Your personnel and ships that have a Star Trek: The Next Generation or Star Trek Generations property logo gain [TNG] (even if not in play). Once each turn, when you play a [TNG] personnel with four or fewer [*] icons (and no DL/ ), you may draw a card. Discard this incident if you play (or have played) a non-[TNG] personnel or ship.

lore: The homeworld of the Founders of the Dominion is shrouded in mystery. The Dominion establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Dominion Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Dominion ENGINEER.

lore: Facing the impending loss of the Boraalan people and culture due to atmospheric dissipation, Nikolai Rozhenko circumvented the Prime Directive to try and save them.
name: Unorthodox Preservation
text: To get past requires 2 Anthropology OR a personnel with OFFICER and Empathy OR a staffed ship with a Holodeck here.

lore: Duras, Son of Ja'rod, constructed a web of lies to hide his father's treacherous actions at Khitomer. Worf and his cha'DIch eventually uncovered the truth.
name: A Good Day to Lie
text: To get past, requires 3 Diplomacy OR 3 Treachery. If a [Kli] Treachery personnel in play, opponent may then download {Duras} to anywhere at this location.

lore: Control systems degrade over time. The Oracle of the People, a computer that guided the asteroid-like Yonada for millennia, required repairs after experiencing a malfunction.
name: Ancient Computer
text: Cannot get past unless 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE OR 3 ENGINEER present.

lore: Armus, a remnant of the Vagrans, engulfed William T. Riker in his skin of evil. Only the finesse and skillful negotiation of Jean-Luc Picard resulted in his release.
name: Armus: Sticky Situation
text: Away Team member with highest STRENGTH is stopped if another personnel present has Diplomacy and CUNNING>7, killed otherwise. To get past requires any personnel remaining.

lore: William T. Riker was tortured using neurosomatic techniques and left unable to tell whether he was in a mental institution or a play set in a mental institution.
name: Frame of Mind
text: One personnel present (random selection) now becomes Non-Aligned with attributes of 3-3-3 and only two skills (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 Empathy present.

lore: The Melkotians, a race of xenophobic telepaths, could project powerful hallucinations into the minds of trespassers in their territory, drawn from the historical images in their minds.
name: History Repeats Itself
text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has Anthropology, all three of them are "stopped."

lore: Tuvok performed a mindmeld with Lon Suder hoping to give a sense of order, but received homicidal rage in return.
name: Justice or Vengeance
text: Unless 2 SECURITY and Anthropology OR Honor, Exobiology, and INTEGRITY>32, opponent chooses: kills one Treachery personnel (random selection) OR kills two [DQ] personnel (random selection).

lore: An Away Team that is unprepared to complete its mission will undoubtedly experience delays. Mission progress may be impossible until additional personnel arrive.
name: Lack of Preparation
text: Non-Borg: Cannot get past (lose 10 points) unless you could have met mission requirements at start of attempt. Borg: Must have [Com], [Nav], and [Def] personnel to proceed.

lore: After a Gatherer raid in 2366, the superior strength of the Soong-type android Data was needed to force open a sealed compartment and rescue the wounded survivors.
name: Malfunctioning Door
text: To get past requires a Soong-Type android present OR STRENGTH>27 from up to four personnel.

lore: In politics, mysterious gifts should be handled with care. A bottle of poisoned kanar may have no effect on Vorta but would have been fatal to Tekeny Ghemor.
name: Occupational Hazards
text: Unless 2 Greed OR 2 Treachery OR CUNNING>45, one personnel (random selection) is killed.

lore: First contact requires caution, subterfuge, or force. In the Mirror Universe, Terran aggression could cause first contact situations to go disastrously wrong.
name: Primitive Culture
text: To get past, requires 3 Vulcans OR Anthropology and CIVILIAN OR Vorta and 4 Jem'Hadar OR 2 Tal Shiar OR 2 Obsidian Order OR Acquisition and 2 Greed OR 6 Klingons OR 4 [Def] Borg.

lore: Artificially-induced tremors on Ventax II led the natives to believe the end of the world was nigh. Geordi La Forge and the science team stationed there proved otherwise.
name: Seismic Quake
text: One Away Team member (random selection) is "stopped" if opponent's score is odd, killed otherwise. Cannot get past (shuffle back into seed cards here) unless Geology present.

lore: When unknown threats appear, priority is immediately placed on defensive systems and evasive actions.
name: Shields Up!
text: To get past, "stop" a SECURITY personnel (random selection). If that personnel has Astrophysics or Stellar Cartography or Navigation, randomly select two additional personnel to be "stopped."

name: Alternate Universe Door
text: Place one on table during the seed phase. Door is now open, allowing your [AU] icon cards to enter play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Plays to nullify one {Revolving Door} or {Subspace Schism}. (Discard doorway.) OR Allows one ship to pass through {Q-Net}. (Discard doorway.) OR Nullify one {Temporal Rift}, and return doorway to your hand.

name: Dyson Sphere Door
text: Place one atop Dilemma side deck (up to 13 dilemmas) during the seed phase. Dilemma side deck is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). You may seed [AU] dilemmas. Dilemmas you download must come from here (ignoring opponent's cards that prevent downloading). When opponent seeds {Empok Nor}, you may download and seed up to three dilemmas related to Empok Nor beneath station from here.

lore: To maintain morale after the loss of the U.S.S. Defiant in 2375, Starfleet granted special dispensation to change its successor's name from U.S.S. Sao Paulo to U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Defiant Dedication Plaque
text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is RANGE +2, or +3 if ship is Defiant class. (Not cumulative. Captain's Order.)

lore: The holographic projector at the center of the Yaderan settlement founded by Rurigan is an example of planet-based interactive holographic technology.
name: Holo-Projectors (Homefront VI)
text: Plays on a planet mission. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet.

lore: The threat of continued Dominion advances caused Starfleet to commit many ships and resources to the protection of Federation territory.
name: Line of Defense
text: Plays on table. Your ships are SHIELDS +3 while at missions with matching affiliation icons.

lore: The stimulating Klingon coffee is a staple of Jadzia Dax's morning routine. She isn't awake until she's had her first cup.
name: Raktajino
text: Plays to make a unique personnel attributes +2 until end of turn OR shuffle the bottom three personnel and/or ships from your discard pile into your draw deck. Discard event.

lore: The Traveler transcends space with thought. Took the U.S.S. Enterprise to Galaxy M-33, then to an even greater extragalactic distance.
name: Where No One Has Gone Before
text: Plays on table. Allows all your ships to leave one end of the spaceline and enter the other end.

lore: The Bajoran homeworld is Bajor. The Bajorans establish outposts throughout their territory.
name: Bajoran Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Bajoran ENGINEER.

lore: Identification: BORG OUTPOST Task: Construct Borg vessels. Disseminate resources.
name: Borg Outpost
text: Seed one at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission (or at an assimilated planet) where you have a Borg ENGINEER. DL/ {Transwarp Network Gateway}

lore: Cardassia Prime is the homeworld of the Cardassians. The Cardassian Union establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Cardassian Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Cardassian ENGINEER.

lore: Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Federation Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Federation ENGINEER.

lore: Hidden enclave and meeting place for the Terran rebels of the mirror universe.
name: Terran Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [TE] ENGINEER. May be seeded or built at {Terran Hideout} if no {headquarters} there.

lore: Ferenginar is the rainy, soggy homeworld of the highly capitalistic Ferengi people. The Ferengi Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Ferengi Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER.

lore: For 100,000 years, the nomadic Hirogen have hunted prey, establishing outposts throughout their territory.
name: Hirogen Outpost
text: Seed one at a [HIR] mission or any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission where you have a Hirogen ENGINEER. Has a Holodeck. DL/ {Hirogen Hunt}

lore: Since losing its homeworld, the Kazon Collective raids others, establishing outposts throughout its territory.
name: Kazon Outpost
text: Seed one at a [KAZ] or [NON] location OR build at such a location where you have a Kazon ENGINEER. Has no transporters. DL/ {The Kazon Collective}

lore: In the mirror universe, the Klingon Empire is a member of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. The Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Klingon Empire Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [KCA] ENGINEER.

lore: The Klingon homeworld is Qo'noS. The Klingon Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Klingon Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klingon ENGINEER.

lore: Romulus is one of the two homeworlds for the Romulans. The Romulan Star Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Romulan Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Romulan ENGINEER.

lore: The Vidiian Sodality establishes outposts throughout its territory, often hiding them inside barren planetoids.
name: Vidiian Outpost
text: Seed one at a [VID] or [NON] location OR build at such a location where you have a Vidiian ENGINEER. DL/ {The Vidiian Sodality}

name: Call for Reinforcements
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may download a [Univ] ship. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may fully repair your ship if you have a matching facility (or compatible {Nor}) in play.

name: New Arrivals
text: Seeds on table. Once each turn, you may play a [Univ] personnel you do not already have in play for free. End of each turn, you may draw an extra card. Discard incident if you play more than one personnel for free on any turn.

name: Reshape the Quadrant
text: Seed one on table. You may download one [RC] card. Your Nors, personnel, and ships that have a Star Trek: Deep Space Nine property logo gain [DS9] (even if not in play). Discard incident if you play (or have played) a non-[DS9] personnel or ship.

lore: Most vessels carry escape pods to save the crew in an emergency. In 2153, Jonathan Archer used one on a Klingon vessel to escape his captors.
name: Escape Pod
text: Plays on ship being destroyed. Escape pod saves entire crew. Unseen by enemy ships, crew remains in pod until personnel rescued. Discard after rescue.

name: Reflection Therapy
text: Plays on a personnel (except {Suna}) if your Treachery > Honor present. Replace one regular skill with one level of another regular skill (discard if skill lost). Any player may nullify with 3 Empathy present. OR Plays on an opponent's personnel affected by {Frame of Mind}; personnel is captured. Discard objective if rescued or (on a later turn) to download {Brainwash} or {Interrogation} to this captive.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Capturing-related card; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Bartender who pretends to work for the Alliance. Quark secretly helps Terran slaves escape from Terok Nor.
name: Mr. Quark *VP
text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Honor Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy DL/ {Rescue Captives} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Rom}.

lore: Terran slave Miles O'Brien was named and inspired by Mr. Sisko. "Fixer" favored by the Intendant. Repaired equipment for Overseer Odo.
name: Smiley (Crossover) *VP
text: ENGINEER Geology Physics Transporter Skill Computer Skill DL/ {Tinkerer}

lore: With the Starship Enterprise powerless to help, Khan left Admiral Kirk as Kirk had left him: marooned for eternity.
name: Buried Alive
text: If you did not seed this dilemma, place on mission and attempt ends. Adds [S] (does not count for {Balancing Act}). (Unique.)

lore: A plot to maintain military tensions between the Klingons and the Federation targeted key personnel for elimination.
name: Assassination Attempt
text: Opponent may download an assassin here. Unless Transporter Skill and a personnel with INTEGRITY>7 OR a personnel with SECURITY x2 present OR no assassin on planet, one personnel is killed (random selection).

lore: Chief Navigator Chekov attempted to advance his standing on the I.S.S. Enterprise by assassinating James Tiberius Kirk, who had himself eliminated Captain Pike.
name: Climbing the Ranks
text: Kills the highest STRENGTH OFFICER personnel present who does not have Leadership. To get past requires STRENGTH>24 remaining.

lore: Surprise attacks and boarding parties, such as the incident orchestrated by Valeris and General Chang in 2293, can wreak havoc on unsuspecting vessels.
name: Disgraceful Assault
text: Opponent may [Flip] (or [Flip] [Flip] if they have an [Objective] in point area). Unless 2 SECURITY and Transporter Skill present, one personnel (opponent's choice) is killed. Discard dilemma.

lore: To deter tampering with its deadly mission, the Dreadnought's security systems included an identity check of anyone boarding the vessel.
name: DNA Security Scan
text: To get past, must have 2 ENGINEER, 2 Computer Skill, and CUNNING>15X. X=number of [Objective] cards in opponent's discard pile (limit 6). Nullify with {Scan Cycle Check}.

lore: Valeris eliminated her co-conspirators, Burke and Samno. "The first rule of assassination: kill the assassins."
name: Ensure Their Silence
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed. If opponent's infiltrator attempting, two more personnel (random selection) are killed and one such infiltrator (owner's choice) is exposed.

lore: Though most starships are outfitted with emergency forcefields in the event of a hull breach, there is unfortunately a slight delay before they can be activated.
name: Explosive Decompression
text: Kills X personnel (random selection), where X=number of opponent's [Univ][S] mission with point boxes. If >9 personnel remain, opponent may [Flip][Flip].

lore: When advanced technology is damaged, the power flowing through those systems can instead arc through adjacent walls and across passageways.
name: Exposed Power Relay
text: X personnel (random selection) are stopped, where X=number of opponent's missions showing 25 points or less. Cannot get past if >9 personnel remain.

lore: When Kira Nerys encountered her doppelganger from the mirror universe, they were both taken aback by not only their similarities but also their differences.
name: Eye to Eye
text: Player with the most cards in hand chooses two personnel to be stopped. If tied, cannot get past.

lore: Overseer Odo's strict enforcement of order in the Ore Processing unit made life dangerous for any slave that stepped out of line.
name: Rules of Obedience
text: Personnel with highest INTEGRITY OR fewest [*] icons is killed (opponent's choice). To get past requires Geology and 2 Honor OR 2 SECURITY and 2 Treachery OR {Smiley}.

lore: After encountering a quantum duplicate of herself and the U.S.S. Voyager crew, Kathryn Janeway worked with her doppelganger to try to prevent further death or damage.
name: Face to Face
text: Player with the least points chooses one personnel to be killed. If tied, ship is damaged and stopped until end of next turn.

lore: When the Chameloid Martia took the form of Captain Kirk on Rura Penthe, the warden of the penal colony was unsure who was the escapee and who was the doppelganger.
name: Head to Head
text: Player with most points chooses one personnel to be killed. If tied, two personnel killed (random selection) and Away Team stopped until end of next turn.

lore: Thomas Riker, a transporter duplicate of William T. Riker, resented his doppelganger's authority and superior rank, and viewed him as a rival for the affections of Deanna Troi.
name: One to One
text: Each player reveals a personnel from hand (if none, CUNNING=0). Highest CUNNING scores points, others lose points. Cannot get past if tie.

lore: While investigating mysterious positronic signatures, Jean-Luc Picard and his crew were forced to flee from attacking natives.
name: Pursuit Just Behind
text: Kills X personnel (random selection), where X=number of opponent's [Univ][P] missions with point boxes. If >9 personnel remain, destroys three Equipment present.

lore: With Worf already excused, the remaining senior officers of the U.S.S. Enterprise were required to attend Calvin Hutchinson's formal reception on Arkaria.
name: Tedious Soiree
text: Opponent names a classification or a subcommand icon. All but one personnel with that classification or icon (your choice) are stopped. Nullified by {Incoming Message}.

lore: To further the Collective's attempts to stop first contact and take over the U.S.S. Enterprise-E, the Borg Queen attempted to seduce Data by offering him a sensual tactile experience.
name: Temptations of the Flesh
text: One personnel is stopped (random selection) for each objective in play (limit 5). To get past requires [Cmd] OR [Ent-E] OR any Queen.

lore: Klingons revel at their culture's prowess in battle. A mighty flagship embodies their power and dominance.
name: Pride of the Fleet
text: Seeds or plays on your Negh'Var-class ship. If, at end of turn, ship is staffed, undocked, uncloaked, and no other uncloaked ship in quadrant has higher WEAPONS, draw an extra card.

lore: Although not technically slaves, Mr. Sisko and his crew spent their lives doing the Intendant's bidding. With Julian Bashir's influence, they rebelled, cost the Alliance bitterly.
name: Rebellious Servants
text: Download different [MQ] [Non] human and/or Vulcan personnel with up to 7 total [*] icons to your [MQ] facility. Discard event (lose points).

lore: Having carved out an existence for himself and his crew better than most under the Alliance, Mr. Sisko was satisfied he had made his contribution to improve the lives of Terrans.
name: The Best of a Bad Life
text: Return up to two [Non][KCA] cards from your discard pile to hand. Discard event. OR Plays on table. Your [Non][KCA] personnel are attributes all +1. (Cumulative.)

lore: Insurgents and guerilla fighters often use unorthodox techniques to keep larger enemy forces off-balance.
name: Resistance Tactics
text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard event to cancel a just-initiated battle involving your Resistance, [Maq], or [DS9][TE] personnel.

lore: In the mirror universe, the Cardassian Union and the Klingon Empire united with other smaller powers to take advantage of the peaceful reforms of the Terran Empire.
name: Treaty: The Alliance
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [KCA] cards may mix and cooperate, and your [KCA] leaders may use your [KCA] ships. Your [KCA] leaders may attempt [KLI] and [CAR] missions.

lore: A Klingon proverb holds that "if a warrior does not fight, he does not breathe."
name: Warrior's Birthright
text: Plays on your mission. Your [Kli], [Kaz], [Hir], [TE], and [KCA] personnel may contribute their STRENGTH instead towards INTEGRITY and CUNNING requirements of mission, and dilemmas here.

name: An Important Victory
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your [DS9][Fed][TE] personnel reporting to [TE] {Mirror Terok Nor} may do so for free. {Contain Boarding Parties} may seed or play there. You may ignore the point box of {Rebellious Servants} when played as your normal card play. Nullified if you play or have seeded {Terran Rebellion HQ}.

lore: In the mirror universe, the Cardassian Union is a member of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. The Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Alliance Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [KCA] ENGINEER.

name: Expert Pilot
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your unique ships with a personnel with Navigation x2 aboard are RANGE +2, are immune to {Loss of Orbital Stability} and {Outgunned}, and may download {Evasive Maneuvers}. When you complete a space mission, you may download {Space Boomer}. Doubles skill requirements of each {Fly by the Seat of your Pants}.

name: Center of Authority
text: Plays on table; if opponent's [TE] {Mirror Terok Nor} in play, you may download a [KCA] Outpost (ignoring ENGINEER requirement). Once each turn, your [DS9][Baj][KCA] personnel OR [DS9][Car][KCA] personnel reporting to [KCA] Mirror Terok Nor (or, if opponent's [TE] Mirror Terok Nor in play, to your [KCA] outpost) may do so for free.

lore: There are only two settings. Stun and kill. Make sure not to get them mixed up.
name: Starfleet Phaser Pistol
text: Starfleet use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (or +3 if that personnel has SECURITY). (Cumulative).

name: Plenty of Captains
text: Plays on table; you may download {A Safe Place to Hide}. Your [TE] personnel lose [KCA] (even if not in play). Your [DS9][TE] personnel and ships may report to any [MQ] Badlands Region [P] mission; once each turn, one such [Fed] or [Non] personnel may do so for free. Nullified if you seeded {Mirror Terok Nor}.

name: Taking Charge
requires: Admiral; Alpha-Hirogen; Captain; Colonel; DaiMon; General; Gul; Jem'Hadar First; Legate; Maje;
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your personnel at a non-homeworld mission with an objective on it are attributes all +1. Once each turn, if your Admiral, General, Captain, Colonel, Gul, Legate, DaiMon, Maje, Alpha-Hirogen, or Jem'Hadar First is at your mission, you may download an objective onto that mission.

name: The Regent's Flagship
text: Plays on table; download {Regency 1}. Your [KCA] personnel lose [TE] (even if not in play). Your [KCA] personnel may report aboard Regency 1; once each turn, one such [DS9][Car] or [DS9][Kli] personnel may do so for free. In place of your normal card play, you may download a non-[Non][KCA] leader (once per game per affiliation). Nullified if you seeded {Mirror Terok Nor}.

name: Tinkerer
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, may "stop" your non-[Bor] ENGINEER personnel to choose one: fully repair your ship or facility they are aboard (limit once per game) OR shuffle any number of non-hand weapon equipment from your discard pile into your deck OR discard an equipment present to download an ENGINEER-related equipment there.

name: You Can't Kill the Captain
text: Plays on table. At the start of each of your turns, your [DS9][Fed][TE] personnel with the highest INTEGRITY (your choice if tie) gains V.I.P. until end of turn. When your [DS9][TE] personnel dies, you may place them here. (Personnel here are not in play.) Once each turn, you may discard a card from here to give one of your [DS9][TE] personnel any skill until end of turn.

lore: In what he called a sacred moment, a member of the Pah-wraith cult stabbed Benjamin Sisko on Earth in 2375.
name: Shrouded Assailant
text: Once every turn, plays on your Treachery personnel using a blade weapon to kill one other personnel present (random selection) OR Nullifies {Handshake}.

lore: Seek and retrieve resources from opposite quadrant.
name: Conduct Crossover Operation
text: Treachery + Transporter Skill x2 + ENGINEER + CUNNING>32 OR {Ezri} OR {The Intendant} OR {Smiley}

lore: Recruit troops for conflict between the Alliance and the rebels.
name: Enlistment Drive
text: Diplomacy x2 + Leadership + INTEGRITY>30 OR Treachery x2 + OFFICER + STRENGTH>30

lore: Use natural phenomena to hide from pursuing vessels.
name: Evade Patrolling Squadron
text: Navigation x2 + SCIENCE + CUNNING>30 When seeded, you may download {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Opponent's side: No Gametext.

lore: Study remnant of trans-dimensional event in Tholian-annexed space.
name: Examine Disappearance Site
text: Stellar Cartography + SCIENCE + (Treachery OR Honor)

lore: Determine battle capabilities of new warship.
name: Test Warship
text: SECURITY + Leadership x2 + ENGINEER + CUNNING>35 * +5 points if {Defiant} or {Regency 1} here when solved.

name: Historic Coming Together
text: Seeds or plays on your [MU] planet mission. Nullified if you attempt with <5 (or >9) personnel. Just after you start a mission attempt here, if mission is unexamined, you may draw X cards, where X=the number of different affiliations among your [DS9][KCA] personnel involved.
