If X>2, discard objective to score points. Otherwise, place objective out of play.

name: Study Divergent History
text: Seeds or plays on {Guest Quarters} OR {The Intendant's Quarters} OR your [MU] ship OR a {headquarters}. Twice each turn, you may stop two personnel present from opposite quadrants to draw a card. Doubles point boxes of your {File Mission Report} in this quadrant (for opposite quadrant missions).

lore: Resourceful prisoner, seductress, and assassin. Kira Nerys left a trail of bodies behind while escaping her rebel captors. Misses her milk baths.
name: The Intendant (Crossover)
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Transporter Skill DL/ {Assassination Plot} (as the assassin, even while captive).

lore: Hands-on general. Wishes to dispose of the rebels himself. Worf wished to acquire a cloaking device and more Hupyrian beetle snuff.
name: Regent Worf (Crossover)
text: V.I.P. SECURITY OFFICER Leadership Treachery DL/ {Pride of the Fleet} DL/ {Taking Charge}

lore: Terran slave Miles O'Brien was named and inspired by Mr. Sisko. "Fixer" favored by the Intendant. Repaired equipment for Overseer Odo.
name: Smiley (Crossover)
text: ENGINEER Geology Physics Transporter Skill Computer Skill DL/ {Tinkerer}

lore: Terran rebel scientist from a family of collaborators. Visited Benjamin Sisko in 2372. She kidnapped Jake Sisko to lure his father to the mirror universe.
name: Professor Sisko (Crossover)
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Physics Treachery DL/ {Study Divergent History}

lore: Typical member of the Rebellion. Half Terran, half Betazoid friend of Captain Bashir. Has studied military history since joining the rebels.
name: Banya
text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Empathy Law Anthropology

lore: Evaluate threat posed by ship after sudden appearance.
name: Investigate Intrusion
text: Leadership + SECURITY + OFFICER + STRENGTH>30

lore: Spy on Klingon/Cardassian Alliance military activity on outlying colony.
name: Observe Alliance Operations
text: Treachery x2 + Leadership + SECURITY

lore: Quell dissension and ensure allegiance among native inhabitants of Vulcan homeworld.
name: Oppress Population
text: Treachery + SECURITY + Exobiology x2 + STRENGTH>34

lore: Gather slave laborers from Terran colony.
name: Replenish Workforce
text: OFFICER + SECURITY x2 + STRENGTH>30 When you solve, may download a [KCA] human here.

lore: Re-establish Terran Empire trade route.
name: Secure Supply Lines
text: SECURITY + Treachery + Navigation

lore: Search for information hidden by former emperor.
name: Seek Knowledge Cache
text: Anthropology + Archaeology + (CUNNING>32 OR Memory Omega OR {First Officer Spock})

name: A Safe Place to Hide
text: Plays on table. While on the table, you may discard a card from hand to place this objective on your unsolved non-homeworld [MU] mission. While on a mission, at the end of your turn, if your staffed [TE] ship at this mission is undocked, uncloaked, and not landed, you may draw an additional card. When this mission is completed, return this objective to table. (Unique.)

name: Emotional Blackmail
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Brainwash} to a captive escorted by your [MU] personnel at a non-[MU] mission; captive does not relocate to an outpost. When that personnel helps you complete a [MU] mission, you may discard objective and Brainwash to score points (captive is released and relocated to opponent's facility).

name: Evaluate Starship Systems
text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, place on your {Defiant}, {I.K.S. Negh'Var}, or ship with "prototype" in lore; ship is attributes all +1 for each of your missions with "Test" in title and each of your objectives played on a mission (limit +4). When ship's crew completes a mission with "Test" in title or a mission with an objective on it, discard this objective to score points and draw 3 cards.

name: Process Ore: Mining
text: Seeds or plays on your non-homeworld [P] mission. Adds Geology to requirements. Start of each turn, while you have no facility here, your non-[Bor] Geology personnel present and unopposed may "process ore": discard one non-[Ref] card from hand, place bottom non-[Ref] card of discard pile in point area (worth 1 point), then draw one card (or two if 2 Geology present).

name: Raid Opposite Quadrant
text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, place on your [MU] ship docked at a [MU] facility. If ship's crew or Away Team completes a mission in another quadrant, then ship returns and docks at that facility, you may discard objective to download up to two [Equipment] cards OR one "use as Equipment" artifact (as if earned) here.

name: Reap All the Glory
text: Seeds or plays on your space mission; it may be attempted by your crew with at least four [TE] personnel. Your [TE] ships here are SHIELDS +2. When you solve mission with such a crew, score 5 points and relocate objective to table; your [TE] ships are attributes all +1.

lore: Representative of loyal commandos serving The Intendant. Assisted in Mr. Quark's execution in 2370. Desires a greater role for Bajor in the Alliance.
name: Bor Kaffe
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Treachery Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Typical ore processing technician. Served under Overseer Odo. Occasionally deputized by station security during emergencies on Terok Nor.
name: Jalota Mar
text: ENGINEER Geology Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Terok Nor security officers under Security Chief Garak. Assisted the Intendant with her pursuit of Terran rebels in 2371.
name: Merdan
text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Treachery

lore: Typical cultural attach and legal expert. Discredited former legate trying to regain power by allying with Regent Worf. Rival of Security Chief Garak.
name: Trepar
text: OFFICER Anthropology Law Archaeology

lore: One of many Terrans who joined the Rebellion against the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Formerly part of Mr. Sisko's crew of mercenaries.
name: Ahanu
text: SCIENCE SECURITY Geology Youth Treachery

lore: Typical Terran rebel. Tests innovative battlefield medicine techniques on wounded soldiers. Assisted Mr. Sisko on several key missions.
name: Al Vermont
text: OFFICER Greed Treachery MEDICAL

lore: Benjamin Sisko changed his mind and began the rebellion against the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Terran captain married to Professor Sisko.
name: Mr. Sisko (Crossover)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Honor Leadership Navigation x 2 DL/ {You Can't Kill the Captain}

lore: Freedom fighter in the Terran Rebellion. One of many crewmembers aboard the Defiant in 2372. Fights to end Alliance oppression of her people.
name: Sarah Shaw
text: OFFICER Transporter Skill Computer Skill Astrophysics

lore: Typical rebel who assisted in the construction of the Defiant. Struggled to calibrate the power system. Terran quartermaster and cook.
name: Stoichkov
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography

lore: Humanoid dabo girl. Moved to Bajor after the Terran occupation. Works for Mr. Nog, but forced to covertly feed information to Security Chief Garak.
name: Nizari
names: Mr. Nog Mr. Nog;Security Chief Garak
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Greed Anthropology Youth DL/ {Dabo}

lore: Lursa is the sister of Captain B'Etor. Squadron commander serving under Regent Worf. Embraces the equal opportunities offered by the Alliance.
name: Captain Lursa
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Geology Honor Leadership Navigation DL/ {Historic Coming Together}

lore: Klingon captain who mistook Kira Nerys for the Intendant. Reported the incident to Security Chief Garak. Amateur Klingon opera soloist.
name: Nu'Tal
text: OFFICER Anthropology Music SECURITY Treachery Law

lore: Typical male Terran slave. Discussed grooming tips with a man posing as Mr. Sisko in 2371. Envious of Ezri's freedom but can't refuse the Intendant.
name: Errol
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Biology

lore: Giant Terran mercenary and bodyguard who worked as part of Mr. Sisko's crew. Poor dabo player. Later joined the rebellion against the Alliance.
name: Guron
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Exobiology Biology Leadership

lore: Typical Terran member of Mr. Sisko's crew. Hates the Alliance for causing the death of his wife. Despite a love for danger, declined a knife fight with Telok.
name: Marauder (Crossover)
text: SECURITY Acquisition Biology Computer Skill DL/ {Mirror Dagger} (ignoring [AU])

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Terran slaves who process ore on Terok Nor. Freed by Smiley in 2371. Abandoned his Alliance designation and adopted his birth name again.
name: McKay
text: ENGINEER Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Vulcan; Male; Nurse; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Typical Vulcan servant of the Intendant aboard Terok Nor. Trained nurse and masseuse, he secretly provides intelligence to the rebels.
name: Selot
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology Music Mindmeld Memory Omega

lore: Male Vulcan hairstylist aboard Terok Nor. Encourages the Intendant to position herself as a fashion trendsetter in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
name: V'mor
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Anthropology Mindmeld Barbering May nullify {Strict Dress Code} where present

lore: Typical supply vessel used by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Moderately armed to defend against pirates and other raiders.
name: Alliance Freighter
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Commanded by Mr. Sisko. Used as a privateer for the Intendant. Later used as a raider for the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Sisko's Interceptor
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=3 vs. [KCA]

lore: Alliance warship captained by Nu'Tal on patrol in the Bajoran sector. Investigated the mysterious appearance of a damaged ship near Terok Nor.
name: Ya'Vang
text: Tractor Beam X=1 in a region.

name: The Intendant's Quarters
text: {The Intendant}, [KCA] Vulcans, and any personnel who mentions The Intendant as a romantic partner may report here. Personnel who mention The Intendant in lore may file mission reports here. Once each turn a player may stop their The Intendant and another personnel present to draw one card. While station has [TE], The Intendant's Quarters are suspended. {Mirror Terok Nor}: Habitat Ring

lore: Commander in chief of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance, General Worf rules with an iron fist - often literally.
name: Regent Worf *VP
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Treachery Leadership Navigation On a [KCA] ship, may select any matching [KCA] personnel aboard as its matching commander. DL/ {Make It So}

lore: B'Etor is the younger sister of Captain Lursa. Seeks to bring Security Chief Garak and The Intendant to trial for negligence and fraternizing with the enemy.
name: Captain B'Etor
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Law Physics SCIENCE Youth

lore: The Mirror universe version of Bareil Antos unexpectedly beamed aboard Deep Space 9 and took Kira Nerys hostage. He demanded a ship in exchange for her life.
name: A Fast Ship Would Be Nice
text: Kills one personnel (opponent's choice). You may substitute a bodyguard or {Guard Drone} present OR an empty ship here (moved to opponent's side of spaceline; commandeered).

lore: The fifth Starfleet ship named Enterprise, launched in 2363. Built at the Utopia Planetia shipyards orbiting Mars.
name: U.S.S. Enterprise (Borderless Promos)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: "You aren't very persistent, Mr. Sulu. The game has rules; you're ignoring them. I protest... and you come back. You didn't... come... back."
name: Distraction
text: One male or female present (random selection) "distracts" a personnel of the opposite gender (opponent's choice). If neither has Honor, both are "stopped."

lore: With the field density between the mirror universe and their own closing quickly, Mr. Scott and Dr. McCoy rushed to complete modifications to the transporters.
name: Emergency Conversion
text: To get past requires 2 Astrophysics and Transporter Skill.

lore: If the holographic ma tre d' hadn't delayed the Borg, they would have killed Jean-Luc Picard before he could have completed his plan.
name: Strict Dress Code
text: Sacrifice one Diplomacy, one [Holo] or two [Def] personnel present (killed); otherwise, one personnel present is killed (opponent's choice). Mission continues.

name: Bajoran Wormhole: Mirror Universe
text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Mirror Quadrant. Limit one. Inserts into spaceline to create a Bajor Region location (span 1); any player may download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any ship may move between here and another Bajoran Wormhole if damaged or if ENGINEER and SCIENCE aboard, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

lore: Pain-inflicting device developed by the Terran Empire. Fear of punishment drives crew members to maintain maximum efficiency at all times. Ensures alertness, loyalty, and obedience.
name: Agonizer
text: Where present, each of your [MQ] personnel and [OS] Klingons is INTEGRITY and CUNNING +1. (Cumulative up to +3.)

lore: Small blade weapon used for personal protection. Ubiquitous in the mirror universe. Quite handy when an unexpected career-advancement opportunity presents itself.
name: Mirror Dagger
text: Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a [MQ] facility for free OR to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [MQ] card(s).

lore: Modifies transporter function to allow beaming to an alternate universe. Developed in the mirror universe. Used by Smiley, Professor Sisko, the Intendant, and others to cross over.
name: Multidimensional Transport Device
text: Reports in Alpha or Mirror Quadrant. Twice each turn, where present, allows transporters to beam to opposite quadrant (anywhere at corresponding location), ignoring all SHIELDS.

lore: Geordi La Forge was mentally reprogrammed to do the Romulans' bidding by a machine that accessed his mind through his VISOR's direct neural implants.
name: Brainwash
text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Captive reports to your outpost, is under your control and may mix with your personnel regardless of affiliation.

lore: In 2372, the Terran Rebellion kidnapped Jake Sisko from Deep Space 9, knowing that Benjamin Sisko would promptly pursue his son to the mirror universe.
name: Crossover: An Invitation
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your personnel native to the Alpha Quadrant may report (but not download) as if they were [MQ].

lore: On stardate 42679.2, the U.S.S. Enterprise encountered a duplicate of Jean-Luc Picard from six hours in the future. He was eventually killed by Jean-Luc Picard.
name: Doppelganger
text: Plays on table. While in play, if a unique personnel moves to the same location as its duplicate, the duplicate is discarded unless {Clone Machine} in play.

lore: "Today we're about to cross a new threshold. For nearly a century, we've waded ankle-deep in the ocean of space."
name: Finally Ready to Swim
text: Seeds on table. Once every turn, when you play a [22] card, you may draw a card. When you play a non-[22] personnel or ship, you must discard a card from hand.

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility commandeered by the Terran Rebellion in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor
text: Seeds during dilemma phase at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

lore: Cardassian ore processing facility controlled by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance in the mirror universe.
name: Mirror Terok Nor (back)
text: Seeds at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. (Not duplicatable.) {Quark's Bar} may seed or play on this Nor; [eDS9] {Ops} may not.

name: Agony Booth
text: Plays on your [MQ] ship. Once every turn, if ship, its crew, or one of its Away Teams solves a mission or wins a battle against opponent's cards, you may draw up to three cards. But whenever they fail a mission attempt or fail to win such a battle, one of your personnel involved (random selection) must do nothing but return to ship (if not already aboard), then is "stopped."

name: Crossover
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [MU] personnel may ignore their [MU] icon when reporting OR just after you report {Smiley}, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Professor Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Bareil}, {The Intendant}, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Ezri}, {Rom}, or {Quark}, you may download a {Multidimensional Transport Device} to that personnel (or vice versa, if you reported Device as your normal card play; discard incident).

name: Emblem of the Alliance
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [KCA] cards, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Once each turn, you may report a [KCA] personnel for free if you have in play a [KCA] leader who names (or is named by) them in lore. {Ore Processing Units} on [MQ] Nors are immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present.

name: Emblem of the Empire
text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [TE] cards, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Your [TE] facilities and staffed ships are immune to {Navigate Plasma Storms}. {Ore Processing Unit} on {Mirror Terok Nor} is immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present, and may {Process Ore} while under [Fed] control.

name: Strategema
text: Seeds or plays on table. {Ooby Dooby} and {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} are nullified. {Q's Planet} may not enter play. Your opponent may not initiate battle or play {Outgunned} at a homeworld against your force containing a card matching that homeworld's affiliation.

name: The Art of Diplomacy
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [MQ], [Maq], Resistance, and Orion Syndicate personnel who are using a hand weapon may use 2 Treachery as if it were 1 Diplomacy (ignoring reductions from rifles) and, once each turn, may place incident out-of-play to kill one other personnel present. Once per game, you may discard incident to download one hand weapon to one of your personnel who has 2 Treachery.

name: Transporter Mixup
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) If up to four of your personnel are beaming up from a planet in their native quadrant, you may replace (discard) them by downloading an equal number of others to complete the transport. Each [Univ] personnel may be replaced by any [Univ] personnel native to opposite quadrant; others may be replaced only by opposite versions of their personas. Discard incident.

lore: Repair severe damage at automated facility.
name: Automated Repair Station
text: Physics + Computer Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download and use {Spacedock} here.

lore: Conduct sabotage operations on Bajoran homeworld.
name: Disrupt Alliance
text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [TE] leaders OR {Captain Bashir} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No Gametext.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Witness historical events first hand using the Guardian of Forever.
name: Historical Research
text: Anthropology x2 + Archaeology x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) When seeded, you may download {The Guardian of Forever}. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Replenish dilithium supply from world conquered decades ago.
name: Mine Dilithium
text: Geology + Transporter Skill Solving player's ships are RANGE +1.

lore: Retrieve escape pod of fleeing Bajoran operative.
name: Recover Prisoner
text: OFFICER + SECURITY + (Treachery OR Physics OR Greed) When you solve, may capture an opponent's personnel here. Opponent's side: [FED] Navigation + Youth + SECURITY When you solve, may download {Rescue Captives}.

lore: Search planet for illegal Maquis arms cache.
name: Search for Weapons
text: OFFICER + Navigation + Treachery May seed hand weapons under here.

lore: Provide aid for a helium ignition project attempting to revitalize dying sun.
name: Test Mission
text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28

lore: Test upgrades to faster-than-light drive components.
name: Test Propulsion Systems
text: Navigation + Physics + ENGINEER + % ship Solving player's ships are RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

name: Straight and Steady
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your [22] card is attacked, you may discard objective to make each [22] card involved attributes all +5 until the end of that battle. At the end of your opponent's turn, you may discard objective to move your [22] ship one spaceline location toward your homeworld or facility. (Unique. Captain's Order.)

lore: One of many Bajoran nationals living aboard Terok Nor. The Intendant, quite a fan of his talents, often invites him to perform at special functions.
name: Javek Len
text: CIVILIAN Music SCIENCE Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling security chief of Deep Space 9. Not very good at pretense. Always investigates Quark.
name: Odo
text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 Law Once per turn, may "stop" {any Quark} present.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: The mirror version of Odo supervises ore processing on Terok Nor. Has strict rules of obedience. The only changeling his contemporaries have ever seen.
name: Overseer Odo
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Process Ore}

lore: Typical of personal physicians employed by important Alliance officials. Assigned to the Intendant. Surprised at how frequently she comes in for an exam.
name: Romara Cal
text: MEDICAL Biology Physics

lore: Representative of security officers serving in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Part of the Intendant's elite assault team. Helped track down Professor Sisko.
name: Taymar Bern
text: SECURITY Anthropology Navigation Treachery

lore: Representative of Cardassians in the mirror universe. Strives to be noticed - without raising the ire of Security Chief Garak. Has done neither thus far.
name: Aramax
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Greed

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Female; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Female Cardassian in the mirror universe. Science officer aboard Terok Nor. Occasionally keeps high-profile visitors under surveillance for the Intendant.
name: Dorza
text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

lore: Overseer of ore processing on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Less demanding than his predecessor, Overseer Odo, but just as hated by the Terran slaves.
name: Overseer Mardel
text: ENGINEER Exobiology Anthropology Geology

lore: Although the mirror universe Elim Garak hates the Intendant, he is still able to please her now and then. Not Regent Worf's type.
name: Security Chief Garak
text: OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY Biology Treachery x 2 DL/ Any Cardassian Equipment card

lore: Hot-headed Terran rebel. Julian Bashir interrogated and tortured the Intendant. One of many "captains" fighting to overthrow the Alliance.
name: Captain Bashir
text: OFFICER Navigation SCIENCE Leadership Biology Smuggling DL/ {Interrogation} OR {Torture}

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Captain; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Aggressive, roguish Trill. Host to Dax symbiont. Once the mistress of Mr. Sisko, Jadzia Dax is now romantically involved with Captain Bashir.
name: Captain Dax
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Archaeology Geology Leadership DL/ {Evasive Maneuvers}

lore: Mr. Scott is chief engineer of the I.S.S. Enterprise. Scotty is a relentless taskmaster. His department has the highest rate of turnover on the ship.
name: Chief Engineer Scott
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography If on a [MQ][OS] ship, it is attributes all +2. Physics

lore: Ensign Chekov arranged an attack on his captain in the hopes of moving up in rank. Spent time in the I.S.S. Enterprise agony booth for his misguided ambition.
name: Chief Navigator Chekov
text: OFFICER Youth Treachery Navigation Astrophysics If on {I.S.S. Enterprise}, it is RANGE and WEAPONS +1.

lore: I.S.S. Enterprise chief medical officer. Dr. McCoy runs one of the most feared sickbays in the Empire. Never loses a subject before completing their interrogation.
name: Chief Surgeon McCoy
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Classic Medical Tricorder}

lore: Communications officer aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Uhura is the object of Security Chief Sulu's constant advances. Knows how to handle him.
name: Comm Officer Uhura
text: OFFICER Youth ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Mirror Dagger}

lore: Typical crewman on the I.S.S. Enterprise. Seeks any opportunity to be made an officer. Isn't likely to find one on Kirk's ship.
name: Crewman Wilson
text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: Security guard aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Easily dispatched by Dr. McCoy and Mr. Scott with the old "you distract him, I'll hit him with the hypo" trick.
name: Ensign Davis
text: SECURITY Treachery

lore: Dedicated crewman aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Abandoned a promising career in the sciences for the greater advancement opportunities in security.
name: Ensign Gaffney
text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human. History will record that Mr. Spock rose to command the I.S.S. Enterprise, then reformed the Empire and ultimately caused its downfall.
name: First Officer Spock
text: SCIENCE OFFICER Mindmeld Diplomacy x 2 Honor Transporter Skill DL/ Any [OS] Equipment card

lore: The ruthless Captain Kirk took command of the I.S.S. Enterprise by assassinating Captain Pike. Uses the deadly Tantalus Field to maintain his control.
name: James Tiberius Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Treachery x 2 Archaeology DL/ {Tantalus Field} DL/ {Classic Communicator}

lore: Terran rebel who faithfully followed Mr. Sisko for many years. Lost an eye in a dangerous stunt.
name: Marauder
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Exobiology

lore: The mirror version of Lt. Moreau is assigned to the I.S.S. Enterprise chem lab. Romantically involved with James Tiberius Kirk. Likes being a "captain's woman."
name: Marlena Moreau
text: SCIENCE Biology Physics Treachery Anthropology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Former Terran slave on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Liberated when the Rebellion seized control in 2372.
name: Mr. Andrews
text: CIVILIAN Biology MEDICAL

lore: Coldly logical soldier. In the mirror universe, the Vulcan Tuvok fought for the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Tuvok (Shades of Gray)
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Mindmeld Memory Omega Once per game, may be taken into hand from draw deck when any player uses the DL/ on a [MQ] card.

lore: The mirror universe equivalent of Lt. Sulu is chief of security and second officer aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Desires command of both the ship and Uhura.
name: Security Chief Sulu
text: OFFICER SECURITY Biology Computer Skill Navigation Treachery DL/ {Classic Type II Phaser}

lore: Second leader of the Terran Rebellion. Miles O'Brien commanded the Defiant, which he helped construct using plans stolen from Deep Space 9.
name: Smiley
text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill Leadership Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship} OR {Crossover}

lore: Transporter chief aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Kyle was punished by First Officer Spock for failing to compensate for a transporter malfunction in 2267.
name: Transporter Chief Kyle
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology DL/ {Agonizer}

lore: Ferengi mercenary. Very good engineer and cook. Brunt is loyal to his partner, Ezri, with whom he is secretly infatuated. Unfortunately, he is not her type.
name: Mr. Brunt
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Navigation Honor Archaeology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Quark}.

lore: Nog is thankful to the Intendant for making him the bartender and owner of his uncle's bar. Distrusts tall men. Likes tall women.
name: Mr. Nog
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Greed Physics Treachery DL/ {Bribery} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Brunt}.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Capturing-related card; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Bartender who pretends to work for the Alliance. Quark secretly helps Terran slaves escape from Terok Nor.
name: Mr. Quark
text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Honor Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy DL/ {Rescue Captives} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Rom}.

lore: Ferengi soldier in the Terran Rebellion. The mirror version of Rom seeks vengeance against the Alliance.
name: Mr. Rom
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Physics Geology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Nog}.

lore: Typical section head in Regent Worf's crew. Frequent target of the Regent's temperamental outbursts. Finds being a bridge officer to be a mixed blessing.
name: Korvek
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology

lore: Female Klingon representative of medical assistants throughout the Alliance. Sees very few patients, but has assisted in countless interrogations and autopsies.
name: Loreva
text: MEDICAL Exobiology

lore: Chief helmsman aboard Regency 1. Survivor of several Badlands expeditions in search of the rebel stronghold - more than any other pilot in the Alliance.
name: Rukor
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Science officer in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Assigned to Terok Nor. Finds the station rife with gossip, backstabbing, and treachery. Likes it that way.
name: T'Vor
text: SCIENCE Geology Stellar Cartography

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Bodyguard; Duras-related; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Served for four years as a bodyguard in the house of Duras. Took a position aboard Terok Nor to escape the unpredictable demands of Lursa and B'Etor.
name: Telok
text: SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Stellar Cartography

lore: First officer of the Alliance battle cruiser that intercepted Kira and Bashir's runabout when they first crossed over to the mirror universe.
name: Vartoq
text: OFFICER Biology Transporter Skill

lore: Typical Terran in the Mirror universe. Caught trying to escape Terok Nor. Brought to The Intendant for sentencing by Security Chief Garak and Telok.
name: 0413-Theta
text: ENGINEER Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Lower Decks}

lore: Trill mercenary in the mirror universe. Unlike Ezri Dax, this Ezri is not joined to a symbiont. Partners with Mr. Brunt. Romantically involved with the Intendant.
name: Ezri
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Transporter Skill Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography DL/ {Crossover}

lore: After years collecting duties for (and being romantically involved with) the Intendant, the mirror Benjamin Sisko became leader of the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Sisko
text: SECURITY Leadership x 2 Biology Navigation Honor Your [TE] personnel (except [AU]) are attributes all +1.

lore: Scientist who abandoned her work for the Alliance to join the Rebellion at the urging of Benjamin Sisko. Bonded with Jake, the son she would never have.
name: Professor Sisko
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics {Any Sisko} may report where present (for free if Jake).

lore: Typical Cardassian warship in the mirror universe. Type 3 designation. Part of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance fleet. Stationed at Terok Nor.
name: Alliance Galor
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Constructed by the Terran Rebellion using stolen plans of the U.S.S. Defiant. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko during the defense of rebel-held Terok Nor.
name: Defiant
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: Typical battle cruiser of the Terran Empire. Outfitted for a variety of mission profiles, including conquest, domination, subjugation, and Imperial enforcement.
name: I.S.S. Constitution
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] [TE][OS] personnel}

lore: Imperial starship. Credited with many successful and profitable missions. I.S.S. Enterprise officers are frequently promoted - usually through assassination.
name: I.S.S. Enterprise
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [TE][OS] personnel}

lore: Interceptor/fighter used by Terran rebels in the mirror universe. Typically stolen from the Bajorans. Smiley enhanced and commanded this one.
name: Rebel Interceptor
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=3 if moving within a region.

lore: Fast and powerful battle cruiser. Backbone of the Alliance fleet. Their only weakness is in their targeting systems; they've been known to chase warp shadows.
name: Alliance Vor'Cha
text: Tractor Beam

lore: Massive flagship of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Commanded by Regent Worf. Has a stolen cloaking device installed - and sabotaged - by Rom.
name: Regency 1
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Stolen Cloaking Device}

lore: Site of dilithium deposits and obstinate inhabitants.
name: Halkan Council
text: Seeds or plays on table; any players may download one [MQ] Constitution-class ship here. Native to this timeline: all [AU][MU][OS] cards, and all [OS] Equipment cards. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

name: Quantum Incursions *VP
text: Seeds like a [S/P] dilemma. QR Code

lore: Timothy suppressed the trauma of losing his parents by emulating his new hero, the android Data. Counseling the boy occupied much of Data's time.
name: Hero Worship *VP
text: "Stops" non-Borg crew or Away Team members with the most and fewest [*] icons. (In case of ties, "stops" all tied personnel.)

lore: The Vori employ psychological conditioning on new recruits to make them hate their Kradin nemeses and believe they are vicious killers who would slaughter even innocent civilians.
name: Brainwash *VP
text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Captive reports to your outpost, is under your control and may mix with your personnel regardless of affiliation.

name: Blood Oath *VP
text: Plays on a non-Borg personnel who has INTEGRITY<8 and no Honor. Adds <R) icon beginning at start of your next turn. OR Plays on table. While you have two (R> personnel present together, all <R) personnel lose their first-listed skill and, in place of your normal card draw, you may download to that location {I.K.C. Ning'tao}, {I.K.C. Lukara}, {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, {Bat'leth}, {Blood Oath} or one (R> personnel.

name: Make It So *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if your staffed ship has its matching commander aboard, you may "unstop" it (once per game per Ship card title) OR download {Ready Room Door} (to download a Captain's Order) OR , if that ship is in battle (even during opponent's turn), download a Tactic card (once per game per Tactic card title). Discard incident after use, unless that matching commander has [Ent-E] icon.

lore: Gather information about distant areas of the galaxy.
name: Probe Alpha Quadrant System *VP
text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + (Vorta OR Dosi OR Diplomacy x2)

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Female; Intendant; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Kira Nerys commands Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Enjoys being intimate with her friends - and enemies.
name: The Intendant *VP
text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation Exobiology May replace anyone present who was just targeted by any gender-related dilemma. Treachery x 2

lore: Devious Cardassian operative. Broke her cover after becoming trapped in the Delta Quadrant aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Formed an alliance with the Kazon-Nistrim.
name: Seska *VP
text: ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill

lore: Ru'afo's first officer. Once the most vengeance-minded of the Son'a, recent time with the Ba'ku - and a persuasive Federation captain - has softened his hatred.
name: Gallatin *VP
text: OFFICER Anthropology SCIENCE Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-72381. Science vessel pulled from Alpha Quadrant by the Caretaker. Its rogue crew designed an enhanced warp drive, killing nucleogenic life-forms for fuel.
name: U.S.S. Equinox *VP
text: X=4 if any crew member has "U.S.S. Equinox" in lore. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Warbird commanded by Tomalak. Often assigned to the Neutral Zone. Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise twice in 2366.
name: Deranas *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in Neutral Zone.

lore: After the Ferengi attempted to cheat him at dabo, Falow introduced Quark to the game of chula.
name: A New Game
text: Opponent may download and seed here up to two Chula dilemmas (except The Chandra or The Game). Place on mission; one personnel (opponent's choice) is excluded from random selections of each Chula dilemma here.

lore: Klingon warrior whose recessive gene allowed him to access Unimatrix Zero. Fought to free himself and his fellow Borg. Known as Six of Ten by his hive.
name: General Korok*
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography

lore: Retired mastermind planning a dramatic comeback. Working with the Tal Shiar and his fellow Cardassians to destroy the Founders. Mentored Elim Garak.
name: Enabran Tain (The Gamma Quadrant)*
text: V.I.P. Obsidian Order Tal Shiar Treachery x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Combined Strike}

lore: Ferengi bartender and trade envoy of Grand Nagus Zek. Assigned to negotiate with the Dominion. Oblivious to Pel's romantic intentions toward him.
name: Quark (The Gamma Quadrant)*
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Navigation Acquisition Anthropology Computer Skill If in [GQ]: May serve as Nagus.

characteristicsKeywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Commander of a D'deridex-class warbird. Frequent nemesis of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Tomalak *VP
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

lore: In 2369, aliens from a tertiary subspace domain abducted crew members from the U.S.S. Enterprise. The crew used the holodeck to jog their memories of the incident.
name: Alien Abduction: Test Subjects
text: Three personnel (random selection) are held with dilemma atop mission. Cure with 2 Physics OR a Holodeck and CUNNING>40.

lore: Quark auctioned off several Gamma Quadrant artifacts in 2369. One valuable item disrupted station operations and was sought by both DS9's crew and wealthy bidders alike.
name: Attractive Antiquities
text: To get past requires Acquisition and 2 Greed OR Honor, OFFICER, SECURITY, and INTEGRITY>20X, where X=number of opponent's {Gold-Pressed Latinum} in play (limit 3).

lore: While coordinating the evacuation of the Bajoran moon Jeraddo, Kira Nerys found herself sympathizing with the stubborn farmer Mullibok.
name: Between Duty and Respect
text: To get past requires Geology, Leadership, and OFFICER OR Honor, Archaeology, and SCIENCE (all requirements doubled if 4 or more Bajor Region missions in play).

lore: Causing heavy damage to the ships it encountered, the Caretaker used a displacement wave to bring vessels from all over the galaxy to his array.
name: Caretaker's Wave
text: Unless Astrophysics and Stellar Cartography OR 3 Navigation present, you choose: opponent may [Flip][Flip][Flip] OR opponent may [Flip] and/or relocate ship to {Caretaker's Array}.

lore: Neglected facilities often hold hidden dangers. According to standard Cardassian procedure, abandoned facilities like Empok Nor were booby-trapped to deter potential looters.
name: Dangerous Derelict
text: Opponent may download and seed here up to two Empok Nor-related dilemmas (except {Friendly Fire} or {Ferengi Infestation}).

lore: Charles Tucker's experimentation with Xyrillian granules at Ah'len's suggestion led to surprises culinary, romantic, and even obstetric.
name: Unexpected
text: Unless you have Astrophysics and 2 Exobiology OR a female who has MEDICAL, one personnel (random selection, excluding females) is placed atop owner's draw deck.

lore: A Vorta scenario shut Romulus out of treaty negotiations. T'Rul's protests terminated her further involvement.
name: Excluded
text: For each affiliation present that does not include a V.I.P., one personnel of that affiliation is discarded (random selection), and others are stopped. Nullified if entire Away Team shares a faction icon. Discard dilemma.

lore: To save her life in Q's recreation of Sherwood Forest, Vash reluctantly agreed to marry Sir Guy of Gisbourne.
name: Exe-Q-tioner
text: Unless Treachery and INTEGRITY<29 OR CIVILIAN and INTEGRITY>49, one personnel (random selection) is killed and opponent re-seeds dilemma under a different unsolved mission.

lore: With help from Jadzia Dax and Worf, Quark rehearsed his Klingon seduction techniques, with successful results.
name: Looking for Par'mach
text: To get past requires a male and a female OR OFFICER and CUNNING>60. Opponent may then download and seed here up to two of the following: {Distraction}, {Strange Bedfellows}, {Brief Romance}, or {Unexpected}.

lore: A changeling disguised as Ambassador Krajensky nearly tricked the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant into starting a war.
name: Misdirection
text: Unless SECURITY, Exobiology, and {any tricorder} OR Section 31 OR Mindmeld OR a changeling present, play on table as [Event]: Your personnel present with an infiltrator are CUNNING -2.

lore: Brutal predators often target unprotected shipping lanes, plundering vulnerable freighters and non-military vessels. Only the most fortunate escape such encounters.
name: Nausicaans: Pirates
text: Unless you have 2 Navigation, 3 SECURITY, and STRENGTH>40 OR a Cloaking Device and CUNNING>40, two personnel (random selection) are killed. Discard dilemma.

lore: Honoring his promise not to trouble Picard's ship again, Q took the good captain hostage in a shuttlecraft to ensure his request was heard.
name: Q-uality Time
text: Opponent chooses: they may download and seed here {Q} OR highest INTEGRITY personnel returns to hand unless 2 Leadership and CUNNING>30. Discard dilemma.

lore: Starfleet protocol requires medical staff to regularly conduct and record physical examinations of starship personnel. Crew members are often reluctant to undergo such procedures.
name: Routine Physical
text: Stops X lowest STRENGTH personnel (your choice if tie), where X=number of different MEDICAL personnel present. To get past requires 2 Computer Skill remaining.

lore: James Tiberius Kirk's enemies often vanished mysteriously. Security Chief Sulu had to gather power with care.
name: Habit of Disappearing
text: Seeds or plays on table. End of each turn, you must place out-of-play the top three cards of your draw deck (just one, if you have three [AU][TE] personnel in play), then draw a card. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Covert Agent
text: Seeds or plays on table. Opponent may not return a ship to hand if your infiltrator aboard. When opponent reports a personnel or ship to same location as your infiltrator, you may draw a card (once per turn per infiltrator). When a mission attempt or battle begins at same location as your infiltrator, you may download to hand a morph card or an infiltration-related card (once per game per card title).

name: Full Complement of Shuttles
text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of your turn, you may discard a non-personnel card to download to hand a [Fed] shuttlecraft. Your {Type 9 Shuttlecraft} may report with crew (limit two personnel, each must be [DQ][Fed]) to your [Fed] {U.S.S. Voyager}. At any time (limit twice per game), you may download {Narrow Escape} (even from your discard pile). Your [Fed] ships are attributes all +3 in [DQ] if opponent's non-[Fed] ship in [DQ].

name: Getting to Know You
text: Plays to draw a card. Then draw an additional card for each different infiltration icon you have in play that does not match any opponent's cards (maximum 3). OR Download {Insert Undercover Agent}. OR Plays (for free, once each turn) on an opponent's personnel present with your infiltrator. Your Founders and personnel with any Intelligence add target's regular skills until end of your turn. Discard incident after any use.

name: Greater Glory of Cardassia
text: Seeds or plays on table. {Ore Processing Unit}s on [DS9][Car] Nors are immune to {Reactor Overload} if SECURITY aboard. While you have not attempted a mission, your [Car] Nor cannot be commandeered. Once per game, if you downloaded a [Car] or [KCA] outpost during your seed phase, you may download 3 [DS9] cards there (limit one ship) OR {A Better Alternative} OR {Automated Security System}.

name: Protect the Timeline
text: Seeds on a time location. (Unique.) Once each turn, one of your unique personnel reporting here may do so for free. You may not report personnel for free unless native to this timeline or reporting to a ship or facility here. Any ship may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location (once per turn per ship), then is stopped unless ship or three personnel aboard are native to this timeline.

name: Station Briefing
text: Seeds or plays on {Commander's Office}. No player may commandeer station unless that player has 2 Leadership unopposed at this site. While your facility commander present: once each turn, your Captain's Order or {File Mission Report} may play for free, and any of your personnel may "file a mission report" here.

name: Supplant Opposite
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your non-[MU] personnel with "mirror universe" in lore gain infiltration icons ([TE] if [Fed] or [Sta], otherwise [KCA], even if not in play; may be exposed by their opposite), and may report as if [MU] (once each turn). When reported as your normal card play (or downloaded by {Transporter Mixup}), such a personnel may gain any skill until end of turn (once per game per card title), and you may draw a card.

name: Valuable Prisoner
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) Place on your personnel who is about to be killed; relocate (as a captive) to opponent's crew or Away Team in same quadrant; worth points if rescued. OR Place on an opponent's personnel who is about to be killed; relocate (as a captive) to your crew or Away Team in same quadrant (or to {Internment Camp 371}); you may download {Impersonate Captive} or {a [Pun] card}.

lore: During the Dominion War, crew morale was often low. In his quest to give his father a baseball card, Jake Sisko lifted everyone's spirits and a new optimism swept through DS9.
name: Renewed Spirit
text: Nullifies half of a Combo dilemma. OR Unstops your non-[Bor] Away Team or your non-[Bor] ship and crew at your [Univ] mission (once per game per Mission card title).

lore: In the mirror universe, the crew of the Starship Enterprise found it far easier as civilized men to behave as barbarians than for their counterparts to behave as civilized men.
name: Smoke and Mirrors
text: While facing a dilemma, removes classification and all skills from one of your personnel until dilemma resolved, then discard interrupt.

lore: Study notable contact with parallel universe at site of transporter incident.
name: Research Historic Accident
text: Archaeology + Transporter Skill + Physics When seeded, you may download {Transporter Mixup}. Opponent's side: No gametext

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Raid ruins in search of powerful artifact.
name: Seek Illicit Relic
text: Geology + (Smuggling OR Transporter Skill) + CUNNING>28 {Dead End} here is nullified. Opponent's side: Once per game, may download {The Charybdis}.

lore: Seize opportunity to explore alternate reality.
name: Visit Parallel Universe
text: Anthropology + (Youth OR Greed) + 2 non-[MU] personnel When seeded, you may download {Crossover: An Invitation}. Opponent's side: No gametext.

name: Assemble Rescue Team
text: Seeds or plays on table. Start of each turn, if your unique [Fer] personnel is a captive, you may download {The Emperor's New Cloak} OR {Prisoner Exchange} OR {Quark} OR {Nog} OR {Leck} OR a non-[MU][Fer] personnel with "Quark" in lore. Once per game, you may discard objective to score points when your captured [Fer] personnel is released from a non-Alpha Quadrant location.

name: Assume Identity
text: Seeds or plays on table. If an opponent's non-Borg [Univ] personnel was just killed, place on your Founder (except {Odo Founder}) in same quadrant. Founder morphs to impersonate killed personnel. Founder's classification and staffing icon change to those of killed personnel. Founder gains infiltration icon(s) for killed personnel's affiliation(s). May morph back at any time (discard objective).

name: Fear Will Keep Them in Line
text: Seeds or plays on a [MU] mission. In place of your normal card draw, you may download {Agony Booth} or an {Agonizer} to your [AU][TE] ship here. Each of your [AU][TE] ships with an Agony Booth are attributes all +1. When you solve mission, score bonus points equal to your total WEAPONS from staffed [AU][TE] ships at this mission (limit 15 points), then discard objective.

name: Get Back
text: Plays on table. When Transporter Skill aboard, your {Transporter Mixup} may work "in reverse" (replace personnel with their opposites native to this quadrant). When four unique personnel are replaced in this way, discard objective to score points. OR Plays on a non-[MU] ship docked at a [MU] facility. If ship and non-[MU] crew subsequently dock at a non-[MU] Nor, discard objective to score points (once per game).

name: Imperial Intimidation
text: Seeds or plays on your [AU][Fed][TE] ship. Doubles attribute bonuses to this ship from special skills. End of each turn, if this staffed ship orbiting an unsolved, non-homeworld planet mission, you may probe: [TE], [Equipment]: Intimidation. Draw a card. [Interrupt], [Objective]: Exploitation. Play a non-[Fed] personnel. [Non], [Doorway]: Rebellion. Discard a card from hand.

name: Insert Undercover Agent
text: Seeds or plays on table. May discard from table to relocate one of your personnel to an opponent's crew or Away Team which they can infiltrate, and/or download {Covert Agent}. OR Once per game, place on your personnel with an infiltration icon (unless infiltrating); icon changes to match an opponent's affiliation or faction present; exposed (if infiltrating) when countdown expires.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: First officer of DS9. She accidentally entered the mirror universe while commanding the U.S.S. Rio Grande in 2370. Spitting image of the Intendant.
name: Kira Nerys (Through the Looking Glass)
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Honor X=3 vs. [KCA]. DL/ {Get Back} (if in [MU]).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: Commander of DS9 who twice visited the mirror universe. Briefly romantically involved with Captain Dax and the Intendant. Helped launch the Defiant.
name: Benjamin Sisko (Through the Looking Glass)
names: Captain Dax;The Intendant Captain Dax;The Intendant
text: ENGINEER OFFICER Leadership x 2 Biology Anthropology DL/ {Defiant Dedication Plaque} (if in [MU]).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: Briefly captained the I.S.S. Enterprise in the mirror universe. Profoundly influenced First Officer Spock.
name: Captain Kirk (Through the Looking Glass)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Honor Diplomacy DL/ {Get Back} If in [MU]: Anthropology, Law, X=2 If in [MU]: {Dr. McCoy} may report here (for free).

lore: Typical Terran bodyguard aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Assisted Chief Navigator Chekov's attempt to assassinate James Tiberius Kirk.
name: Crewman Bredahl
text: SCIENCE Treachery Navigation DL/ {Assassination Plot} If present, {Chief Navigator Chekov} is an assassin.

lore: Representative of Terran medical assistants throughout the Empire. Occasional bodyguard of James Tiberius Kirk. Dealer of illicit art forms.
name: Crewman Peart
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Smuggling

lore: Surgeon who assisted Mr. Scott in a plan to escape the mirror universe. Saved First Officer Spock's life.
name: Dr. McCoy (Through the Looking Glass)
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology x 2 Once each turn, you may save a just-killed [OS] personnel present (both are stopped). If in [MU]: {Mr. Scott} may report here (for free).

lore: Typical Terran member of Security Chief Sulu's department aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Assisted efforts to improve the agony booth's pain quotient.
name: Ensign Caggiano
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Geology DL/ {Bodyguards}

lore: Typical Terran technician aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Manned the bridge engineering station in 2267. Appreciates the low mortality rate of his section.
name: Ensign Chagwiza
text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: Typical Terran security guard often assigned to the phaser control room on the I.S.S. Enterprise. Loyal to Security Chief Sulu. Confronted Mr. Scott in 2267.
name: Ensign Kjolholm
text: SECURITY Treachery Youth DL/ {Tactical Scan} Your [OS][TE] OFFICER personnel present add Leadership.

lore: Trusted bodyguard of James Tiberius Kirk. Terran who helped identify plundered alien artifacts. Has an uncle who works in espionage. Wary of Haadok.
name: Farrell
text: SECURITY Archaeology Geology Greed Physics Your [OS][TE][Cmd] personnel present add V.I.P.

lore: First Officer Spock's Vulcan bodyguard aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Perplexed by his captain's aberrant, illogical behavior in 2267. Tolerates Farrell.
name: Haadok
text: SECURITY Law Biology Anthropology Mindmeld DL/ {Vulcan Nerve Pinch}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: Genetically enhanced doctor from DS9. Put to work as a slave by Overseer Odo in the mirror universe.
name: Julian Bashir (Through the Looking Glass)
text: MEDICAL Biology Geology DL/ {Phaser Burns} (if in [MU]). Once per game, may steal a hand weapon present. If with {Smiley}, both are attributes all +2.

lore: Linguist quick to learn the rules of the game in the mirror universe. She distracted Security Chief Sulu.
name: Lt. Uhura (Through the Looking Glass)
text: OFFICER Computer Skill Youth Anthropology DL/ {Driven} Once per game, may nullify a Female-related dilemma here. If in [MU]: {Captain Kirk} may report here (for free).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; any Scotty; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: Wry Scotsman. Mirror universe technology variations were nothing Scotty couldn't handle.
name: Mr. Scott (Through the Looking Glass)
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Transporter Skill Computer Skill DL/ {Transporter Mixup} If in [MU]: {Lt. Uhura} may report here (for free).

lore: Typical Terran yeoman aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Aspires to become a "captain's woman." Organizes shipboard social activities to cultivate allies.
name: Yeoman Vaughn
text: MEDICAL Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Capturing-related card; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel; Nagus;
lore: Ferengi who sought new opportunities in the mirror universe. Briefly romantically involved with the Intendant. Counted on Quark to help him.
name: Grand Nagus Zek (Through the Looking Glass)
text: V.I.P. Acquisition Greed x 2 DL/ {Maihar'du} (if in [MU] or [GQ]). DL/ {Valuable Prisoner} DL/ {Oo-mox} (if with {The Intendant}).

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Capturing-related card; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel;
lore: Bartender who traveled with Ezri and Rom to the mirror universe in 2375 to rescue Grand Nagus Zek.
name: Quark (Through the Looking Glass)
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Smuggling Treachery DL/ {Assemble Rescue Team} Honor, X=4 (if {Ishka}, any Nagus, or {any Ezri} in play).

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Mirror universe-related personnel; Waiter;
lore: Former waiter on DS9. Husband of Leeta. Worked with Quark to rescue Grand Nagus Zek from the mirror universe. Sabotaged a stolen cloaking device.
name: Rom (Through the Looking Glass)
text: ENGINEER Honor Navigation Physics If in [MU]: ENGINEER, SCIENCE, Treachery

lore: Halkan council representative in the mirror universe. Derives his wisdom from his people's history of total peace.
name: Baze
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Music

lore: Halkan ethically compelled to preserve the pacifist ways of his people by refusing Terran demands to mine their dilithium. Tharn led the Halkan Council.
name: Minister Tharn
text: V.I.P. At [S]: Honor x2, INTEGRITY +1 At [P]: Anthropology, Diplomacy, Leadership

lore: In the mirror universe, the crew of the Starship Enterprise found it far easier as civilized men to behave as barbarians than for their counterparts to behave as civilized men.
name: Smoke and Mirrors *VP
text: While facing a dilemma, removes classification and all skills from one of your personnel until dilemma resolved, then discard interrupt.

lore: Cardassia Prime is the homeworld of the Cardassians. The Cardassian Union establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Cardassian Outpost *VP
text: Seed one OR build where you have a Cardassian ENGINEER.

lore: Surgically-altered human thief. Captain Kirk was under secret orders from Starfleet Intelligence.
name: Centurion Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Computer Skill If [Fed], gains <Rom>. DL/ {Romulan Cloaking Device} May meet any Intelligence requirement with SECURITY.

lore: Humanoid dabo girl. Moved to Bajor after the Terran occupation. Works for Mr. Nog, but forced to covertly feed information to Security Chief Garak.
name: Nizari*
names: Mr. Nog Mr. Nog;Security Chief Garak
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Greed Anthropology Youth DL/ {Dabo}

lore: Commanded by Mr. Sisko. Used as a privateer for the Intendant. Later used as a raider for the Terran Rebellion.
name: Mr. Sisko's Interceptor*
text: May take off or land once each turn. X=3 vs. [KCA]

lore: Surgically-altered human thief. Captain Kirk was under secret orders from Starfleet Intelligence.
name: Centurion Kirk* *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Computer Skill If [Fed], gains <Rom>. DL/ {Romulan Cloaking Device} May meet any Intelligence requirement with SECURITY.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Born in LaBarre, France. Has an artificial heart. Reads Shakespeare. Something of a Renaissance man.
name: Jean-Luc Picard *VP
text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Archaeology Navigation Music

lore: Covetous commander of the Starship Defiant. A soldier all his life, Jonathan Archer was romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato.
name: Commander Archer *VP
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 SECURITY Stellar Cartography Leadership Navigation DL/ {Watch Dog} DL/ {Tyranny}

lore: In the more primitive areas of the galaxy, such as the Delta Quadrant and 1986 Earth, medical supplies and those trained in their use are equally rare.
name: Medical Crisis *VP
text: Randomly select a MEDICAL personnel. Killed if [Kaz] or [Vid], "stopped" otherwise. To get past requires 2 Biology and (2 MEDICAL OR a Nurse).

lore: Starbase 247 commander Admiral Riker could request a ship for his old captain but hesitated to anger the Klingon Empire.
name: You Know I'd Like to Help
text: Seeds or plays on your facility. If your facility commander aboard, your matching ship reporting here may do so for free (once per game per facility commander). (Unique.)

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kang. Transported its commander and his comrades to Secarus IV in 2370, to confront the Albino in his stronghold.
name: I.K.S. Lukara *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: The Vidiians use scout ships to explore uncharted space. One such vessel hid within the reflective interior of an asteroid to avoid detection and retain its cargo of harvested organs.
name: Scout Encounter *VP
text: Opponent may download to this location one scout ship with one or two [Univ] crew members. That ship may (if possible) initiate battle against you or move away.

lore: High-res encoding of 20th century rock 'n' roll, known for its enervating rhythms and unbearable volume. "You don't know what we can find... on a Magic Carpet Ride."
name: Magic Carpet Ride OCD *VP
text: May seed at a space location. Owner may relocate any ship at this location (and ship's Away Teams, if any) to any planet location on spaceline. Discard artifact.

lore: With a damaged Malon freighter leaking theta radiation, the Doctor developed an inoculation to allow U.S.S. Voyager to beam over an away team to conduct repairs.
name: Theta-Radiation Poisoning *VP
text: Play on any ship or outpost here (opponent's choice). End of each turn, one personnel present without {Medical Kit} killed (random selection). Cure with 6 ENGINEER.

name: The First Stable Wormhole *VP
text: Seeds on table. You may download {Bajoran Wormhole}(s) (even from outside the game). When your ship travels through Bajoran Wormhole, you may discard a card from hand to download {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (even from discard pile). Your [GQ] missions are span -1 for your [DS9] ships. Doubles point boxes of your {File Mission Report} (for [GQ] missions) and {Rescue Personnel} (if Away Team on a [GQ] planet).

lore: Isogenic enzyme controlled by the Vorta. Genetically addicted Jem'Hadar need a constant supply of "the white" to stay alive. Withdrawal prevents shrouding and leads to killing rampages.
name: Ketracel-White *VP
text: Where present, prevents "white deprivation." Counts down only if you have [KW] personnel present. (Your Vorta may "ration" just one Ketracel-White present to count down.)

lore: Captain Kirk was captured by the Vians on Minara II in 2268. He was subjected to intense physiological and psychological torment to explore the nature of self-sacrifice.
name: Torture *VP
text: Plays on a personnel you've captured. When countdown expires, captive dies and owner loses points (including any {Madred} bonuses).

lore: After moving up through the ranks aboard Enterprise, Lt. Sulu was given the captaincy he deserved in 2290. Holds loyalty in high regard, his crew as dear as family.
name: Captain Sulu *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Honor Physics SCIENCE

lore: 20th-century marine biologist. Helped Admiral Kirk safely bring George and Gracie to the 23rd century, where she then signed on aboard a Starfleet science vessel.
name: Dr. Gillian Taylor *VP
text: CIVILIAN May exclude {George and Gracie} from any personnel battle or random selection here. Biology SCIENCE

lore: Banished from Vulcan, Sybok urged people to face their pain and draw strength from it.
name: A Passionate Vulcan
text: Unless Mindmeld and Anthropology present, opponent may download (or relocate) {Sybok} here and may download {Release This Pain} onto one of your personnel present (random selection). Discard dilemma.

lore: The Son'a used transporter drones to forcibly relocate anyone interfering with their harvest of metaphasic radiation.
name: Attack of the Drones
text: Opponent may download up to three {Transporter Drones} to this planet. Three personnel (random selection) face the Drones as if in personnel battle, then are stopped; lose 3 points for each personnel captured.

lore: Admiral Kirk and Captain Spock found their progress on 20th-century Earth slowed by obscure and archaic financial practices.
name: Exact Change
text: To get past requires exactly 50 CUNNING from all Away Team members. May nullify by stopping two personnel (opponent's choice) until end of next turn.

lore: With the Genesis Planet collapsing, Admiral Kirk impersonated Kruge in order to secure his and Captain Spock's escape aboard a Klingon Bird-of-Prey. "Activate beam!"
name: Jol Yichu'!
text: Unless Anthropology in Away Team and Transporter Skill on your staffed ship in orbit, two personnel (opponent's choice) are killed.

lore: Solar research post. Secretly housed Dr. Tolian Soran's trilithium missile project.
name: Amargosa Observatory
text: Plays at {Amargosa}. Once per game, if your {Dr. Tolian Soran} is aboard, you may change the direction of {The Nexus}, then download {Trilithium Weapon} (as if earned).

name: Combined Task Force
text: Plays on table; you may download {Treaty: Federation/Klingon}. Your [DS9] cards may initiate battle against any non-[Fed] and non-[Kli] target. You may only report ships or personnel that are [Fed] or [Kli]. Once each turn, one [DS9] (except [OS] or [MU]) personnel may report for free OR you may nullify {Homefront} present with your V.I.P. Nullified if you control a Nor.

name: The Warp Five Program
text: Seeds or plays on {Seat of Starfleet}. Mission specialists you download may download here. Just after your [Sta] personnel reports here, you may relocate them to your NX-class ship in the Alpha Quadrant. If the first mission you solve is [S], score 10 points. Nullified if you have more than one ship (except shuttlepods) in play.

lore: "...KHAN!"
name: Khan!
text: Just after an opponent scores bonus points, nullify those points. OR Nullifies {The Genesis Effect}.

lore: Take desperate action to repel relentless adversary.
name: Battle of Sector 001
text: 6 [Ent-E] personnel *+25 if your total WEAPONS>24 here. Opponent's side: OFFICER x6 You may start {Borg Ship} dilemma here. Points: [40]

lore: Perform routine observations of yellow giant star.
name: Conduct Stellar Research
text: Astrophysics x2 + Stellar Cartography + Physics When seeded, you may download {Amargosa Observatory}. Opponent's side: No gametext.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Search northern territory for evidence of long-dead settlers.
name: Investigate Probe Origin
text: {Kamin} + CUNNING>30 OR Archaeology x3 Opponent's side: CUNNING>30 OR Archaeology x3

lore: Ensure mines operate at peak efficiency.
name: Supervise Dilithium Mine
text: Geology + OFFICER + SECURITY + STRENGTH>34 When seeded, you may download {Process Ore: Mining} here. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Defeat nemesis among starship-debilitating ionized gases.
name: Vanquish Enemy
text: Leadership x2 + (Treachery OR Honor) + CUNNING>50 Once per game, may [Flip][Flip] opponent's ship here.

name: Facilitate Peace Talks
text: Seeds or plays on {Khitomer}; download {Treaty: Federation/Klingon}. Your [Films] personnel may attempt mission with the following requirements: Diplomacy x2 + Leadership x2 + INTEGRITY>40 When you solve, you may download up to two [Films] personnel of different affiliations here.

name: Prepare Landing Party
text: Plays on your [P] mission. At the start of your first mission attempt here, you may download one [Univ][OS] SECURITY personnel OR one [OS] equipment to Away Team. If three unique [OS] personnel with different classifications are present when you solve mission, discard objective to score points and/or draw 3 cards. Nullified if you play (or have played) a non-[OS] personnel.

name: Reunite Legends
text: Seeds or plays on your outpost. Once per game, you may download a matching [Films] ship here (except {I.K.S. Kla'Diyus}). When your crew completes a [S] mission aboard a [Films] ship, if crew included at least seven unique [Films] personnel at start of attempt, discard objective to score points.

name: Set a Course for Home
text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. If you have solved two [DQ] missions, your {U.S.S. Voyager} may move between any spaceline end and this mission using its full RANGE. Your Away Team of only [DQ][Fed] personnel may attempt this mission with the following requirements: Navigation x2 + OFFICER x2 + CUNNING>40

name: The Inner Light
text: Seeds or plays on {Parvenium System}; download and seed {Ressikan Flute} here. Your personnel may attempt this mission. When you acquire Ressikan Flute, choose a personnel (they are now Kamin). When Kamin helps solve a planet mission, you may download {Drought Tree} there. (If on {Kataan} or Kamin is {Jean-Luc Picard}, double Drought Tree points and they may not be nullified.) (Unique.)

lore: The seat of the Terran Empire has been located in numerous places including San Francisco and Kyoto.
name: Imperial Palace
text: Seeds or plays on [MQ] {2155 Earth}. Once per turn, one [Sta] personnel may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Hoshi Sato seized command of the Starship Defiant and declared herself Empress of the Terran Empire.
name: Comm Officer Sato
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Anthropology Computer Skill Doubles {Male's Love Interest}.

lore: Prototype Terran flagship commanded by Captain Forrest. Later captained by Commander Archer.
name: I.S.S. Enterprise NX-01
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][TE] aboard (limit 4). DL/ {Suliban Cloaking Device}

lore: Reliance on automation can be dangerous. In 2268, shipboard tests of the M-5 multitronic unit with a skeleton crew resulted in the unit defending itself with deadly force.
name: Multitronic Menace
text: If ship has any attribute > number of personnel in crew, kills a unique personnel (random selection) for each of this ship's staffing icons. Mission continues.

lore: In the 22nd century, cloaking devices were rare. The Suliban were one of the few sources of such technology.
name: Suliban Cloaking Device
text: May report to your [22] ship (for free if Suliban). While aboard your ship, that ship has a Cloaking Device. Counts down only if you have any cards in hand.

lore: After attacking San Francisco, Empress Sato moved her throne to Kyoto.
name: 22nd-Century Japan
text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Imperial Palace} here; any players may download {UFP: One Small Step}. Native to this timeline: all [MU][Sta] cards, [MU][Non][22] personnel, [MU][Neu][22] cards, and [22] equipment. Non-[22] cards are excluded from battle here.

lore: Representative of junior science officers seeking out new worlds and civilizations to conquer. Obsessive collector of rare gemstones.
name: Ensign Guerrero
text: SCIENCE Smuggling Stellar Cartography Geology

lore: NCC-1764. Responded to a Tholian distress call in 2268 and entered an area of spatial interphase. Emerged in the 22nd century mirror universe.
name: Starship Defiant
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Terran Flagship}

lore: Weakened area of space where universes overlap.
name: Vintaak Disappearance Site (back)*
text: Any player's ship with Tractor Beam, 4 SCIENCE, and CUNNING>40 aboard may commandeer {Starship Defiant} here. At the end of each of your turns, flip this card over.

lore: Site of concealed Tholian base used to study mysterious vessel.
name: Vintaak Drydock Station
text: Seeds on table; download {Starship Defiant} here from outside the game, uncontrolled. Any player may beam personnel from their ship here aboard Starship Defiant; may be commandeered by unopposed Away Team with 2 ENGINEER, OFFICER, SECURITY and STRENGTH>50 aboard. At the end of each of your turns, flip this card over.

lore: What constitutes a winning hand in fizzbin depends on the day of the week and whether it's dark outside. It's one of the few card games that requires its own glossary.
name: A Real Game
text: Seeds or plays on table. Players need an additional 10 points to win the game. Nullified if any player has solved or scouted three or more missions. (Cumulative.)

lore: Typical Andorian dissident serving aboard the I.S.S. Avenger. Sensor specialist and aspiring pilot. He enjoys old stories of the Andorian Imperial Guard.
name: Crewman Gham
text: OFFICER Archaeology SCIENCE Honor

name: Radiation Monitoring
text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard a card from hand to make your [Sta][TE] ship attributes +1 until the start of your next turn (limit +3). Also, while you have no cards in hand, you may ignore your opponent's {Containment Field} when using a DL/ on your [Sta][TE] personnel.

lore: First Terran to make contact with an alien species. Zefram Cochrane likes rum, country music, guns, and women in uniform. Demanded a statue.
name: Dr. Cochrane
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics Treachery DL/ {Zefram Cochrane's Shotgun}

name: UFP: One Small Step
text: Plays on table. Your [Sta] personnel may attempt non-homeworld [FED] missions. While all your personnel are [AU] and the same affiliation, each of your personnel (and ships) are CUNNING (or RANGE) +1. OR Seeds or plays on a time location. Any ship may move between this time location and another time location in the same quadrant with a matching year by using 4 RANGE.

lore: Self-taught Terran biochemist serving in Mr. Sisko's crew. Typical female mercenary. Cook who often mediates shipboard conflicts. Plays the flute.
name: Carri
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Music Law

lore: After years of oppression by their Terran colleagues, the powerful threat of the Starship Defiant incited many within the Empire to rise up.
name: Alien Conspiracy
text: Choose one personnel in crew or Away Team for each Dissident your opponent has in play. Your opponent chooses up to two of those personnel to be killed.

lore: Many cultures have elaborate ceremonies. Jean-Luc Picard used the ja'chuq, a lengthy recitation of victories, to delay the selection of a new Klingon High Council leader.
name: Archaic Ritual
text: To get past, two personnel in crew or Away Team with the highest STRENGTH and one additional personnel with highest remaining CUNNING are stopped.

lore: Denying the Tholian "visitor" the extreme environmental conditions it required to survive proved to be an effective way of extracting information - and killing the troublesome guest.
name: Will You Kindly Die?
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, if you have no cards in hand, you may make your opponent choose and discard one of their universal personnel in play.

lore: Sadistic physiologist whose finesse was useful to the Empire. The Denubulan doctor Phlox was courted by the rebels and became a reluctant dissident.
name: Chief Surgeon Phlox
text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 SCIENCE Biology Physics DL/ {Will You Kindly Die?}

name: Declare New Sovereign
text: Plays on table if your {Consolidate Power} complete. When the Contender helps solve a matching homeworld, objective complete (once per game): Place objective in point area, the Contender is now an Emperor (or Empress), and once each turn you may stop that personnel to either draw four cards OR download a personnel.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bodyguard; MACO; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Opportunistic sergeant romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato. Travis Mayweather is a MACO and bodyguard to Commander Archer.
name: Sergeant Mayweather
text: SECURITY Anthropology

lore: While Dr. Farallon's exocomps proved useful as tools, their potential sentience led to conflict over whether they should be sacrificed to save humanoid lives.
name: Quality of Life
text: Opponent may draw a card for each [Equipment] present. To get past requires an [Equipment] (your choice, discarded) OR Cybernetics and 2 Law OR 4 ENGINEER OR {Exocomp}.

lore: Faced with time-consuming repairs, Chief Engineer Tucker was initially unaware that the sabotage was due to a suggestion implanted in his mind by Commander T'Pol.
name: Reflections
text: Randomly stops half of crew (round down). If opponent has no cards in hand, those personnel are killed instead. Nullify with a personnel with Mindmeld and Treachery.

lore: Keeping her powers secret, Amanda Rogers protected the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise from minor mishaps. A crisis in engineering ultimately forced her to reveal herself.
name: Amanda Rogers: Protector
text: Seeds or plays on table. Nullify a non-[Ref] interrupt; if you have any cards in hand, place that interrupt atop owner's draw deck. Discard event.

lore: Although Starfleet regulations normally prohibit a starship commander from leading away missions, a captain can ignore such directives if it suits their interests or experience.
name: Captain's Prerogative
text: Plays on table. While you have no cards in hand, if the matching commander of a ship you have in play helps solve a mission, score 5 points. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Although junior officers can be impulsive and exuberant, a commanding officer relies on their quick reactions for timely protection.
name: Loyal Subordinate
text: Plays on table. While you have no cards in hand, your [Cmd] personnel cannot be captured or killed by opponent's dilemmas; stopped instead. (Captain's Order.)

lore: In times of crisis, those who wear the uniform have to be prepared for any contingency.
name: Security Drills
text: Plays on table. Name a skill (or two skills if you have no cards in hand). Your [DS9][Fed] and MACO personnel may use 2 SECURITY as the named skill(s).

lore: With help from Geordi La Forge, Jean-Luc Picard was able to steal Ardra's magic tricks, revealing her fraud and rendering the "mythical being" powerless.
name: Technical Wizardry
text: Plays on table. While you have no cards in hand, your events are immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.

lore: The capture of the technologically sophisticated Starship Defiant significantly advanced the Terran Empire.
name: Terran Flagship: Predator
text: Plays on your unique, non-[MU] ship at a Mirror Quadrant location. Ship gains [MU] and [TE], is attributes all +4, replaces each staffing icon with [TE][TE], and once per game may nullify a [P] dilemma here (if at a [MU] mission).

lore: Powerful dictatorships like the Terran Empire have traditionally gained additional manpower by creating a pervasive climate of fear.
name: Tyranny
text: Plays on table. At the start of your turn, if you had no cards in hand when your turn began, you may download to hand a [MU][22] card or an [AU] event. (Cumulative.)

lore: In the mirror universe, the Terran system is the heart of the Terran Empire. The Terran Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
name: Imperial Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [Sta][TE] ENGINEER. DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

lore: As humanity explored further into deep space, Starfleet established outposts throughout its expanding territory.
name: Starfleet Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [Sta] ENGINEER. DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

name: Watch Dog
text: Plays on table if you have three [Sta][TE] personnel in play. Once each turn, you may play an [Event] with a countdown for free. Place any cards drawn at the end of your turn face down beneath this incident. At the start of your turn, take all cards from beneath this incident into hand. While you have cards in hand, your personnel lose their first-listed skill. (Unique.)

lore: Repatriate historic object to reliquary on the Vulcan homeworld.
name: Deliver Ancient Artifact
text: Archaeology + Exobiology + Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>37 OR any artifact with "Vulcan" in title or lore

lore: Subdue menacing life-forms disrupting mining operations on resource-rich planet.
name: Incapacitate Inhabitants
text: SECURITY + Exobiology + Geology + Treachery * -5 points if opponent's 3 MEDICAL here.

lore: Lead bold assault on Klingon homeworld to destabilize Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
name: Launch Military Strike
text: OFFICER + STRENGTH>44 + 2[TE] OR [Sta] Emperor When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Conduct covert cultural research on former Starfleet homeworld.
name: Monitor Population
text: Anthropology + SCIENCE + Treachery x2

lore: Covertly monitor former incursion site for further transdimensional incidents.
name: Observe Spatial Coordinates
