text: SECURITY + Navigation + CUNNING>30 * +5 points if ship has Cloaking Device.

lore: Destabilize independent Terran colony reliant on artificial habitat.
name: Sabotage Biosphere
text: Geology + OFFICER + ENGINEER x2 * +5 points if opponent's objective in play.

lore: Bypass chain of command to coordinate strike on subversives.
name: Unsanctioned Attack
text: Treachery x2 + CUNNING>35 + discard one [Cmd] personnel

name: Assert Authority
text: Seeds on table. If, at the end of your turn, your staffed ship with a unique [MU][22] personnel aboard is at a mission opponent seeded (or a [Univ] mission), objective complete (once per game): Place objective in point area, place a copy of the unique personnel (the Contender) beneath objective from outside the game, draw a card, and you may download {Betray Captain}.

name: Betray Captain
text: Plays on table if your {Assert Authority} complete. If, at the end of your turn, your ship is at your unique mission with its matching commander and the Contender aboard, kill that commander; objective complete (once per game): Place objective in point area, the Contender is now the matching commander of that ship, draw two cards, and you may download {Consolidate Power}.

name: Consolidate Power
text: Plays on table if your {Betray Captain} complete. If you just won a battle involving at least two of your ships and the Contender, objective complete (once per game): Place objective in point area, the Contender is now an Admiral, your ship the Contender is aboard is attributes all +2, draw three cards, and you may download {Declare New Sovereign}.

lore: Typical humanoid slave laborer reporting to Slar. His knowledge of alien cultures and anatomy did little to aid the reverse-engineering of the Starship Defiant.
name: Haon Obst
text: CIVILIAN Honor Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Typical military leader. Briefly served as president of the Imperial Commission for Loyalty. Terran commander of the I.S.S. Avenger.
name: Admiral Black
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Law Leadership Greed

lore: Confident captain in the Terran Empire. Maxwell Forrest has friends in high places. Romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato.
name: Captain Forrest
text: OFFICER Treachery Leadership Law Archaeology Biology Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: Talented Terran engineer recommended for his position by Admiral Black. Charles Tucker III has absorbed dangerously high levels of delta radiation.
name: Chief Engineer Tucker
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill Cybernetics DL/ {Technical Wizardry}

lore: Covetous commander of the Starship Defiant. A soldier all his life, Jonathan Archer was romantically involved with Comm Officer Sato.
name: Commander Archer
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 SECURITY Stellar Cartography Leadership Navigation DL/ {Watch Dog} DL/ {Tyranny}

lore: Dutiful commander. Vulcan dissident loyal to Captain Forrest. T'Pol was romantically involved with Chief Engineer Tucker during her last Pon farr.
name: Commander T'Pol
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Hinder Progress}

lore: Typical Terran MACO. Defended Commander Archer from a Gorn attack aboard the Starship Defiant.
name: Corporal Scott
text: SECURITY Honor MEDICAL Geology Astrophysics

lore: Representative of Terran engineers. An expert in radiation effects on physiology. From Tosche Station, Luna. He likes to tinker with power converters.
name: Crewman Biggs
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Exobiology

lore: One of many subjugated Orion slave girls serving on Imperial Starfleet vessels. Dissident who is popular among her crewmates.
name: Crewman D'Vela
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Navigation MEDICAL DL/ {Seductive Dance}

lore: Typical Tellarite once suspected of being late for his duty shift. Became a dissident after spending time in the agony booth. Misses singing in the mud bath.
name: Crewman Terev
text: OFFICER Music Computer Skill Exobiology

lore: Idealist and mentor to Commander T'Pol. Soval thought he was too old to become a revolutionary. Vulcan dissident. Commanded the I.S.S. Avenger.
name: Crewman Soval
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Biology Exobiology Geology Anthropology

lore: Terran who helped repair the Starship Defiant. Kelby covets Chief Engineer Tucker's position. Fascinated by methods of achieving enlightenment.
name: Ensign Kelby
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Meditation}

lore: Enthusiastic major, MACO, and opportunistic assassin. Second officer Malcolm Reed is largely credited with the creation of the agony booth.
name: Major Reed
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery Physics DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tense Situation}

lore: One of many Terran soldiers. Considered a career in the sciences before becoming a MACO. Distrusts his non-Terran crewmates, particularly Vulcans.
name: Private Brown
text: SECURITY Biology Archaeology Leadership

lore: Representative of female MACO soldiers who worked closely with Major Reed and Sergeant Mayweather.
name: Private Palmer
text: OFFICER Youth Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical Terran tasked with procuring specimens for the medical bay. MACO interrogator entrusted by Major Reed to oversee the agony booth.
name: Sergeant Moreno
text: SECURITY Biology MEDICAL Acquisition DL/ {Agony Booth}

lore: Admiral's ship, NX-09. Captained by Admiral Black in the Empire's fight against the rebellion and later commanded by Crewman Soval in the strike back.
name: I.S.S. Avenger
text: DL/ {Radiation Monitoring} X=2 in [MU]

lore: Destroyer used by the Terran Empire. Backbone of the fleet. Frequently used as support for the larger NX-class battle cruisers.
name: Imperial Interceptor
text: X=3 at a [P] mission.

name: Phase Cannons
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Starfleet ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
name: I.K.S. Bortas *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Son of M'Rel. Leader of the Klingon High Council after defeating the Duras forces in the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
name: Gowron *VP
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor

lore: An unstable tunnel through subspace that links to locations in normal space/time.
name: Wormhole *VP
text: Requires two wormholes. Play one on your ship. Play the other at any location (even a time location). Ship relocates to that location (and then is stopped).

lore: Have a good, relaxing holiday on the pleasure planet.
name: Risa Shore Leave *VP
text: Music + Youth + CIVILIAN x2 + Female + Male

characteristicsKeywords: Duras-related; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Warship commanded by Duras Son of Toral. Pursued rebels from Raatooras. Once engaged Enterprise in combat.
name: Battle Cruiser Bortas *VP
text: Tractor Beam. Attributes all +1 for each [Kli][22][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
name: Enterprise* *VP
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

lore: Harassed by marauding Klingons, deuterium miners found they needed both guts and guile to protect their assets.
name: A Miner Confrontation
text: To get past requires three personnel with Leadership OR three personnel with ENGINEER classification.

lore: Many ships have secure areas to store valuable or dangerous materials. Only trusted officers can access such places. In 2151, unknown privateers searched for a vault on Enterprise.
name: Authorized Access Only
text: To get past requires three personnel with Acquisition OR three personnel with OFFICER classification.

lore: Misplacing advanced technology can endanger both the development of pre-warp societies and those studying them.
name: Contaminating a Culture
text: To get past requires 2 Anthropology; then place on mission until solved. If any equipment is discarded here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).

lore: Preserved in the Arctic ice for 90 years, two cybernetic bodies posed more of a threat than initially suspected.
name: Defrosted Menace
text: Unless 2 Biology, 2 Archaeology, and 2 SCIENCE present, place on mission. Now and start of every player's turn, their opponent (if playing Borg) assimilates their lowest CUNNING personnel here.

lore: The Kreetassans were deeply insulted when Porthos urinated on an alvera tree. Considering the plants cultural treasures, they demanded a ritualistic apology from Jonathan Archer.
name: Faux Pas
text: To get past requires three personnel with Diplomacy OR three personnel with V.I.P. classification.

lore: During the Earth-Romulan War, MACO soldiers served on the front lines as ground troops. Some later found it hard to find a role in peacetime.
name: MACO Encounter
text: Opponent may download up to two MACOs and/or one {MACO Assault Rifle} to planet. Any MACOs on planet may (if possible) initiate personnel battle. Discard dilemma.

lore: While exploring a trinary system containing a black hole, unusual radiation caused the Enterprise crew to exhibit erratic and obsessive behavior.
name: Preoccupied
text: Place on ship. Double first and second listed skill and removes all other skills on each non-Vulcan personnel aboard.

lore: After sabotaging the Xindi weapon, Jonathan Archer was caught in the explosion and vanished. He awoke, trapped in the past, striving to put right what had gone wrong.
name: Quantum Leap
text: One OFFICER (opponent's choice) is relocated to a time location (your choice); "disappears" (discarded) if none in play. To get past requires SECURITY and 2 Archaeology.

lore: An Enterprise away team was exposed to a psychotropic compound in 2151. Experiencing intense anxiety and hallucinations, they claimed to see beings inside solid rock.
name: Rock People
text: To get past requires three personnel with Geology OR three personnel with SCIENCE classification.

lore: Unidentified hostile vessel. Delayed Enterprise in 2151 until its phase cannon upgrades were completed.
name: Silent Enemy
text: Immediately battles attempting ship when encountered. End of every turn: Stops each ship here without CUNNING>30 aboard until end of owner's next turn, then moves.

lore: After the Eugenics Wars of the 20th century, human genetic engineering was outlawed. An encounter with hostile augments in 2154 reaffirmed the need for the ban.
name: Stand-Off
text: To get past requires three personnel with Anthropology OR three personnel with SECURITY classification.

lore: A highly contagious disease which kills its victims through increased body temperature and destruction of blood vessel walls. Samples were kept at Cold Station 12 in 2154.
name: Symbalene Blood Burn
text: Kills one personnel (random selection). Place on facility here (your choice, quarantined). Now and start of each turn, kills one personnel aboard (your choice).

lore: Trapped in the transporter pattern buffer, Hoshi Sato had an elaborate hallucination about a fictional transporter test subject, alien saboteurs, and her own disappearance.
name: The Ghost of Cyrus Ramsey
text: To get past requires three personnel with Transporter Skill OR three personnel with MEDICAL classification.

lore: Even the small-scale test of the Xindi weapon in 2153 caused massive destruction.
name: Xindi Test Strike
text: Kills two personnel (random selection) and discards one personnel or empty ship (opponent's choice) at a corresponding time location. Nullify with 3 SECURITY OR a Xindi.

name: Temporal Conduit
text: Seeds on table. Your [AU] cards may seed and play (one per turn). Twice each turn, you may place a card from hand beneath draw deck to relocate your Away Team or staffed ship from a time location to the corresponding spaceline location, or vice versa. Once per game, you may download {Stone Knives and Bearskins} OR {Out of Time} OR {Temporal Investigations}.

lore: Generic phaser rifle developed for use by United Earth military forces. Produces rapid-fire discharges of energy ideal for combating multiple assailants.
name: MACO Assault Rifle
text: MACO use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

lore: Knowing death is around every corner, soldiers often form close bonds with each other. The sense of camaraderie leads to improved teamwork and increased confidence.
name: Combat-Ready: Solidarity
text: Plays on table. MACOs cannot be killed by dilemmas (stopped instead) when present with two other unstopped MACOs.

lore: The resilient MACOs were keen to volunteer for a unified assault team with their Starfleet colleagues and stop the Xindi weapon, even after the tragic loss of Jeremiah Hayes.
name: Combat-Ready: Tense Situation
text: Plays on your MACO or your bodyguard; they gain Leadership. Each of your other leaders present gains SECURITY and is attributes all +1.

lore: Prior to the invention of the transporter biofilter, Starfleet away teams routinely spent several minutes in decontamination chambers after returning from missions.
name: Decontamination
text: Plays on table (for free). Once per game, if your [Sta] personnel have faced dilemmas at three different missions, you may discard event to score points.

lore: The grappler technology used on Starfleet vessels in the 22nd century aided docking and loading procedures but also had more unorthodox applications.
name: Grappler: Shuttlepod Retrieval
text: Plays on table. Your [Sta] ships with at least one staffing icon gain Tractor Beam. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} if all your personnel are [22].)

lore: Part of the United Earth military with technology two to three years more advanced than that of Starfleet. MACO troops were assigned to Enterprise in 2153.
name: Military Assault Command Operations
text: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. You may report for free any MACO personnel revealed; place all other cards revealed beneath draw deck. Discard event.

lore: In the 22nd century, Starfleet vessels used electromagnetic stiffening mechanisms to mitigate damage from enemy weapons.
name: Polarized Hull Plating
text: Plays on table. Discard event to nullify one damage marker about to be placed on your [22] ship. (Captain's Order.)

name: Gold!
text: Seeds on table. Once every turn, when one of your personnel is eligible for random selection, you may ask "Where's the Vault?" to pass this card to opponent (they now control it). If you do not, selection is instead opponent's choice. (May also be passed to opponent at start of your turn.) Worth points; X varies, where X=number of times passed. (Not duplicatable.)

name: Klingon Imperial Court
text: Plays on {Hall of Magistrates}. Adds a Brig to each of your [Kli] outposts. Once each turn, your [Kli] personnel (and any captives present) may relocate from here to {Rura Penthe} (and vice-versa) or to your [Kli][22] ship in the Alpha Quadrant. Worth points while you have three or more captives on Rura Penthe.

name: Launch Bay
text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of a card draw, you may download one [Sta] shuttlepod to hand. Once per game, you may download {Grappler} and/or {Emergency Evacuation}. Your [Sta] shuttlepods may be loaded aboard (limit 4) and launched from your NX-class ships with Tractor Beam. Your [Sta] shuttlepods may land on or take off from planets using 1 RANGE.

name: Reed Alert!
text: Plays to download to your [22] ship its matching commander OR to download any two of the following: {Straight and Steady} OR {Explore New World} OR {Polarized Hull Plating} OR {Expert Pilot}. (Captain's Order.)

name: Sickbay: Menagerie
text: Plays on your [22] ship with at least one staffing icon. Thrice per game, you may stop your [22] MEDICAL personnel aboard to prevent one personnel present from being assimilated, controlled by {Ceti Eel}, or killed by a dilemma; personnel is stopped instead. May be nullified by {Plasma Fire}.

lore: Soldiers are trained to quickly assess and handle a variety of technological obstacles, even under pressure.
name: Combat-Ready: Jury-Rig
text: Plays on your MACO or Miracle Worker. Until end of turn, that personnel is attributes all +2 and gains ENGINEER, Transporter Skill, and Computer Skill.

lore: Military officers can quickly redeploy forces to where thy can be of the most use.
name: Combat-Ready: Tactical Reserve
text: Plays on your [Cmd] personnel. Relocate one of your unstopped matching SECURITY-classification personnel from a mission in same quadrant to this personnel.

lore: Klingons are extremely territorial. There is no such thing as an insignificant corner of Klingon space.
name: Klingon Border Patrol
text: Plays on your [Kli][22] ship present with an opponent's ship. If this ship is present with an opponent's ship at end of your next turn, score points.

lore: Victims of the Klingon justice system, such as Jonathan Archer, soon learned that Klingons had little tolerance for escapees.
name: Klingon Bounty
text: Once per game, plays on an opponent's ship at same location as your 2 [Kli][22] SECURITY. One personnel aboard (random selection) is captured (relocated to those SECURITY).

lore: Battle adversary at Klingon colony world.
name: Battle of Narendra III
text: Leadership + SECURITY + Honor x2 + [AU] ship with WEAPONS>7 Opponent's side: [ROM][KLI] Leadership + SECURITY + Treachery x2 + ship with WEAPONS>7

lore: Test security vulnerabilities of harsh work camp and devise escape plan.
name: Escape Gulag
text: Geology + Transporter Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>36 Opponent's side: [KLI] SECURITY x2 + Geology + ENGINEER + Law

lore: Drill into giant comet and collect sample of scarce eisilium.
name: Extract Rare Mineral
text: SCIENCE + Geology + (Tractor Beam OR INTEGRITY>32) * +5 if any shuttlepod or [Vul] ship here.

lore: Protect civilian transports along vital shipping lane.
name: Police Trade Route
text: MEDICAL + SECURITY + OFFICER + (Honor OR Treachery) + (STRENGTH>42 OR Guramba)

lore: Examine site of unprovoked assault on the Starfleet homeworld.
name: Research Devastating Attack
text: Diplomacy + Exobiology + Archaeology + Anthropology

lore: Recover technology previously lost on less-advanced planet.
name: Retrieve Materiel
text: Anthropology + Transporter Skill + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download one [22][Equipment] here.

lore: Examine plasma phenomena traveling at high warp.
name: Study Neutronic Storm
text: Navigation + CUNNING>41 + (SCIENCE + Biology OR SECURITY + Stellar Cartography)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Study habitable planet with novel ecosystems.
name: Survey New World
text: OFFICER + SCIENCE + Exobiology + CUNNING>32 *+5 if landed ship or {Environmental Suit} here.

lore: Attend survival school on the surface of Earth's moon.
name: Survival Training
text: OFFICER x2 + 6 MACOs

name: Explore New World
text: Plays on your unexamined planet mission. You may not voluntarily use transporters here. If your entire Away Team (containing three or more [Sta] personnel) was just stopped by a dilemma here, you may download one equipment here. When mission solved by your [Sta] Away Team, you may unstop all your Away Teams here, restore full RANGE to one of your [Sta] ships in orbit and/or download {Diverse Experiences}.

name: Operate Dilithium Gulag
text: Seeds or plays on {Rura Penthe}; rotate mission so that your side now faces opponent. Once per game, at the start of your turn, you may download one personnel with "Rura Penthe" in lore to hand. While you have a captive (or any personnel with "Prisoner" in title) here, you may draw one additional card at the end of each turn. Once solved, each of your [Kli] ships is RANGE +2.

name: Search and Seize
text: Plays on your unexamined [KLI][S] mission. Each time your crew of only [Kli][22] personnel overcomes a dilemma here, reveal top card of opponent's draw deck. If it is a personnel, opponent reports that personnel (if possible) to {Rura Penthe} (captured); discard otherwise. Once solved, increases point box of Rura Penthe by 10 points while a captive is there. (Unique.)

lore: Identification: HARVEST DRONE Task: Identify targets in Sector 001. Engage. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Four of Fifty
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Exobiology May download {One with the Borg} in place of a card draw. DL/ {Orbital Bombardment} OR {Establish Tractor Lock}

lore: Identification: SYNERGY DRONE Task: Recognize optimum performance. Coordinate. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
name: Ten of Fifty
text: Cybernetics Attributes all +2 while sharing skills. Once each turn, may return to hand your non-[BO] Objective in play.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Capturing-related card; Male; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
lore: Courageous Klingon who won over 200 cases in 50 years of legal practice. Defended Prisoner Archer in court on Narendra III. Lost an eye on Rura Penthe.
name: Advocate Kolos
text: CIVILIAN Law x 2 Computer Skill Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Klingon Imperial Court}

lore: Typical of help officers on smaller Klingon ships. Served under Duras Son of Toral in 2153. Pilot particularly practiced at orbital maneuvers.
name: Aklam
text: OFFICER Navigation Astrophysics

lore: Chief engineer of the I.K.S. Somraw who survived Xarantine ale poisoning. Sought to avoid a dishonorable death for herself and her crewmates.
name: Bu'kaH
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill Biology Honor ENGINEER (if aboard a [Kli][22] ship).

lore: Klingon thief who hired bounty hunters to recapture Prisoner Archer. Initially agreed to pay nine thousand darseks but only gave Skalaar six thousand.
name: Captain Goroth
text: OFFICER Greed Treachery Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ {Gold-Pressed Latinum}

lore: Klingon freighter captain. Thief who used intimidation to take deuterium from mining colonies. Ancestor of General Korok. Former pilot.
name: Captain Korok
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Treachery Leadership Geology Acquisition Navigation

lore: Representative of 22nd-century Klingon captains. Raided a Xarantine outpost in 2151. Got more than he bargained for.
name: Captain Monak
text: OFFICER Greed Stellar Cartography Diplomacy (if with {Bu'kaH}).

lore: Commander of a prototype Klingon vessel. Spared a Xyrillian ship in 2151 in exchange for holographic technology.
name: Captain Vorok
text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Holodeck Door}

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Chancellor; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Typical Klingon High Council Leader of the mid-22nd century. Encountered Jonathan Archer in 2151. Rumored to have exotic taste in women.
name: Chancellor M'Rek
text: V.I.P. Leadership Anthropology Geology Klingon Intelligence

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; Duras-related; High Council; Male;
lore: Former captain demoted for failing to locate rebels harbored by Jonathan Archer. Given another chance by the High Council. Ancestor of Ja'rod.
name: Duras Son of Toral
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Leadership SECURITY Greed DL/ {Any [Univ][Kli][22] personnel with "Duras" in lore}

lore: Representative of soldiers aboard Klingon ships in the 22nd century. Cook who excels at preparing pipius claw, Captain Korok's favorite dish.
name: Gonik
text: ENGINEER Navigation Smuggling Astrophysics If with {Captain Korok}, both are attributes all +1.

lore: Typical Klingon female stationed aboard the Battle Cruiser Bortas. Served as yaS wa'DIch, executive officer, under Duras Son of Toral.
name: J'Met
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Treachery Youth Diplomacy (if with {Duras Son of Toral}).

lore: Seven foot tall High Council courier. Met with Sarin on Rigel X. Crashed on Earth in 2151. First Klingon encountered by humans. Treated by Phlox.
name: Klaang
text: SECURITY Navigation Klingon Intelligence Exobiology Anthropology Honor Transporter Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; General; Male; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
lore: Typical Klingon magistrate overseeing the courts on Narendra III. Retired general who sentenced Prisoner Archer to a life of hard labor on Rura Penthe.
name: Magistrate Gorvil
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Archaeology Law

lore: Representative of Klingon bridge officers. Trustworthy member of the I.K.S. Nguq'Yab crew. Bodyguard who often takes the fall for his superiors.
name: Morga
text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Physics

lore: Representative of Klingon mercenaries engaged in less honorable pursuits. Served with Captain Korok in 2152. A competent field nurse.
name: P'Mokh
text: SECURITY Treachery Greed MEDICAL Exobiology

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; Prisoner-related personnel; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
lore: Human captain well-known in the Klingon Empire. Jonathan Archer was convicted of conspiracy and sentenced to a life of hard labor on Rura Penthe.
name: Prisoner Archer
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Physics Honor Navigation May report to {Rura Penthe}.

lore: Klingon lawyer with the ferocity of a warrior. Pursued the death penalty in the Klingon Empire's case against Prisoner Archer.
name: Prosecutor Orak
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Treachery Anthropology Law Archaeology DL/ {Internment}

lore: Aquatic member of Phlox's menagerie. Female osmotic eel with wound-sealing capabilities.
name: Osmotic Eel
text: ANIMAL Once each turn (where present), may nullify {1 Tribble} OR prevent a [22] personnel from being disabled or placed in stasis. Reports for free to {Phlox} or on {Mordan IV}.

lore: One of several Denobulan researchers working on Cold Station 12. He served with Jeremy Lucas in 2154 as a doctor and anatomist.
name: Darrit
text: MEDICAL Anthropology Exobiology Honor Youth

lore: Giant Orion slaver. Runs the slave market on Verex III. Processed T'Pol and Jeffrey Pierce for auction in 2154. Likes to put on a big show.
name: Shobbi-Har
text: SECURITY Leadership Law Treachery Greed DL/ {Gold-Pressed Latinum} OR any Orion slave girl

lore: Bounty hunter. Tellarite freighter captain. Brother of Gaavrin. Captured Jonathan Archer in 2153 but gave him the means to escape the Klingons.
name: Skalaar
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Physics Acquisition DL/ {Captured} DL/ {Escape Pod}

lore: Typical Denobulan geologist. She studied unusual speleothems on Xantoras with Dr. Yolen. Tried to find clues to prevent seismic disasters on Denobula.
name: Trevix
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Geology Diplomacy Biology

lore: Typical MACO corporal. Holds the team sharpshooting record. She once received Vulcan neuro-pressure treatment from Charles Tucker III.
name: Amanda Cole
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Exobiology Computer Skill Stellar Cartography DL/ {Combat-Ready: Jury-Rig}

lore: Typical Starfleet petty officer. She manned the bridge engineering station during Enterprise's battle with a group of augments in 2154.
name: Callaghan
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Stellar Cartography Youth

lore: Experienced corporal who trained with gravity boots at Jupiter Station. MACO assigned to Enterprise in 2153. Goes by her middle name. Always alert.
name: Fiona McKenzie
text: SECURITY Exobiology Leadership Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ {Raktajino}

lore: Conscientious corporal from Hawaii. MACO who joined Enterprise for a crusade into the Delphic Expanse. Feared getting lost. Likes fast motorcycles.
name: Hideaki Chang
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Physics Stellar Cartography Biology Your other MACOs here are attributes all +1.

lore: Arrogant engineer. Believed his promotion to chief engineer of Enterprise was endangered by Charles Tucker III's continued presence.
name: Kelby
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Divert Power} (unless {any Tucker} present).

lore: Diligent major and MACO commander. Expert at both armed and unarmed combat. Found a sparring partner in Malcolm Reed. Likes consistency.
name: Jeremiah Hayes
text: SECURITY Honor OFFICER DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tactical Reserve} Diplomacy Leadership (if no other leader present).

lore: Fanatic who served as chief administrator of the Orpheus Mining Facility. Leader of Terra Prime. Demanded aliens comply with evacuation orders.
name: John Frederick Paxton
text: V.I.P. Leadership Geology Biology ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Greed

lore: Heroic diplomat and greatest explorer of the 22nd century. Captained Enterprise in the 2150s. Saved Earth from the Xindi. Friend of Charles Tucker III.
name: Jonathan Archer (Broken Bow)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership ENGINEER Honor At [S]: Navigation, Anthropology, Physics, Law

lore: Extraction specialist quick to volunteer for dangerous missions. MACO soldier assigned to Enterprise in 2153 under the command of Jeremiah Hayes.
name: Markus Forbes
text: SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership Navigation SCIENCE DL/ {Rescue Captives}

lore: Starfleet executive who authorized the early launch of Enterprise during the Broken Bow incident. Admiral who worked closely with the Vulcans.
name: Maxwell Forrest (Broken Bow)
text: V.I.P. Law Leadership Diplomacy MEDICAL Your [Sta] personnel at [S] missions are attributes all +1.

lore: High-ranking government minister. Ex-mayor who climbed to the top. Former member of Terra Prime. Underestimated Jonathan Archer.
name: Nathan Samuels
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology Exobiology Leadership

lore: Representative of MACO sergeants assigned to Enterprise in 2153. Unaccustomed to life in space, he still visits Phlox every morning.
name: Nelson Kemper
text: SECURITY Archaeology Geology

lore: Alien physiologist who keeps an exotic menagerie. Denobulan doctor and occasional counselor. Has three wives, adhering to his world's polyamorous customs.
name: Phlox (Broken Bow)
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology SCIENCE DL/ {Sickbay} Attributes all +1 for each ANIMAL present.

lore: Typical MACO who serves aboard Enterprise with distinction, despite having been injured more than once. She sometimes picks up the wrong uniform.
name: Sascha Money
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Navigation Physics DL/ {Combat-Ready: Solidarity}

lore: Typical of aggressive MACOs often assigned to boarding parties. Has received extensive EV combat training. Always ready to stretch his legs.
name: Sean Hawkins
text: SECURITY Anthropology ENGINEER Transporter Skill DL/ {Security Sacrifice}

lore: Typical Starfleet engineer. Human from Cleveland, Ohio. His humor helped the crew bear the perils of the various alien quagmires they encountered.
name: Stewart Rivers
text: ENGINEER Navigation Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Duras-related; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Warship commanded by Duras Son of Toral. Pursued rebels from Raatooras. Once engaged Enterprise in combat.
name: Battle Cruiser Bortas
text: Tractor Beam. Attributes all +1 for each [Kli][22][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

lore: Small scout vessel used by the Klingon Empire in the 22nd century. Equipped with photon torpedoes and a hull reinforced with a coherent molecular alloy.
name: I.K.S. Raptor
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Klingon Bounty}

lore: Typical early starship design. Routinely stationed near the Sol system. The Intrepid-type variant became the standard design for this class of vessel.
name: Intrepid
text: X=2 if moving within a region. DL/ {Grappler}

lore: Enterprise shuttlecraft. With transporter technology in its infancy, officers relied on shuttles instead.
name: Shuttlepod One
text: May report (for free) to your NX-class ship. DL/ {Explore New World}

lore: Typical Starfleet shuttlecraft of the mid-22nd century. Has plasma weapons and a ditanium hull.
name: Shuttlepod Two
text: May report with crew (limit one) to your NX-class ship.

lore: Klingon sector judicial authority. Site of several historic trials.
name: Hall of Magistrates
text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of a normal card play, any player may download a [Kli][22] Law personnel here. Native to this timeline: all [Kli][22] cards, all [Non][22] personnel, and all [22] equipment (except [MU] cards). Once per turn, one such personnel reporting at this location may do so for free (if all of that player's Time Locations are 2154).

lore: Military Assault Command Operations established a training facility on Earth's moon.
name: MACO Training Camp
text: Seeds or plays on table. Any player who did not seed Earth may report a MACO for free here (once per turn) and may (if possible) relocate them to his or her NX-class ship. Any such player, in place of a normal card play, you may download {Military Assault Command Operations} (even from discard pile). Native to this time: all [Sta] cards, [Neu][22] cards, and [22] equipment (except [MU] cards).

lore: Engineer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Acted drunk while afflicted by the Tsiolkovsky infection in 2364. www.trekcc.org
name: Jim Shimoda
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Adds 2 to each printed number on {Isolinear Puzzle}.

name: Battle Bridge Door *VP
text: Place one atop Battle Bridge side deck during the seed phase. Battle Bridge is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). OR Stock in deck and play at start of ship battle (even during opponent's turn) if you have Leadership in that battle. Allows you to draw two extra Tactic cards (cumulative) or enhances each of your ships' and facilities' WEAPONS +1; then discard doorway.

lore: Standard Vulcan Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
name: Vulcan PADD
text: Your [22] personnel present are CUNNING +2. Once each turn, one of your personnel present may add a skill from your ship's special equipment here until end of turn. (Unique.)

lore: Handheld phased energy weapon from the 22nd century. Standard issue amongst Vulcan security, although many prefer to use the traditional lirpa.
name: Vulcan Phaser
text: Vulcan use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: The Vulcan High Command maintained a watchful eye on the military capabilities of the aggressive and adversarial Klingon Empire.
name: Espionage: Vulcan on Klingon
text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Vulcan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: The Vulcan High Command uses its influence with other governments to gather intelligence on them, as with its advisory role in the Starfleet Warp Five Program.
name: Espionage: Vulcan on Starfleet
text: Plays on any Starfleet mission. Your Vulcan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Prior to the formation of the Federation, the Vulcan High Command allied with Starfleet to advise on its tentative early footsteps into deep space.
name: Treaty: Starfleet/Vulcan
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Starfleet and Vulcan affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Vulcan is the homeworld of the highly logical Vulcan people. The Vulcan High Command established outposts throughout its territory.
name: Vulcan Outpost
text: Seed one OR build where you have a [Vul] ENGINEER.

name: Kolinahr
text: Seeds or plays on {Vulcan}. Your Vulcan cards may mix and cooperate (regardless of affiliation) and may use Vulcan ships and [Fed] facilities. Once each turn, if you do not have {Protect the Timeline} in play, one personnel may report for free. Twice each turn, your personnel and ships may move between here and {2154 Vulcan}. Discard incident if you play (or have played) any non-Vulcan personnel.

name: Vulcan Database
text: Plays on your [22] ship or {Vulcan Lander}; ship gains one of the following skills as special equipment: ENGINEER, MEDICAL, Anthropology, Astrophysics, Biology, Computer Skill, Exobiology, Geology, Physics, or Stellar Cartography. If a Vulcan aboard, may re-select skill once each turn. OR Plays to draw 2 cards (limit 4) for each of your ships in play with a skill as special equipment.

lore: Illuminate concentrated dark matter using metreon particle bombardment.
name: Excite Dark Matter
text: SCIENCE x2 + Stellar Cartography x2 OR ENGINEER + Astrophysics x2 + Honor

lore: Representative of Syrranite dissidents. Part-time bodyguard. Struggled to maintain emotional control while performing his own musical compositions.
name: Delvok
text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics Biology Music

lore: One of many Vulcans trained in the field of science. Served on the D'kyr in 2152. Worked as a cook in his family's plomeek soup kitchen.
name: Sanye
text: SCIENCE SCIENCE

lore: Typical Vulcan captain. V'Shar agent working for the High Command. Spied on by Shran. Led a rescue mission on Coridan. Often patrols the Klaestron sector.
name: Sopek
text: OFFICER V'Shar Leadership Diplomacy Computer Skill

lore: Vulcan ambassador to Earth. Has liaised between the High Command and many alien nations. Thought it was "a mistake" to return Klaang to Qo'noS alive.
name: Soval
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Leadership x 2 Anthropology DL/ {Team of Ambassadors}

lore: Typical Vulcan doctor. Attended an Interspecies Medical Exchange conference on Dekendi III. Diagnosed T'Pol from residue on a PADD.
name: Strom
text: MEDICAL Exobiology SCIENCE Computer Skill DL/ {Vulcan PADD}

lore: Typical Vulcan High Command security advisor. She contacted T'Pol in 2152 regarding the fugitive Menos. Expert in the Vulcan martial art suus mahna.
name: T'Lam
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Vulcan aide to Soval. She thinks humans are not yet ready for space exploration. Tasked by the High Command to act as Jonathan Archer's first officer.
name: T'Pol (Pre-Warp Pack)
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology DL/ {Vulcan Tricorder} DL/ {Vulcan Database}

lore: Representative of subspace geometry consultants. Vulcan who observed the early NX Program tests on Earth. He later joined the Syrranites as a dissident.
name: Valrik
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Diplomacy DL/ {Warp Core Breach} (tripling requirements).

characteristicsKeywords: Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: 22nd-century mainstay of the Vulcan fleet. Combat cruiser tasked to ferry Phlox and T'Pol home after Enterprise was temporarily recalled in 2152.
name: D'kyr
text: Tractor Beam, SCIENCE

lore: Hoshi Sato seized command of the Starship Defiant and declared herself Empress of the Terran Empire.
name: Comm Officer Sato *VP
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Anthropology Computer Skill Doubles {Male's Love Interest}.

characteristicsKeywords: Betazoid; Ambassador; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: Female Betazoid ambassador who visited DS9 several times. Suffered the effects of Zanthi fever in 2371. Romantically involved with Jeyal and Odo.
name: Lwaxana Troi (20th Anniversary) *VP
text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Odo} (even from your discard pile).

lore: Talaxian jack-of-all-trades. Has served on a Trabalian freighter, mining colony, and Voyager. Serves as cook, morale officer, guide, and sometimes ambassador.
name: Neelix *VP
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Diplomacy ENGINEER Geology

lore: Acquired by Zek from one of his contacts on Cardassia III. The Grand Nagus used the Orb to contact the Prophets, then sold it to the Bajoran government at a substantial profit.
name: Orb of Wisdom *VP
text: Use as Equipment card. Your personnel here are each INTEGRITY +3. Each turn, one of your cards played here plays for free if your [Orb] personnel present. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: When the Federation tried to contact the pre-industrial society on Rubicun III, the Edo Probe demanded in ship-shuddering tones that Jean-Luc Picard "State the purpose!"
name: Edo Probe *VP
text: Abandon mission attempt until any player completes a different mission OR continue but lose points if you do not solve mission this turn.

lore: Cybernetic life forms from a commandeered Earth research transport were able to beam aboard Enterprise without being identified. This led to a nasty surprise for her crew.
name: Undetected Beam-In *VP
text: Opponent may download to this location up to 4 Borg drones or {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} (they do not battle now). Nullify dilemma with {Shelby} OR 4 SECURITY.

lore: Benevolent humanoid from Tau Alpha C who could transcend space and time with thought.
name: The Traveler: Transcendence *VP
text: Place beside any player's draw deck. That player must draw one extra card at the end of each turn. Also, while in play, nullifies {Static Warp Bubble}. (Not cumulative.)

lore: Use natural phenomena to hide from pursuing vessels.
name: Evade Patrolling Squadron *VP
text: Navigation x2 + SCIENCE + CUNNING>30 When seeded, you may download {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Opponent's side: No Gametext.

name: Commandeer Ship *VP
text: Plays on your Computer Skill personnel who is aboard opponent's empty ship (except a Borg cube). That personnel commandeers ship and, while objective in play, may meet up to three of its staffing icons. OR Seeds or plays on table. Opponent may not return to hand any ship which has your personnel aboard as an intruder or infiltrator.

lore: Skilled thief and decryption expert. Bareil Antos was romantically involved with both the Intendant and Kira Nerys, who gave him an Orb experience.
name: Bareil *VP
names: The Intendant;Kira Nerys  The Intendant;Kira Nerys
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill x 2 SECURITY Biology Honor Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Any Equipment card}

lore: Norcadian entertainment producer. Arrogant. Corrupt. Abducts aliens from all over the sector and forces them to fight in the Tsunkatse matches.
name: Penk *VP
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition SECURITY Treachery x 2 Greed DL/ Any other card that has "Tsunkatse" in title or lore

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Dukat. Commandeered near the Cardassian outpost on Korma. Named for Tora Ziyal's mother. Carried Jodmos to Ty'Gokor in 2373.
name: Naprem *VP
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: 20th-century marine biologist. Helped Admiral Kirk safely bring George and Gracie to the 23rd century, where she then signed on aboard a Starfleet science vessel.
name: Dr. Gillian Taylor* *VP
text: CIVILIAN May exclude {George and Gracie} from any personnel battle or random selection here. Biology SCIENCE

lore: Legendary Vulcan artifact containing Surak's original writings. Thought lost for centuries, its rediscovery led to the Vulcan Reformation and a new period of enlightenment.
name: Kir'Shara
text: Immediately play on table; you may download to hand two interrupts with "Vulcan" in title or lore. Your [FED] missions are worth +5 points if a [Vul] personnel helps solve.

lore: Exposure to large concentrations of Trellium-D in the Delphic Expanse disrupted T'Pol's synaptic pathways. Her loss of emotional control endangered other crew members.
name: T'Pol Has Some Issues
text: Place on (stops) a personnel present (random selection). End of each turn, they kill another personnel present with lower INTEGRITY (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 SCIENCE.

lore: Romulan spies were everywhere.
name: Espionage: Romulan on Vulcan
text: Plays on any Vulcan mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Starfleet routinely gathered intelligence on neighboring civilizations, even ostensibly friendly ones such as the Vulcans.
name: Espionage: Starfleet on Vulcan
text: Plays on any Vulcan mission. Your Starfleet personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: The Vulcan High Command routinely monitored the activity of more emotional and aggressive neighboring species, such as the Andorians, from hidden listening posts.
name: Espionage: Vulcan on Andorian
text: Plays on any Non-Aligned mission (or any mission with "Andorian" in lore). Your Vulcan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

lore: Vulcan discipline for relaxing the mind and muscles by stimulating neural nodes and pressure points. Charles Tucker III was one of the few outsiders to experience it.
name: Neuropressure Massage
text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, if all your personnel are Vulcan, you may draw two cards and place one of them beneath draw deck.

lore: The Vulcans approached exploration of other cultures through passive observation and impassionate logic. The High Command encouraged other cultures to adopt similar policies.
name: Strange New Worlds
text: Plays on a mission. (Unique.) Opponent's mission attempts here must use the following requirements: Anthropology + Diplomacy + Law + INTEGRITY>32

lore: Alarmed by the rapid pace at which Starfleet was venturing into deep space, the Vulcan High Command sought to curb humanity's potentially dangerous progress.
name: Temper Advancements
text: Once per game, seeds or plays on table. Each non-[Vul] personnel or ship enters play stopped.

name: Cautionary Tale
text: Seeds or plays on table. If you have three [Vul] personnel in play, your {Abandon Mission}, {Gaps in Normal Space}, {Q-Net}, and {Subspace Warp Rift} gain [Sch] and are unique (even if not in play; if you have multiple in play, discard down to one copy of each). OR Plays to download a [Sch] card (once per game per card title), then discard incident.

name: IDIC: Courage of the V'Shar
text: Plays on table. Your [Vul] personnel may attempt Alpha Quadrant missions requiring SECURITY. When you play (but not download) a Vulcan espionage card, you may draw up to two cards. Once each turn, you may place an Espionage card from hand beneath your deck to download a different Espionage card to hand.

name: IDIC: Power of the High Command
text: Plays on table. Your [Vul] personnel may attempt Alpha Quadrant missions requiring OFFICER. Once each turn, when you play (but not download) a [Sch] card, if you have at least four [Vul] personnel in play, you may draw up to two cards OR (once per game) download to hand a [Vul] ship and its matching commander.

name: IDIC: Wisdom of Surak
text: Plays on table. Your [Vul] personnel may attempt Alpha Quadrant missions requiring Honor. When you play a Vulcan Dissident as your normal card play, you may draw a card. Once per game, you may download {Seek Hidden Reliquary}. Once per game, your Syrranite may use Honor as if it were any other regular skill (lasts until end of turn).

name: Only Logical
text: Plays on your mission (lose points). When attempting this mission, while at least four Vulcans are in crew or Away Team, name a card before each unexamined seed card is revealed. If it is the card you named, nullify it. (Unique.)

name: The Katra of Surak
text: Plays on your [Vul] personnel. (Unique.) This personnel gains Archaeology. Your Vulcan personnel present gain Honor, are attributes all +1, and may ignore their Treachery. At the start of your turn (or when this personnel is killed), if Mindmeld present, may transfer to your other personnel present.

name: The Secret of P'Jem
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your {Espionage: Vulcan on Andorian} may target [FED] missions (except {Vulcan}). Your Espionage cards targeting a mission you seeded may not be nullified by opponent's cards. Once each turn, when you complete a mission targeted by an Espionage card, you may download {File Mission Report}.

name: Thorough Debriefing
text: Plays between two adjacent missions if you have three [Vul] personnel in play. Just after an opponent's personnel at an adjacent mission uses a regular skill to solve a mission, overcome a dilemma, or cure a dilemma, they are stopped. (Unique.)

name: You're Not Ready
text: Plays between two adjacent missions if you have three [Vul] personnel in play. Opponent may not begin mission attempts at adjacent missions with fewer than nine personnel. (Unique.)

lore: Seize rare opportunity to study xenophobic race and their silk production process.
name: Accept Ambassadorial Invitation
text: Geology + Exobiology + Diplomacy + V.I.P. + (CUNNING>33 OR {Environmental Suit})

lore: Coordinate forces at staging ground beyond the range of Andorian listening posts.
name: Assemble Fleet
text: OFFICER + Leadership + (Treachery x2 OR Honor x2) + (any Intelligence OR {Shran})

lore: Accept invitation to visit Tellarite capital for annual dinner at Andorian embassy.
name: Attend Ambassadorial Banquet
text: Diplomacy x2 + Exobiology + OFFICER Solving player may download {Ambassador Gral} here.

lore: Aid observation of primitive society.
name: Cultural Observation II
text: Anthropology + Leadership + STRENGTH>30 WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

lore: Aid observation of primitive society.
name: Cultural Observation II (back)
text: Anthropology + Leadership + STRENGTH>30 If you have a staffed ship here, you may play {Long-Range Scan} here to "detect Wormhole" (flip mission over).

lore: Study remnants of old regional barrier.
name: Explore Delphic Expanse
text: SCIENCE + Navigation + Stellar Cartography x2

lore: Seize influential figure from enemy vessel.
name: Intercept Dignitary
text: OFFICER + SECURITY + Navigation x2 When you solve, you may nullify a [Sch] card. Opponent's side: [ROM][NON][CAR][FER]  Acquisition + SECURITY + Treachery x2 *+5 points if you have a captive. Points: [35*]

lore: Seek out secretive Andorian subspecies living in the Northern Wastes.
name: Locate Telepaths
text: Geology x2 + Biology + (Honor x2 OR Empathy) *+5 if an Aenar, a Breen, or {Shran} present.

lore: Present research at annual Interspecies Medical Exchange convention.
name: Medical Conference
text: MEDICAL x2 + SCIENCE + Biology + (Honor OR Mindmeld) + CUNNING>38

lore: Restore ancient Vulcan sanctuary destroyed during Andorian espionage incident.
name: Rebuild Monastery
text: Archaeology x2 + Geology + ENGINEER + (Priest OR Vedek OR {Koroth} OR INTEGRITY>30)

lore: Return warrior found at distant crash site to the Klingon homeworld.
name: Repatriate Citizen
text: Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology + Exobiology + (OFFICER OR V.I.P.)

lore: Observe shift in government policies towards anti-immigration stance.
name: Study Xenophobic Tendencies
text: Anthropology + Leadership + Exobiology + no Suliban + no shape-shifter

name: Seek Hidden Reliquary
text: Plays on your Archaeology personnel (for free if {Tallera} OR {The Katra of Surak} present). Once per game, you may download and seed at a planet here an artifact with "Vulcan" in title or lore. When your Away Team including a [Vul] personnel earns {Kir'Shara} here, you may download a [Vul] Honor personnel (X=their printed INTEGRITY; discard objective).

lore: Surgically altered Vulcan. Former V'Shar operative turned smuggler after prolonged exposure to criminal activities. Has an air of mystique about him.
name: Menos
text: ENGINEER Smuggling Exobiology V'Shar (if [Vul]). Treachery Excluded from "opponent's choice" selections.

lore: Surgically altered Vulcan. Former V'Shar operative turned smuggler after prolonged exposure to criminal activities. Has an air of mystique about him.
name: Menos*
text: ENGINEER Smuggling Exobiology V'Shar (if [Vul]). Treachery Excluded from "opponent's choice" selections.

lore: Noted dignitary with a distinguished career. Gathered evidence against Mazarite criminals who later pursued her. Dissident against the V'Las regime.
name: Ambassador V'Lar
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Honor Law SECURITY

lore: Human engineer. Guest at the wedding of T'Pol and Koss, despite being romantically involved with T'Pol. Experienced in Vulcan neuropressure massage.
name: Charles Tucker III (Live Long and Prosper)
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 DL/ {Neuropressure Massage}

lore: Human engineer. Guest at the wedding of T'Pol and Koss, despite being romantically involved with T'Pol. Experienced in Vulcan neuropressure massage.
name: Charles Tucker III (Live Long and Prosper)*
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 DL/ {Neuropressure Massage}

lore: Human captain who accompanied T'Pol into The Forge. Became embroiled in Vulcan politics and mysticism when he carried the katra of Surak.
name: Jonathan Archer (Live Long and Prosper)
text: OFFICER Leadership Archaeology Exobiology Honor DL/ {The Katra of Surak} (if [Vul]).

lore: Human captain who accompanied T'Pol into The Forge. Became embroiled in Vulcan politics and mysticism when he carried the katra of Surak.
name: Jonathan Archer (Live Long and Prosper)*
text: OFFICER Leadership Archaeology Exobiology Honor DL/ {The Katra of Surak} (if [Vul]).

lore: Vulcan architect briefly married to T'Pol. Helped to reinstate T'Les to her academy position. He aided Jonathan Archer's quest to return the Kir'Shara.
name: Koss
text: ENGINEER Geology Archaeology Honor Physics DL/ {Going to the Top}

lore: Member of the High Command. He questioned the aggressive policies towards Syrranites and Andorians. Deposed V'Las after the recovery of the Kir'Shara.
name: Minister Kuvak
text: V.I.P. Honor Law Leadership Once each turn, while you examine opponent's hand, draw a card.

lore: Former dissident and Syrranite leader. Found the Kir'Shara with Jonathan Archer. In her hands, it was used to initiate reform of the Vulcan government.
name: Minister T'Pau
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Youth Mindmeld SECURITY Archaeology Geology

lore: Senior physician working for the Vulcan High Command. Refused to share data on Pa'nar Syndrome. Suspended Yuris for his revelations.
name: Oratt
text: MEDICAL Leadership Biology x 2 Treachery Thrice per game, may stop to examine opponent's hand.

lore: Characteristic of Vulcan officers serving the High Command. He commanded the Sh'Raan during an encounter with Mazarite forces in 2152.
name: Sedis
text: OFFICER Navigation Physics Honor Transporter Skill MEDICAL

lore: High priest at the P'Jem Sanctuary. He was recruited by the Vulcan High Command to keep the secret monitoring station there concealed from visitors.
name: Sinam
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology x 2 V'Shar SCIENCE SECURITY Biology DL/ Any Vulcan Espionage card

lore: Typical Vulcan commando. He was ordered by the Vulcan High Command to hunt down and exterminate "criminals" hiding in The Forge.
name: Smolek
text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill DL/ {Lirpa}

lore: Typical junior academic. Former assistant to V'Las. He now studies ancient texts under V'Tal. Dissident who attended Koss and T'Pol's wedding.
name: Sodor
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Geology Youth

lore: Former Vulcan ambassador turned dissident. Lost his position after using a mindmeld to investigate the 2154 embassy bombing. Friend of Maxwell Forrest.
name: Soval (Live Long and Prosper)
text: V.I.P. Mindmeld Honor Diplomacy Law Computer Skill x 2

lore: Chief investigator working for the High Command. Assassin favored by V'Las. He framed the Syrranites for the United Earth Embassy bombing in 2154.
name: Stel
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 SECURITY Law Biology DL/ {Thorough Debriefing}

lore: Archivist and novice priest at the P'Jem Sanctuary. He sought to attain kolinahr. One of the few Vulcans aware of the concealed monitoring station there.
name: Sulok
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Geology Archaeology Youth May report for free to {P'Jem Sanctuary}.

lore: Legendary 4th century Vulcan philosopher, scientist, and logician. Father of modern Vulcan civilization. Founded the T'Karath sanctuary. His katra survives.
name: Surak
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Honor x 2 Diplomacy x 2 Mindmeld x 2 SCIENCE x 2 DL/ {Only Logical}

lore: Meaning Desert Wind, the Syrranite leader assumed the name Arev to travel incognito. Pacifist Vulcan dissident, he carried the katra of Surak.
name: Syrran
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Mindmeld Anthropology Archaeology Diplomacy Honor x 2

lore: Mother of T'Pol. Former instructor at the Vulcan Science Academy, forcibly retired following T'Pol's actions at P'Jem. Dissident who became a Syrranite.
name: T'Les
text: SCIENCE Honor Biology Anthropology SCIENCE Exobiology DL/ {IDIC Medallion}

characteristicsKeywords: Vulcan; Dissident; Female; Nurse; Support Personnel; Syrranite;
lore: Representative of Vulcan medical assistants. Nurse and dissident who became a Syrranite. She dislikes the harsh conditions in The Forge. Has a pet sehlat.
name: T'Mer
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology

lore: Captain of the D'kyr. Dutiful servant of the Vulcan High Command. She ordered her ship to rendezvous with Enterprise in 2152.
name: T'Mik
text: ENGINEER Leadership Law Diplomacy Archaeology DL/ {Life-form Scan}

lore: Typical Vulcan warp theorist. Assigned by the High Command to observe the NX Program. He considered the human engine design to be unsound.
name: Talma
text: V.I.P. SCIENCE ENGINEER DL/ {Temper Advancements}

lore: Captain of the Nyran. Sent by the High Command to take custody of the prisoner Menos. He delivered a water polo result to the "captain" of Enterprise.
name: Tavek
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Astrophysics V'Shar Navigation

lore: Vulcan minister and High Command administrator. He conspired with Talok to eliminate the Syrranites.
name: V'Las
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Treachery x 2 Law Once per game, may discard a Dissident present. DL/ {Orbital Bombardment} DL/ Any [Vul] Treachery personnel

lore: Vulcan minister and High Command administrator. He conspired with Talok to eliminate the Syrranites.
name: V'Las*
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Treachery x 2 Law Once per game, may discard a Dissident present. DL/ {Orbital Bombardment} DL/ Any [Vul] Treachery personnel

lore: Elderly Vulcan priest. Secret expert on melding techniques. He relieved Jonathan Archer of Surak's katra. Officiated at the wedding of Koss and T'Pol.
name: V'Tal
text: CIVILIAN Mindmeld x 2 MEDICAL Anthropology Biology Honor DL/ {Vulcan Mindmeld}

lore: Long-serving officer reporting to the Vulcan High Command. Captain of the Ti'Mur. Logistics expert. He helped rescue two Enterprise crewmen in 2151.
name: Vanik
text: OFFICER Leadership Law Astrophysics

lore: Junior physician and former nurse. Lost his standing in Vulcan medical circles after he exposed his mindmeld abilities. Later became a dissident.
name: Yuris
text: MEDICAL Youth Smuggling Mindmeld Honor

characteristicsKeywords: Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: Vulcan combat cruiser commanded by Sopek. Assigned to return T'Pol to Vulcan in 2151. Landed troops on Coridan as part of a rescue attempt.
name: Ni'Var
text: Tractor Beam, SECURITY DL/ {Launch Portal}

characteristicsKeywords: Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: Vulcan combat cruiser dispatched to rendezvous with Enterprise. Efficiently disabled Mazarite attackers attempting to capture Ambassador V'Lar.
name: Sh'Raan
text: Tractor Beam, Navigation DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tactical Reserve}

characteristicsKeywords: Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: Cruiser that conveyed a message to T'Pol about her marriage. Observed Enterprise studying a comet. Rescued a shuttlepod with its tractor beam.
name: Ti'Mur
text: Tractor Beam, Geology DL/ {Activate Tractor Beam}

lore: Large shuttlecraft in use by the High Command. Outfitted with particle beam armament for orbital defense of Vulcan. Often repurposed as a scout ship.
name: Vulcan Frigate
Vulcan Particle Beam
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Vulcan ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

lore: Desert metropolis located near The Forge. Birthplace of many famous Vulcans.
name: 22nd-Century ShiKahr
text: Seeds or plays on table; any player may download {IDIC}. Native to this timeline: all [Vul][22] cards, [Non][22] personnel, and [22] equipment (except [MU] cards). Once each turn, one such personnel reporting at this location may do so for free. Non-[22] cards are excluded from battle here.

lore: Ancient Vulcan monastery. Concealed a secret V'Shar monitoring post.
name: P'Jem Sanctuary
text: Seeds or plays on table; any player may download {The Secret of P'Jem} and/or a V'Shar personnel here. Native to this timeline: all [Vul][22] cards and [22] equipment (except [MU] cards). V'Shar personnel may {file mission report}s here. When a player solves a mission, any V'Shar personnel there may relocate here.

lore: After some selective sabotage by Mr. Scott, the crew of the Starship Excelsior discovered that their new transwarp drive was not going to be breaking any speed records.
name: Up Yer Shaft!
text: One Computer Skill present (random selection) is placed atop draw deck. To get past requires ENGINEER>Leadership present. Nullify with {Transwarp Conduit}.

lore: Founded in 2267 after the Federation-Klingon War, Nimbus III was a dream given form. Located deep in neutral space, it was considered the last, best hope for peace. It failed.
name: Planet of Galactic Peace
text: Plays on your non-homeworld mission. Your cards here may mix and cooperate regardless of affiliation. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: HQ: Executive Orders
text: Seeds or plays on any {headquarters}. Once each turn, if you report a matching personnel here that has a property logo not on any of your other personnel in play, you may draw a card. Your matching V.I.P.-classification personnel here gain SECURITY.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
lore: Blockade commander Kira Nerys opposed the Romulans at Derna. She commanded DS9 in 2375.
name: Colonel Kira (Warp Pack)
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership Once each turn (twice per game), you may draw a card for each staffed [Baj] ship here.

lore: Identification: DEPLOYMENT DRONE Task: Assess inter-hive resourcing. Optimize. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Five of Fourteen
text: SECURITY Exobiology May download {Retask} in place of your normal card play. Once per game, may nullify {Temporal Vortex}.

lore: Human president of the United Federation of Planets during the 2286 whale probe incident. He demoted Admiral Kirk for disobeying Starfleet regulations.
name: Hiram Roth
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 DL/ {HQ: Executive Orders} [Fed] personnel are INTEGRITY +2 if {The Whale Probe} in play.

lore: Typical Alpha-Hirogen in training. Refined his skills leading several successful hunts against holographic prey. Eager to test himself against a real opponent.
name: Mellis
text: SECURITY Anthropology Leadership Archaeology Once each turn, you may play {Hunting Group} for free.

lore: First officer of the I.K.S. Amar during the V'Ger incident. Normally a calming influence on his commanding officer, Krase.
name: Mo'Lak
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Points you score from [Self] cards do not count towards {Writ of Accountability}.

lore: One of many humans descended from The 37's. Her ancestors were kidnapped and relocated to the Delta Quadrant. Protects her colony from invaders.
name: Karyn Berlin
text: SECURITY Law Diplomacy

lore: Hologram created in 2372 with the intelligence and consciousness of the Vidiian female Danara Pel. Romantically involved with The Doctor.
name: Dr. Pel
text: MEDICAL Biology Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL DL/ {Holoprogram: Make-Out Point}

lore: Hologram created in 2372 with the intelligence and consciousness of the Vidiian female Danara Pel. Romantically involved with The Doctor.
name: Dr. Pel*
text: MEDICAL Biology Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL DL/ {Holoprogram: Make-Out Point}

characteristicsKeywords: female-related dilemma; male-related dilemma; murder-related dilemma;
lore: Manipulated by D'Nesh and her Orion pheromones, Kelby sabotaged the electro-plasma system aboard Enterprise as part of Harrad-Sar's attempt to capture the vessel.
name: A Crime of Passion
text: Unless a female ENGINEER OR a unique male with printed INTEGRITY>7 present, opponent may choose a ship here to [Flip][Flip]. Discard dilemma.

lore: The Romulan government tried to suppress Ambassador Spock's underground movement and its efforts towards unification.
name: Enemies of the State
text: Place on planet. Opponent may download three dissidents to planet. Now and at start of each attempt here, Away Team stopped if INTEGRITY from up to X personnel < opposing INTEGRITY. X = number of opposing personnel present.

characteristicsKeywords: Capturing-related card; female-related dilemma; male-related dilemma; murder-related dilemma;
lore: In 2152, Charles Tucker III and Malcolm Reed were deceived by con artists posing as alluring females on Risa. The Vulcan database hadn't warned them of potential criminal activity.
name: No Mention of Crime
text: Opponent chooses to capture male with most [*] icons OR stop any two males present. Nullify with four females.

lore: In the wrong hands, a new discovery or scientific advancement can be perverted into a dreadful weapon.
name: Pawns of the Military
text: If {T'Lani III} or a biolab in play, opponent may download and seed here up to two of the following: {Hyper-Aging}, {Aphasia Device} or any virus-related dilemma; then place on mission: add 2 SCIENCE to requirements of all such dilemmas here.

name: Temporal Benefactor
text: Seeds on table. Place one personnel beneath here from outside the game; "Benefactor" in play for uniqueness only. Your unique [AU] personnel naming (or named by) Benefactor in lore are temporal agents and (when in play) gain Benefactor's skills. Once each turn, you may place a [22] personnel from hand beneath draw deck to download to hand {Timepod Ring} or a card with "temporal agent" in gametext or lore. (Unique.)

lore: The secrets of a small futuristic ship and the corpse of a presumed temporal agent led Starfleet, Suliban, and Tholian forces to abandon all other priorities in an attempt to secure it.
name: Bigger on the Inside
text: Plays on a mission if your temporal agent is here or adjacent. Mission may not be attempted or scouted unless 4 [Cmd] OR any Intelligence in crew or Away Team. (Unique.)

lore: When temporal agent Daniels pulled Jonathan Archer out of a dangerous situation with the Suliban in the 22nd century, it resulted in devastating alterations to the timeline.
name: Disrupted Continuum
text: Plays on table. Once per game, discard event to nullify a non-[Q] dilemma your opponent just revealed; may download and seed a replacement [S] or [P] dilemma.

lore: With the firepower of the Starship Defiant at her disposal, the former communications officer quickly assumed a new position of power. "You are speaking to Empress Sato."
name: Empress
text: Plays on your Contender (for free if {any Hoshi}). Once per game, at the start of your turn, discard event to complete a Contender-related objective (but draw no cards).

lore: Damar rallied the civilian population of Cardassia, knowing that failure to oppose an enemy as evil and powerful as the Dominion would condemn them all to eternal submission.
name: Revolutionaries
text: Plays on table. Your dissidents may initiate battle against their own affiliation. OR Download two [Univ] dissident personnel. Discard event.

lore: Many species use mines to deny access to particular areas of space. Cloaked Romulan mines caused significant damage to Enterprise in 2152.
name: Romulan Minefield
text: Plays between two missions (for free if both are [ROM]). Creates a location (span 2). Passing non-[Rom] ships must stop here for rest of turn or incur damage.

lore: Outraged by the taxes and social reforms on Ferenginar, Quark declared that his bar would be the last outpost of what had once made Ferenginar great.
name: The Unrelenting Lust for Profit
text: Seeds on {Quark's Bar} or a {Trading Post}; download {1st Rule of Acquisition} or {The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition}. You may use them at any time on your turn.

lore: Under the administration of V'Las, a covert alliance existed in 2154 between the Vulcan High Command and Romulan agents with the aim of "reunifying" the two cultures.
name: Treaty: Romulan/Vulcan
text: Plays on table (for free if you have {V'Las} in play). Your [Vul] cards and your [Rom][22] cards recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

lore: Having pursued their Gorn adversaries into Metron-controlled space, the crew of the Starship Enterprise was forced to resolve their conflict on the Metrons' terms.
name: "We Are the Metrons"
text: Seeds on your mission. If each of your missions has exactly one affiliation icon and all match, all non-[Bor] cards at this mission have attack restrictions of that affiliation.

lore: 22nd-century biolab built by Earth and Denobula. Stored hazardous pathogens and genetically enhanced embryos. Commandeered by augments.
name: Cold Station 12
text: Seed one at a [STA] [S] mission. Your [Non] cards with "Khan" in title or lore may report here; one may seed here.

lore: 22nd-century depot operated by the Tellarite Mining Consortium. Home away from home for diplomats, hustlers, entrepreneurs, and wanderers.
name: Tellarite Trading Post
text: Seeds or plays at a 2154 [S] location. Ships may dock and repair here (as if an outpost). DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

name: Comfort Women
text: Plays once each turn (for free) on your Gul or Senator present with a female of a different species. For rest of turn, this personnel gains any regular skill; discard incident. OR Seeds on {Bajor}. Your [Baj] females become [Car] dissidents with "Terok Nor" in lore (even if not in play); download a site. OR Seeds on {Verex III}. Your [Non][22] females are considered native to 2154 Time Locations.

name: Ferengi Gas Trap
text: Plays on a [S] location. Opponent's ship here must "bring this card aboard" (place on ship; limit once per game per ship title). Counts down only while on a ship. While on opponent's ship: crew disabled, and ship (if non-[Bor]) may be targeted by {Secondary Market}. Nullified if {Decontamination} is in play, by {Disruptor Overload}, or with CUNNING>103 here. (Unique.)

name: Holographic Camouflage
text: Seeds on table; place here from outside the game up to 7 different non-[Bor] ships. At the start of your turn, you may place a ship here out-of-play; until start of your next turn: your ships with Holographic Skin have that ship's WEAPONS and add its special equipment, use tactics as if that ship, and damage is replaced with [Flip] for all hits (score 5 points per hit). Your {Outgunned} is nullified.

name: One with the Borg
text: Plays on table. Once per game, when you assimilate an opponent's personnel, place your [Def] drone present beneath your draw deck and discard incident to assimilate another of opponent's personnel present (random selection). OR Plays on a ship you have assimilated. While your [Com] aboard, worth points equal to ship's highest printed attribute.

name: The Spires of Romulus
requires: Mission Specialist; Neutral Zone Region; Reman;
text: Seeds on {2154 Romulus}. Your [Univ][Rom] personnel and Remans are considered native, and your downloaded mission specialists may download to here. When your staffed ship's crew solves a [S] mission or wins a battle at a Neutral Zone location, you may relocate that ship to here.

name: These Are the Voyages
text: Plays on {Devlin System Asteroid Belt}. Even if not in play, your non-[MQ][Sta][22] personnel lose [AU] and [Sta] but add [Holo] and [Fed], and they (and {Chef}) add [TNG] while {Continuing Mission} in play. In place of your normal card play, you may download Chef. Once each turn, a unique [Holo][22] with INTEGRITY>6 may report for free to Chef. If Chef helps solve this mission, you may download {U.S.S. Pegasus} here.

lore: Oppressed by the Romulans for centuries, Reman troops made a vicious and expendable fighting force. They were frequently used as cannon fodder during the Dominion War.
name: Reman Sacrifice
text: Plays on your Reman. They are sacrificed (die) to draw three cards (once each turn) OR to substitute for a [Rom] personnel present who is about to die.

lore: Jonathan Archer had access to a database of future events and details, left behind by temporal agent Daniels. He rarely used it, fearing the consequences could be disastrous.
name: Temporal Almanac
text: Once each turn, if you have a temporal agent at a time location, you may draw two cards OR immediately play an event on table for free.

lore: Investigate reports of a detonation in recently reactivated minefield.
name: Inspect Strategic Snare
text: SECURITY + ENGINEER + Treachery + CUNNING>36 May [Flip] opponent's ship that stops here. Opponent's side: Any crew may attempt this mission. Diplomacy x2 + Navigation x2 + SECURITY No gametext.

name: Distant Control
text: Seeds on table. While your Leadership, Empathy, and Treachery present at {Drone Control Room}, your all-native Away Team present may attempt [S] missions as the crew of your empty [Rom] Drone-class ship (may not die unless they have Empathy, and may not relocate to spaceline). At the end of any dilemma, if no Empathy remains, attempt ends. You may not re-attempt this turn.

name: Hinder Progress
text: Seeds or plays on table. When opponent's crew or Away Team fails a mission attempt, if you have a personnel at that mission OR a dissident in play with affiliation matching any personnel in the attempt, you may place objective on that mission (limit once per mission): discard objective at end of turn, and score points if mission not solved.

lore: William T. Riker had a crisis of conscience over the search for the U.S.S. Pegasus. The cook sought guidance from recreations of Starfleet legends.
name: Chef
text: CIVILIAN Your [Holo][22] may report where present. Anthropology Twice per game, may download {Holodeck Door}.

lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Sutherland during the Klingon Civil War. Soong-type android who was romantically involved with Tasha Yar and Jenna D'Sora.
name: Data (Cold Front)
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Honor Physics Your {Tachyon Detection Grid} only requires one ship.

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Counselor; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Trill with symbiont;
lore: Trill successor to Jadzia Dax. Counselor who drew on Joran Dax's memories from her symbiont to profile and apprehend a murderer aboard DS9.
name: Ezri Dax (Cold Front)
text: OFFICER SCIENCE SECURITY Anthropology Youth Music OR Treachery (change at any time).

lore: Targ kept by Antaak since childhood. An early patient of the aspiring surgeon. Faithful pet who would recognize his master even without cranial ridges.
name: Boshar
text: ANIMAL Klingon MEDICAL- and SCIENCE-classification personnel present gain an additional MEDICAL.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Scientist and temporal agent. In an alternate future, he conspired with Admiral Janeway to gain a seat on the High Council. Invented the chrono deflector.
name: Korath
text: SCIENCE Physics x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Klingon Intelligence

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Capturing-related card; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: "Father" of many augment embryos from the time of Khan. Skilled doctor and geneticist. Human who traded goods and data with the Orion Syndicate.
name: Arik Soong
text: MEDICAL Biology x 2 Archaeology Treachery x 2 Cybernetics May release captives here.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Capturing-related card; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: "Father" of many augment embryos from the time of Khan. Skilled doctor and geneticist. Human who traded goods and data with the Orion Syndicate.
name: Arik Soong*
text: MEDICAL Biology x 2 Archaeology Treachery x 2 Cybernetics May release captives here.

lore: Typical 22nd-century colonist. Humanoid nurse living on a deuterium mining colony. She helped fight off marauding Klingons in 2152.
name: E'Lis
text: MEDICAL Leadership Physics Exobiology

lore: Denobulan quantum optics expert. Second wife of Phlox. Made advances towards Charles Tucker III, in keeping with the polyamorous customs of her race.
name: Feezal Phlox
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Physics x 2 {Male's Love Interest} affects three males (no doubling).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
lore: Typical augment from the time of Khan. She sided with Malik to overthrow Raakin. Helped to rescue her "father" Arik Soong from his Starfleet captors.
name: Jaya
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Navigation Greed Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Captain; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Human captain recruited as a temporal agent by Daniels. Experienced time traveller. Visited 2004 Detroit with T'Pol to destroy a Xindi bioweapon.
name: Jonathan Archer (Cold Front)
text: CIVILIAN OFFICER Biology Honor SCIENCE Diplomacy Archaeology

lore: Aenar leader and "speaker." Pacifist who refused to aid in destroying the Romulan drones. Later became a minister in a unified Andorian government.
name: Lissan
text: V.I.P. Leadership Law Empathy x 2 Diplomacy Your cards may not initiate battle here.

lore: Typical Tarkalean navigator. She encountered an unknown race in 2153 and was partially assimilated as a Borg. Felt compelled to assimilate Enterprise.
name: N'Rana
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography For rest of game, all {Nanoprobe Resuscitation} gain [-5 Pts].

lore: Typical Orion serving under Harrad-Sar. Systems specialist aboard the Devna-Lev. Overexposure to slave girl pheromones has left him easy to fool.
name: Parrec-Sut
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Transporter Skill Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Elder augment from the time of Khan. Kept his siblings alive after Arik Soong's arrest. Romantically involved with Persis prior to her and Malik's betrayal.
name: Raakin
text: CIVILIAN Stellar Cartography Archaeology Navigation Transporter Skill

lore: Talented Akaali apothecary, even by pre-industrial standards. She discovered the truth about Malurian pollution. Romantically involved with Jonathan Archer.
name: Riaan
text: MEDICAL Biology SCIENCE Honor Once per game, you may glance at {any [HA] card}.

characteristicsKeywords: Suliban; Dissident; Female; genetically enhanced; Shape-shifter; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Suliban dissident and former Cabal member turned temporal agent. Genetically-enhanced shape-shifter. She worked with Klaang to expose Silik's plans.
name: Sarin
text: SECURITY Empathy Youth Anthropology MEDICAL DL/ {Caught Red-Handed}

lore: Strategist and student of history. Mendak helped retrieve Selok from deep cover. Strives to emulate military icons like Admiral Valdore, Keras, and Talok.
name: Admiral Mendak
text: OFFICER Exobiology Leadership Archaeology Treachery DL/ {Any [Sch]} OR Romulan espionage card

lore: Representative of Romulan technicians working for the Tal Shiar. Served under Admiral Valdore. He gathered holographic specifications on alien vessels.
name: Devanha
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Diplomacy Tal Shiar

lore: Physician and bodyguard typical of Reman conscripts. Like many of his race, possesses telepathic abilities and extreme sensitivity to light.
name: Leodis
text: MEDICAL Biology Transporter Skill Empathy

lore: Typical 22nd-century Romulan officer. Worked with Nijil in 2154. Specialist in remote astrometric navigation. He disliked their reliance on an Aenar.
name: Olicana
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Navigation Stellar Cartography Treachery

lore: Romulan operative. Spent years undercover on Vulcan. Served under T'Pol on the Tomed mission. Devious major who conspired with V'Las.
name: Talok
