text: OFFICER Tal Shiar V'Shar SECURITY Exobiology DL/ {Insert Undercover Agent} OR {Romulan "Reunification"}

lore: Typical Reman soldier. Aide and bodyguard to Senator Vrax in 2154. Dissident who secretly plotted independence from his Romulan masters.
name: Venoxis
text: SECURITY SCIENCE Archaeology Youth Once per game, may unstop his Away Team after personnel battle.

lore: Federation warship. Mass produced after Miles O'Brien had resolved the kinks in the U.S.S. Defiant.
name: Escort Vessel
text: Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi ship; Merchant vessel; Tractor Beam;
lore: Ferengi merchant vessel from the 22nd century. The large cargo capacity resulted in numerous trading partners adopting the design - for a modest fee.
name: Cargo Vessel
text: Tractor Beam. [Non] cards have standard attack restrictions here.

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi ship; Merchant vessel; Tractor Beam;
lore: Ferengi merchant vessel from the 22nd century. The large cargo capacity resulted in numerous trading partners adopting the design - for a modest fee.
name: Cargo Vessel*
text: Tractor Beam. [Non] cards have standard attack restrictions here.

lore: One of many vessels operated as a privateer and slave transport by the Orion Syndicate. Commanded by Harrad-Sar. Battled Enterprise in 2154.
name: Devna-Lev
text: DL/ {Grappler} (may use as if [Sta] NX-class).

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Typical cruiser used by the Romulan Star Empire in the 22nd century to patrol the edges of its territory. Mainstay used during the Earth-Romulan War.
name: Bird-of-Prey
text: X=3 if all crew are [22] or [Univ]. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam.

lore: Second of two prototypes created from modified warbirds. Controlled remotely via telepresence. Carried an advanced multispatial sensor platform.
name: Raptor Two
text: Holographic Skin. May move to {Raptor One} using full RANGE.

lore: Lawless shipping lane frequented by scum and villainy.
name: Smugglers' Rendezvous
text: Seeds on table; any player may download {Tellarite Trading Post} here. Native to this timeline: All [22] cards (except [MQ] cards). Once per turn, one native personnel reporting here may do so for free. Any player may seed one native [Univ] ship here. Any player who seeds or reports cards here may not report cards at other time locations for rest of game.

lore: Dutiful commander. Vulcan dissident loyal to Captain Forrest. T'Pol was romantically involved with Chief Engineer Tucker during her last Pon farr.
name: Commander T'Pol*
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Hinder Progress}

lore: Idealist and mentor to Commander T'Pol. Soval thought he was too old to become a revolutionary. Vulcan dissident. Commanded the I.S.S. Avenger.
name: Crewman Soval*
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Biology Exobiology Geology Anthropology

name: Comfort Women *VP
text: Plays once each turn (for free) on your Gul or Senator present with a female of a different species. For rest of turn, this personnel gains any regular skill; discard incident. OR Seeds on {Bajor}. Your [Baj] females become [Car] dissidents with "Terok Nor" in lore (even if not in play); download a site. OR Seeds on {Verex III}. Your [Non][22] females are considered native to 2154 Time Locations.

lore: Devious Cardassian operative. Broke her cover after becoming trapped in the Delta Quadrant aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Formed an alliance with the Kazon-Nistrim.
name: Seska* *VP
text: ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: NCC-72381. Science vessel pulled from Alpha Quadrant by the Caretaker. Its rogue crew designed an enhanced warp drive, killing nucleogenic life-forms for fuel.
name: U.S.S. Equinox* *VP
text: X=4 if any crew member has "U.S.S. Equinox" in lore. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Zibalian transport and merchant vessel commanded by Kivas Fajo. Houses his collection of rare and one-of-a-kind objects. Used to imprison Data in 2366.
name: Jovis *VP
text: Once per game, you may capture an android on an undocked ship here. DL/ {Kivas Fajo}

lore: Unscrupulous, murderous, conceited Zibalian trader. Collector. Notorious member of Stacius Trade Guild.
name: Kivas Fajo *VP
text: CIVILIAN Greed x 2 Acquisition Treachery Each unduplicated artifact present is worth 5 points. Makes parallel use of opponent's {Palor Toff} cards.

lore: Beverly Crusher was detained by Ansata separatists on Rutia IV. She was compelled to ease the suffering caused by their repeated use of dimensional shifting.
name: Hippocratic Oath *VP
text: To get past, most CUNNING MEDICAL must relocate with dilemma to nearest planet at another location (must still have MEDICAL upon arrival); stopped until countdown expires.

lore: In 2269, the Starship Enterprise was penetrated by a storm-like phenomena which attacked both the ship's technology and the nervous systems of the crew.
name: The Cloud *VP
text: Unless 2 MEDICAL, 2 ENGINEER, and 2 Astrophysics present, ship is damaged and stopped until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: Many junior officers aboard the Starship Enterprise could be found socialising with their colleagues, relaxing from the daily perils of killer plants, salt-sucking aliens, and exploding rocks.
name: Lower Decks *VP
text: Plays on table. Each of your non-holographic, universal personnel is attributes all +2. (Captain's Order.)

name: Protect the Timeline *VP
text: Seeds on a time location. (Unique.) Once each turn, one of your unique personnel reporting here may do so for free. You may not report personnel for free unless native to this timeline or reporting to a ship or facility here. Any ship may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location (once per turn per ship), then is stopped unless ship or three personnel aboard are native to this timeline.

lore: To determine if Data had the right to choose, Jean-Luc Picard asked Judge Advocate General Phillipa Louvois to rule on the matter. The unenviable task of prosecuting fell to Riker.
name: Going to the Top *VP
text: Plays if you have two [Cmd] personnel together on a facility. Download a compatible personnel with Leadership x2 to them (once per game per affiliation).

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; Duras-related; High Council; Male;
lore: Former captain demoted for failing to locate rebels harbored by Jonathan Archer. Given another chance by the High Council. Ancestor of Ja'rod.
name: Duras Son of Toral *VP
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Leadership SECURITY Greed DL/ {Any [Univ][Kli][22] personnel with "Duras" in lore}

lore: Brilliant military strategist behind most of the campaigns of the Earth-Romulan War. A former senator expelled for challenging Imperial doctrine.
name: Admiral Valdore *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Gareb} DL/ {Remote Interference}

lore: Diligent major and MACO commander. Expert at both armed and unarmed combat. Found a sparring partner in Malcolm Reed. Likes consistency.
name: Jeremiah Hayes *VP
text: SECURITY Honor OFFICER DL/ {Combat-Ready: Tactical Reserve} Diplomacy Leadership (if no other leader present).

lore: Former dissident and Syrranite leader. Found the Kir'Shara with Jonathan Archer. In her hands, it was used to initiate reform of the Vulcan government.
name: Minister T'Pau *VP
text: CIVILIAN Leadership Youth Mindmeld SECURITY Archaeology Geology

lore: Although there are many command styles, the best leaders share the ability to make difficult decisions and take swift action in a crisis.
name: Command Decisions
text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you stop a personnel with Leadership or OFFICER. To get past requires STRENGTH>24.

lore: Leader of a band of torturous performers, The Clown could easily tap into the fears of his victims and manipulate the artificial environment in which they resided.
name: The Clown: On His Throne
text: Place on mission. Opponent chooses INTEGRITY, CUNNING, or STRENGTH. Replace other personnel attributes in dilemma and mission text here with the named attribute.

lore: On Cardassia Prime, no crime goes unsolved and all criminals are punished. With conviction guaranteed before trial, the people's faith in Cardassian justice is assured.
name: Awaiting Trial
text: Plays on table (for free if you have three [Car] personnel in play). At the end of each of your turns, if you have a captive, draw an extra card. (Cumulative.)

lore: In 2369, to prevent the collection of further DNA samples from Indri VIII, Nu'Daq destroyed all life on the planet.
name: Biosphere Toxin
text: Plays on an unsolved planet mission if you have a ship there with 4 Treachery aboard. Mission worth -5 points. At the end of each turn, kills an opponent's personnel present (random selection). (Cumulative.)

lore: In a 31st-century Kyrian recreation, Starfleet officers were portrayed as belligerent and undisciplined, brawling with each other to settle their differences.
name: Earn Your Rank!
text: Plays on table. Your [Holo] leaders gain [Cmd]; your other non-CIVILIAN [Holo] personnel gain [Stf]. When you play {Holodeck Door}, draw a card.

lore: Bajorans often seek guidance from their religious leaders. Members of the Vedek Assembly help many fellow Bajorans explore their pagh and gain enlightenment.
name: Esteemed Vedek
text: Plays on table; download a Vedek personnel. Also, while in play, each [Baj] personnel is INTEGRITY +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: While Samuel Clemens lamented the loss of opening a door for a lady, the 24th century's gains in eliminating poverty, prejudice, sexism, and intolerance far outweighed any losses.
name: Life's Simple Pleasures
text: Plays on your non-[Bor] crew of at least six personnel. If more males than females, download a female personnel; otherwise, draw three cards. Discard event.

lore: Many individuals have faked their own death to conduct illicit activities with impunity. In 2369, Jo'Bril used such a ploy in an attempt to steal Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield technology.
name: Patient Schemer
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your assassin, thief, or {Jo'Bril} is about to be killed by a dilemma, return them to your hand instead.

lore: In 2369, the Cardassian Union used the capture of Jean-Luc Picard to gain leverage in its negotiations with Starfleet.
name: Psychological Pressure
text: Seeds or plays on table. For each different regular skill in dilemma or mission requirements that is also on your captive, opponent must discard a card from hand to use that skill to meet those requirements (or choose not to).

lore: In 2371, Odo was informed that three former agents of the Obsidian Order had died the previous day from "natural causes," while two more perished in "accidents."
name: Quite a Coincidence
text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on a personnel just played. When personnel is killed, discard event to score points.

lore: Ships like the I.K.S. T'Ong could be deployed with their crew in cryogenic suspension. Once awakened, such ships could attack - unaware of changes in the political situation.
name: Sleeper Ship
text: Seeds or plays on table. When your ship wins a battle and its matching commander is aboard, you may report a personnel aboard. (Captain's Order.)

name: Condition Red
text: Plays on table. While aboard your ships, each of your [Stf] personnel gains [Cmd]. At the start of each of your turns, if opponent has more ships in play than you (including any cloaked, phased, or landed ships), you may discard a card from hand to download a ship to hand, then discard incident (unless ship is [Univ]). (Captain's Order.)

name: Group Therapy
text: Seeds or plays on your {headquarters}, outpost, or site. In place of a card draw, you may download a [Fed] CIVILIAN to hand OR a [Fed] genetically enhanced personnel to your {Karen Loews}. If present with {Julian Bashir}, your {Jack}, {Lauren}, {Sarina}, and {any Patrick} may use their classification as if it were ENGINEER-, MEDICAL-, SCIENCE-, or V.I.P.-classification.

name: Holoprogram: The Voyager Encounter
text: Plays on {Museum of Kyrian Heritage}; [Holo] cards may exist here. At the start of your turn, your native [Holo] personnel may exchange (from hand to in play, or vice versa) with your personnel named in their printed lore (limit once each turn per lore reference). When a native personnel leaves play this way, draw a card. When a native personnel enters play this way, their DL/ is considered unused.

name: Intuition
requires: Counselor; Dabo Girl; El-Aurian; genetically enhanced;
text: Seeds or plays on table (for free if {Deanna Troi} in play). Once each turn, if you have a dabo girl, counselor, El-Aurian, or genetically enhanced personnel in play, you may name a card type and reveal a random card from opponent's hand. If it is the named card type, draw a card.

name: Training Cruise
text: Plays on your ship. Compatible cadets may report aboard; once each turn, one such personnel may report aboard for free. Ship is attributes all +1 for each cadet aboard (limit 4). If crew has no more than one non-cadet, ship and crew may ignore affiliation attack restrictions.

lore: Many Bajorans believe that what remains after death is just a shell, with the pagh leaving the body to begin a new journey: to walk with the Prophets in the Celestial Temple.
name: Souls of the Dead
text: Plays once each turn if you have three [Baj] personnel in play. Place a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

lore: Jack, Lauren, and Patrick impersonated Starfleet officers to escape the Institute and bring Sarina to DS9 for treatment. Admiral Patrick had the perfect reply to any challenges.
name: That's a Stupid Question!
text: Suspends play to make all opponent's OFFICER-classification personnel attributes -2 until end of turn. OR Nullifies any card with "question" or "?" in title.

lore: Negotiate exchange of goods amid geo-political conflict.
name: Conduct Perilous Trade
text: Diplomacy x2 + (Honor x2 OR Treachery x2)

lore: Conduct training exercise near Saturn.
name: Practice Orbital Maneuvers
text: Navigation + SECURITY + 3 cadets Opponent's side: Astrophysics + Leadership + Navigation + SECURITY + CUNNING>36

lore: Assess potential for tactical alliance with beings last encountered in 23rd century.
name: Secure Strategic Base
text: Anthropology + SECURITY + 3 [AU] Personnel Once per game, may download {Strategic Base} here. Opponent's side: No gametext.

lore: Collect technical data on advanced enemy ship reported to be in this area.
name: Tactical Observation
text: ENGINEER x2 + Leadership + Navigation {U.S.S. Valiant} may be seeded here; facilities may not. Opponent's side: [CAR][DOM] SECURITY x2 + OFFICER x2 {Dominion Battleship} may report here.

lore: Identification: CALIBRATION DRONE Task: Track hive resource usage. Optimize. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Ninety
text: Archaeology Biology Geology DL/ {Masaka Transformations} (targeting yourself).

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Cardassian technicians stationed on Terok Nor in 2374. Assigned to analyze the changes to the repurposed ore processing facilities.
name: Thorel
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Geology

characteristicsKeywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Jem'Hadar soldiers posted to Terok Nor in 2374. Second assigned to protect the Founder Leader during visits to Odo's quarters.
name: Imat'Korex
text: SECURITY Biology Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Admiral; genetically enhanced; Infiltrator; Male;
lore: Genetically enhanced imposter. In 2375, Patrick used his "rank" to bluster past any opposition.
name: Admiral Patrick
text: V.I.P. Leadership (if no other Leadership present). x 2 DL/ {Inspection} DL/ {That's a Stupid Question!} X=number of genetically enhanced personnel present.

lore: Acting chief petty officer on the U.S.S. Valiant. Red Squad cadet from Tycho City, Lunar Colony. She misses the beauty of dawn on the moon.
name: Dorian Collins
text: ENGINEER Anthropology Honor Youth Geology, Transporter Skill (if with another cadet).

lore: Typical cadet aboard the Starship Enterprise in 2285. Trainee medevac shuttle pilot. Only son of a Starfleet Intelligence agent. Always up for a party.
name: Foster
text: MEDICAL Navigation Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Maladjusted misfit and genetically enhanced genius. He visited DS9 with Lauren, Patrick, and Sarina.
name: Jack
text: CIVILIAN Astrophysics Computer Skill Physics Law DL/ {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} (if with {Patrick}, {Sarina}, or {Lauren}). Regular skills doubled if with Patrick, Sarina, and Lauren.

lore: Nova Squadron navigator. In 2368, she attempted to perform an illegal Kolvoord Starburst maneuver with Wesley Crusher and Sito Jaxa. Talented cadet.
name: Jean Hajar
text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill Physics Youth Astrophysics DL/ {Space Boomer}

lore: Rigorous leader promoted to first officer of the U.S.S. Valiant by Tim Watters. Icy Red Squad cadet. Fiercely loyal to her captain.
name: Karen Farris
text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Leadership Youth ENGINEER, Astrophysics (if with another cadet).

lore: Chief medical officer who succeeded Beverly Crusher in 2365. Talented doctor and cardiothoracic surgeon. She makes a mean chicken soup.
name: Katherine Pulaski (Metamorphosis)
text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Anthropology Biology Honor Exobiology DL/ {Genetronic Replicator}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; genetically enhanced;
lore: Flirtatious, genetically enhanced visitor to DS9. Found Nog attractive. Self-styled femme fatale.
name: Lauren
text: CIVILIAN Biology Stellar Cartography Geology Music DL/ {Life's Simple Pleasures} (if with {Jack}, {Sarina}, or {Patrick}). Regular skills doubled if with Jack, Sarina, and Patrick.

lore: Observant officer serving aboard U.S.S. Voyager. In 2373, she accompanied Chakotay on a shuttle mission to conduct a survey of the Nekrit Expanse.
name: Marie Kaplan
text: SCIENCE Archaeology MEDICAL Biology Transporter Skill

lore: Ferengi cadet and former waiter. Attends Starfleet Academy. Aspires to join Red Squad. Son of Rom.
name: Nog (Metamorphosis)
text: ENGINEER Acquisition Youth Honor OFFICER (if with another cadet). X=number of other cadets present (limit 4).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
lore: Idiot savant who visited DS9 to meet Julian Bashir. Genetically enhanced and emotional. Likes parties.
name: Patrick
text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Archaeology Anthropology DL/ {Surprise Party} (if with {Jack}, {Lauren}, or {Sarina}). Regular skills doubled if with Jack, Lauren, and Sarina.

lore: Imposturous first officer in a 31st-century recreation. Chakotay oversaw brutal interrogations, despite describing himself as a "man of peace."
name: Revised Chakotay
text: OFFICER Anthropology Honor Treachery SECURITY DL/ {Security Sacrifice} OR {Fitting In}

lore: Mass murderer in a 31st-century recreation. An Emergency Medical Android, The Doctor designed bio-weapons that killed eight million Kyrians.
name: Revised Doctor
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology SCIENCE Treachery x 2 DL/ {Biosphere Toxin}

lore: Cold-blooded killer, Kathryn Janeway. She captained the U.S.S. Voyager in a 31st-century recreation.
name: Revised Janeway
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 SCIENCE Leadership DL/ Any [DQ] card with "31st-century" in lore DL/ {The Art of Diplomacy} (effects extended to [AU][Fed][Holo])

lore: Interrogator who assisted in the prolonged torture of several Kyrians. 31st-century recreation of Harry Kim. Always looking for ways to advance his career.
name: Revised Kim
text: OFFICER SECURITY Computer Skill Treachery x 2 DL/ {Reflection Therapy}

lore: Typical Kazon-Ogla crewman, captured and made to work as part of the combat forces in a 31st-century recreation of U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Revised Kizar
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Treachery Archaeology DL/ {Disengage Safety Protocols}

lore: "Hedgehog" ops officer in a 31st-century recreation. Neelix was one of several subjugated crewmen.
name: Revised Neelix
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Biology Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill Treachery x 2 DL/ Any hand weapon

lore: Ensign chaser. Tom Paris was considered the least inaccurate 31st-century recreation of U.S.S. Voyager crewmembers. He prefers a direct assault.
name: Revised Paris
text: OFFICER Astrophysics Navigation x 2 Treachery DL/ {Earn Your Rank!} OR {Space Boomer}

lore: Shock-trooper in a 31st-century recreation. Seven of Nine was captured from the Borg and assimilated into Starfleet. She neutralized a Kyrian boarding party.
name: Revised Seven of Nine
text: SECURITY ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill DL/ {Nanoprobe Resuscitation} (targeting an [AU] card).

lore: Evil instrument of destruction who directed the orbital assault against the Kyrians. 31st-century recreation of Tuvok.
name: Revised Tuvok
text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Law DL/ Any [AU][Holo] personnel

lore: Confident cadet ordered by Admiral Leyton to sabotage Earth's power grid in 2372. Red Squad member later assigned to the U.S.S. Valiant.
name: Riley Shepard
text: SECURITY Biology Navigation Youth Computer Skill, Navigation (if with another cadet).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; genetically enhanced;
lore: Genetically enhanced introvert. She became romantically involved with Julian Bashir on DS9.
name: Sarina
text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Physics SCIENCE Exobiology DL/ {Meditation} (if with {Jack}, {Lauren}, or {Patrick}). Regular skills doubled if with Jack, Lauren, and Patrick.

lore: Red Squad cadet typical of those assigned to train on the U.S.S. Valiant in 2373. Although loyal to Tim Watters, he secretly misses home.
name: Seth Matthews
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Archaeology Youth

lore: Valiant captain given a battlefield commission. Overconfident cadet determined to succeed. Proud member of Red Squad. An inspiration to his crew.
name: Tim Watters
text: OFFICER Leadership Physics Youth Diplomacy, Leadership (if with another cadet).

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Dabo Girl; Female; Teacher; Thief; Vedek;
lore: Grifter, thief, dabo girl, teacher, vedek - whatever the customer wants. Human working for Nunk. Briefly romantically involved with Reginald Barclay.
name: Leosa
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Computer Skill Treachery Twice per game, may nullify {Holodeck Door} just played.

lore: "Good luck charm" aboard the I.K.S. Rotarran with a talent for mishaps. 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 human son of Worf and K'Ehleyr. Joined the House of Martok.
name: Alexander Rozhenko (Metamorphosis)
text: ENGINEER Honor Transporter Skill Youth If aboard your ship when it wins a battle, draw a card.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Arms dealer; Female; High Council; Nurse;
lore: Typical surgeon serving under Martok. Former nurse and arms dealer. She developed new combat stimulants and advised the High Council on their use.
name: B'amara
text: MEDICAL Biology Honor Physics Computer Skill

lore: Typical Klingon operative. She was ordered by Gowron to observe commercial operations within the Bajoran sector of 2373. Collector of bronze statues.
name: Meraht
text: OFFICER Klingon Intelligence Transporter Skill Honor Exobiology Anthropology

lore: Kyrian historian in charge of a 31st-century museum. Discovered an E.M.H. backup who helped him to revise the Kyrian and Vaskan history books.
name: Curator Quarren
text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Holo-Projectors} Cards you DL/ may come from your discard pile.

lore: Not a legal expert - just a dabo girl. Complained about the lurid requirements in her contract with Quark. Later advocated the abolition of such terms.
name: Sarda
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Law DL/ {Intuition}

lore: Tamarian first officer. One of many sons of Tama. "Kiteo, his eyes closed. Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel. Mirab, with sails unfurled. Temba, at rest."
name: Togaran
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Leadership Transporter Skill

lore: One of many Reman soldiers under the command of Shinzon. Former deuterium purification specialist. He helped develop the thalaron radiation generator.
name: Chagrith
text: SCIENCE Archaeology Geology Physics

lore: Typical Reman surgeon. Doctor who worked under The Viceroy aboard the Scimitar in 2379. He studied the cloning techniques used in creating Shinzon.
name: Dralvak
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology Treachery

lore: Representative of Reman navigators serving aboard the Scimitar. A former assault trooper, he was recruited to join a boarding party in 2379.
name: Jorvas
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Navigation SECURITY

lore: Characteristic of Reman assault troops. Soldier who fought in many conflicts during the Dominion War. He is eager to serve Shinzon and The Viceroy.
name: Thexor
text: SECURITY Computer Skill Transporter Skill Treachery DL/ {Reman Disruptor Rifle}

lore: Flagship of a Bajoran blockade in 2375. Commanded by Colonel Kira in opposition to the Romulan fortification of their medical facilities on Derna.
name: Kitara
text: DL/ {Souls of the Dead}

lore: Red Squad training ship caught behind enemy lines during the Dominion War. Captained by Tim Watters.
name: U.S.S. Valiant
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Training Cruise}

lore: Exhibition of ancient artifacts and historical recreations.
name: Museum of Kyrian Heritage
text: Seeds on table during facility phase; any player who did not seed {Ocampa planet} may download a non-Borg [DQ] ship here and/or {Holoprogram: The Voyager Encounter}. Native to this timeline: all [DQ][AU] cards with "31st-century" in lore. Once each turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

lore: Not a legal expert - just a dabo girl. Complained about the lurid requirements in her contract with Quark. Later advocated the abolition of such terms.
name: Sarda*
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Law DL/ {Intuition}

lore: Typical Kazon-Ogla crewman, captured and made to work as part of the combat forces in a 31st-century recreation of U.S.S. Voyager.
name: Revised Kizar*
text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Treachery Archaeology DL/ {Disengage Safety Protocols}

lore: Experienced gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Alluring Orion slave girl and a master thief. Nearly succeeded in capturing Enterprise.
name: Navaar *VP
text: CIVILIAN Leadership x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Orion Syndicate DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

lore: To learn about death, Nagilum attempted to obtain information on it through experimenting on the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
name: Nagilum: Test Subjects
text: Place on ship. Now and start of each turn, kills one crew member (random selection). Cure with 2 SCIENCE, Diplomacy, and Physics OR {Auto-Destruct Sequence}.

lore: Warning for the dead to beware; a Klingon warrior is about to arrive. In Klingon myth, killed warriors with honor go to Sto-Vo-Kor. Dishonored dead go to Gre'thor.
name: Klingon Death Yell
text: Plays on any just killed Klingon with Honor. Yell to warn the dead and earn bonus points. May play only one death yell for each such Klingon.

lore: Chart cataclysmic final battle from the Menthar-Promellian war.
name: Examine Battle Site
text: SCIENCE + (Archaeology OR Anthropology) + Physics + CUNNING>40

lore: Pinpoint source of subspace probe that emanated from this inhospitable world.
name: Investigate Energy Readings
text: SECURITY + Anthropology x2 + (CUNNING>38 OR [Bar]) When you solve, may download {Barash} here.

lore: Ready crew for combat simulation designed to hone tactical skills.
name: Prepare War Game Scenario
text: Computer Skill + SECURITY + Leadership x2 + (CUNNING>40 OR {Sirna Kolrami})

lore: Probe reports of mysterious Ferengi activity in this sector.
name: Reported Activity
text: Navigation + Honor x2 OR Navigation + ENGINEER x2

lore: Typical Cardassian military aide. Fleet logistics expert and skilled negotiator. Glinn who assisted Lemec in 2369. Friend of Corak.
name: Tajor
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Archaeology

lore: Nurse Alyssa Ogawa is a medical assistant and friend to Dr. Beverly Crusher.
name: Alyssa Ogawa
text: MEDICAL Biology

lore: Typical human settler on Dorvan V. He joined the Maquis after the colony was passed to Cardassian control following the U.S.S. Enterprise visit in 2370.
name: Anhaica
text: SECURITY Archaeology Geology Astrophysics ENGINEER, Physics (if with a different [Maq] personnel).

lore: Typical human settler on Dorvan V. He joined the Maquis after the colony was passed to Cardassian control following the U.S.S. Enterprise visit in 2370.
name: Anhaica*
text: SECURITY Archaeology Geology Astrophysics ENGINEER, Physics (if with a different [Maq] personnel).

lore: Typical humanoid employee of Omag. Retained for her expertise in biochemical weaponry and her talents for the tympanic tickle. Mentor to Calandra.
name: Aletia
text: SCIENCE Acquisition Biology Physics

lore: Typical humanoid employee of Omag. Retained for her expertise in biochemical weaponry and her talents for the tympanic tickle. Mentor to Calandra.
name: Aletia*
text: SCIENCE Acquisition Biology Physics

characteristicsKeywords: Ferengi; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Representative of Ferengi trained in the field of commercial security. He helped Lurin take over the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2369.
name: Follis
text: SECURITY Navigation

lore: Transporter technician under the command of Lurin. Guarded a U.S.S. Enterprise transporter room during his DaiMon's unsuccessful takeover attempt.
name: Krunk
text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

lore: Representative Ferengi DaiMon. First member of the Ferengi Alliance to make visual contact with humans. Claimed he sought "only what is equitable."
name: Taar
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Astrophysics May double {Ferengi Attack} faced in same quadrant.

lore: Male trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Studied the effects of Tribbles on the Klingon nervous system.
name: Divok
text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Smuggled Federation secrets to the Romulans in the form of amino acid codes.
name: J'Ddan
text: SCIENCE Exobiology Treachery

lore: Typical Klingon captain. Enjoys drinking with friends and enemies alike. Commanded a squadron for the House of Duras during the Klingon Civil War.
name: Larg
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Computer Skill Klingon Intelligence

lore: Representative of senior advisors living on Qo'noS. Has loyally served the Klingon High Council since his appointment by K'mpec. Collects antique bat'leths.
name: Qup'ta
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Archaeology Diplomacy

lore: Typical Klingon physician. Personal surgeon to Kargan. Became romantically involved with Vekma while serving aboard the I.K.S. Pagh.
name: Vol'Jin
text: MEDICAL Physics Navigation Exobiology

lore: Genetically engineered human and leader of an isolationist colony on Moab IV. He became romantically involved with Deanna Troi in 2368.
name: Aaron Conor
text: CIVILIAN Leadership ENGINEER Biology Honor Doubles {Female's Love Interest}.

lore: Rutian chief of police. Takes a hard line on terrorism. Pledges to end the Ansata violence. Has survived three assassination attempts on her life.
name: Alexana Devos
text: SECURITY Law Leadership MEDICAL Biology Archaeology

characteristicsKeywords: Humanoid; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
lore: Typical humanoid mercenary. Colleague of Narik and Vekor. In 2370, he worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol. Distrusts Galen.
name: Dacres
text: SECURITY Astrophysics Biology Physics Treachery

lore: Characteristic of disconnected Borg. Assault team member on Ohniaka III. Assigned by The One to identify the Starfleet forces encountered there.
name: Tayar
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Physics Stellar Cartography

lore: Typical member of the Romulan underground. Colleague of Dr. Koramar. Impersonated a security officer to apprehend Jean-Luc Picard and Data.
name: Jacen
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Astrophysics

lore: Typical Romulan underground sympathizer. Chief engineer aboard the Khazara. He aided N'Vek in misaligning the cloak. Collects antique globes.
name: Mengran
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Biology Astrophysics Honor

lore: Representative of versatile bridge officers serving aboard the Haakona under Taris. He later returned to Romulus and joined the Romulan underground.
name: Nefets
text: OFFICER Honor SCIENCE Leadership Geology

lore: Romulan trained in the field of engineering. A specialist in artificial quantum singularity. Served aboard the Khazara in 2369.
name: Palteth
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Ferengi marauder. Under the command of Bractor in 2365, interrupted a mysterious battle between the Federation starships Enterprise and Hathaway.
name: Kreechta
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

lore: Attempt to restore civilians killed by metreon cascade weapon on the Talaxian moon of Rinax.
name: Restore Victims *VP
text: SCIENCE x2 + Physics x3 + Transporter Skill x2 Talaxians may report on planet (for free).

lore: They have two settings, stun and kill. It would be best not to confuse them.
name: Starfleet Phaser Pistol
text: Starfleet use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (or +3 if that personnel has SECURITY). (Cumulative.)

lore: One might meet an unfortunate end if the timeline were to be altered.
name: Revisionist History
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn (thrice per game), you may discard a card from hand to search your discard pile for an [AU] Event and take it into hand.

lore: Time travel can afford the user certain abilities that might not be available to those native to the current time.
name: Temporal Shifting
text: Plays on a player. That player must choose to either discard three cards from hand or discard one [AU] card. If that player discards an [AU] card, he/she may draw up to four cards. Discard event.

lore: The place that started it all. Changed the galaxy as we know it.
name: Seat of Starfleet
text: Seeds or plays on {2154 Earth}. Once per turn, one [Sta] personnel may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.) DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

lore: Self-taught chief engineer of Enterprise. Best friend and confidant to Jonathan Archer. From Panama City, Florida. Enjoys pecan pie.
name: Charles Tucker III
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Honor Computer Skill x 2 Diplomacy Transporter Skill x 2 DL/ {Any tricorder}

lore: Hard working scientist, gourmet cook, and amateur bartender. Always eager to be selected for special assignments.
name: Elizabeth Cutler
text: SCIENCE Biology Exobiology Geology May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

lore: Inventor of the transporter and father figure to Jonathan Archer. Dreams big. Honorary president of the Association of Transporter Technicians.
name: Emory Erickson
text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Transporter Skill x 3 Physics Computer Skill x 2

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bartender; Cook; Male; President; Senator; Waiter;
lore: Tends to leave jobs quickly. Tried working as a cook, bartender, waiter, fan club president and even student senator before joining Starfleet.
name: Ethan Novakovich
text: SCIENCE Biology Computer Skill Physics

lore: Communications officer on board Enterprise, NX-01. Didn't want to come along, but after listening to some Klingon, she felt motivated.
name: Hoshi Sato
text: OFFICER Music Anthropology DL/ {Hail} May nullify Female-related dilemmas where present.

lore: Chairman of research at Cold Station 12. Close friend of Phlox. His optimism sometimes leads him to jump to dangerous conclusions.
name: Jeremy Lucas
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Honor DL/ Any MEDICAL-related Equipment card

lore: Captain of Enterprise, NX-01. Leaped into deep space to make the future quantifiably better for all mankind.
name: Jonathan Archer
text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Navigation Leadership x 2 Anthropology DL/ {Porthos} DL/ {Captain's Log}

lore: Head of security aboard Enterprise. Experienced weapons expert, qualified bodyguard and crack shot.
name: Malcolm Reed
text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Law Leadership Transporter Skill Other SECURITY personnel present are attributes all +1.

lore: Respected admiral. Friend of Soval. Sent the crew of Enterprise out into the final frontier to go where no man had gone before.
name: Maxwell Forrest
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership x 2 Astrophysics DL/ Any NX-class ship

lore: Denobulan miracle worker. Former chairman of immunology at his alma mater. Has a great smile.
name: Phlox
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Honor Exobiology If a [Sta] personnel present dies, you may discard two cards to return that personnel to hand.

lore: Female Vulcan first officer of Enterprise, NX-01. Finds humans to be fascinating. Dislikes the smell of dogs.
name: T'Pol
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Mindmeld Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology DL/ Any Interrupt with "Vulcan" in title or gametext

lore: Crack pilot aboard Enterprise, NX-01. Itching to get into deep space. Loves the sweet spot.
name: Travis Mayweather
text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Astrophysics Navigation x 2 Computer Skill Once every turn, may nullify {Full Planet Scan}.

lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
name: Enterprise
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

name: T'Pol/Soong Maneuver
text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +3 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a NX-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Burn and Turn: until the end of your next full turn, this ship may not move to a mission where an opponent has a ship.

lore: Standard Kazon Personal Display Device for computerized information. Such equipment has been developed by many races throughout the Delta Quadrant.
name: Kazon PADD
text: May be used only by a non-Federation [DQ] personnel. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

lore: When pursuing particularly dangerous prey, Hirogen hunting groups would often join forces in a multi-pronged attack.
name: Hirogen Hunt: Coordinated Effort
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if all your ships in play are [Hir] or a [Self] card is in play, you may report a [Univ][Hir] personnel for free. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: In 2371, the Cardassian agent Seska formed a pact with the Kazon-Nistrim, covertly supplying them with Federation technology.
name: Treaty: Cardassian/Kazon
text: Seeds or plays on table (plays for free if you have {Seska} in play). Your Cardassian and Kazon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

name: Homestead
text: Seeds or plays on table. If you have completed three missions (including at least one [P] and one [S]), you may ignore any effect that requires you to score "an additional 40 points to win." Nullified if you have seeded a mission showing more than 30 points.

lore: Use dense astronomical phenomenon to avoid local conflict.
name: Bypass Warzone
text: Leadership + SCIENCE + Astrophysics *+10 points if no [Non] in crew.

lore: Scout immediate area and ascertain potential for conquest.
name: Preliminary Incursion
text: SECURITY + Navigation x2 + Astrophysics

lore: Captured by Karr and altered to appear Klingon. Human captain Kathryn Janeway fought in Hirogen training simulations. She's no one's prey.
name: Janeway
text: V.I.P. Honor Anthropology DL/ {Warrior's Birthright} SCIENCE Your [Hir] personnel present are STRENGTH +1

characteristicsKeywords: Kazon/Cardassian; Dual-personnel; Female; Kazon-Nistrim; Maje; Male;
lore: In 2371, First Maje Culluh of the Kazon-Nistrim allied himself with the Cardassian spy Seska and took her as his mate. They had a son together.
name: Culluh and Seska
text: OFFICER/ENGINEER Culluh: Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Greed Seska: SECURITY Transporter Skill Treachery x 2

lore: In 2377, Tom Paris accepted T'Greth's challenge of a fight to the death. Human nurse, husband of B'Elanna Daughter of Miral, and father of their child.
name: Tom Son of Owen
text: OFFICER Honor MEDICAL Navigation x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Bat'leth}

lore: Talaxian jack-of-all-trades. Has served on a Trabalian freighter, mining colony, and Voyager. Serves as cook, morale officer, guide, and sometimes ambassador.
name: Neelix* *VP
text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Diplomacy ENGINEER Geology

lore: Vulcan discipline for relaxing the mind and muscles by stimulating neural nodes and pressure points. Charles Tucker III was one of the few outsiders to experience it.
name: Neuropressure Massage *VP
text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, if all your personnel are Vulcan, you may draw two cards and place one of them beneath draw deck.

lore: Captured by Karr and altered to appear Klingon. Human captain Kathryn Janeway fought in Hirogen training simulations. She's no one's prey.
name: Janeway*
text: V.I.P. Honor Anthropology DL/ {Warrior's Birthright} SCIENCE Your [Hir] personnel present are STRENGTH +1

lore: In 2374, Jadzia Dax was severely wounded on a critical mission. Worf was compelled to save the woman he loved, ignoring the mission and the consequences for the Federation.
name: The Beating Heart
text: Plays on table. You may stop your personnel to prevent their romantic partner present from being killed by a dilemma (that personnel is stopped instead).

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Ambassador; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter; zhian'tara;
lore: As part of Jadzia Dax's zhian'tara ritual aboard DS9, former Ambassador and host Curzon Dax was merged with the changeling Odo in 2371.
name: Curzon Odo
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Anthropology Law SECURITY When he leaves play, may download {Odo} and/or {Jadzia Dax}.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Ambassador; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter; zhian'tara;
lore: As part of Jadzia Dax's zhian'tara ritual aboard DS9, former Ambassador and host Curzon Dax was merged with the changeling Odo in 2371.
name: Curzon Odo*
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Anthropology Law SECURITY When he leaves play, may download {Odo} and/or {Jadzia Dax}.

lore: Typical symbiont host. Trill Symbiosis Commission member. She evaluated Jadzia Dax as an initiate.
name: Dr. Renhol
text: MEDICAL Treachery OR Diplomacy (change at any time). Opponent may not attempt {Symbiont Diagnosis} unless opponent seeded it. Biology

lore: Trill scientist. Host of the Kahn symbiont. In 2372, she became romantically involved with Jadzia Dax.
name: Lenara Kahn
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Physics ENGINEER You may play a {Wormhole} interrupt on a location to move her ship there.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon/Trill; Female; Male; Trill with symbiont;
lore: The Klingon Worf and his Trill bride Jadzia Dax opted for a Klingon ceremony to differentiate from other weddings her symbiont had experienced.
name: Worf and Jadzia
text: OFFICER/SCIENCE Worf: Honor x 2 SECURITY DL/ {The Beating Heart} Jadzia: Anthropology Physics Astrophysics

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon/Trill; Female; Male; Trill with symbiont;
lore: The Klingon Worf and his Trill bride Jadzia Dax opted for a Klingon ceremony to differentiate from other weddings her symbiont had experienced.
name: Worf and Jadzia*
text: OFFICER/SCIENCE Worf: Honor x 2 SECURITY DL/ {The Beating Heart} Jadzia: Anthropology Physics Astrophysics

lore: Violent, unstable pianist embodied in the human Benjamin Sisko during Jadzia Dax's zhian'tara. By 2286, he had murdered a total of three people.
name: Joran
text: CIVILIAN Music x 2 Treachery x 2 Anthropology SECURITY DL/ {Shrouded Assailant}

lore: Pioneering legislator. One of the first councilwomen appointed on Trill. Was embodied in the Bajoran Kira Nerys during Jadzia Dax's zhian'tara.
name: Lela
text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Diplomacy Stellar Cartography Leadership Other females present are attributes all +1.

lore: Pilot embodied in the human Julian Bashir during Jadzia Dax's zhian'tara. Knows life is too short.
name: Torias
text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Astrophysics Youth Must be selected by "opponent's choice" selections (if applicable).

lore: Part human, part Trill descendant of Jadzia Dax who inherited the symbiont in an alternate timeline. Felt liable for the accidental creation of the Gaia colony.
name: Yedrin Dax
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Physics Anthropology Treachery Personnel present gain CIVILIAN, if in {Colony}.

lore: "We all originated from lesser species. I myself came from Species 125. But that's irrelevant now. We are Borg... Our thoughts are one... One order, one voice."
name: Borg Queen (The Borg) *VP
text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download any [BO] Event or Interrupt card in place of your normal card play.

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Assimilate human homeworld by direct attack, Earth date 2373. Borg Queen commands.
name: Queen's Borg Cube *VP
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at {Earth}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

lore: To solve this holographic puzzle, its challenger must turn a multicolor sphere a solid hue using neural theta waves. The symbiont Dax tried unsuccessfully for over 140 years.
name: Altonian Brain Teaser *VP
text: Most CUNNING personnel present is "stopped." If their CUNNING<15, bonus points scored at this spaceline location do not count toward winning. Discard dilemma.

lore: To obtain a rare gift for his father, Jake Sisko and his friend Nog bartered, swapped favors, stole a teddy bear, and even negotiated with Weyoun.
name: Incentive-Based Economics *VP
text: To get past requires Honor and no SECURITY OR CIVILIAN, Anthropology, Diplomacy, Youth, and a personnel with STRENGTH<8.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
lore: Outspoken Major in Bajoran Militia. Assigned as first officer of Deep Space 9. Former member of Shakaar resistance cell. Romantically involved with Odo.
name: Kira Nerys *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation x 2 Computer Skill X=3 vs. [Car].

lore: Changeling posing as Julian Bashir. Tried to destroy an entire fleet by causing the Bajoran sun to go nova.
name: Bashir Founder *VP
text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Supernova} ({Tox Uthat} not required; opponent must have total usable WEAPONS>36 at this location).

lore: Chief of operations on Deep Space 9. Friend of Julian. Father of Molly and Kirayoshi. Husband of Keiko. Likes kayaking, darts and historical battle simulations.
name: Miles O'Brien (Blaze of Glory) *VP
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Defense System Upgrade}

lore: Klingon strategic operations officer aboard DS9. Often commanded the U.S.S. Defiant. Romantically involved with Jadzia Dax. Likes prune juice.
name: Worf (20th Anniversary) *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership Honor x 2 Diplomacy SECURITY Doubles DEFENSE bonus of your Tactic (if involved).

lore: The human Benjamin Sisko assumed the identity of Jodmos, son of Kobor, to help rid the Klingon Empire of a suspected changeling at Ty'Gokor.
name: Jodmos *VP
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Honor May stun adversary without Honor he just engaged.

lore: Odo donned civilian clothes and went aboard Deep Space Station K-7 in 2267 to search for an explosive tribble. Recently made human by the Great Link.
name: Odo (The Trouble with Tribbles) *VP
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY x 2 Computer Skill Honor DL/ {Classic Communicator}

name: Quark's Bar *VP
requires: Bartender; Dabo Girl; Ferengi; Ferengi ship; Waiter;
text: {Morn} and Ferengi may report here. Once each turn, a bartender, a dabo girl, a waiter, {any Quark} or {any Rom} may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Any player who has Morn unopposed here may draw an additional card at end of each turn. Any player who kills any waiters or dabo girls here in battle must discard two cards for each. Ferengi ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

lore: In 2168, a copy of the book Chicago Mobs of the Twenties was left on planet Sigma Iotia II by a crew member from the Starfleet vessel Horizon.
name: The Book
text: Immediately name a non-[Bor] affiliation and a regular skill; place on table. Your [Non] personnel gain the named affiliation and skill (even if not in play).

lore: Genetically engineered for greater strength and ambition, human augments can be intimidating foes. The Starship Enterprise encountered some in suspended animation in 2267.
name: Augment Aggression
text: Opponent may download to this location up to three augments. If you have Archaeology and MEDICAL, these augments are in stasis until the end of your next turn.

lore: Fleet captain and former Starship Enterprise commander Christopher Pike was exposed to disfiguring delta particle radiation in the line of duty while saving trainees and cadets.
name: Crippling Injury
text: To get past requires 2 OFFICER OR 2 Leadership. Then, place on a unique leader present (opponent's choice); loses all regular skills and has NO STRENGTH.

lore: Gaseous predator which feeds on red blood cells. Killed 200 crewmen from the Starship Farragut in 2257.
name: Dikironium Cloud Creature
text: End of every turn: Kills four of each player's personnel here (their choice, human if possible), then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

lore: The Platonians' psychokinetic abilities allowed them to turn Captain Kirk, Mr. Spock, Lt. Uhura and Nurse Chapel into playthings for their amusement.
name: Entertaining Display
text: Opponent may download up to two females to planet; place on mission. To solve mission, Away Team must have more Anthropology than opponent has females present.

lore: Translated as "marriage or challenge", this ritual requires Vulcans, driven by the neurochemical imbalance known as Pon Farr, to take a mate or fight a challenger in combat.
name: Koon-ut-kal-if-fee
text: Randomly select one Vulcan male OR opponent chooses one personnel. To get past, personnel must relocate to matching homeworld OR battle strongest other male present.

lore: With the meaning of the Yangs' "holy words" lost to them, Captain Kirk re-educated them about freedom and liberty.
name: Misinterpreted History
text: Personnel with highest CUNNING OR most Treachery is killed (opponent's choice). To get past requires Law and Archaeology OR Exobiology and 2 Leadership OR a President.

lore: Automated machine capable of destroying entire planets with an antiproton beam and consuming the debris for fuel.
name: Planet Killer
text: End of every turn: Attacks all ships here, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

lore: Mutated into a different stage of human evolution, Tom Paris and Kathryn Janeway reverted to their animal instincts and procreated.
name: Primal Urges
text: To get past, one male and one female (your choice) must run off to furthest planet. Nullify with 2 ANIMAL.

lore: Large, space-dwelling, single-celled organism. Surrounded by a field of negative energy, toxic to humanoid life.
name: Space Amoeba
text: All attributes of ships and personnel at this location (and each adjacent location) become 5. End of every turn: Moves.

lore: Enhanced with inhuman abilities, Charlie Evans took control of the Starship Enterprise. By turning on all shipboard systems, Captain Kirk proved the young man had overreached himself.
name: Thasian Powers
text: You may discard any number of cards from hand. To get past requires CUNNING>(40 + 5X), where X = number of cards in your hand.

name: Preserver Obelisk
text: Seed one on table in facility phase; if you have no personnel in play, you may download up to 2 different [OS] personnel who name in lore a planet you seeded. Score 5 points whenever such a personnel helps solve the planet mission they name. You may not seed {Assign Mission Specialists}. OR Plays to download such a personnel whom you do not have in play.

lore: The 23rd century was a period of expansion and exploration for many spacefaring races.
name: Five-Year Mission
text: Seeds on table. At the end of each of your turns, if all of your personnel and ships in play are [OS], you may draw an extra card. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: Advanced multitronic computer prototype created by Richard Daystrom in 2268. More sophisticated than the duotronic computer. Its self-preservation instinct proved dangerous.
name: M-5 Computer
text: Plays on your [OS] ship OR non-[Bor] ship with 2 Computer Skill aboard. Ship may move and initiate battle without staffing or leader aboard. (Unique.)

lore: During their off-hours, Starfleet officers in the 23rd century would frequently gather in crew lounges for socializing over some food, listening to music, and playing card games.
name: Recreation Room
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, when you play a unique [OS] card, you may draw a card and then place a card from hand on the bottom of your deck.

lore: Exploration of the stars, encounters with different cultures, and the potential for knowledge and advancements were driving forces for expansion in the 23rd century.
name: To Boldly Go
text: Seeds or plays on table. For every mission you seeded with "23rd century" in lore, your [OS] ships are RANGE and SHIELDS +1 (limit 3). (Captain's Order.)

lore: "The transmissions of an orbiting Probe are causing critical damage to this planet... Save your energy, save yourselves. Avoid the planet Earth at all costs. Farewell."
name: Urgent Warning
text: Once per game per card title, you may download {The Whale Probe} OR a {[Self] dilemma} and put it into play at a spaceline end (opponent's choice). Discard event.

name: Ravenous Hunger
text: Plays on an opponent's non-homeworld [P] mission (once per game, may play for free). End of every turn, if {Planet Killer} is here and did not move or battle here this turn, and no ships here, planet is converted to a [S] mission. If unsolved, [S] mission now worth 30 points. Planet Killer may not move from here while this is a [P] mission (but may "fly by").

name: Risk is Our Business
text: Seeds or plays on table. End of each turn, if your [Fed][OS] ship is exposed with two unstopped [OS] personnel aboard at a mission with "23rd century" in lore, draw a card. At the start of your first mission attempt of each mission, you may download {Prepare Landing Party} OR {Where No Man Has Gone Before} OR {Where No One Has Gone Before} OR {Preserver Obelisk} OR {Recreation Room} OR {Corbomite Device}.

name: The Final Frontier
text: Seed one on your outpost. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may download an [OS] ship. Twice each turn, your matching [AU][OS] personnel OR [AU][Non][OS] personnel reporting here may do so for free. You may not play non-[OS] personnel or report cards to time locations. All {Temporal Investigations} and your {Crew Reassignment} and {Crossover} are nullified.

lore: Mr. Scott was well known for his ability to swiftly retrieve his shipmates from difficult situations
name: Scotty, Beam Me Up!
text: Plays on your Away Team just after a dilemma kills your personnel present. Transporter Skill on your ship in orbit may beam up entire Away Team.

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Acquire information from central Federation library, built in the 23rd century.
name: Access Archives
text: Computer Skill X = number of different classifications present.

lore: Host conference at venue famed for several historic treaties of the 23rd century.
name: Arbitrate Negotiations
text: Diplomacy x2 + SECURITY x2 + CUNNING>40

lore: Search for evidence of cultural interference from stranded 23rd century crew.
name: Clandestine Search
text: SECURITY x2 + Diplomacy + Computer Skill + (Anthropology OR Treachery x2 OR a Praetor)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Study ancient obelisk which defends preserved society encountered in the 23rd century.
name: Examine Protected Culture
text: OFFICER x2 + ENGINEER + (CIVILIAN OR Music OR {Classic Communicator})

lore: Update 23rd century data on electromagnetic phenomenon.
name: Examine Quasar
text: SCIENCE + Exobiology + Astrophysics + Navigation

lore: Determine origin of General Order 7, imposed on this planet in the 23rd century.
name: Investigate Quarantine
text: (Honor OR Treachery) + Anthropology + SECURITY + (any Intelligence OR CUNNING>32 OR {Vina})

lore: Collect gains from 23rd century contract and determine re-investment options.
name: Reallocate Dividends
text: Diplomacy + (Anthropology OR Acquisition) + (Law OR Greed OR CUNNING>32)

lore: Enhance 23rd century spore-based vaccine to protect against Berthold rays.
name: Refine Inoculation
text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + Physics + STRENGTH>36

lore: Defuse recent hostility in system at peace since the 23rd century.
name: Resolve Local Tensions
text: Diplomacy + Leadership + staffed ship in orbit with (Computer Skill + Navigation OR {Mr. Scott}) aboard

lore: Evaluate pergium extraction process since Horta tunnelling began in the 23rd century.
name: Review Mining Operation
text: Geology + Diplomacy + ENGINEER + SECURITY {Process Ore: Mining} here scores double points.

lore: Search for debris from Starship Intrepid, destroyed in the 23rd century.
name: Seek Remnants
text: Navigation + Computer Skill + Archaeology + CUNNING>35

lore: Study impact from 23rd century explosion of Ceti Alpha VI.
name: Study Planetary Devastation
text: Leadership + CUNNING>32 + (SCIENCE x2 OR Geology)

lore: Deliver medical supplies to prevent reoccurrence of 23rd century plague.
name: Transfer Vaccines
text: ENGINEER + Navigation + MEDICAL Solving player may immediately cure one dilemma.

name: General Order 7
text: Seeds or plays on {Talos IV}. Your [Fed][OS] personnel may attempt this mission. Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download to hand {Christopher Pike} or any personnel who names him in lore. Your {Starship Enterprise} may use its full range to move here from any spaceline location in the Alpha Quadrant.

name: Let Me Help
text: Seeds on table if you seeded at least 18 cards under opponent's missions. {Love Interest} dilemmas affect one additional personnel. On dilemmas with "male" or "female" in gametext (except {Distraction}), every printed number is increased by 1. Such dilemmas are considered Borg-related; [Univ][Bor] personnel encountering them are considered male and female.

name: Obsession
text: Seeds on table; download a {[Self] dilemma} (except {Borg Ship}) and put it into play at a spaceline end (opponent's choice). Once each turn, your event that plays on a ship may play for free. When you destroy a [Self] card, score points equal to its RANGE + WEAPONS. Points scored from [Self] cards do not count towards {Writ of Accountability}. (Unique.)

lore: Youthful commander of the Starship Enterprise who succeeded Christopher Pike. Talented strategist who can outwit a computer or a Vulcan.
name: Captain Kirk (The Cage)
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Anthropology Youth Computer Skill SECURITY Law

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Christopher Pike-related; Male; Mission Specialist;
lore: Typical transporter operator. Human who served under Christopher Pike in 2254. He had a brother who briefly worked in security.
name: Chief Pitcairn
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill

lore: Decorated flag officer and commander of Starbase 11 on Planet M-11. He acted as president of the court during Captain Kirk's court martial in 2267.
name: Commodore Stone
text: V.I.P. OFFICER ENGINEER Leadership DL/ {Legal Proceedings}

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Bartender; Christopher Pike-related; Counselor; Male;
lore: Chief medical officer of the Starship Enterprise in 2254. Human doctor, he also served as bartender, counselor, and confidant to Christopher Pike.
name: Dr. Boyce
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Anthropology Honor

lore: Security chief aboard the Starship Enterprise in 2267. He led the security forces that attempted to track down the Horta on Janus VI. Dislikes computers.
name: Lt. Commander Giotto
text: SECURITY Honor Leadership Astrophysics DL/ {Classic Communicator}

lore: One of many navigators who served aboard the Starship Enterprise under Christopher Pike. He joined the initial landing party to Talos IV in 2254.
name: Lt. Jose Tyler
text: SECURITY Physics Navigation If on an [OS] ship, it is WEAPONS +3 while returning fire. (Cumulative.)

lore: One of many navigators on the Starship Enterprise. Irishman who survived the Tarsus IV massacre. Later sought vengeance on Governor Kodos. Talented singer.
name: Lt. Kevin Riley
text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Music

lore: Expert in ancient civilizations. Human who served aboard Starship Enterprise and visited Pollux IV in 2267. Apollo selected her to be his queen.
name: Lt. Palamas
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Archaeology Youth

lore: Head of Astrosciences aboard the Starship Enterprise in 2265. He joined the ship shortly after the departure of Christopher Pike. Born in San Francisco.
name: Lt. Sulu (The Cage)
text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Biology Physics DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

lore: Chief engineer. Scotty often served as acting captain of the Starship Enterprise. He has impeccable timing.
name: Mr. Scott (The Cage)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Transporter Skill ENGINEER Physics Leadership DL/ {Classic Phaser Banks} DL/ {Scotty, Beam Me Up!}

lore: Analytical first officer, talented with computers. She frequently commanded Starship Enterprise when Christopher Pike was part of a landing party.
name: Number One
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Computer Skill DL/ {Rescue Captives}

lore: Genius who designed the duotronic computer and later developed the M-5 computer. He has won both the Nobel and Zee-Magnees prizes.
name: Richard Daystrom
text: V.I.P. Computer Skill x 3 ENGINEER Physics DL/ {M-5 Computer}

lore: Attorney at law living on Planet M-11. Human who never uses computers. Prefers his library of books, from the Magna Carta to The Statutes of Alpha III.
name: Samuel T. Cogley
text: CIVILIAN Law x 2 Honor Anthropology Biology Once per game, may nullify {Computer Crash}.

lore: Typical of chief engineers on mining colonies. Administrator for the Janus VI pergium operation. Came to accept the Horta, despite their appearance.
name: Vanderberg
text: ENGINEER Leadership Geology Acquisition Archaeology

lore: Representative of yeomen serving in Starfleet in 2254. Newly assigned to Christopher Pike. She is one of only a few humans ever to visit Talos IV.
name: Yeoman Colt
text: OFFICER Youth Geology Astrophysics

lore: Lascivious lackey of Par Lenor. Typical member of the Ferengi Trade Mission. He tried to free Kamala.
name: Qol (The Cage)
text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Exobiology Draw a card when opponent reveals a gender-related dilemma. (Not cumulative.)

characteristicsKeywords: Planet 892-IV native; Male; Mission Specialist; Proconsul;
lore: Typical corrupt politician, obsessed with television ratings. Proconsul of a Roman Empire. Hails from Planet 892-IV. Fan of gladiatorial combat.
name: Claudius Marcus
text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy

lore: Typical human settler and botanist on Omicron Ceti III. She became romantically involved with Mr. Spock during his euphoria after exposure to local spore plants.
name: Leila Kalomi
text: SCIENCE Exobiology

lore: Native of Eminiar VII and daughter of Anan 7. She was vocal in defending the Eminian philosophy of humane war, horrified by the prospect of a real one.
name: Mea 3
text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Honor Computer Skill

lore: Human tribal priestess living on the planet Amerind. Fell in love with and married Captain Kirk, whom she knew as Kirok. Had faith he would save her people.
name: Miramanee
text: CIVILIAN Honor Law Anthropology Youth DL/ {I Love You}

lore: Hunter and pilot. Humanoid obsessed with killing the soulless telepathic protoplasmic beast that devoured his family. Has an icy and robotic disposition.
name: Qatai
text: ENGINEER MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Navigation DL/ {Urgent Warning}

characteristicsKeywords: Sigma Iotia II native; Male; Thief;
lore: Typical gangster boss from Sigma Iotia II. Ruled a territory there, like fellow bosses Bela Okmyx and Jojo Krako. Former jewel thief. Likes soup.
name: Tepo
text: V.I.P. SECURITY Geology Leadership Acquisition

lore: Talosian magistrate who oversaw a menagerie of extraterrestrials on Talos IV. He tried to add Christopher Pike to his collection as a mate for Vina.
name: The Keeper
text: SECURITY Empathy x 3 Anthropology Treachery

lore: Starfleet registry number NCC-1017. In 2267 investigated vast destruction in systems L-370 through L-374. Commanded by Commodore Decker.
name: Starship Constellation
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Emergency Evacuation}

name: Classic Phaser Banks
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 3. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Constitution-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Code One Emergency: [Fed][OS] ships may attack this ship, ignoring affiliation attack restrictions.

name: It Must Be Destroyed
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. If battling a [Self] card, ATTACK bonus +4 and your ships and crews are not stopped afterwards (but may not initiate battle again this turn). Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25%

name: Preserver Obelisk *VP
text: Seed one on table in facility phase; if you have no personnel in play, you may download up to 2 different [OS] personnel who name in lore a planet you seeded. Score 5 points whenever such a personnel helps solve the planet mission they name. You may not seed {Assign Mission Specialists}. OR Plays to download such a personnel whom you do not have in play.

name: Population 9 Billion - All Borg *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. If your Borg have completed {Stop First Contact} (or {Build Interplexing Beacon}), place incident on {Earth}; you may download a {Borg outpost} there. Your [Bor] cards may subsequently report on Earth or to that outpost; and your subsequently completed [BO] objectives targeting missions in the Alpha Quadrant score double points.

lore: Race which explores the galaxy by giving other species the temporary ability and strong compulsion to come to them.
name: Cytherians *VP
text: Place on ship. Ship must do nothing but travel to far end of spaceline at normal speed. When reached, discard dilemma. Score points.

lore: Sentient dimensional beings whose young incubate in black holes. When nesting in a Romulan ship's artificial singularity engine, a frozen-time effect occurs.
name: Quantum Singularity Lifeforms *VP
text: If a Romulan ship present, all ships and personnel here are placed in stasis. Cure with {Emergency Transporter Armbands}, {Timepod Ring} or new ENGINEER arriving.

name: Temporal Vortex *VP
text: Plays on a time location. While in play, any ships may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location. OR Suspends play while you place doorway on {Borg Ship} dilemma or {The Sheliak}. While in play, dilemma disappears. OR Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Distortion of Space/Time Continuum}. OR Relocates one of your ships at a time location to spaceline location of opponent's choice.

name: Devidian Door *VP
text: Plays on table. While in play, allows you to play a card "from the future." Once each turn, you may say "Devidian Door" and play one Personnel or Equipment card to any planet. At any time during your next turn (or at game end, if sooner), you must show a Devidian Door from hand and place it out-of-play, or you lose the game. (Immune to cards which close doorways.)

lore: Small device used to monitor the auto-timer on the time travel pod appropriated by Berlinghoff Rasmussen. As he was uncertain how to reprogram the timer, the ring was very precious to him.
name: Timepod Ring *VP
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may peek at the top card of your deck. Also, you may discard this event and the top card of your draw deck to nullify an [AU] dilemma.

name: Out of Time *VP
text: Plays for free at any time to take up to three temporal agents in your discard pile into hand OR to allow your temporal agent, any number of your personnel present, and/or your ship he or she is aboard to time travel between a time location and the corresponding spaceline location. Discard incident OR "stop" your temporal agent to place this on top of your draw deck.

lore: Investigate quantum fissure between parallel universes reported here.
name: Fissure Research *VP
text: Astrophysics + Physics + 3 [AU] icon Personnel

characteristicsKeywords: Suliban; genetically enhanced; Male; Shape-shifter; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Genetically-enhanced Suliban shape-shifter who led the Cabal in the 22nd-century. Temporal agent for a mysterious manipulator from the future.
name: Silik *VP
text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 ENGINEER Physics Leadership May report to any time location.

name: Science Lab *VP
text: Compatible SCIENCE-classification personnel, SCIENCE-related Equipment cards, {I.P. Scanner} and {PADD}s may report here. Once each turn, if station at a [S] mission and player who controls station has a SCIENCE personnel unopposed here, that player may scan bottom seed card under the mission. Matching SCIENCE personnel may {file mission report}s here. Any Nor: Docking Ring

lore: The Borg Queen uses deadly force and extreme measures to protect the hive mind. The sense of identity found in residents of Unimatrix Zero was both a threat and a means to resist.
name: Persistent Individuality
text: Kills 7 - X personnel (random selection), where X = the number of different classifications present. To get past requires ENGINEER.

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Mainstay battle cruiser of the Jem'Hadar fleets. Capable of serving as a mobile base for attack ships. Equipped with shield-penetrating transporters.
name: Jem'Hadar Warship (Borderless Promos)
text: Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

lore: Venerable Starfleet ship refit in 2270. Completed many successful missions before being transferred to Captain Spock's command and retired for use as a training vessel.
name: Starship Enterprise (The Motion Pictures) (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Crew Reassignment}

characteristicsKeywords: D'Kora-class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by DaiMon Bok during his quest for vengeance against Captain Picard. First officer Kazago commanded following Bok's arrest.
name: Kurdon (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam, Holodeck DL/ Any [TNG][Fer] personnel

lore: Small ship usually manned by a hunting pair. Often travels in groups like that which subdued Voyager in 2374. Its monotanium armor scatters enemy targeting scanners.
name: Hunting Vessel (Borderless Promos)
text: X=7+ number of your other staffed [Hir] ships here. Tractor Beam

lore: Massive flagship of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Commanded by Regent Worf. Has a stolen cloaking device installed - and sabotaged - by Rom.
name: Regency 1 (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Stolen Cloaking Device}

lore: With a single thought, Kevin Uxbridge killed the entire Husnock race (50 billion lives) everywhere in the universe. Their powerful ships remain.
name: Husnock Ship (Borderless Promos)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Commanded by Keras during the incursion of Neutral Zone in 2266. Possibly the first Romulan ship with a cloaking device. Named for the firefalls on Romulus.
name: Gal Gath'thong (Borderless Promos)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Romulan [OS] personnel}

lore: Largest starship in the Vidiian fleet. Capable of grappling onto an enemy ship, subduing it for boarding. Drenol commanded one.
name: Vidiian Cruiser (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Vidiian Boarding Claw}

characteristicsKeywords: Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
lore: 22nd-century mainstay of the Vulcan fleet. Combat cruiser tasked to ferry Phlox and T'Pol home after Enterprise was temporarily recalled in 2152.
name: D'kyr (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam, SCIENCE

lore: Flagship of a Bajoran blockade in 2375. Commanded by Colonel Kira in opposition to the Romulan fortification of their medical facilities on Derna.
name: Kitara (Borderless Promos)
text: DL/ {Souls of the Dead}

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Eliminate resistance at location designation Wolf 359. Locutus of Borg commands.
name: Locutus' Borg Cube (Borderless Promos)
text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at Wolf 359. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Keldon Class; Tractor Beam;
lore: Faster than standard Keldon-class vessels. Secretly upgraded by Obsidian Order. Staged in Orias System.
name: Keldon Advanced (Borderless Promos)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Constructed by the Terran Rebellion using stolen plans of the U.S.S. Defiant. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko during the defense of rebel-held Terok Nor.
name: Defiant (Borderless Promos)
text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

lore: First runabout assigned to Deep Space 9. Towed the Prakesh through the Bajoran Wormhole. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko.
name: U.S.S. Rio Grande (Borderless Promos)
text: DL/ {Activate Tractor Beam}

characteristicsKeywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
lore: In 2372, Culluh and Seska took command of the Alpha Quadrant vessel U.S.S. Voyager and its technology for the benefit of the Kazon-Nistrim sect.
name: Voyager (Borderless Promos)
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Home Away from Home}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Bird-of-prey stationed at Deep Space 9 during the war against the Dominion. Commanded by Martok. Led many raids into Cardassian and Dominion space.
name: I.K.S. Rotarran (Borderless Promos)
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

lore: Immense spherical vessel. Flagship of the First Federation. Commanded by Balok.
name: Fesarius (Borderless Promos)
text: Your {Balok} may report aboard (for free). Tractor Beam

lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
name: Enterprise (Borderless Promos)
text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

name: Condition Red *VP
text: Plays on table. While aboard your ships, each of your [Stf] personnel gains [Cmd]. At the start of each of your turns, if opponent has more ships in play than you (including any cloaked, phased, or landed ships), you may discard a card from hand to download a ship to hand, then discard incident (unless ship is [Univ]). (Captain's Order.)

lore: Many occasions are often marked by raising a glass to acknowledge either great joy or tearful sadness. "To absent friends..."
name: Celebratory Toast
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if not playing Borg, you may examine the top card of your draw deck, then place that card on the top or bottom of that deck. (Cumulative.)

lore: Many occasions are often marked by raising a glass to acknowledge either great joy or tearful sadness. "...The bride and groom."
name: Celebratory Toast* *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if not playing Borg, you may examine the top card of your draw deck, then place that card on the top or bottom of that deck. (Cumulative.)

lore: Functions: Disseminate assimilated knowledge and reallocate Collective resources.
name: Distribution Node
text: Your [TNG] Borg here share first-listed skills at highest level. Once each turn, you may discard your drone here to make your drones here all gain any skill until end of turn.

name: Transwarp Network Gateway (Q Who?)
text: Seed one during facility phase on any spaceline end OR play on any spaceline location where you have a [Nav] Borg. Any player may play a {Transwarp Conduit} (or another copy of this doorway) to allow moving any or all of that player's ships from this Transwarp Network Gateway to another. OR Downloads Transwarp Conduit (discard doorway).

lore: After the U.S.S. Enterprise retaliated to the initial assault by the Borg in system J-25, the Collective re-prioritized all drone activity into regenerating the ship.
name: Redirected Effort
text: Plays on table. Once each turn, if you have two [TNG] drones present together, you may place one card from hand beneath draw deck, then draw a card. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

name: Relentless
text: Seeds on table; you may not play implant cards. Initiating a scouting attempt requires a minimum of three drones. Once each turn, you may play {Adapt: Negate Obstruction} to target dilemmas previously encountered by your [TNG] Borg on the same turn. Scouting of missions targeted by your {Consume} objectives is completed at the end of the scouting attempt if no dilemmas remain under mission to be encountered.

name: The Ultimate User
text: Plays on table. You may not download drones. Once each turn, you may report one [TNG] drone for free. Once each turn, when you begin a scouting attempt at a location where you have a [TNG] ship, you may draw a card. Once each turn, your [TNG] drone may discard your [BO] objective and/or download a [BO] objective (ignoring {Computer Crash}).

lore: Confronted by a Starfleet assault team and unable to modulate shielding to their rotating phaser frequencies, Locutus adapted and used physical force to resist their efforts.
name: Adapt: Negate Obstruction (Q Who?)
text: Nullifies a dilemma (except a Q-related dilemma) just encountered by your [Com] Borg if your Borg encountered that dilemma (or a copy) on a previous turn.

lore: Evaluate ominous disappearance of local infrastructure.
name: Examine Distant Sector
text: Navigation x2 + Computer Skill + Stellar Cartography + (RANGE + WEAPONS + SHIELDS>25)

name: Consume: Outpost
text: Plays on table. Target an unsolved Neutral Zone Region mission you have not examined with no [BO] objective on it; download an outpost there (ignoring ENGINEER requirement) from outside the game, uncontrolled. Your [TNG] Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if your staffed [TNG] Borg cube here, Objective complete: place on mission; place outpost out-of-play.

name: Consume: Resources
text: Plays on table. Target an unsolved non-homeworld planet mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your [TNG] Borg may scout that planet. After scouting complete, if your staffed [TNG] Borg cube there, Objective complete: Place on mission; your Archaeology present may acquire any artifacts here. Your [TNG] [Com] drones gain non-Intelligence skills in mission requirements (at their highest level).

name: Consume: Technology
text: Plays on table. Target your unsolved space mission requiring Computer Skill with no [BO] objective on it. Your [TNG] Borg may scout that mission. After scouting complete, if your staffed [TNG] Borg cube there, Objective complete: Place on mission; your [TNG] [Nav] drones gain non-Intelligence skills in mission requirements (at their highest level).
