lore: Identification: ASSEMBLY DRONE Task: Produce enhanced components. Upgrade. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eight of Twenty
text: Physics ENGINEER Navigation Once per game, may download {Redirected Effort}.

lore: Identification: ASTROMETRIC DRONE Task: Catalog interstellar phenomena. Analyze. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eighteen of Twenty
text: Stellar Cartography Navigation Your {Topology Drone} present gains SECURITY.

lore: Identification: BIOHAZARD DRONE Task: Assess biological organisms. Evaluate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Eleven of Fourteen
text: Biology MEDICAL Archaeology If your [TNG] [Com] drone present, may download {A Willing Companion} or {Lower Decks} in place of a card draw.

lore: Identification: OBSERVATION DRONE Task: Collect data on new species. Relay. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Nineteen of Twenty
text: MEDICAL ENGINEER Observation and {Scout Drones} here share printed skills at highest level. If killed, shuffle this drone into your draw deck.

lore: Identification: PRODUCTIVITY DRONE Task: Assess data transfer protocols. Enhance. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: One of Fourteen
text: Anthropology SCIENCE Computer Skill If your [TNG] [Nav] drone present, you may download {Distribution Node} in place of a card draw.

lore: In one universe, Q explored life as a Borg to better understand the hive mind, and determine how best to use the Collective to torment other races.
name: Q of Borg
text: CIVILIAN Treachery Physics x 10 DL/ {Q-Net} His ship may ignore required actions. Once per game, may relocate your ship here to {System J-25}.

lore: Identification: REACTION DRONE Task: Assess progress of hive objectives. Facilitate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
name: Six of Fourteen
text: Transporter Skill SCIENCE Draw a card when your [TNG] counterpart here is stopped by a dilemma (once per game per dilemma card title).

lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Patrol system J-25. Pursue and eliminate resistance. Adapt to unfamiliar weaponry.
name: J-25 Cube
text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam DL/ {Regenerate} (if damaged).

lore: Gul in command of the Reklar. Clashed with Captain Edward Jellico over troop and ship movements along the Federation-Cardassian border.
name: Lemec *VP
text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

lore: Newly promoted human captain William T. Riker married his imzadi, the 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human Deanna Troi, before she transferred to join him.
name: Mr. and Mrs. Troi
text: OFFICER+OFFICER Riker: Leadership x 2 Honor SECURITY Troi: Empathy Diplomacy Anthropology

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Captain; Capturing-related card; Gul; Male;
lore: Harsh interrogator who excels in extracting confessions from Maquis terrorists. Gul. Patrols the Badlands as captain of the Vetar.
name: Evek (Homefront II) *VP
text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Leadership If you hold a captive, gains Biology and Law.

lore: Cardassian warship that surveyed Dorvan V. Pursued the Liberty into the Badlands. Commanded by Evek.
name: Vetar *VP
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Pursuit] card} WEAPONS +2 vs. [Maq].

name: Assign Support Personnel *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) Your "support personnel" (those who have exactly two skills, but no special skills) may report aboard your compatible ships that have two or more staffing icons. Once each turn, you may discard objective to download a "support personnel" (once per game per Personnel card title) to your matching ship that has two or more staffing icons, or to your matching facility.

lore: Eminiar VII was in a simulated war with Vendikar for 500 years. Shipboard and ground-based deaths were determined by computer and completed at disintegration stations.
name: Eminian Disintegration Protocol
text: One SECURITY (at [P]) or one ENGINEER (at [S]) with most [*] is killed. To get past requires 2 SECURITY (at [P]) OR 2 ENGINEER (at [S]) OR six non-[Bor] [Univ] personnel.

lore: In his efforts to commandeer the U.S.S. Enterprise, Kavok would use "punishments" to slow the progress of the remaining Starfleet personnel aboard from reaching the bridge.
name: Experience Bij!
text: Attempt ends. Place on mission; cannot be attempted or scouted. May be nullified by any player encountering another dilemma OR if {Dead End} is on this mission.

lore: Last member of a telepathic, shape-shifting species. Craves salt. Will extract it, often fatally, from other creatures.
name: M-113 Creature
text: Place on mission. Now and end of every player's turn, kills one of that player's personnel here (opponent's choice; human if possible). Cure with 2 Exobiology here.

lore: Having discovered no covert base on Nelvana III, the U.S.S. Enterprise was caught in the act of violating the Neutral Zone by two D'deridex class warbirds.
name: Nelvana Trap
text: Opponent may relocate up to two of their [Rom][OS] or [TNG][Rom] ships from any {Engage Cloak} to here (decloaked). Those ships may initiate battle or move away.

lore: In 1968, Gary Seven assumed the mission of two deceased temporal agents and caused a nuclear missile malfunction, preventing further proliferation of atomic weapons.
name: Nuclear Disarmament
text: Kills all your temporal agents in play (if 3 Anthropology present, stopped instead). To get past requires 2 Computer Skill and INTEGRITY>40 OR Physics and ANIMAL.

lore: Mr. Scott was not impressed by the newly launched U.S.S Enterprise-A and the numerous repairs needed. "Half the doors won't open, and guess whose job it is to make it right?"
name: Poor Quality Workmanship
text: To get past requires 4 personnel with (ENGINEER OR Computer Skill) OR discard {any Kit} (at [P]) OR discard {any PADD} (at [S]).

lore: In 2367, an accident aboard the Nenebek, a mining shuttle transporting Jean-Luc Picard and Wesley Crusher to Pentarus V, caused it to crash land on one of the moons orbiting Pentarus III.
name: Shuttle Crash
text: Stops one Youth personnel (opponent's choice) then one OFFICER (your choice). To get past requires 2 Navigation and (CUNNING>45 at [S] OR STRENGTH>45 at [P]).

lore: Kivas Fajo kept the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise busy dealing with a contaminated water table on Beta Agni II to avoid further investigation into the explosion of Data's shuttle.
name: Tricyanate Poisoning
text: Unless requirements of nearest planet mission (at [S]) OR requirements of nearest space mission (at [P]) present, place on mission; mission worth zero points. (Unique.)

lore: Time-obsessed recreation from Alice's Adventures in Wonderland encountered by Dr. McCoy. Caused shore leave to be delayed until such anachronisms could be explained.
name: White Rabbit
text: Unless Physics and Archaeology present, place on mission. When countdown expires, if mission unsolved, reduce points by 10. Nullified by {any Pocketwatch}.

lore: Keras and his officers lived by the ideals of duty, obedience, and service to the Praetor, to the exclusion of all other concerns.
name: Creatures of Duty
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [Rom][OS] male personnel with OFFICER classification may meet dilemma requirements as if CIVILIAN or V.I.P. or female, then are stopped.

lore: Inside the Link, an intimate sharing of thought and form, idea and sensation, concepts like gender are meaningless. Outside the Link, changelings can take any form, male or female.
name: Shape-Shift: Fluidity
text: Plays on table. Each changeling in play is a romantic partner of every other changeling in play and, once each turn, may change their gender (until end of turn).

lore: The burgeoning Maquis activity in and around the Demilitarized Zone began to draw intense scrutiny from both the Cardassian Union and the Federation.
name: Strategic Sector
text: Plays on a mission in a region. If not playing Borg, you may draw a card for every two missions in that region (plus one if you have no facilities in that region). Discard event.

lore: After the Earth-Romulan War, Starfleet constructed a series of outposts along the Neutral Zone.
name: Earth Outpost
text: Seeds (limit one) or plays at a Neutral Zone Region mission.

name: Community Leader
text: Seeds on table. Once per game, at any time, you may download {Quark's Bar} and/or one {Holosuite}. Your {Quark} gains Leadership. Your Quark, {Rom}, and your [DS9][Fer] bartenders, dabo girls, and waiters may mix with your cards. All personnel may mix at Quark's Bar.

name: Hard-Working, Happy Androids
text: Seeds on {Exo III} or {Planet Mudd}. Your androids, {Cravic Warship}s, and {Pralor Warship}s may report here. While you have no more than one non-android personnel in play, once each turn you may "conduct upgrades": place one android from hand underneath deck to draw 2 cards (one android drawn may report to your Cybernetics personnel). Once per game, you may download {Lore's Fingernail}.

name: Long Live the Empire!
text: Seeds on {Imperial Palace}. If you seeded 6 [MQ] missions and have no ship in play, at the start of your turn you may download one [MQ] NX-class ship here. Once each turn you may discard 2 or more cards from hand to put top two cards of draw deck beneath {Watch Dog} and/or keep one event from counting down this turn.

name: The Neutral Zone
text: Seeds on table if you seeded at least 5 different Neutral Zone missions and no homeworld. All ships are RANGE +2 in Neutral Zone. Once per game, you may download {Test For Weakness} OR {Consume: Outpost}. End of every player's turn, that player may draw an extra card if their staffed, exposed, non-[Fed] ship is at a Neutral Zone mission.

lore: With the vapor trail of comet Icarus IV to further obscure their movements, the Gal Gath'thong was able to change course and evade the pursuit from their Starfleet adversary.
name: Cloaked Maneuvers
text: Plays on your undamaged ship with a Cloaking Device. Ship cloaks (even if stopped or it has decloaked this turn). Shuffle back into deck if ship is [Rom][OS].

lore: Filled with rage following the death of his son, Admiral Kirk angrily ended Kruge's quest to acquire the secret of Genesis.
name: I... Have Had... Enough of You!
text: Once per game per persona, plays on any Benefactor OR on a personnel to prevent a DL/ they just initiated (after start of next turn, DL/ considered unused). Target personnel loses all skills until end of turn.

lore: With a physical show of force futile, the crew of the Starship Enterprise planned to use confusion and illogic, forcing the androids to consult Norman for advice.
name: Not Programmed to Respond
text: Plays to stop your android. If {Norman} is in play, one of your other androids present with him gains a skill of your choice until end of turn. OR Nullifies {Kelvan Show of Force}.

lore: Evade tachyon beams and pursuing vessels.
name: Breach Detection Grid
requires: Cloaking Device; Founder; Neutral Zone Region;
text: (Cloaking Device OR any Intelligence OR any Founder) + Computer Skill + Navigation + SECURITY

lore: Hide near comet discovered in 23rd century.
name: Evade Sensors
text: Leadership x2 + Navigation + Computer Skill + Stellar Cartography

lore: Study aftereffect from 23rd century comet.
name: Investigate Decaying Radiation
text: SCIENCE + Exobiology + Astrophysics + Youth

lore: Give direction to a society of androids first discovered in the 23rd century.
name: Provide Purpose
text: Leadership + Cybernetics OR {Harcourt Fenton Mudd} Owner's androids may not mix with aligned personnel.

lore: Examine android components and systems uncovered during the 23rd century.
name: Study Cybernetic Relics
text: 3 non-android Computer Skill OR Cybernetics + {Ruk} Owner's androids may not mix with aligned personnel.

name: Test for Weakness
text: Plays on a Neutral Zone Region mission. Once per game, you may download {Earth Outpost} here (under opponent's control). Doubles WEAPONS of your [Rom][OS] ships here when attacked or if attacking alone versus outposts. When an opposing outpost is destroyed here, score points (discard objective).

name: The Squire's Rules
text: Seeds in doorway phase. At start of dilemma phase, shuffle all your dilemmas. You must seed them without looking at them. When your [S/P] dilemma is revealed, if no other copies of that dilemma that you own have been revealed this game, it stops one personnel (random selection); otherwise, it is a mis-seed. All other cards you seed under missions are mis-seeds (except artifacts). You may not download dilemmas.

lore: Representative of virtual players in the Vorta scenario testing designed by Borath. Jem'Hadar Third trained in the fields of engineering and wormhole theory.
name: Shah'Razad
text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Navigation

lore: Navigator and weapons controller. Has a phenomenal hatred of the Romulans, as many of his ancestors served and died during the Earth-Romulan War.
name: Lt. Stiles
text: OFFICER SECURITY Navigation Stellar Cartography Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Rom].

lore: Representative of androids found on Planet Mudd. She was not programmed to respond in all areas.
name: Alice Series
text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Transporter Skill Biology Diplomacy DL/ {Not Programmed to Respond}

lore: Android built on Exo III by Dr. Roger Korby. She found human emotions to be very confusing. Assisted in producing an android duplicate of Captain Kirk.
name: Andrea
text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Biology Physics If with {Dr. Roger Korby}, both are attributes all +1.

lore: Characteristic of androids native to Planet Mudd. Lt. Uhura was impressed by her estimated lifespan.
name: Barbara Series
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Astrophysics Navigation

lore: Android recreation of Dr. Roger Korby's assistant. Survived underground on Exo III. Often talks about his great Scottish ancestry. A student of all sciences.
name: Dr. Brown
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Physics Anthropology Your {Dr. Roger Korby} here gains SCIENCE.

lore: Android recreation of Captain Kirk built on Exo III by Dr. Roger Korby. Expressed annoyance at Mr. Spock and his half-breed interference.
name: Kirk-Android
text: OFFICER Treachery Leadership Anthropology SECURITY Navigation

lore: The only android of his model. Acts as central control locus for his fellow androids. Native to Planet Mudd. Diverted the Starship Enterprise there in 2268.
name: Norman
text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation DL/ {Commandeer Ship} Cybernetics Computer Skill (if with another android)

lore: Android companion created by Flint. Struggled with her newfound emotional attachment to Captain Kirk.
name: Rayna Kapec
text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Biology Youth ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics

lore: Gorn captain. He ordered the destruction of the outpost on Cestus III. Immensely strong. Forced by the Metrons to fight Captain Kirk. Snappy conversationalist.
name: S'Salk
text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Honor Scores 5 points when you destroy a facility here.

lore: One of many strict and unpleasant androids on Planet Mudd. Proficient at nagging Harcourt Fenton Mudd.
name: Stella Mudd
text: CIVILIAN If with {Harcourt Fenton Mudd}, gains SECURITY and Leadership. Law Anthropology

lore: Typical Argelian and wife of Prefect Jaris. Descended from ancient priestesses, she tried to use empathic contact to solve a series of murders on Argelius II.
name: Sybo
text: CIVILIAN Empathy Diplomacy Anthropology

lore: Characteristic of mid-23rd century Romulan soldiers. Diligent in his sentry duty. Aspires to command his own ship in service of the Star Empire.
name: Borix
text: SECURITY Youth Honor Exobiology If in Neutral Zone: Leadership, Law

lore: Surgically-altered human thief. Captain Kirk was under secret orders from Starfleet Intelligence.
name: Centurion Kirk
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Computer Skill If [Fed], gains <Rom>. DL/ {Romulan Cloaking Device} May meet any Intelligence requirement with SECURITY.

lore: Surgically-altered human thief. Captain Kirk was under secret orders from Starfleet Intelligence.
name: Centurion Kirk*
text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Computer Skill If [Fed], gains <Rom>. DL/ {Romulan Cloaking Device} May meet any Intelligence requirement with SECURITY.

lore: Assistant to Subcommander Tal who intercepted covert transmissions in 2268. Secretly an undercover Tal Shiar operative. He was later promoted to general.
name: Dividius
text: ENGINEER OFFICER Navigation Physics Tal Shiar DL/ {Classic Communicator} (if in Neutral Zone).

lore: Typical Romulan officer, assigned to guard the cloaking device in 2268. Asked Centurion Kirk for his authorization. Easily distracted.
name: Govas
text: OFFICER ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Honor DL/ {Classic Disruptor} (if in Neutral Zone).

lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human science officer. Briefly became romantically involved with Commander Charvanek as part of a covert operation in 2268.
name: Mr. Spock (The Neutral Zone)
text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Mindmeld SECURITY Physics Computer Skill DL/ {Getting Under Your Skin}

lore: Sensor specialist and bridge officer who served under Keras aboard the Gal Gath'thong in 2266. Did not wish to use the cloak to run from a reflection.
name: Praxus
text: SCIENCE OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography May download {Cloaked Maneuvers} in place of a card draw.

lore: Romulan technical officer serving under Commander Charvanek. He confronted and was incapacitated by an unidentified centurion in 2268. Ale connoisseur.
name: Ptol
text: ENGINEER OFFICER Archaeology Computer Skill SECURITY Biology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

lore: Representative of junior officers serving the Romulan Star Empire in 2268. Trained as a field nurse. Along with Gorrus, took part in a hostage exchange.
name: Pytron
text: OFFICER MEDICAL Diplomacy Smuggling Transporter Skill

lore: Typical Romulan thruster specialist. Assigned to guard the brig. Studied the unusual radiation effects recently discovered on Gamma Hydra IV. Enthusiastic cook.
name: R'Moog
text: ENGINEER SECURITY Archaeology Treachery Youth DL/ {Reaction Control Thrusters} (if in Neutral Zone).

lore: One of many Romulan security guards serving under Commander Charvanek. Was assigned as her personal bodyguard in 2268. Collects rare Romulan ales.
name: Telman
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Anthropology Biology

lore: Typical sensor operator on the Gal Gath'thong under the command of Keras. Surveyed Gamma Hydra IV prior to Federation colonization.
name: Veznik
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Geology If in Neutral Zone: Stellar Cartography, Navigation

lore: Typical biotechnology technician. Former teacher of genetics at University of Chicago. Conscripted into Starfleet to develop more resistant radiation shielding.
name: Ensign Tamara
text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Anthropology Navigation Biology DL/ {Regenerate}

characteristicsKeywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Prototype warbird. Based on an earlier 22nd century design. Became a mainstay of the Romulan fleet in the 23rd century, alongside the D-7.
name: Bird-of-Prey, Mk II
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam X=2 in Neutral Zone Region.

name: Primary Turbolift
text: Compatible personnel may report (but not download) here. Once every turn, when a [DS9] personnel reports (but is not downloaded) using their classification to another site on this Nor, that personnel's owner may draw a card. Any Nor: Ops Module

name: Primary Plasma Weapon
text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. Requires a [Rom][OS] ship firing. ATTACK bonus +3 vs. Facilities. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Damaged Crew Morale: [Stf] Personnel aboard are attributes all -2.

lore: Keras and his officers lived by the ideals of duty, obedience, and service to the Praetor, to the exclusion of all other concerns.
name: Creatures of Duty *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [Rom][OS] male personnel with OFFICER classification may meet dilemma requirements as if CIVILIAN or V.I.P. or female, then are stopped.

lore: Illustrious Vulcan Federation ambassador. Over 200 years old. Married at least three times: to a Vulcan princess, to Amanda, and to Perrin. Father of Spock.
name: Sarek *VP
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 3 Mindmeld

lore: Determine origin of General Order 7, imposed on this planet in the 23rd century.
name: Investigate Quarantine *VP
text: (Honor OR Treachery) + Anthropology + SECURITY + (any Intelligence OR CUNNING>32 OR {Vina})

lore: Complete covert weapons transfer to agents supplying the Circle.
name: Kressari Rendezvous *VP
text: OFFICER + (Treachery x2 OR Smuggling) * Discard up to four hand weapons for +5 each.

lore: Confronted with Manua Agpar's interpretation of events, William T. Riker found his reputation and his honor in question. "She's lying! That never happened!"
name: Implication *VP
text: To get past requires 3 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>30 OR Law and CUNNING>30.

lore: Stellar flares release tremendous amounts of energy and radiation. A particle beam, accurately directed at the surface of a star, can produce abnormally large and dangerous eruptions.
name: Stellar Flare *VP
text: Damages and "stops" all ships at this location except those that are docked, landed, or carried OR have 2 Navigation and Astrophysics aboard OR have SHIELDS>11. Discard dilemma.

name: Barzan Wormhole *VP
text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Gamma or Delta Quadrant (limit one). Inserts into spaceline; creates a location (span 2). Any ship may move between {Wormhole Terminus} mission and here, then is "stopped." OR Once each turn, plays to relocate Barzan Wormhole to a new location in Gamma or Delta Quadrant; discard doorway.

lore: With Data, Troi, and O'Brien possessed by spirits encountered on a moon of Mab-Bu VI, Riker quickly rerouted command functions to prevent them from taking over the ship.
name: Computer Crash *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. No player may play a {Q's Tent} doorway, download any card or play any card that requires downloading. Discard event at end of your next turn.

lore: Unknowingly assisted by Q, Jean-Luc Picard found himself jumping between different periods of his life.
name: Temporal Shifting* *VP
text: Plays on a player. That player must choose to either discard three cards from hand or discard one [AU] card. If that player discards an [AU] card, he/she may draw up to four cards. Discard event.

name: Cybernetics Expertise *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your android may report for free if Cybernetics present and may report to your personnel who has Cybernetics x2. Also, once each turn, you may exchange a card from hand for an android in your discard pile.

lore: Docking large starships within space facilities requires precision maneuvering to avoid potentially disastrous consequences.
name: Docking Procedures *VP
text: Plays on any ship just as it begins to dock or undock at any facility. Ship and crew are "stopped." Docking or undocking complete at end of turn.

lore: Assisted by Maques, Deanna Troi was able to enter Lwaxana Troi's metaconscious mind and resolve the hidden psychological issues which had caused her mother to withdraw there.
name: Empathic Touch *VP
text: When your personnel is about to be killed, if your Empathy personnel is present, stop both personnel to prevent that.

lore: In 2365, Worf attempted to build a model ship. The Klingon warrior struggled to master the delicate dexterity required.
name: Shipwreck *VP
text: Suspends ALL ship attribute enhancements for the rest of this turn. (May be played at start of battle.) OR Nullifies all {Wall of Ships} cards in play.

lore: Shortly after discovery of the Bajoran wormhole in 2369, a delegation of Wadi visitors arrived from the Gamma Quadrant. They coerced Quark into playing their unusual game of chula.
name: Chula: The Game *VP
text: Unless one personnel present has Greed and Treachery OR Greed and CUNNING>7, crew or Away Team is stopped until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

lore: Following scientific analysis of some unusual mutations among the crew, The Doctor and Seven of Nine were able to uncover a series of experiments being conducted by the Srivani.
name: Scientific Method *VP
text: To get past requires MEDICAL and 3 SCIENCE.

lore: Stasis chambers holding homicidal Cardassians infected with a biogenic compound. Left aboard the abandoned Empok Nor and rigged to activate should anyone come aboard.
name: Sleeper Trap *VP
text: Opponent may download to one site or planet here up to three different [Univ] Cardassians and one hand weapon. They may (if possible) initiate personnel battle. Discard dilemma.

lore: Representative of a specialized tricorder optimized for medical use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Medical Tricorder *VP
text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

characteristicsKeywords: Trill; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Trill with Symbiont; Vedek;
lore: Trill with symbiont. Jadzia Dax posed as a vedek to sneak Kira Nerys past members of the Circle and into the Chamber of Ministers. Joked about keeping the nose.
name: Vedek Dax *VP
text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Anthropology Physics Navigation Exobiology

lore: Rush to plug information leaks occurring from this remote border sector.
name: Compromised Mission *VP
text: Treachery x 2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35 Opponent's side: [FED] Treachery x2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35

lore: In 2293, a debriefing was held at Starfleet Command to discuss the environmental, economical, and political consequences following the explosion of the Klingon moon Praxis.
name: Mission Debriefing *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever any crew or Away Team finishes a mission attempt (whether successful or not), it is stopped. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Liberate prisoner being held by Kazon sect on the surface of this desert planet.
name: Liberation *VP
text: SECURITY + (Transporter Skill OR {Neelix}) Ocampa may report on planet (for free).

lore: Non-corporeal energy being fueled by anger and hatred. Could transmute matter, turning everyday objects into weapons.
name: Beta XII-A Entity
text: End of every turn: If no personnel here, moves. Otherwise, on planet surface and aboard each ship and facility here, two strongest personnel must battle each other.

lore: After killing a string of women on Argelius II, the murderous entity possessed the computer banks of the Starship Enterprise.
name: Redjac
text: End of every turn: Kills one of each player's [Univ] personnel (random selection) on planet surface, on each non-Nor facility here, and aboard each exposed ship here, then moves.

lore: Electrified baton used throughout the Klingon Empire. Requires incredible endurance to withstand it. Often used by prison guards or during Klingon ceremonies.
name: Painstik
text: When reported, name a skill. Your [Kli] personnel present with that skill are STRENGTH +2. Opponent's personnel present without that skill are STRENGTH -1. (Cumulative.)

name: Organian Annexation
text: Seeds on {Organia}. You may only play personnel and ships if they are [Kli][OS] or [Non][OS]. Once each turn, when you report a [Univ][Kli][OS] personnel, you may report an [OS] equipment or equipment with "Klingon" or [Kli] in gametext to that personnel for free OR place an equipment, personnel, or ship from discard pile beneath draw deck.

lore: Negotiate for dilithium, stockpiled here since the 23rd century.
name: Access Dilithium Cache
text: Geology x2 + Diplomacy + Anthropology + (Acquisition x2 OR <Fed> personnel OR INTEGRITY>35)

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Make contact with rock-based life-form first encountered in the 23rd century.
name: Examine Morality
text: Honor x4 + no Treachery OR Treachery x4 + no Honor OR Geology x4 + no Honor + no Treachery

lore: Klingon warrior who encountered Captain Kirk on Beta XII-A. Tried to avenge the destruction of his ship and the deaths of 400 soldiers. Husband of Mara.
name: Captain Kang (A Private Little War)
text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Physics Diplomacy DL/ {Classic Disruptor} (if with two other [Kli][OS] personnel).

lore: Representative of deflector technicians serving in the 2260s. Part of Captain Kang's crew for many years, eventually rising to chief engineer of the I.K.S. K'elric.
name: Piabok
text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Navigation If all your personnel present are [OS]: Physics, Treachery.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Loyal henchman and right-hand man to Khan. Genetically engineered augment who was loyally exiled with his leader. Father of Joachim.
name: Joaquin
text: SECURITY Leadership SECURITY Treachery If with {any Khan}: Archaeology, Diplomacy, Astrophysics.

lore: Excalbian shape-shifter. He studied whether good or evil was more powerful through a test on Excalbia.
name: Yarnek
text: SCIENCE Anthropology Geology Empathy Away Teams present on planet have no affiliation attack restrictions.

lore: Commander of I.K.C. Gr'oth. Sent to protect Klingon interests in Sherman's Planet. Dear to Captain Kirk.
name: Captain Koloth *VP
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Anthropology SCIENCE If on {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, it is attributes all +1 for each Klingon [OS] personnel aboard (up to +3).

lore: Computer interface from Sigma Draconis VI. Ancient technology which temporarily imparts knowledge, spanning topics such as neurosurgery, astrometrics, philosophy, and card game rules.
name: The Great Teacher
text: Use as Equipment card. (Unique.) Immediately choose a personnel present. While present, chosen personnel gains two of every regular skill.

lore: Typical Klingon battlefield surgeon serving in the 2260s. She was one of 40 survivors from her ship rescued by the crew of the Starship Enterprise.
name: Yeboah
text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology

lore: Computer memory storage medium. During the 23rd century, much historical data and distant star charts were stored on such devices. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
name: Library Record Tape
text: Once each turn, you may select Anthropology OR Stellar Cartography. Until re-selected, your [OS] OFFICER personnel and Computer Skill personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

lore: Representative of junior science officers serving in the Klingon Defense Force in the 23rd century. He is good with a blade. Member of the House of D'Ghor.
name: Dorigo
text: SCIENCE Geology Treachery Computer Skill Youth

name: The Savage Curtain
text: Seeds or plays on {Excalbia}. {Captain Kirk} and {Mr. Spock} in play gain Honor and (O>. Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download to hand a (O> or <O). When you solve this mission, you may draw a card for each Geology personnel who helped solve, then may report an Honor personnel for each (O> who helped solve, then may report a Treachery personnel for each <O) who helped solve.

lore: Excalbian who posed as a genocidal human colonel for a morality play on Excalbia. He euthanized countless radiation victims. Genetic purist. Inspired Terra Prime.
name: Excalbian Green
text: OFFICER Treachery x 2 Leadership Navigation Physics X=3 vs. non-human adversaries.

lore: Hero of Captain Kirk who fought to abolish slavery. In truth an Excalbian who posed as the human president. Helped confront the forces of evil on Excalbia in 2269.
name: Excalbian Lincoln
text: V.I.P. When your personnel present is captured, you may draw a card. Law x 2 Honor Leadership

lore: Klingon fleet captain. Commanded the I.K.S. Molor in 2268. Co-ordinated with the Elasian traitor Kryton to attack a sabotaged Starship Enterprise.
name: Captain Khod
text: OFFICER Anthropology Computer Skill Treachery If all your personnel present are [OS]: Biology, MEDICAL.

lore: Imperial cruiser that patrolled the Tellun system. Commanded by Captain Khod. Attacked the Starship Enterprise to trigger sabotage to their warp core.
name: I.K.S. Molor
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any <Fed>[OS] personnel}

lore: In 2268, Mr. Spock's brain was removed and taken to Sigma Draconis VI to act as a computer control system for the Eymorg.
name: Spock's Brain
text: To get past, most CUNNING SCIENCE must relocate to a planet with "23rd century" in lore (your choice; dilemma nullified if no such planet); they are stopped until countdown expires. Nullify with {The Great Teacher} present.

lore: Excalbian who posed as the Tiburonian governor. She experimented on many subjects' body chemistry.
name: Excalbian Zora
text: MEDICAL Treachery x 2 Exobiology MEDICAL Leadership When randomly selected, may substitute your [Univ][OS] personnel present instead.

lore: Primitive hand weapon developed by many races. Uses chemical combustion to fire projectiles over a long distance.
name: Flintlock Rifle
text: Once each turn, discard your [Univ][Non] or [Non][OS] personnel here to unstop up to X non-Honor [Kli] personnel in your Away Team here. X = number of [*] on the discarded personnel.

lore: Native of Planet Neural and leader of a village there. He was supplied with advanced weapons by Krell to attain power and act on behalf of the Klingon Empire.
name: Apella
text: V.I.P. Leadership Treachery Greed DL/ {Flintlock Rifle}

lore: Typical soldier in the Klingon Defense Force. Friend of Korax. Relayed information to Arne Darvin during the Sherman's Planet affair. Talented linguist.
name: Mok'Rand
text: SECURITY Klingon Intelligence Exobiology If all your personnel present are [OS]: Diplomacy, Biology.

name: Assignment: Earth
text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. Your {Gary Seven}, {Isis}, and {Roberta Lincoln} gain [OS] (even if not in play) and may report to any corresponding time location. Your facilities, personnel, and ships at same location as your Gary Seven are immune to timeline disruption effects of {Build Interplexing Beacon} and {Stop First Contact}.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; genetically enhanced; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
lore: Supervisor 194. Temporal agent sent to 1968 Earth to protect Earth's future. Genetically enhanced human and pilot. Travels everywhere with Isis.
name: Gary Seven
text: SECURITY OFFICER Astrophysics Archaeology Navigation Transporter Skill Immune to {Vulcan Nerve Pinch}.

lore: Excalbian who posed as the human military strategist who united the Mongol tribes and became their emperor. He likes the sugar rush from certain foods.
name: Excalbian Genghis
text: V.I.P. Treachery SECURITY Law DL/ Any blade weapon (if present with another <O).)

lore: Typical independent transport used by many Alpha Quadrant traders in the 23rd century. Harcourt Fenton Mudd commanded one.
name: Class J Cargo Ship
text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ][Non][OS] personnel}

lore: To resolve the conflict between the Gorn Hegemony and the Federation, the Metrons arranged for the two representative captains to battle for survival.
name: The Metrons' Arena
text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is relocated to nearest planet with no personnel on surface; opponent may download {S'Salk} there. Attempt ends.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Arms dealer; High Council; Male;
lore: Klingon arms dealer working for the High Council. Provided "advanced" weapons to Apella to tip the local balance of power. Descendant of Admiral Krell.
name: Krell
text: SECURITY Anthropology Archaeology Klingon Intelligence Smuggling Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon treaty; Romulan treaty;
lore: Fueled by a mutual hatred of the Federation, the Klingon Empire and the Romulan Star Empire formed a brief alliance to share technology in the 2260's.
name: Technology Sharing Treaty
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [Kli][OS] and [Rom][OS] cards are compatible and may use your D-7-Class ships. Your D-7-Class ships gain Cloaking Device.

lore: Renew technology-sharing agreement from the 23rd century.
name: Renegotiate Pact
text: Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) When seeded, you may download {Technology Sharing Treaty}.

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
lore: Historian and artist. Human who betrayed her crew when she became romantically involved with Khan Noonien Singh. Later exiled with her beloved Khan.
name: Lt. McGivers
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Archaeology Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
lore: Historian and artist. Human who betrayed her crew when she became romantically involved with Khan Noonien Singh. Later exiled with her beloved Khan.
name: Lt. McGivers*
text: OFFICER SCIENCE Archaeology Treachery

characteristicsKeywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
lore: Genetically engineered augment revived from suspended animation in 2267. After he tried to kill Captain Kirk, Khan was marooned on Ceti Alpha V.
name: Khan Noonien Singh
text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Treachery Computer Skill x 2 Diplomacy DL/ {Sleeper Ship}

lore: Largely ornamental Klingon garment. Often used ceremonially to denote membership of a specific Klingon house. A cunning wearer can conceal weapons within as part of a strategic plan.
name: Klingon Baldric
text: Your non-Treachery Klingons present are INTEGRITY +2. Your {Worf} OR one of your [Kli] leaders present may pair first in personnel battle (and select their adversary).

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Captain; Governor; High Council; Male;
lore: Fleet captain and Dahar master. Klingon warrior and military strategist who reports directly to the High Council. Hero of the glorious Baltar campaigns.
name: Governor Kor
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Leadership Law Diplomacy SECURITY DL/ {Taking Charge} DL/ {Klingon Baldric}

lore: The Klingon Worf visited Deep Space Station K-7 near Sherman's Planet in 2267. Hates Tribbles.
name: Trader Worf
text: CIVILIAN Honor SECURITY Anthropology If all your personnel present are [OS]: Acquisition, Law. Twice per game, may nullify all [Tribble] cards present.

lore: The Klingon Worf visited Deep Space Station K-7 near Sherman's Planet in 2267. Hates Tribbles.
name: Trader Worf*
text: CIVILIAN Honor SECURITY Anthropology If all your personnel present are [OS]: Acquisition, Law. Twice per game, may nullify all [Tribble] cards present.

lore: Science officer and wife of Captain Kang. She was initially skeptical about an alien fueling tensions.
name: Mara
text: SCIENCE Physics Honor ENGINEER Computer Skill If with {Captain Kang}, both are attributes all +2. DL/ {Library Record Tape} (if with 2 other [Kli][OS] personnel).

lore: The diverse nature of the Federation diplomatic corps resulted in many conflicting views, but allowed for the collected wisdom of the various ambassadors to find optimal solutions.
name: Team of Ambassadors
text: Plays on your unstopped personnel with V.I.P. and Diplomacy to cause a random selection present to be cancelled and re-selected. OR Nullifies {Misinterpreted History}.

lore: Troyian diplomat and emissary sent to act as teacher for Elaan before she reached Troyius. Got a knife in his back for trying to educate her in manners.
name: Ambassador Petri
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology Law

name: Ancient Citadel
text: Seeds or plays on your [P] mission with "23rd century" in lore. Your [Non][OS] personnel who name in lore this planet become [Kli] (even if not in play). OR Plays on your crew or Away Team with at least 4 [Kli] Honor or 4 [Kli][OS] SECURITY. Draw up to three cards; discard objective.

lore: Characteristic of Klingon soldiers assigned under Governor Kor. Stationed on Organia in 2267. Despite trying, could not provoke any Organians to fight him.
name: Radebe
text: OFFICER Leadership Transporter Skill If all your personnel present are [OS]: Honor, Physics.

lore: Ambush high ranking official travelling to famed site used since the 23rd century.
name: Assassinate Diplomat
text: SECURITY x2 + (Treachery x3 OR Orion Syndicate OR <Fed> personnel OR assassin) + no humans

lore: Surgically altered Orion who posed as Thelev, an Andorian ambassadorial aide. Assassin who wanted to derail the Coridan admission conference on Babel.
name: Thelev Impersonator
text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Anthropology Orion Syndicate DL/ {Assassination Plot}

name: Military Protectorate
text: Seeds or plays on your non-homeworld [KLI] mission. When your Away Team of at least four [Kli][OS] personnel solve this mission, you may download {Colony} here; it becomes [Kli] and compatible cards may report here. While a Colony is here, personnel who name this mission in lore and your [Kli][OS] SECURITY-classification personnel here gain CIVILIAN.

name: New Civilizations
text: Seeds on table if each of your non-homeworld missions shows 30 points or less. When you have completed a planet mission, a space mission, and four total missions, you win the game.

lore: Attend remembrance event for those massacred in the 23rd century after food shortages.
name: Mourn Victims
text: Anthropology + Leadership + (Music OR Honor x2)

lore: The human Starfleet officer Captain Kirk posed as a native on Organia to hide during its occupation by the Klingons. Appointed as liaison. A ram amongst sheep.
name: Baroner
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Anthropology DL/ {Disruptor Overload}

lore: The human Starfleet officer Captain Kirk posed as a native on Organia to hide during its occupation by the Klingons. Appointed as liaison. A ram amongst sheep.
name: Baroner*
text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Anthropology DL/ {Disruptor Overload}

lore: Adhere to strict formal protocols imposed since the 23rd century.
name: Attend Royal Function
text: Leadership + SECURITY + Anthropology + (Guramba OR STRENGTH>35)

lore: Dohlman of Elas who became queen of Troyius. Elasian promised in marriage to create peace. Her tears can intoxicate men. Not used to anyone defying her will.
name: Elaan
text: V.I.P. Leadership Youth Biology DL/ {I Love You}

lore: When new worlds are absorbed into the Klingon Empire, such as Organia in 2267, a battalion of Klingon warriors quickly subdues the population and suppresses any resistance.
name: Klingon Troop Deployment
text: Opponent may download to this planet up to three different {[Univ][Kli][OS] personnel} and/or one {Classic Disruptor}. They may initiate battle (if possible).

lore: Participate in court-martial at starbase established in the 23rd century.
name: Attend Disciplinary Proceeding
text: Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology + (Law OR INTEGRITY>30)

lore: Fuel political unrest in system contested since the 23rd century.
name: Destabilize Region
text: SECURITY + Treachery x2 + Navigation

lore: Renegotiate topaline deposit rights, first granted to the Federation in the 23rd century.
name: Obtain Mining Agreement
text: Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology x2 + MEDICAL + Geology When you solve, you may draw two cards.

lore: Track entity feeding on hostility, first encountered her in the 23rd century.
name: Pursue Origins
text: SECURITY + Leadership + Physics + CUNNING>30 OR {Captain Kirk} + {Captain Kang}

lore: Re-arm faction after initial military interference in the 23rd century.
name: Upgrade Munitions
text: SECURITY x2 + Leadership + (Klingon Intelligence OR Law OR Treachery x2)

lore: Loyal henchman. Security chief serving under Captain Kang. Acted as bodyguard to Mara while aboard the Starship Enterprise in 2268.
name: Bielsa
text: SECURITY Physics Transporter Skill Navigation x 2 DL/ {Agonizer} (if with two other [Kli][OS] personnel).

lore: Stiff, robotic Elasian bodyguard. Part of a noble family on Elas. He conspired with the Klingons, jealous that Elaan was promised in marriage to a Troyian.
name: Kryton
text: ENGINEER SECURITY Treachery Greed DL/ {Bodyguards} OR {Warp Core Breach}

lore: Excalbian who posed as the legendary Klingon, drawn from the limited Starfleet data available in 2269.
name: Excalbian Kahless
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership x 2 SECURITY Once each turn, may gain a skill from a personnel present until end of turn.

lore: Excalbian who posed as the legendary Klingon, drawn from the limited Starfleet data available in 2269.
name: Excalbian Kahless*
text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership x 2 SECURITY Once each turn, may gain a skill from a personnel present until end of turn.

lore: Excalbian who posed as the famous Vulcan scientist and philosopher. Abhors violence. Finds it more logical to heal than to kill. He went in peace to propose peace.
name: Excalbian Surak
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 SCIENCE Anthropology When killed, you may draw up to 3 cards.

lore: Excalbian who posed as the famous Vulcan scientist and philosopher. Abhors violence. Finds it more logical to heal than to kill. He went in peace to propose peace.
name: Excalbian Surak*
text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 SCIENCE Anthropology When killed, you may draw up to 3 cards.

lore: Alien shape-shifter and telepath posing as a cat. She is assistant to Gary Seven. Travelled to 1968 Earth to protect the future. Enjoys confusing Roberta Lincoln.
name: Isis
text: ANIMAL Where present, {Gary Seven} can't be killed by dilemmas (stopped instead). Empathy x 2

lore: Human secretary from 1968 Earth. Erratic, but possessed a high IQ. She had many adventures as Gary Seven's companion. Doesn't trust Isis.
name: Roberta Lincoln
text: CIVILIAN Youth Honor Anthropology Computer Skill If with {Gary Seven}, both are attributes all +2.

name: Frontal Assault
text: Attack: 1. Defense: 1. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a [Kli][OS] ship firing OR multiple non-[Bor] ships here. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Intrusion Points: randomly kills one SECURITY personnel aboard (on a Nor, one personnel at a docking site).

lore: Investigate disturbance at Boreth monastery.
name: Investigate Disturbance *VP
text: Honor + Leadership + INTEGRITY>30 OR {Gowron} + Biology

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
lore: Glinn who accompanied Gul Macet aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367. Confined to his quarters by Macet for attempting to access Federation tactical data.
name: Telle *VP
text: SECURITY Computer Skill MEDICAL

lore: Male bodyguard of Sela. Stationed on Romulus. Lieutenant operative in the Tal Shiar's new Android Research section.
name: Telak *VP
text: SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar Cybernetics

lore: Former Maquis who became chief engineer of U.S.S. Voyager. Her Klingon and human halves are often at odds with each other. Married Tom Paris in 2377.
name: B'Elanna Torres *VP
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Cybernetics Transporter Skill

lore: Former Maquis who became chief engineer of U.S.S. Voyager. Her Klingon and human halves are often at odds with each other. Married Tom Paris in 2377.
name: B'Elanna Torres* *VP
text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Cybernetics Transporter Skill

lore: The Dominion has the ability to produce Jem'Hadar in massive numbers with incredible ease. Losses taken in their war with the Alpha Quadrant meant as little to them as their Cardassian allies.
name: Dominion War Efforts *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your {Assign Support Personnel} card is not discarded when used to download a [Dom] or [Car] "support personnel." (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

lore: Cybernetic enhancements allow drones to survive extreme conditions, instantly reconnecting them to the Borg collective consciousness via their subspace communications network.
name: Awaken *VP
text: Downloads one [Com] or [Nav] drone. OR Plays at start of battle to download to one of your ships at that location one [Def] drone (two if opponent initiated the battle).

lore: Respond to distress call and beware of Ferengi activity in this sector.
name: Distress Mission *VP
text: Youth x3 + CUNNING>32 OR Honor x3 + STRENGTH>36

lore: Relocate settlers before moon becomes uninhabitable due to core tapping project.
name: Relocate Settlers *VP
text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + SECURITY x2 OR SECURITY x2 + Treachery OR {Kira Nerys}

lore: Military official of Tilonus IV. He twisted William T. Riker's mind using neurosomatic techniques. Typical of treacherous Tilonian government interrogators.
name: Suna *VP
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery Once per game, may download {Reflection Therapy}.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War)+ *VP
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). {Strike Three} (when attacked).

lore: During the Dominion War, Deep Space 9 became a key facility to plan and strategize the joint military efforts of the Federation, the Klingon Empire and the Romulan Star Empire.
name: Attack Plans
text: Plays on {Ops}. If your opponent's personnel or ship has ever initiated battle against your [DS9][Fed] cards, your cards have no affiliation attack restrictions. (Captain's Order.)

lore: Armus, a remnant of the Vagrans, engulfed William T. Riker in his skin of evil. Only the finesse and skillful negotiation of Jean-Luc Picard resulted in his release.
name: Armus: Sticky Situation
text: Away Team member with highest STRENGTH is stopped if another personnel present has Diplomacy and CUNNING>7, killed otherwise. To get past requires any personnel remaining.

lore: On stardate 49066.5, rogue Jem'Hadar detained Julian Bashir on Bopak III. He was compelled to seek a cure to their genetically engineered addiction to the drug ketracel-white.
name: Hippocratic Oath
text: To get past, most CUNNING MEDICAL must relocate with dilemma to nearest planet at another location (must still have MEDICAL upon arrival); stopped until countdown expires.

lore: Conduct negotiations to establish peaceful rapport and cultural exchange.
name: Establish Relations
text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>32 + (Leadership OR V.I.P.) When you solve, you may download a [Non] personnel here.

lore: Upon beaming down to Sigma Iotia II, the crew of the Starship Enterprise were swiftly taken captive by henchmen working for Bela Okmyx, the crime boss of the Northside Territory.
name: Alien Abduction *VP
text: Most CUNNING Away Team member (owner's choice if tie) is held atop mission. Cure with 3 Leadership. Nullified when mission completed.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War)* *VP
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). {Strike Three} (when attacked).

lore: "We are Pakleds. We look for things...things to make us go. You are smart. Can you make our ship go? Do not try to trick us. We can tell."
name: Make Us Go
text: To get past, place most CUNNING ENGINEER present atop mission with dilemma. At end of your next turn, place both out of play if you do not have CUNNING>24 here.

name: HQ: Return Orb to Bajor *VP
text: Plays on your [Orb] personnel. Where present, that personnel may earn Orb artifacts just encountered and may "reclaim" (steal) any Orb artifacts in play. If that personnel is on {Bajor} with Orb artifacts present, draw up to three cards for each one, discard objective and score points. (Each artifact may be "returned" only once per game.)

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; General; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
lore: High-ranking Bajoran Militia leader. Member of the Circle. Took over Deep Space 9 in 2370, but returned the station when informed of Cardassian involvement.
name: General Krim *VP
text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography

lore: Mainstay of the Bajoran Militia. During the 2370 coup attempt by the Circle, assault vessels commanded by General Krim and Colonel Day invaded Deep Space 9.
name: Assault Vessel *VP
text: Tractor Beam

lore: The Prophets of Bajor live outside of linear time.
name: The Celestial Temple *VP
text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, any player may relocate their unique non-Treachery personnel between here and their ship or facility at the Alpha Quadrant {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any player with an [Orb] personnel here may draw an additional card at the end of each turn unless total WEAPONS>9 at any Bajoran Wormhole. No capturing or battles allowed here.

lore: Gigantic cubic ship of the Borg collective. Possesses powerful weapons and remarkable regenerative abilities.
name: Borg Ship *VP
text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: Attacks all ships, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

lore: Admiral Dougherty conspired with the Son'a, planning to use a Federation holoship to transport the Ba'ku population without their knowledge.
name: Hologram Ruse *VP
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>30 and CUNNING>30.

name: Black Hole *VP
text: Plays between two adjacent [Univ] missions named {Space}. Creates a location (span 1). End of every turn, destroys all cards here. Also, when countdown would expire, instead destroy an adjacent location and all cards there (left first, then alternating, while possible), then countdown resets. Does not count down the turn it is played. (Not duplicatable.)

lore: Anthropologists from many species use various covert techniques, such as cloaked observation stations and cloaked isolation suits, to observe seemingly less advanced civilizations.
name: Duck Blind *VP
text: Seeds or plays on your Alpha Quadrant planet mission (except a homeworld). End of each turn, if your 2 Anthropology present, draw an extra card. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

lore: As starships grew in size, shuttlepod launch bays evolved into large hangars, able to launch and recover support craft.
name: Engage Shuttle Operations *VP
text: Plays on table. Your shuttlecraft may take off and land (using full RANGE) and be loaded, carried, and launched by your ships with Tractor Beam and ENGINEER aboard (uses 0 RANGE).

lore: In 2371, Data installed an emotion chip developed by Dr. Soong. Although overwhelmed at first, Data was able to experience new sensations, such as the gift of laughter.
name: Data Laughing *VP
text: Nullifies {Calamarain}. OR Doubles {Data's Head} this turn. OR Plays on a ship affected by {Lore Returns}; you gain control of that ship and all {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} aboard.

lore: Called by Q as an expert witness on the Q Continuum, Q provided testimony to himself during Quinn's hearing. "Ta-da!"
name: Q2 *VP
text: Nullifies {Amanda Rogers} OR {Kevin Uxbridge} OR a [Q] icon dilemma OR a dilemma with the word "Q" in title.

lore: Ancient Vulcan ritual which telepathically links minds to intimately share each other's thoughts and knowledge. Captain Spock stored his katra in Dr. McCoy using one. "Remember."
name: Vulcan Mindmeld *VP
text: Plays on your Mindmeld personnel. Personnel gains the skills of one of your other personnel present until end of turn. Discard interrupt.

name: Spacedoor (back)*
text: You may use opponent's {Red Alert}! (only at this outpost) as if you had a copy in play. At the end of your turn, you may discard a card from hand to flip Spacedoor over. (Immune to cards that close doorways.)

lore: Debilitating pathogen developed by Section 31. Engineered to specifically target the morphogenic matrix of changelings, the elusive leaders of the Dominion.
name: Morphogenic Virus
text: Place on one personnel present (random selection). That personnel and all your personnel of your same species are attributes all -2. Cure with 3 Biology OR any 2 Intelligence.

lore: Doing her best to suppress her space sickness, Ezri Dax disabled the engines of her runabout and drifted through the Badlands to retrace the path of Worf's escape pod.
name: Plasma Currents
text: To get past requires STRENGTH>(50+10X), where X = number of other missions in this region, if in a region; otherwise, X = 0.

lore: Unable to cure the morphogenic virus, Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien used an illegally obtained Tal Shiar memory scanner to search the depths of Luther Sloan's mind.
name: Romulan Mind Probes
text: One personnel (random selection) continues, along with all crew or Away Team members who have at least one printed skill matching that personnel. Others are stopped.

lore: In 2375, Benjamin Sisko purchased twelve hecapates of land in Bajor's Kendra province, intending to build a house there, just as soon as the Dominion War was over.
name: Some Day I'll Retire Here
text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>(40 + 10X), where X=number of other missions in this region, if in a region; otherwise, X=0.

lore: Taking a lesson from Kira, Damar's resistance movement did not limit their attacks to non-Cardassian targets, ensuring the Dominion couldn't use Cardassian lives as a shield.
name: Terrorist Explosion
text: Damages your facility here (opponent's choice) unless 4 SECURITY OR Resistance present. Discard dilemma.

lore: Ceremonial robes worn by the Klingon chancellor. Worf briefly wore them before naming Martok the new chancellor.
name: Mantle of the Empire
text: If with your [Kli] chancellor, they are attributes all +1 and your [Kli] SECURITY present gain Leadership. May discard to prevent your chancellor present from being killed by a dilemma.

lore: Unable to access their resources in the Gamma Quadrant, the Dominion looked to their Cardassian allies for help in constructing new vessels to bolster their combined fleet.
name: HQ: Shipyards
text: Seeds or plays on your headquarters. If there is no Nor here, once each turn, when you play a ship here as your normal card play, you may draw a card.

characteristicsKeywords: Bajoran treaty; Federation treaty; Klingon treaty; Romulan treaty;
lore: The assassination of Senator Vreenak, after he uncovered Dominion plans to invade Romulus, resulted in a military alliance between Romulan, Klingon, and Federation forces.
name: Treaty: Alpha Quadrant Alliance
text: Plays on table. If you seeded missions only in the Alpha Quadrant, your [DS9][Fed], [DS9][Rom], [DS9][Kli], and [DS9][Baj] cards are compatible. You may not play [Car] or [Dom] cards.

name: Alliance with the Son'a
text: Seeds on table. Your [Non] Son'a cards become [Dom] and (while your {Reshape the Quadrant} is in play) gain [DS9]. While your Son'a personnel is in play, you may ignore {White Deprivation}. Nullified if you seeded a [GQ] mission. Your {Invasive Beam-In} is nullified.

name: Cardassian Liberation Front
text: Plays on a Cardassia Region [P]; discard if you have a facility in play. Your equipment, [DS9][Car] personnel, and [DS9][Car] ships with one or fewer staffing icons may report here. Once each turn, one [DS9][Car] personnel with "resistance" in lore or [DS9][Car] dissident may report for free. Once each turn, in place of your normal card play, you may download {Revolutionaries} OR {Stolen Attack Ship}.

name: Dominion Command
text: Seeds on {Cardassia Prime} if you have not seeded any [GQ] missions; you may download {Central Command} here. Your compatible Vorta, Founders, and Thots that are native to the Alpha Quadrant may use Central Command as if Cardassian Guls. Once per game, in place of a card draw, you may download one [Univ][Dom] ship native to the Alpha Quadrant here.

name: Staging Ground
text: Plays on {Starbase 375} OR {Docking Pylons} at {Deep Space 9}; download {Treaty: Alpha Quadrant Alliance}. You may not report personnel for free. In place of your normal card play, you may report one [DS9] ship native to the Alpha Quadrant here with up to 3 compatible [DS9] personnel native to the Alpha Quadrant (each of a different affiliation) and up to one [Equipment] aboard. Your {Crossover} is nullified.

name: We All Serve
text: Plays on table; download {Treaty: Cardassian/Dominion}. Nullifies your {Dominion War Efforts}. Once each turn, one [DS9][Dom] OR [DS9][Car] personnel with four or fewer [*] (and no DL/ ) may report for free, then you may draw a card. Discard if you have played a personnel not native to the Alpha Quadrant OR a [Car] Honor personnel.

lore: After years as a puppet of the Dominion, Damar could no longer recognize the man he had become, and decided to rise up and reassert Cardassian autonomy.
name: Distorted Reflection
text: When your [Car] personnel with "resistance" in lore helps solve a Cardassian Region mission, you may score points OR opponent must discard 3 cards.

lore: Tired of the uprisings, disloyalty, and betrayal, the Founder Leader ordered the execution of the Cardassians. All of them.
name: I Want the Cardassians Exterminated!
text: Kill three of your non-[Holo][Car] personnel (X = their total [*]) present with your Founder to peek at the bottom seed card there (once per unattempted mission) and score points.

lore: To defeat the occupying Dominion forces, Damar and his compatriots adopted guerrilla warfare techniques, taught to them by Kira Nerys from her days in the Bajoran resistance.
name: Secret Sabotage
text: Plays once each turn, at the end of your turn, on an opponent's undamaged ship. If you have 3 [Car] personnel with "resistance" in lore here, you may [Flip][Flip].

lore: Defeat overwhelming Dominion forces.
name: Battle of Cardassia
text: Leaderships x2 + SECURITY x2 + Honor x2 *+20 points if your [Fed] ship, [Rom] ship, and [Kli] ship here. Opponent's side: [CAR][DOM] Leadership x2 + SECURITY x2 + Treachery x2 May only attempt if your total WEAPONS>36 here. Points: [40]

lore: Mass-produce ketracel-white to maintain Jem'Hadar soldiers' biochemical balance.
name: Increase White Production
text: SCIENCE + Biology + (Son'a OR Vorta OR MEDICAL x3) *+5 points for each Son'a present (limit 3).

lore: Rendezvous with Breen flagship in Dominion-occupied Cardassian space.
name: Recruit Ally
text: Leadership + Diplomacy x2 + (Breen OR V.I.P.) Once solved, your Breen ships may report with crew here.

lore: Establish covert base and train in guerrilla warfare.
name: Resist Occupying Forces
text: OFFICER x3 + Honor x3 OR {Kira} + {Legate Damar} *+10 if {Cardassian Liberation Front} in play.

lore: Covertly penetrate facility and retrieve newly installed weapons technology.
name: Steal Breen Armament
text: Anthropology + Honor + Leadership + (3 SECURITY OR 3 [Car] personnel with "resistance" in lore)

name: Decimate Homeworld
text: Plays on a homeworld if you have solved two missions (one [P] and one [S]). Your Breen and Xindi ships may ignore {Strategema} here when initiating battle. If you destroy a headquarters here (or at a corresponding time location) that your opponent seeded or played, you score points, where X = printed SHIELDS of that headquarters.

name: One Big Happy Family
text: Plays on your non-[GQ] mission (limit one per mission). At the start of your first mission attempt here, if you have [Car] and/or [Dom] personnel here from at least four different species, you may draw three cards. Once solved, your [Car] and non-[GQ][Dom] ships with personnel of three different species aboard are attributes all +2, or +4 if in a region with this mission (cumulative).

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian/Bajoran; Female; Kai; Male; Pah-wraith-related card; Vedek;
lore: The Cardassian Dukat, anointed by the Pah-wraiths, became romantically involved with former Vedek Winn, now Kai of Bajor. He acted as her guide.
name: Anjohl and Winn
text: CIVILIAN/V.I.P. Anjohl: Treachery x 2 Anthropology Archaeology Winn: Leadership Treachery Diplomacy

lore: Typical member of Damar's resistance. Dissident who performed many acts of terrorism against the Dominion. One of Rusot's most experienced soldiers.
name: Bronok
text: ENGINEER Geology Physics Smuggling

characteristicsKeywords: Cardassian; Cardassian resistance; Dissident; Male; Nurse;
lore: One of many battlefield nurses on Cardassia Prime. Dissident who was angered by the loss of Cardassian lives. He vowed to join Damar's resistance efforts.
name: Chaban
text: MEDICAL Exobiology Navigation Archaeology

lore: Typical loyal Cardassian glinn. Friends with Ekoor. Joined Damar's resistance movement against the Dominion. Wanted to avenge Lakarian City.
name: Disik
text: OFFICER Honor MEDICAL Anthropology

lore: Cardassian tailor and former spy. He assisted Legate Damar's resistance efforts to free Cardassia.
name: Elim Garak (Dogs of War)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill Diplomacy Honor Obsidian Order

lore: Representative of Cardassian citizens, living under the Dominion occupation. Upon seeing Damar, he was inspired to rise up and join the resistance efforts.
name: Mason
text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Astrophysics Honor Youth

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War)
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy DL/ {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). DL/ {Strike Three} (when attacked).

lore: Breen security specialist. Patrolled the holding cells where Worf and Ezri Dax were held. He helped Thot Gor to plan the attack on Earth.
name: Baas
text: SECURITY Diplomacy Geology Law DL/ {Decimate Homeworld} (if with any Thot).

lore: Cardassian legate and head of state. Holds no true power in the Dominion. Hates the Vorta. Drowns his woes with alcohol. He arranged a surgeon for Dukat.
name: Damar (Dogs of War)
text: OFFICER Diplomacy ENGINEER Treachery Physics Stellar Cartography DL/ {Kanar}

lore: Representative of Breen medics. He was charged with ensuring that prisoners such as Worf and Ezri Dax were not killed during interrogation.
name: Draz
text: MEDICAL Biology Stellar Cartography Youth X = number of your other Breen present.

lore: Typical Breen scientist. He supervised the interrogation of Worf and Ezri Dax. Accompanied Thot Gor for the initial meeting with the Dominion.
name: Fel
text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Honor Music

lore: Typical Jem'Hadar First bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Served during the battle to retake the Chin'toka system, which saw the U.S.S. Defiant destroyed.
name: Flet'ika
text: OFFICER Archaeology Transporter Skill Leadership Exobiology

lore: Diseased changeling trapped in the Alpha Quadrant. Her negotiations brought the Breen into the war.
name: Founder Leader (Dogs of War)
text: V.I.P. Leadership Exobiology Treachery x 2 Diplomacy DL/ Any Thot DL/ {I Want the Cardassians Exterminated!}

lore: Vorta clone activated in the Alpha Quadrant near the end of the war after the death of her predecessor. Luaran helped negotiate the peace accords.
name: Luaran 9
text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Biology Diplomacy Leadership Your non-[GQ][Dom] ships here are each WEAPONS +1.

lore: One of many Vorta bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Was instructed to continue the viral research of his predecessor. Witnessed the Treaty of Bajor signing.
name: Rayva
text: MEDICAL Astrophysics Anthropology Treachery X = number of affiliations of non-[Dom] personnel present.

lore: Overconfident Vorta. The last Weyoun clone. Activated in the Alpha Quadrant after his predecessor was killed by Worf. Lives to serve the Founders.
name: Weyoun 8
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery x 2 Law Biology Once per game, if killed, draw 3 cards.

lore: Ferengi serving on Deep Space 9. One of Benjamin Sisko's final acts was to promote Nog. Future Starfleet vessels would bear his illustrious name.
name: Lieutenant Nog
text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER Navigation Diplomacy DL/ {Phaser Array Power Cell}

lore: Former waiter Rom married Leeta in 2373. He was selected by Grand Nagus Zek as a kinder, gentler, more benevolent Nagus to succeed him.
name: Grand Nagus Rom
text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Honor x 2 ENGINEER Physics Your other Ferengi present are each INTEGRITY +2.

characteristicsKeywords: Klingon; Chancellor; General; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
lore: Honored General. Martok became High Council leader after the death of Gowron. Soldier who detests politics. Commands the I.K.S. Rotarran.
name: Chancellor Martok
text: V.I.P. OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Honor x 2 Law Once per game, may download {Mantle of the Empire}.

lore: Klingon general and military aide to Chancellor Gowron. He commanded a Modified Vor'Cha during the Dominion War. Collects rare, vintage bloodwine.
name: Chu'vok
text: V.I.P. Leadership ENGINEER Honor Archaeology

lore: Putting aside his oath to Starfleet, the Klingon Worf killed Chancellor Gowron in ritual combat. Was briefly romantically involved with Ezri Dax.
name: Worf Son of Mogh (Dogs of War)
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Honor x 2 Leadership Law Your other [Kli] personnel present are INTEGRITY +1.

lore: Self-aware holographic singer. After he helped Nog to recover, his program was left running permanently.
name: Vic Fontaine (Dogs of War)
text: CIVILIAN Music x 2 Worth points while present with {any Sisko}, {any Kira}, {any Quark}, {any O'Brien}, {any Odo}, {any Dax}, {any Bashir}, {any Nog}, and {any Worf}.

lore: Typical military negotiator. She attended the signing of the Treaty of Bajor as the highest-ranking Romulan officer after Velal's death at the Battle of Cardassia.
name: General Lar
text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Archaeology If with {Velal} OR any [DS9][Rom] V.I.P.: MEDICAL, Geology.

lore: Heavy duty military vessel outfitted with the latest Dominion security protocols. Damar's resistance used one to infiltrate the Kelvas V shipyards.
name: Hideki Cruiser
text: DL/ {Strafing Run} OR {Activate Tractor Beam}

characteristicsKeywords: Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Invasive Transporters; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Upgraded warship constructed in the Alpha Quadrant. Had Breen energy-dampening technology built into its arsenal. Luaran 9 commanded one.
name: Enhanced Warship
text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Breen ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Tractor Beam; Warship;
lore: Breen flagship commanded by Thot Pran. One of the few vessels to survive the attack on Earth.
name: Tykk
text: Energy Dampener, Tractor Beam

lore: NCC-71820. Fought in Operation Return. Briefly commanded by Admiral Ross. Served as his flagship during the Battle of Cardassia.
name: U.S.S. Magellan
text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam If [DS9]: DL/ {Line of Defense}

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Klingon heavy cruiser used during the Dominion War. Upgraded in 2375 to counteract recently encountered Breen energy-dampening technology.
name: Modified Vor'Cha
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Energy Dampeners here are off line.

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: The Romulan fleet rearmed to replace the Tal Shiar ships destroyed in 2371. Ruwon commanded one.
name: B-Type Warbird
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

characteristicsKeywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
lore: Flagship of the Romulan forces stationed at Deep Space 9 during the final stages of the Dominion War. Commanded by Velal.
name: Rovaran
text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +2 vs. [Dom].

lore: Cardassian tailor and former spy. He assisted Legate Damar's resistance efforts to free Cardassia.
name: Elim Garak (Dogs of War)*
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill Diplomacy Honor Obsidian Order

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War)*
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy DL/ {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). DL/ {Strike Three} (when attacked).

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War)+
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy DL/ {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). DL/ {Strike Three} (when attacked).

lore: Putting aside his oath to Starfleet, the Klingon Worf killed Chancellor Gowron in ritual combat. Was briefly romantically involved with Ezri Dax.
name: Worf Son of Mogh (Dogs of War)*
text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Honor x 2 Leadership Law Your other [Kli] personnel present are INTEGRITY +1.

name: Spacedoor
text: Seeds on your outpost during facility phase. Outpost is SHIELDS -8 (cumulative). In place of your normal card play, you may return your empty ship docked here (and all cards played on it) to owners' hands, nullifying any {Static Warp Bubble} targeting you OR download {Spacedock} or one compatible [Univ] ship to outpost. Flip Spacedoor over after either use.

characteristicsKeywords: Changeling; Cardassian resistance; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
lore: Changeling who aided Damar's resistance. Frequent shape-shifting advanced the onset of the morphogenic virus. He posed as the Founder, Founder Leader.
name: Odo (Dogs of War) *VP
text: SECURITY Honor Law Computer Skill Diplomacy {You Dirty Rat} (to hand). {Strike Three} (when attacked).

lore: Krenim attacks repeatedly damaged the U.S.S. Voyager. Failing life support systems led Kathryn Janeway to order the evacuation of all personnel except senior staff.
name: Abandon Ship!
text: If ship damaged or RANGE reduced, personnel not needed for staffing are placed with dilemma atop mission. Rescue (opponent may capture) personnel with different ship here.

lore: Military official of Tilonus IV. He twisted William T. Riker's mind using neurosomatic techniques. Typical of treacherous Tilonian government interrogators.
name: Suna
text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery Once per game, may download {Reflection Therapy}.

lore: As part of his plan to steal the newly developed metaphasic shield technology, Jo'Bril sabotaged the initial testing, faked his own death and killed the inventor.
name: Unscientific Method
text: Most CUNNING SCIENCE personnel present without Greed or Treachery is killed. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

name: Space-Time Portal
text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] cards may seed and (once per turn) play. At any time, discard doorway to download {Alternate Universe Door} (except to table) OR play {Wormhole} on a location to relocate your ship there (stopped) OR nullify {Temporal Rift} OR return one of your ships to owner's hand OR (once per game) report with crew one [AU] ship (all crew must be [AU]) to any location.

characteristicsKeywords: Federation treaty; Klingon treaty; Romulan treaty;
lore: Three major Alpha Quadrant powers, in an uncharacteristic show of solidarity in 2373, focused their resources against the Dominion threat in a united stand at station Deep Space 9.
name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan/Klingon
text: Plays on table. While you have no open side decks, your [Fed], [Rom], and [Kli] affiliations are compatible and ignore affiliation attack restrictions. They may not attempt opponent's missions.

lore: The sudden eradication of the entire Husnock race left its many outposts vacant. Various affiliations take advantage of these available facilities.
name: Husnock Outpost
text: Seed at any [NON] location. You may seed one [Univ] {Husnock Ship} face up here. Extends only 25% of its SHIELDS to ships.

lore: Gather data on newly encountered phenomenon.
name: Explore Interstellar Matter
text: SCIENCE + (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) Your {Subspace Warp Rift} and {Tetryon Field} play for free here. Opponent's side: Opponent's {Calamarain} plays at this mission (or a copy).

lore: Unify diverse nation-states via coercion and occupation.
name: Impose Order
text: Diplomacy + Treachery + STRENGTH>40 *Unopposed OFFICER on planet may steal points.

affiliation: Any crew may attempt mission. Your {Salvage Starship} objective may target this location.
lore: Investigate reports of Borg presence in this sector.
name: Investigate Incursion
text: SECURITY + ({Shelby} OR Leadership + OFFICER x2) X=30 (45 if [Bor] or [BO] card or {Borg Ship} dilemma here). Opponent's side: Your Borg ships may report with crew here.  Points: [30]

affiliation: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
lore: Survey planetoid with minimal atmosphere to determine value of mineral deposits.
name: Mineral Survey
text: Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>28 When you solve, draw up to two cards.

lore: Test upgrades to faster-than-light drive components.
name: Test Propulsion Systems
text: Navigation + Physics + ENGINEER + % ship Solving player's ships are RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

name: Open Diplomatic Relations
text: Seeds on table during doorway phase; you may seed one {Treaty} during this phase (cumulative). At any time, you may exchange two cards in hand for a Treaty in your discard pile. OR Plays on opponent's ship. Your Away Teams which have a V.I.P. may beam to and from that ship, and it may not voluntarily move while your V.I.P. aboard. Discard objective if your personnel battle aboard that ship.

name: Reflection Therapy
text: Plays on a personnel (except {Suna}) if your Treachery > Honor present. Replace one regular skill with one level of another regular skill (discard if skill lost). Any player may nullify with 3 Empathy present. OR Plays on an opponent's personnel affected by {Frame of Mind}; personnel is captured. Discard objective if rescued or (on a later turn) to download {Brainwash} or {Interrogation} to this captive.

lore: "Why don't we play a little game? I'll hide... you find me."
name: Hide and Seek
text: Shuffle Hide and Seek together with crew or Away Team. Randomly select cards until a [Univ] personnel or Hide and Seek selected. All selected personnel are stopped; discard dilemma. (May be seeded as a [S/P] dilemma.)

characteristicsKeywords: Holodeck; Particle Scattering Device; Tractor Beam;
lore: Typical Tamarian vessel. "Picard and Dathon, trading knives at El-Adrel. Children at Tama's knee. Sokath, forging knives for his brothers."
name: Darmok
text: When reporting, choose Tractor Beam OR Holodeck OR Particle Scattering Device.

name: Assimilate Counterpart *VP
text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's unique male personnel. Your Borg may beam to and battle target's crew or Away Team. One of your Borg who engages target in combat may abduct target. If target is occupying an {Assimilation Table}, you may probe: [Com], [Nav], [Def]: Assimilated as a counterpart. Place on target. Worth 5 points per [*] while objective on target.

lore: Going boldly into the unknown frontiers of the galaxy, brave captains and crews cheat death in search of new life.
name: Where No Man Has Gone Before *VP
text: Plays on table. At start of turn, your undocked ships at any spaceline end are RANGE +3 until end of turn. Once per turn, when your ship moves from one spaceline to another, you may draw a card OR report an [AU] card aboard.

lore: One of many Q conflicts encountered during their voyage home, a furious chase between Q and Quinn threw the U.S.S. Voyager from the birth of the universe to a Christmas tree.
name: Q: A Dazzling Flash
text: Crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash with X cards from opponent's Q-Continuum, where X = number of personnel present. Discard dilemma. (Immune to {Q2}.)

lore: A civil war between the Q resulted in the implosion of multiple stars. Each one created a negative density false vacuum, sucking the surrounding matter into the Continuum.
name: Q: Enter the Supernova
text: Crew has a Q-Flash with X cards from opponent's Q-Continuum, where X = the lowest attribute of attempting ship. Discard dilemma. (Immune to {Q2}.)
